2757 // Another overly complex function until we reorganize everything into a nice all-in-one helper.
2758 // This is made more complex because we have dissociated the layout rectangle (pos_min..pos_max) which define _where_ the ellipsis is, from actual clipping of text and limit of the ellipsis display.
2759 // This is because in the context of tabs we selectively hide part of the text when the Close Button appears, but we don't want the ellipsis to move.
2760 void ImGui::RenderTextEllipsis(ImDrawList* draw_list, const ImVec2& pos_min, const ImVec2& pos_max, float clip_max_x, float ellipsis_max_x, const char* text, const char* text_end_full, const ImVec2* text_size_if_known)
2761 {
2762  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2763  if (text_end_full == NULL)
2764  text_end_full = FindRenderedTextEnd(text);
2765  const ImVec2 text_size = text_size_if_known ? *text_size_if_known : CalcTextSize(text, text_end_full, false, 0.0f);
2766 
2767  //draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(pos_max.x, pos_min.y - 4), ImVec2(pos_max.x, pos_max.y + 4), IM_COL32(0, 0, 255, 255));
2768  //draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(ellipsis_max_x, pos_min.y-2), ImVec2(ellipsis_max_x, pos_max.y+2), IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
2769  //draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_min.y), ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_max.y), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255));
2770  // FIXME: We could technically remove (last_glyph->AdvanceX - last_glyph->X1) from text_size.x here and save a few pixels.
2771  if (text_size.x > pos_max.x - pos_min.x)
2772  {
2773  // Hello wo...
2774  // | | |
2775  // min max ellipsis_max
2776  // <-> this is generally some padding value
2777 
2778  const ImFont* font = draw_list->_Data->Font;
2779  const float font_size = draw_list->_Data->FontSize;
2780  const char* text_end_ellipsis = NULL;
2781 
2782  ImWchar ellipsis_char = font->EllipsisChar;
2783  int ellipsis_char_count = 1;
2784  if (ellipsis_char == (ImWchar)-1)
2785  {
2786  ellipsis_char = (ImWchar)'.';
2787  ellipsis_char_count = 3;
2788  }
2789  const ImFontGlyph* glyph = font->FindGlyph(ellipsis_char);
2790 
2791  float ellipsis_glyph_width = glyph->X1; // Width of the glyph with no padding on either side
2792  float ellipsis_total_width = ellipsis_glyph_width; // Full width of entire ellipsis
2793 
2794  if (ellipsis_char_count > 1)
2795  {
2796  // Full ellipsis size without free spacing after it.
2797  const float spacing_between_dots = 1.0f * (draw_list->_Data->FontSize / font->FontSize);
2798  ellipsis_glyph_width = glyph->X1 - glyph->X0 + spacing_between_dots;
2799  ellipsis_total_width = ellipsis_glyph_width * (float)ellipsis_char_count - spacing_between_dots;
2800  }
2801 
2802  // We can now claim the space between pos_max.x and ellipsis_max.x
2803  const float text_avail_width = ImMax((ImMax(pos_max.x, ellipsis_max_x) - ellipsis_total_width) - pos_min.x, 1.0f);
2804  float text_size_clipped_x = font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, text_avail_width, 0.0f, text, text_end_full, &text_end_ellipsis).x;
2805  if (text == text_end_ellipsis && text_end_ellipsis < text_end_full)
2806  {
2807  // Always display at least 1 character if there's no room for character + ellipsis
2808  text_end_ellipsis = text + ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromChar(text, text_end_full);
2809  text_size_clipped_x = font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, FLT_MAX, 0.0f, text, text_end_ellipsis).x;
2810  }
2811  while (text_end_ellipsis > text && ImCharIsBlankA(text_end_ellipsis[-1]))
2812  {
2813  // Trim trailing space before ellipsis (FIXME: Supporting non-ascii blanks would be nice, for this we need a function to backtrack in UTF-8 text)
2814  text_end_ellipsis--;
2815  text_size_clipped_x -= font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, FLT_MAX, 0.0f, text_end_ellipsis, text_end_ellipsis + 1).x; // Ascii blanks are always 1 byte
2816  }
2817 
2818  // Render text, render ellipsis
2819  RenderTextClippedEx(draw_list, pos_min, ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_max.y), text, text_end_ellipsis, &text_size, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
2820  float ellipsis_x = pos_min.x + text_size_clipped_x;
2821  if (ellipsis_x + ellipsis_total_width <= ellipsis_max_x)
2822  for (int i = 0; i < ellipsis_char_count; i++)
2823  {
2824  font->RenderChar(draw_list, font_size, ImVec2(ellipsis_x, pos_min.y), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), ellipsis_char);
2825  ellipsis_x += ellipsis_glyph_width;
2826  }
2827  }
2828  else
2829  {
2830  RenderTextClippedEx(draw_list, pos_min, ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_max.y), text, text_end_full, &text_size, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
2831  }
2832 
2833  if (g.LogEnabled)
2834  LogRenderedText(&pos_min, text, text_end_full);
2835 }
2836 
2837 // Render a rectangle shaped with optional rounding and borders
2838 void ImGui::RenderFrame(ImVec2 p_min, ImVec2 p_max, ImU32 fill_col, bool border, float rounding)
2839 {
2840  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2841  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
2842  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(p_min, p_max, fill_col, rounding);
2843  const float border_size = g.Style.FrameBorderSize;
2844  if (border && border_size > 0.0f)
2845  {
2846  window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min + ImVec2(1, 1), p_max + ImVec2(1, 1), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_BorderShadow), rounding, ImDrawCornerFlags_All, border_size);
2847  window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min, p_max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), rounding, ImDrawCornerFlags_All, border_size);
2848  }
2849 }
2850 
2851 void ImGui::RenderFrameBorder(ImVec2 p_min, ImVec2 p_max, float rounding)
2852 {
2853  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2854  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
2855  const float border_size = g.Style.FrameBorderSize;
2856  if (border_size > 0.0f)
2857  {
2858  window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min + ImVec2(1, 1), p_max + ImVec2(1, 1), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_BorderShadow), rounding, ImDrawCornerFlags_All, border_size);
2859  window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min, p_max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), rounding, ImDrawCornerFlags_All, border_size);
2860  }
2861 }
2862 
2863 void ImGui::RenderNavHighlight(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, ImGuiNavHighlightFlags flags)
2864 {
2865  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2866  if (id != g.NavId)
2867  return;
2868  if (g.NavDisableHighlight && !(flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_AlwaysDraw))
2869  return;
2870  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
2871  if (window->DC.NavHideHighlightOneFrame)
2872  return;
2873 
2874  float rounding = (flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_NoRounding) ? 0.0f : g.Style.FrameRounding;
2875  ImRect display_rect = bb;
2876  display_rect.ClipWith(window->ClipRect);
2877  if (flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeDefault)
2878  {
2879  const float THICKNESS = 2.0f;
2880  const float DISTANCE = 3.0f + THICKNESS * 0.5f;
2881  display_rect.Expand(ImVec2(DISTANCE, DISTANCE));
2882  bool fully_visible = window->ClipRect.Contains(display_rect);
2883  if (!fully_visible)
2884  window->DrawList->PushClipRect(display_rect.Min, display_rect.Max);
2885  window->DrawList->AddRect(display_rect.Min + ImVec2(THICKNESS * 0.5f, THICKNESS * 0.5f), display_rect.Max - ImVec2(THICKNESS * 0.5f, THICKNESS * 0.5f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavHighlight), rounding, ImDrawCornerFlags_All, THICKNESS);
2886  if (!fully_visible)
2887  window->DrawList->PopClipRect();
2888  }
2889  if (flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeThin)
2890  {
2891  window->DrawList->AddRect(display_rect.Min, display_rect.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavHighlight), rounding, ~0, 1.0f);
2892  }
2893 }
2894 
2895 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2896 // [SECTION] MAIN CODE (most of the code! lots of stuff, needs tidying up!)
2897 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2898 
2899 // ImGuiWindow is mostly a dumb struct. It merely has a constructor and a few helper methods
2900 ImGuiWindow::ImGuiWindow(ImGuiContext* context, const char* name) : DrawListInst(NULL)
2901 {
2902  memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
2903  Name = ImStrdup(name);
2904  NameBufLen = (int)strlen(name) + 1;
2905  ID = ImHashStr(name);
2906  IDStack.push_back(ID);
2907  ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend = -1;
2908  ViewportPos = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
2909  MoveId = GetID("#MOVE");
2910  ScrollTarget = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
2911  ScrollTargetCenterRatio = ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f);
2912  AutoFitFramesX = AutoFitFramesY = -1;
2913  AutoPosLastDirection = ImGuiDir_None;
2914  SetWindowPosAllowFlags = SetWindowSizeAllowFlags = SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags = SetWindowDockAllowFlags = ImGuiCond_Always | ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing;
2915  SetWindowPosVal = SetWindowPosPivot = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
2916  LastFrameActive = -1;
2917  LastFrameJustFocused = -1;
2918  LastTimeActive = -1.0f;
2919  FontWindowScale = FontDpiScale = 1.0f;
2920  SettingsOffset = -1;
2921  DockOrder = -1;
2922  DrawList = &DrawListInst;
2923  DrawList->_Data = &context->DrawListSharedData;
2924  DrawList->_OwnerName = Name;
2925 }
2926 
2927 ImGuiWindow::~ImGuiWindow()
2928 {
2929  IM_ASSERT(DrawList == &DrawListInst);
2930  IM_DELETE(Name);
2931  for (int i = 0; i != ColumnsStorage.Size; i++)
2932  ColumnsStorage[i].~ImGuiOldColumns();
2933 }
2934 
2935 ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetID(const char* str, const char* str_end)
2936 {
2937  ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
2938  ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(str, str_end ? (str_end - str) : 0, seed);
2939  ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
2940 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
2941  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2942  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ID_INFO2(id, ImGuiDataType_String, str, str_end);
2943 #endif
2944  return id;
2945 }
2946 
2947 ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetID(const void* ptr)
2948 {
2949  ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
2950  ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&ptr, sizeof(void*), seed);
2951  ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
2952 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
2953  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2954  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ID_INFO(id, ImGuiDataType_Pointer, ptr);
2955 #endif
2956  return id;
2957 }
2958

2961  ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();

2963  ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
2964 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
2965  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
2966  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ID_INFO(id, ImGuiDataType_S32, (intptr_t)n);
2967 #endif
2968  return id;
2969 }

2999  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ID_INFO(id, ImGuiDataType_S32, (intptr_t)n);
3000 #endif

3003 
3004 // This is only used in rare/specific situations to manufacture an ID out of nowhere.
3005 ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetIDFromRectangle(const ImRect& r_abs)
3006 {
3007  ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3008  const int r_rel[4] = { (int)(r_abs.Min.x - Pos.x), (int)(r_abs.Min.y - Pos.y), (int)(r_abs.Max.x - Pos.x), (int)(r_abs.Max.y - Pos.y) };
3009  ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&r_rel, sizeof(r_rel), seed);
3010  ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
3011  return id;
3012 }
3013 
3014 static void SetCurrentWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
3015 {
3016  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3017  g.CurrentWindow = window;
3018  g.CurrentTable = window && window->DC.CurrentTableIdx != -1 ? g.Tables.GetByIndex(window->DC.CurrentTableIdx) : NULL;
3019  if (window)
3020  g.FontSize = g.DrawListSharedData.FontSize = window->CalcFontSize();
3021 }
3022 
3023 void ImGui::GcCompactTransientMiscBuffers()
3024 {
3025  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3026  g.ItemFlagsStack.clear();
3027  g.GroupStack.clear();
3028  TableGcCompactSettings();
3029 }
3030 
3031 // Free up/compact internal window buffers, we can use this when a window becomes unused.
3032 // Not freed:
3033 // - ImGuiWindow, ImGuiWindowSettings, Name, StateStorage, ColumnsStorage (may hold useful data)
3034 // This should have no noticeable visual effect. When the window reappear however, expect new allocation/buffer growth/copy cost.
3035 void ImGui::GcCompactTransientWindowBuffers(ImGuiWindow* window)
3036 {
3037  window->MemoryCompacted = true;
3038  window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity = window->DrawList->IdxBuffer.Capacity;
3039  window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity = window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.Capacity;
3040  window->IDStack.clear();
3041  window->DrawList->_ClearFreeMemory();
3042  window->DC.ChildWindows.clear();
3043  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.clear();
3044  window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.clear();
3045 }
3046 
3047 void ImGui::GcAwakeTransientWindowBuffers(ImGuiWindow* window)
3048 {
3049  // We stored capacity of the ImDrawList buffer to reduce growth-caused allocation/copy when awakening.
3050  // The other buffers tends to amortize much faster.
3051  window->MemoryCompacted = false;
3052  window->DrawList->IdxBuffer.reserve(window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity);
3053  window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.reserve(window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity);
3054  window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity = window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity = 0;
3055 }
3056 
3057 void ImGui::SetActiveID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindow* window)
3058 {
3059  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3060  g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated = (g.ActiveId != id);
3061  if (g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
3062  {
3063  g.ActiveIdTimer = 0.0f;
3064  g.ActiveIdHasBeenPressedBefore = false;
3065  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore = false;
3066  if (id != 0)
3067  {
3068  g.LastActiveId = id;
3069  g.LastActiveIdTimer = 0.0f;
3070  }
3071  }
3072  g.ActiveId = id;
3073  g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = false;
3074  g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss = false;
3075  g.ActiveIdWindow = window;
3076  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = false;
3077  if (id)
3078  {
3079  g.ActiveIdIsAlive = id;
3080  g.ActiveIdSource = (g.NavActivateId == id || g.NavInputId == id || g.NavJustTabbedId == id || g.NavJustMovedToId == id) ? ImGuiInputSource_Nav : ImGuiInputSource_Mouse;
3081  }
3082 
3083  // Clear declaration of inputs claimed by the widget
3084  // (Please note that this is WIP and not all keys/inputs are thoroughly declared by all widgets yet)
3085  g.ActiveIdUsingMouseWheel = false;
3086  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = 0x00;
3087  g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = 0x00;
3088  g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask = 0x00;
3089 }
3090 
3091 void ImGui::ClearActiveID()
3092 {
3093  SetActiveID(0, NULL); // g.ActiveId = 0;
3094 }
3095 
3096 void ImGui::SetHoveredID(ImGuiID id)
3097 {
3098  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3099  g.HoveredId = id;
3100  g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = false;
3101  g.HoveredIdUsingMouseWheel = false;
3102  if (id != 0 && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != id)
3103  g.HoveredIdTimer = g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer = 0.0f;
3104 }
3105 
3106 ImGuiID ImGui::GetHoveredID()
3107 {
3108  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3109  return g.HoveredId ? g.HoveredId : g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame;
3110 }
3111 
3112 void ImGui::KeepAliveID(ImGuiID id)
3113 {
3114  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3115  if (g.ActiveId == id)
3116  g.ActiveIdIsAlive = id;
3117  if (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == id)
3118  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = true;
3119 }
3120 
3121 void ImGui::MarkItemEdited(ImGuiID id)
3122 {
3123  // This marking is solely to be able to provide info for IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit().
3124  // ActiveId might have been released by the time we call this (as in the typical press/release button behavior) but still need need to fill the data.
3125  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3126  IM_ASSERT(g.ActiveId == id || g.ActiveId == 0 || g.DragDropActive);
3127  IM_UNUSED(id); // Avoid unused variable warnings when asserts are compiled out.
3128  //IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemId == id);
3129  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = true;
3130  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore = true;
3131  g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemStatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited;
3132 }
3133 
3134 static inline bool IsWindowContentHoverable(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
3135 {
3136  // An active popup disable hovering on other windows (apart from its own children)
3137  // FIXME-OPT: This could be cached/stored within the window.
3138  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3139  if (g.NavWindow)
3140  if (ImGuiWindow* focused_root_window = g.NavWindow->RootWindow)
3141  if (focused_root_window->WasActive && focused_root_window != window->RootWindow)
3142  {
3143  // For the purpose of those flags we differentiate "standard popup" from "modal popup"
3144  // NB: The order of those two tests is important because Modal windows are also Popups.
3145  if (focused_root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
3146  return false;
3147  if ((focused_root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
3148  return false;
3149  }
3150 
3151  // Filter by viewport
3152  if (window->Viewport != g.MouseViewport)
3153  if (g.MovingWindow == NULL || window->RootWindow != g.MovingWindow->RootWindow)
3154  return false;
3155 
3156  return true;
3157 }
3158 
3159 // This is roughly matching the behavior of internal-facing ItemHoverable()
3160 // - we allow hovering to be true when ActiveId==window->MoveID, so that clicking on non-interactive items such as a Text() item still returns true with IsItemHovered()
3161 // - this should work even for non-interactive items that have no ID, so we cannot use LastItemId
3162 bool ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
3163 {
3164  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3165  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3166  if (g.NavDisableMouseHover && !g.NavDisableHighlight)
3167  return IsItemFocused();
3168 
3169  // Test for bounding box overlap, as updated as ItemAdd()
3170  if (!(window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect))
3171  return false;
3172  IM_ASSERT((flags & (ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows)) == 0); // Flags not supported by this function
3173 
3174  // Test if we are hovering the right window (our window could be behind another window)
3175  // [2017/10/16] Reverted commit 344d48be3 and testing RootWindow instead. I believe it is correct to NOT test for RootWindow but this leaves us unable to use IsItemHovered() after EndChild() itself.
3176  // Until a solution is found I believe reverting to the test from 2017/09/27 is safe since this was the test that has been running for a long while.
3177  //if (g.HoveredWindow != window)
3178  // return false;
3179  if (g.HoveredRootWindow != window->RootWindow && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped))
3180  return false;
3181 
3182  // Test if another item is active (e.g. being dragged)
3183  if (!(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem))
3184  if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveId != window->DC.LastItemId && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap && g.ActiveId != window->MoveId)
3185  return false;
3186 
3187  // Test if interactions on this window are blocked by an active popup or modal.
3188  // The ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup flag will be tested here.
3189  if (!IsWindowContentHoverable(window, flags))
3190  return false;
3191 
3192  // Test if the item is disabled
3193  if ((window->DC.ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled))
3194  return false;
3195 
3196  // Special handling for calling after Begin() which represent the title bar or tab.
3197  // When the window is collapsed (SkipItems==true) that last item will never be overwritten so we need to detect the case.
3198  if ((window->DC.LastItemId == window->ID || window->DC.LastItemId == window->MoveId) && window->WriteAccessed)
3199  return false;
3200  return true;
3201 }
3202 
3203 // Internal facing ItemHoverable() used when submitting widgets. Differs slightly from IsItemHovered().
3204 bool ImGui::ItemHoverable(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id)
3205 {
3206  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3207  if (g.HoveredId != 0 && g.HoveredId != id && !g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap)
3208  return false;
3209 
3210  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3211  if (g.HoveredWindow != window)
3212  return false;
3213  if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveId != id && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap)
3214  return false;
3215  if (!IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max))
3216  return false;
3217  if (g.NavDisableMouseHover)
3218  return false;
3219  if (!IsWindowContentHoverable(window, ImGuiHoveredFlags_None) || (window->DC.ItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled))
3220  {
3221  g.HoveredIdDisabled = true;
3222  return false;
3223  }
3224 
3225  // We exceptionally allow this function to be called with id==0 to allow using it for easy high-level
3226  // hover test in widgets code. We could also decide to split this function is two.
3227  if (id != 0)
3228  {
3229  SetHoveredID(id);
3230 
3231  // [DEBUG] Item Picker tool!
3232  // We perform the check here because SetHoveredID() is not frequently called (1~ time a frame), making
3233  // the cost of this tool near-zero. We can get slightly better call-stack and support picking non-hovered
3234  // items if we perform the test in ItemAdd(), but that would incur a small runtime cost.
3235  // #define IMGUI_DEBUG_TOOL_ITEM_PICKER_EX in imconfig.h if you want this check to also be performed in ItemAdd().
3236  if (g.DebugItemPickerActive && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame == id)
3237  GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
3238  if (g.DebugItemPickerBreakId == id)
3239  IM_DEBUG_BREAK();
3240  }
3241 
3242  return true;
3243 }
3244 
3245 bool ImGui::IsClippedEx(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, bool clip_even_when_logged)
3246 {
3247  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3248  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3249  if (!bb.Overlaps(window->ClipRect))
3250  if (id == 0 || (id != g.ActiveId && id != g.NavId))
3251  if (clip_even_when_logged || !g.LogEnabled)
3252  return true;
3253  return false;
3254 }
3255 
3256 // This is also inlined in ItemAdd()
3257 // Note: if ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect is set, user needs to set window->DC.LastItemDisplayRect!
3258 void ImGui::SetLastItemData(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiID item_id, ImGuiItemStatusFlags item_flags, const ImRect& item_rect)
3259 {
3260  window->DC.LastItemId = item_id;
3261  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags = item_flags;
3262  window->DC.LastItemRect = item_rect;
3263 }
3264 
3265 // Process TAB/Shift+TAB. Be mindful that this function may _clear_ the ActiveID when tabbing out.
3266 bool ImGui::FocusableItemRegister(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiID id)
3267 {
3268  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3269 
3270  // Increment counters
3271  const bool is_tab_stop = (window->DC.ItemFlags & (ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop | ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled)) == 0;
3272  window->DC.FocusCounterRegular++;
3273  if (is_tab_stop)
3274  window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop++;
3275 
3276  // Process TAB/Shift-TAB to tab *OUT* of the currently focused item.
3277  // (Note that we can always TAB out of a widget that doesn't allow tabbing in)
3278  if (g.ActiveId == id && g.FocusTabPressed && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_Tab) && g.FocusRequestNextWindow == NULL)
3279  {
3280  g.FocusRequestNextWindow = window;
3281  g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop + (g.IO.KeyShift ? (is_tab_stop ? -1 : 0) : +1); // Modulo on index will be applied at the end of frame once we've got the total counter of items.
3282  }
3283 
3284  // Handle focus requests
3285  if (g.FocusRequestCurrWindow == window)
3286  {
3287  if (window->DC.FocusCounterRegular == g.FocusRequestCurrCounterRegular)
3288  return true;
3289  if (is_tab_stop && window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop == g.FocusRequestCurrCounterTabStop)
3290  {
3291  g.NavJustTabbedId = id;
3292  return true;
3293  }
3294 
3295  // If another item is about to be focused, we clear our own active id
3296  if (g.ActiveId == id)
3297  ClearActiveID();
3298  }
3299 
3300  return false;
3301 }
3302 
3303 void ImGui::FocusableItemUnregister(ImGuiWindow* window)
3304 {
3305  window->DC.FocusCounterRegular--;
3306  window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop--;
3307 }
3308 
3309 float ImGui::CalcWrapWidthForPos(const ImVec2& pos, float wrap_pos_x)
3310 {
3311  if (wrap_pos_x < 0.0f)
3312  return 0.0f;
3313 
3314  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3315  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
3316  if (wrap_pos_x == 0.0f)
3317  {
3318  // We could decide to setup a default wrapping max point for auto-resizing windows,
3319  // or have auto-wrap (with unspecified wrapping pos) behave as a ContentSize extending function?
3320  //if (window->Hidden && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
3321  // wrap_pos_x = ImMax(window->WorkRect.Min.x + g.FontSize * 10.0f, window->WorkRect.Max.x);
3322  //else
3323  wrap_pos_x = window->WorkRect.Max.x;
3324  }
3325  else if (wrap_pos_x > 0.0f)
3326  {
3327  wrap_pos_x += window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x; // wrap_pos_x is provided is window local space
3328  }
3329 
3330  return ImMax(wrap_pos_x - pos.x, 1.0f);
3331 }
3332 
3333 // IM_ALLOC() == ImGui::MemAlloc()
3334 void* ImGui::MemAlloc(size_t size)
3335 {
3336  if (ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui)
3337  ctx->IO.MetricsActiveAllocations++;
3338  return GImAllocatorAllocFunc(size, GImAllocatorUserData);
3339 }
3340 
3341 // IM_FREE() == ImGui::MemFree()
3342 void ImGui::MemFree(void* ptr)
3343 {
3344  if (ptr)
3345  if (ImGuiContext* ctx = GImGui)
3346  ctx->IO.MetricsActiveAllocations--;
3347  return GImAllocatorFreeFunc(ptr, GImAllocatorUserData);
3348 }
3349 
3350 const char* ImGui::GetClipboardText()
3351 {
3352  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3353  return g.IO.GetClipboardTextFn ? g.IO.GetClipboardTextFn(g.IO.ClipboardUserData) : "";
3354 }
3355 
3356 void ImGui::SetClipboardText(const char* text)
3357 {
3358  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3359  if (g.IO.SetClipboardTextFn)
3360  g.IO.SetClipboardTextFn(g.IO.ClipboardUserData, text);
3361 }

3364 {
3365  return IMGUI_VERSION;
3366 }
3367 
3368 // Internal state access - if you want to share Dear ImGui state between modules (e.g. DLL) or allocate it yourself
3369 // Note that we still point to some static data and members (such as GFontAtlas), so the state instance you end up using will point to the static data within its module
3370 ImGuiContext* ImGui::GetCurrentContext()
3371 {
3372  return GImGui;
3373 }
3374 
3375 void ImGui::SetCurrentContext(ImGuiContext* ctx)
3376 {
3377 #ifdef IMGUI_SET_CURRENT_CONTEXT_FUNC
3378  IMGUI_SET_CURRENT_CONTEXT_FUNC(ctx); // For custom thread-based hackery you may want to have control over this.
3379 #else
3380  GImGui = ctx;
3381 #endif
3382 }
3383 
3384 void ImGui::SetAllocatorFunctions(void* (*alloc_func)(size_t sz, void* user_data), void (*free_func)(void* ptr, void* user_data), void* user_data)
3385 {
3386  GImAllocatorAllocFunc = alloc_func;
3387  GImAllocatorFreeFunc = free_func;
3388  GImAllocatorUserData = user_data;
3389 }
3390 
3391 ImGuiContext* ImGui::CreateContext(ImFontAtlas* shared_font_atlas)
3392 {
3393  ImGuiContext* ctx = IM_NEW(ImGuiContext)(shared_font_atlas);
3394  if (GImGui == NULL)
3395  SetCurrentContext(ctx);
3396  Initialize(ctx);
3397  return ctx;
3398 }
3399 
3400 void ImGui::DestroyContext(ImGuiContext* ctx)
3401 {
3402  if (ctx == NULL)
3403  ctx = GImGui;
3404  Shutdown(ctx);
3405  if (GImGui == ctx)
3406  SetCurrentContext(NULL);
3407  IM_DELETE(ctx);
3408 }
3409 
3410 // No specific ordering/dependency support, will see as needed
3411 ImGuiID ImGui::AddContextHook(ImGuiContext* ctx, const ImGuiContextHook* hook)
3412 {
3413  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
3414  IM_ASSERT(hook->Callback != NULL && hook->HookId == 0 && hook->Type != ImGuiContextHookType_PendingRemoval_);
3415  g.Hooks.push_back(*hook);
3416  g.Hooks.back().HookId = ++g.HookIdNext;
3417  return g.HookIdNext;
3418 }
3419 
3420 // Deferred removal, avoiding issue with changing vector while iterating it
3421 void ImGui::RemoveContextHook(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID hook_id)
3422 {
3423  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
3424  IM_ASSERT(hook_id != 0);
3425  for (int n = 0; n < g.Hooks.Size; n++)
3426  if (g.Hooks[n].HookId == hook_id)
3427  g.Hooks[n].Type = ImGuiContextHookType_PendingRemoval_;
3428 }
3429 
3430 // Call context hooks (used by e.g. test engine)
3431 // We assume a small number of hooks so all stored in same array
3432 void ImGui::CallContextHooks(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiContextHookType hook_type)
3433 {
3434  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
3435  for (int n = 0; n < g.Hooks.Size; n++)
3436  if (g.Hooks[n].Type == hook_type)
3437  g.Hooks[n].Callback(&g, &g.Hooks[n]);
3438 }
3439 
3440 ImGuiIO& ImGui::GetIO()
3441 {
3442  IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() and ImGui::SetCurrentContext() ?");
3443  return GImGui->IO;
3444 }
3445 
3446 ImGuiPlatformIO& ImGui::GetPlatformIO()
3447 {
3448  IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() or ImGui::SetCurrentContext()?");
3449  return GImGui->PlatformIO;
3450 }
3451 
3452 // Pass this to your backend rendering function! Valid after Render() and until the next call to NewFrame()
3453 ImDrawData* ImGui::GetDrawData()
3454 {
3455  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3456  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[0];
3457  return viewport->DrawDataP.Valid ? &viewport->DrawDataP : NULL;
3458 }

3460 double ImGui::GetTime()
3461 {
3462  return GImGui->Time;
3463 }
3464 
3465 int ImGui::GetFrameCount()
