3468 }
3469 
3470 static ImDrawList* GetViewportDrawList(ImGuiViewportP* viewport, size_t drawlist_no, const char* drawlist_name)
3471 {
3472  // Create the draw list on demand, because they are not frequently used for all viewports
3473  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3474  IM_ASSERT(drawlist_no < IM_ARRAYSIZE(viewport->DrawLists));
3475  ImDrawList* draw_list = viewport->DrawLists[drawlist_no];
3476  if (draw_list == NULL)
3477  {
3478  draw_list = IM_NEW(ImDrawList)(&g.DrawListSharedData);
3479  draw_list->_OwnerName = drawlist_name;
3480  viewport->DrawLists[drawlist_no] = draw_list;
3481  }
3482 
3483  // Our ImDrawList system requires that there is always a command
3484  if (viewport->DrawListsLastFrame[drawlist_no] != g.FrameCount)
3485  {
3486  draw_list->_ResetForNewFrame();
3487  draw_list->PushTextureID(g.IO.Fonts->TexID);
3488  draw_list->PushClipRect(viewport->Pos, viewport->Pos + viewport->Size, false);
3489  viewport->DrawListsLastFrame[drawlist_no] = g.FrameCount;
3490  }
3491  return draw_list;
3492 }
3493 
3494 ImDrawList* ImGui::GetBackgroundDrawList(ImGuiViewport* viewport)
3495 {
3496  return GetViewportDrawList((ImGuiViewportP*)viewport, 0, "##Background");
3497 }
3498 
3499 ImDrawList* ImGui::GetBackgroundDrawList()
3500 {
3501  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3502  return GetBackgroundDrawList(g.CurrentWindow->Viewport);
3503 }
3504 
3505 ImDrawList* ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList(ImGuiViewport* viewport)
3506 {
3507  return GetViewportDrawList((ImGuiViewportP*)viewport, 1, "##Foreground");
3508 }
3509 
3510 ImDrawList* ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList()
3511 {
3512  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3513  return GetForegroundDrawList(g.CurrentWindow->Viewport);
3514 }
3515 
3516 ImDrawListSharedData* ImGui::GetDrawListSharedData()
3517 {
3518  return &GImGui->DrawListSharedData;
3519 }
3520 
3521 void ImGui::StartMouseMovingWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
3522 {
3523  // Set ActiveId even if the _NoMove flag is set. Without it, dragging away from a window with _NoMove would activate hover on other windows.
3524  // We _also_ call this when clicking in a window empty space when io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly is set, but clear g.MovingWindow afterward.
3525  // This is because we want ActiveId to be set even when the window is not permitted to move.
3526  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3527  FocusWindow(window);
3528  SetActiveID(window->MoveId, window);
3529  g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
3530  g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss = true;
3531  g.ActiveIdClickOffset = g.IO.MouseClickedPos[0] - window->RootWindow->Pos;
3532 
3533  bool can_move_window = true;
3534  if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove) || (window->RootWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove))
3535  can_move_window = false;
3536  if (ImGuiDockNode* node = window->DockNodeAsHost)
3537  if (node->VisibleWindow && (node->VisibleWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove))
3538  can_move_window = false;
3539  if (can_move_window)
3540  g.MovingWindow = window;
3541 }
3542 
3543 // We use 'undock_floating_node == false' when dragging from title bar to allow moving groups of floating nodes without undocking them.
3544 // - undock_floating_node == true: when dragging from a floating node within a hierarchy, always undock the node.
3545 // - undock_floating_node == false: when dragging from a floating node within a hierarchy, move root window.
3546 void ImGui::StartMouseMovingWindowOrNode(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiDockNode* node, bool undock_floating_node)
3547 {
3548  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3549  bool can_undock_node = false;
3550  if (node != NULL && node->VisibleWindow && (node->VisibleWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove) == 0)
3551  {
3552  // Can undock if:
3553  // - part of a floating node hierarchy with more than one visible node (if only one is visible, we'll just move the whole hierarchy)
3554  // - part of a dockspace node hierarchy (trivia: undocking from a fixed/central node will create a new node and copy windows)
3555  ImGuiDockNode* root_node = DockNodeGetRootNode(node);
3556  if (root_node->OnlyNodeWithWindows != node || root_node->CentralNode != NULL) // -V1051 PVS-Studio thinks node should be root_node and is wrong about that.
3557  if (undock_floating_node || root_node->IsDockSpace())
3558  can_undock_node = true;
3559  }
3560 
3561  const bool clicked = IsMouseClicked(0);
3562  const bool dragging = IsMouseDragging(0, g.IO.MouseDragThreshold * 1.70f);
3563  if (can_undock_node && dragging)
3564  DockContextQueueUndockNode(&g, node); // Will lead to DockNodeStartMouseMovingWindow() -> StartMouseMovingWindow() being called next frame
3565  else if (!can_undock_node && (clicked || dragging) && g.MovingWindow != window)
3566  StartMouseMovingWindow(window);
3567 }
3568 
3569 // Handle mouse moving window
3570 // Note: moving window with the navigation keys (Square + d-pad / CTRL+TAB + Arrows) are processed in NavUpdateWindowing()
3571 // FIXME: We don't have strong guarantee that g.MovingWindow stay synched with g.ActiveId == g.MovingWindow->MoveId.
3572 // This is currently enforced by the fact that BeginDragDropSource() is setting all g.ActiveIdUsingXXXX flags to inhibit navigation inputs,
3573 // but if we should more thoroughly test cases where g.ActiveId or g.MovingWindow gets changed and not the other.
3574 void ImGui::UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame()
3575 {
3576  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3577  if (g.MovingWindow != NULL)
3578  {
3579  // We actually want to move the root window. g.MovingWindow == window we clicked on (could be a child window).
3580  // We track it to preserve Focus and so that generally ActiveIdWindow == MovingWindow and ActiveId == MovingWindow->MoveId for consistency.
3581  KeepAliveID(g.ActiveId);
3582  IM_ASSERT(g.MovingWindow && g.MovingWindow->RootWindow);
3583  ImGuiWindow* moving_window = g.MovingWindow->RootWindow;
3584  if (g.IO.MouseDown[0] && IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos))
3585  {
3586  ImVec2 pos = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset;
3587  if (moving_window->Pos.x != pos.x || moving_window->Pos.y != pos.y)
3588  {
3589  MarkIniSettingsDirty(moving_window);
3590  SetWindowPos(moving_window, pos, ImGuiCond_Always);
3591  if (moving_window->ViewportOwned) // Synchronize viewport immediately because some overlays may relies on clipping rectangle before we Begin() into the window.
3592  {
3593  moving_window->Viewport->Pos = pos;
3594  moving_window->Viewport->UpdateWorkRect();
3595  }
3596  }
3597  FocusWindow(g.MovingWindow);
3598  }
3599  else
3600  {
3601  // Try to merge the window back into the main viewport.
3602  // This works because MouseViewport should be != MovingWindow->Viewport on release (as per code in UpdateViewports)
3603  if (g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable)
3604  UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewport(moving_window, g.MouseViewport);
3605 
3606  // Restore the mouse viewport so that we don't hover the viewport _under_ the moved window during the frame we released the mouse button.
3607  if (!IsDragDropPayloadBeingAccepted())
3608  g.MouseViewport = moving_window->Viewport;
3609 
3610  // Clear the NoInput window flag set by the Viewport system
3611  moving_window->Viewport->Flags &= ~ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs; // FIXME-VIEWPORT: Test engine managed to crash here because Viewport was NULL.
3612 
3613  ClearActiveID();
3614  g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3615  }
3616  }
3617  else
3618  {
3619  // When clicking/dragging from a window that has the _NoMove flag, we still set the ActiveId in order to prevent hovering others.
3620  if (g.ActiveIdWindow && g.ActiveIdWindow->MoveId == g.ActiveId)
3621  {
3622  KeepAliveID(g.ActiveId);
3623  if (!g.IO.MouseDown[0])
3624  ClearActiveID();
3625  }
3626  }
3627 }
3628 
3629 // Initiate moving window when clicking on empty space or title bar.
3630 // Handle left-click and right-click focus.
3631 void ImGui::UpdateMouseMovingWindowEndFrame()
3632 {
3633  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3634  if (g.ActiveId != 0 || g.HoveredId != 0)
3635  return;
3636 
3637  // Unless we just made a window/popup appear
3638  if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->Appearing)
3639  return;
3640 
3641  // Click on empty space to focus window and start moving
3642  // (after we're done with all our widgets, so e.g. clicking on docking tab-bar which have set HoveredId already and not get us here!)
3643  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[0])
3644  {
3645  // Handle the edge case of a popup being closed while clicking in its empty space.
3646  // If we try to focus it, FocusWindow() > ClosePopupsOverWindow() will accidentally close any parent popups because they are not linked together any more.
3647  ImGuiWindow* root_window = g.HoveredWindow ? g.HoveredWindow->RootWindowDockStop : NULL;
3648  const bool is_closed_popup = root_window && (root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !IsPopupOpen(root_window->PopupId, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel);
3649 
3650  if (root_window != NULL && !is_closed_popup)
3651  {
3652  StartMouseMovingWindow(g.HoveredWindow); //-V595
3653 
3654  // Cancel moving if clicked outside of title bar
3655  if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly)
3656  if (!(root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) || root_window->DockIsActive)
3657  if (!root_window->TitleBarRect().Contains(g.IO.MouseClickedPos[0]))
3658  g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3659 
3660  // Cancel moving if clicked over an item which was disabled or inhibited by popups (note that we know HoveredId == 0 already)
3661  if (g.HoveredIdDisabled)
3662  g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3663  }
3664  else if (root_window == NULL && g.NavWindow != NULL && GetTopMostPopupModal() == NULL)
3665  {
3666  // Clicking on void disable focus
3667  FocusWindow(NULL);
3668  }
3669  }
3670 
3671  // With right mouse button we close popups without changing focus based on where the mouse is aimed
3672  // Instead, focus will be restored to the window under the bottom-most closed popup.
3673  // (The left mouse button path calls FocusWindow on the hovered window, which will lead NewFrame->ClosePopupsOverWindow to trigger)
3674  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[1])
3675  {
3676  // Find the top-most window between HoveredWindow and the top-most Modal Window.
3677  // This is where we can trim the popup stack.
3678  ImGuiWindow* modal = GetTopMostPopupModal();
3679  bool hovered_window_above_modal = g.HoveredWindow && IsWindowAbove(g.HoveredWindow, modal);
3680  ClosePopupsOverWindow(hovered_window_above_modal ? g.HoveredWindow : modal, true);
3681  }
3682 }
3683 
3684 static void TranslateWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& delta)
3685 {
3686  window->Pos += delta;
3687  window->ClipRect.Translate(delta);
3688  window->OuterRectClipped.Translate(delta);
3689  window->InnerRect.Translate(delta);
3690  window->DC.CursorPos += delta;
3691  window->DC.CursorStartPos += delta;
3692  window->DC.CursorMaxPos += delta;
3693  window->DC.LastItemRect.Translate(delta);
3694  window->DC.LastItemDisplayRect.Translate(delta);
3695 }
3696 
3697 static void ScaleWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, float scale)
3698 {
3699  ImVec2 origin = window->Viewport->Pos;
3700  window->Pos = ImFloor((window->Pos - origin) * scale + origin);
3701  window->Size = ImFloor(window->Size * scale);
3702  window->SizeFull = ImFloor(window->SizeFull * scale);
3703  window->ContentSize = ImFloor(window->ContentSize * scale);
3704 }
3705 
3706 static bool IsWindowActiveAndVisible(ImGuiWindow* window)
3707 {
3708  return (window->Active) && (!window->Hidden);
3709 }
3710 
3711 static void ImGui::UpdateMouseInputs()
3712 {
3713  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3714 
3715  // Round mouse position to avoid spreading non-rounded position (e.g. UpdateManualResize doesn't support them well)
3716  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos))
3717  g.IO.MousePos = g.LastValidMousePos = ImFloor(g.IO.MousePos);
3718 
3719  // If mouse just appeared or disappeared (usually denoted by -FLT_MAX components) we cancel out movement in MouseDelta
3720  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) && IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePosPrev))
3721  g.IO.MouseDelta = g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MousePosPrev;
3722  else
3723  g.IO.MouseDelta = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
3724  if (g.IO.MouseDelta.x != 0.0f || g.IO.MouseDelta.y != 0.0f)
3725  g.NavDisableMouseHover = false;
3726 
3727  g.IO.MousePosPrev = g.IO.MousePos;
3728  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown); i++)
3729  {
3730  g.IO.MouseClicked[i] = g.IO.MouseDown[i] && g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] < 0.0f;
3731  g.IO.MouseReleased[i] = !g.IO.MouseDown[i] && g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] >= 0.0f;
3732  g.IO.MouseDownDurationPrev[i] = g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i];
3733  g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] = g.IO.MouseDown[i] ? (g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] < 0.0f ? 0.0f : g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] + g.IO.DeltaTime) : -1.0f;
3734  g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[i] = false;
3735  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[i])
3736  {
3737  if ((float)(g.Time - g.IO.MouseClickedTime[i]) < g.IO.MouseDoubleClickTime)
3738  {
3739  ImVec2 delta_from_click_pos = IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) ? (g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MouseClickedPos[i]) : ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
3740  if (ImLengthSqr(delta_from_click_pos) < g.IO.MouseDoubleClickMaxDist * g.IO.MouseDoubleClickMaxDist)
3741  g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[i] = true;
3742  g.IO.MouseClickedTime[i] = -g.IO.MouseDoubleClickTime * 2.0f; // Mark as "old enough" so the third click isn't turned into a double-click
3743  }
3744  else
3745  {
3746  g.IO.MouseClickedTime[i] = g.Time;
3747  }
3748  g.IO.MouseClickedPos[i] = g.IO.MousePos;
3749  g.IO.MouseDownWasDoubleClick[i] = g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[i];
3750  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i] = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
3751  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i] = 0.0f;
3752  }
3753  else if (g.IO.MouseDown[i])
3754  {
3755  // Maintain the maximum distance we reaching from the initial click position, which is used with dragging threshold
3756  ImVec2 delta_from_click_pos = IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) ? (g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MouseClickedPos[i]) : ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
3757  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i] = ImMax(g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i], ImLengthSqr(delta_from_click_pos));
3758  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].x = ImMax(g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].x, delta_from_click_pos.x < 0.0f ? -delta_from_click_pos.x : delta_from_click_pos.x);
3759  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].y = ImMax(g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].y, delta_from_click_pos.y < 0.0f ? -delta_from_click_pos.y : delta_from_click_pos.y);
3760  }
3761  if (!g.IO.MouseDown[i] && !g.IO.MouseReleased[i])
3762  g.IO.MouseDownWasDoubleClick[i] = false;
3763  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[i]) // Clicking any mouse button reactivate mouse hovering which may have been deactivated by gamepad/keyboard navigation
3764  g.NavDisableMouseHover = false;
3765  }
3766 }
3767 
3768 static void StartLockWheelingWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
3769 {
3770  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3771  if (g.WheelingWindow == window)
3772  return;
3773  g.WheelingWindow = window;
3774  g.WheelingWindowRefMousePos = g.IO.MousePos;
3775  g.WheelingWindowTimer = WINDOWS_MOUSE_WHEEL_SCROLL_LOCK_TIMER;
3776 }
3777 
3778 void ImGui::UpdateMouseWheel()
3779 {
3780  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3781 
3782  // Reset the locked window if we move the mouse or after the timer elapses
3783  if (g.WheelingWindow != NULL)
3784  {
3785  g.WheelingWindowTimer -= g.IO.DeltaTime;
3786  if (IsMousePosValid() && ImLengthSqr(g.IO.MousePos - g.WheelingWindowRefMousePos) > g.IO.MouseDragThreshold * g.IO.MouseDragThreshold)
3787  g.WheelingWindowTimer = 0.0f;
3788  if (g.WheelingWindowTimer <= 0.0f)
3789  {
3790  g.WheelingWindow = NULL;
3791  g.WheelingWindowTimer = 0.0f;
3792  }
3793  }
3794 
3795  if (g.IO.MouseWheel == 0.0f && g.IO.MouseWheelH == 0.0f)
3796  return;
3797 
3798  if ((g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveIdUsingMouseWheel) || (g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != 0 && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrameUsingMouseWheel))
3799  return;
3800 
3801  ImGuiWindow* window = g.WheelingWindow ? g.WheelingWindow : g.HoveredWindow;
3802  if (!window || window->Collapsed)
3803  return;
3804 
3805  // Zoom / Scale window
3806  // FIXME-OBSOLETE: This is an old feature, it still works but pretty much nobody is using it and may be best redesigned.
3807  if (g.IO.MouseWheel != 0.0f && g.IO.KeyCtrl && g.IO.FontAllowUserScaling)
3808  {
3809  StartLockWheelingWindow(window);
3810  const float new_font_scale = ImClamp(window->FontWindowScale + g.IO.MouseWheel * 0.10f, 0.50f, 2.50f);
3811  const float scale = new_font_scale / window->FontWindowScale;
3812  window->FontWindowScale = new_font_scale;
3813  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
3814  {
3815  const ImVec2 offset = window->Size * (1.0f - scale) * (g.IO.MousePos - window->Pos) / window->Size;
3816  SetWindowPos(window, window->Pos + offset, 0);
3817  window->Size = ImFloor(window->Size * scale);
3818  window->SizeFull = ImFloor(window->SizeFull * scale);
3819  }
3820  return;
3821  }
3822 
3823  // Mouse wheel scrolling
3824  // If a child window has the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse flag, we give a chance to scroll its parent
3825 
3826  // Vertical Mouse Wheel scrolling
3827  const float wheel_y = (g.IO.MouseWheel != 0.0f && !g.IO.KeyShift) ? g.IO.MouseWheel : 0.0f;
3828  if (wheel_y != 0.0f && !g.IO.KeyCtrl)
3829  {
3830  StartLockWheelingWindow(window);
3831  while ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && ((window->ScrollMax.y == 0.0f) || ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))))
3832  window = window->ParentWindow;
3833  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
3834  {
3835  float max_step = window->InnerRect.GetHeight() * 0.67f;
3836  float scroll_step = ImFloor(ImMin(5 * window->CalcFontSize(), max_step));
3837  SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y - wheel_y * scroll_step);
3838  }
3839  }
3840 
3841  // Horizontal Mouse Wheel scrolling, or Vertical Mouse Wheel w/ Shift held
3842  const float wheel_x = (g.IO.MouseWheelH != 0.0f && !g.IO.KeyShift) ? g.IO.MouseWheelH : (g.IO.MouseWheel != 0.0f && g.IO.KeyShift) ? g.IO.MouseWheel : 0.0f;
3843  if (wheel_x != 0.0f && !g.IO.KeyCtrl)
3844  {
3845  StartLockWheelingWindow(window);
3846  while ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && ((window->ScrollMax.x == 0.0f) || ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))))
3847  window = window->ParentWindow;
3848  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
3849  {
3850  float max_step = window->InnerRect.GetWidth() * 0.67f;
3851  float scroll_step = ImFloor(ImMin(2 * window->CalcFontSize(), max_step));
3852  SetScrollX(window, window->Scroll.x - wheel_x * scroll_step);
3853  }
3854  }
3855 }
3856 
3857 void ImGui::UpdateTabFocus()
3858 {
3859  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3860 
3861  // Pressing TAB activate widget focus
3862  g.FocusTabPressed = (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->Active && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) && !g.IO.KeyCtrl && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Tab));
3863  if (g.ActiveId == 0 && g.FocusTabPressed)
3864  {
3865  // Note that SetKeyboardFocusHere() sets the Next fields mid-frame. To be consistent we also
3866  // manipulate the Next fields even, even though they will be turned into Curr fields by the code below.
3867  g.FocusRequestNextWindow = g.NavWindow;
3868  g.FocusRequestNextCounterRegular = INT_MAX;
3869  if (g.NavId != 0 && g.NavIdTabCounter != INT_MAX)
3870  g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = g.NavIdTabCounter + 1 + (g.IO.KeyShift ? -1 : 1);
3871  else
3872  g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = g.IO.KeyShift ? -1 : 0;
3873  }
3874 
3875  // Turn queued focus request into current one
3876  g.FocusRequestCurrWindow = NULL;
3877  g.FocusRequestCurrCounterRegular = g.FocusRequestCurrCounterTabStop = INT_MAX;
3878  if (g.FocusRequestNextWindow != NULL)
3879  {
3880  ImGuiWindow* window = g.FocusRequestNextWindow;
3881  g.FocusRequestCurrWindow = window;
3882  if (g.FocusRequestNextCounterRegular != INT_MAX && window->DC.FocusCounterRegular != -1)
3883  g.FocusRequestCurrCounterRegular = ImModPositive(g.FocusRequestNextCounterRegular, window->DC.FocusCounterRegular + 1);
3884  if (g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop != INT_MAX && window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop != -1)
3885  g.FocusRequestCurrCounterTabStop = ImModPositive(g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop, window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop + 1);
3886  g.FocusRequestNextWindow = NULL;
3887  g.FocusRequestNextCounterRegular = g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = INT_MAX;
3888  }
3889 
3890  g.NavIdTabCounter = INT_MAX;
3891 }
3892 
3893 // The reason this is exposed in imgui_internal.h is: on touch-based system that don't have hovering, we want to dispatch inputs to the right target (imgui vs imgui+app)
3894 void ImGui::UpdateHoveredWindowAndCaptureFlags()
3895 {
3896  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3897 
3898  // Find the window hovered by mouse:
3899  // - Child windows can extend beyond the limit of their parent so we need to derive HoveredRootWindow from HoveredWindow.
3900  // - When moving a window we can skip the search, which also conveniently bypasses the fact that window->WindowRectClipped is lagging as this point of the frame.
3901  // - We also support the moved window toggling the NoInputs flag after moving has started in order to be able to detect windows below it, which is useful for e.g. docking mechanisms.
3902  bool clear_hovered_windows = false;
3903  FindHoveredWindow();
3904  IM_ASSERT(g.HoveredWindow == NULL || g.HoveredWindow == g.MovingWindow || g.HoveredWindow->Viewport == g.MouseViewport);
3905 
3906  // Modal windows prevents mouse from hovering behind them.
3907  ImGuiWindow* modal_window = GetTopMostPopupModal();
3908  if (modal_window && g.HoveredRootWindow && !IsWindowChildOf(g.HoveredRootWindow, modal_window))
3909  clear_hovered_windows = true;
3910 
3911  // Disabled mouse?
3912  if (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse)
3913  clear_hovered_windows = true;
3914 
3915  // We track click ownership. When clicked outside of a window the click is owned by the application and won't report hovering nor request capture even while dragging over our windows afterward.
3916  int mouse_earliest_button_down = -1;
3917  bool mouse_any_down = false;
3918  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown); i++)
3919  {
3920  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[i])
3921  g.IO.MouseDownOwned[i] = (g.HoveredWindow != NULL) || (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0);
3922  mouse_any_down |= g.IO.MouseDown[i];
3923  if (g.IO.MouseDown[i])
3924  if (mouse_earliest_button_down == -1 || g.IO.MouseClickedTime[i] < g.IO.MouseClickedTime[mouse_earliest_button_down])
3925  mouse_earliest_button_down = i;
3926  }
3927  const bool mouse_avail_to_imgui = (mouse_earliest_button_down == -1) || g.IO.MouseDownOwned[mouse_earliest_button_down];
3928 
3929  // If mouse was first clicked outside of ImGui bounds we also cancel out hovering.
3930  // FIXME: For patterns of drag and drop across OS windows, we may need to rework/remove this test (first committed 311c0ca9 on 2015/02)
3931  const bool mouse_dragging_extern_payload = g.DragDropActive && (g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern) != 0;
3932  if (!mouse_avail_to_imgui && !mouse_dragging_extern_payload)
3933  clear_hovered_windows = true;
3934 
3935  if (clear_hovered_windows)
3936  g.HoveredWindow = g.HoveredRootWindow = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow = NULL;
3937 
3938  // Update io.WantCaptureMouse for the user application (true = dispatch mouse info to imgui, false = dispatch mouse info to Dear ImGui + app)
3939  if (g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame != -1)
3940  g.IO.WantCaptureMouse = (g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame != 0);
3941  else
3942  g.IO.WantCaptureMouse = (mouse_avail_to_imgui && (g.HoveredWindow != NULL || mouse_any_down)) || (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0);
3943 
3944  // Update io.WantCaptureKeyboard for the user application (true = dispatch keyboard info to imgui, false = dispatch keyboard info to Dear ImGui + app)
3945  if (g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame != -1)
3946  g.IO.WantCaptureKeyboard = (g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame != 0);
3947  else
3948  g.IO.WantCaptureKeyboard = (g.ActiveId != 0) || (modal_window != NULL);
3949  if (g.IO.NavActive && (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) && !(g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard))
3950  g.IO.WantCaptureKeyboard = true;
3951 
3952  // Update io.WantTextInput flag, this is to allow systems without a keyboard (e.g. mobile, hand-held) to show a software keyboard if possible
3953  g.IO.WantTextInput = (g.WantTextInputNextFrame != -1) ? (g.WantTextInputNextFrame != 0) : false;
3954 }
3955 
3956 ImGuiKeyModFlags ImGui::GetMergedKeyModFlags()
3957 {
3958  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3959  ImGuiKeyModFlags key_mod_flags = ImGuiKeyModFlags_None;
3960  if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) { key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Ctrl; }
3961  if (g.IO.KeyShift) { key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Shift; }
3962  if (g.IO.KeyAlt) { key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt; }
3963  if (g.IO.KeySuper) { key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Super; }
3964  return key_mod_flags;
3965 }
3966 
3967 void ImGui::NewFrame()
3968 {
3969  IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() and ImGui::SetCurrentContext() ?");
3970  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3971 
3972  // Remove pending delete hooks before frame start.
3973  // This deferred removal avoid issues of removal while iterating the hook vector
3974  for (int n = g.Hooks.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
3975  if (g.Hooks[n].Type == ImGuiContextHookType_PendingRemoval_)
3976  g.Hooks.erase(&g.Hooks[n]);
3977 
3978  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_NewFramePre);
3979 
3980  // Check and assert for various common IO and Configuration mistakes
3981  g.ConfigFlagsLastFrame = g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame;
3982  ErrorCheckNewFrameSanityChecks();
3983  g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame = g.IO.ConfigFlags;
3984 
3985  // Load settings on first frame, save settings when modified (after a delay)
3986  UpdateSettings();
3987 
3988  g.Time += g.IO.DeltaTime;
3989  g.WithinFrameScope = true;
3990  g.FrameCount += 1;
3991  g.TooltipOverrideCount = 0;
3992  g.WindowsActiveCount = 0;
3993  g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.resize(0);
3994 
3995  // Calculate frame-rate for the user, as a purely luxurious feature
3996  g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum += g.IO.DeltaTime - g.FramerateSecPerFrame[g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx];
3997  g.FramerateSecPerFrame[g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx] = g.IO.DeltaTime;
3998  g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx = (g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx + 1) % IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.FramerateSecPerFrame);
3999  g.IO.Framerate = (g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum > 0.0f) ? (1.0f / (g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum / (float)IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.FramerateSecPerFrame))) : FLT_MAX;
4000 
4001  UpdateViewportsNewFrame();
4002 
4003  // Setup current font and draw list shared data
4004  // FIXME-VIEWPORT: the concept of a single ClipRectFullscreen is not ideal!
4005  g.IO.Fonts->Locked = true;
4006  SetCurrentFont(GetDefaultFont());
4007  IM_ASSERT(g.Font->IsLoaded());
4008  ImRect virtual_space(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX);
4009  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
4010  virtual_space.Add(g.Viewports[n]->GetMainRect());
4011  g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen = virtual_space.ToVec4();
4012  g.DrawListSharedData.CurveTessellationTol = g.Style.CurveTessellationTol;
4013  g.DrawListSharedData.SetCircleTessellationMaxError(g.Style.CircleTessellationMaxError);
4014  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags = ImDrawListFlags_None;
4015  if (g.Style.AntiAliasedLines)
4016  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines;
4017  if (g.Style.AntiAliasedLinesUseTex && !(g.Font->ContainerAtlas->Flags & ImFontAtlasFlags_NoBakedLines))
4018  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLinesUseTex;
4019  if (g.Style.AntiAliasedFill)
4020  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedFill;
4021  if (g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset)
4022  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset;
4023 
4024  // Mark rendering data as invalid to prevent user who may have a handle on it to use it.
4025  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
4026  {
4027  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
4028  viewport->DrawData = NULL;
4029  viewport->DrawDataP.Clear();
4030  }
4031 
4032  // Drag and drop keep the source ID alive so even if the source disappear our state is consistent
4033  if (g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropPayload.SourceId == g.ActiveId)
4034  KeepAliveID(g.DragDropPayload.SourceId);
4035 
4036  // Update HoveredId data
4037  if (!g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame)
4038  g.HoveredIdTimer = 0.0f;
4039  if (!g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame || (g.HoveredId && g.ActiveId == g.HoveredId))
4040  g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer = 0.0f;
4041  if (g.HoveredId)
4042  g.HoveredIdTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4043  if (g.HoveredId && g.ActiveId != g.HoveredId)
4044  g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4045  g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame = g.HoveredId;
4046  g.HoveredIdPreviousFrameUsingMouseWheel = g.HoveredIdUsingMouseWheel;
4047  g.HoveredId = 0;
4048  g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = false;
4049  g.HoveredIdUsingMouseWheel = false;
4050  g.HoveredIdDisabled = false;
4051 
4052  // Update ActiveId data (clear reference to active widget if the widget isn't alive anymore)
4053  if (g.ActiveIdIsAlive != g.ActiveId && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == g.ActiveId && g.ActiveId != 0)
4054  ClearActiveID();
4055  if (g.ActiveId)
4056  g.ActiveIdTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4057  g.LastActiveIdTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
4058  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame = g.ActiveId;
4059  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameWindow = g.ActiveIdWindow;
4060  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameHasBeenEditedBefore = g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore;
4061  g.ActiveIdIsAlive = 0;
4062  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = false;
4063  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = false;
4064  g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated = false;
4065  if (g.TempInputId != 0 && g.ActiveId != g.TempInputId)
4066  g.TempInputId = 0;
4067  if (g.ActiveId == 0)
4068  {
4069  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = 0x00;
4070  g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = 0x00;
4071  g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask = 0x00;
4072  }
4073 
4074  // Drag and drop
4075  g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev = g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr;
4076  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = 0;
4077  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = FLT_MAX;
4078  g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
4079  g.DragDropWithinTarget = false;
4080  g.DragDropHoldJustPressedId = 0;
4081 
4082  // Update keyboard input state
4083  // Synchronize io.KeyMods with individual modifiers io.KeyXXX bools
4084  g.IO.KeyMods = GetMergedKeyModFlags();
4085  memcpy(g.IO.KeysDownDurationPrev, g.IO.KeysDownDuration, sizeof(g.IO.KeysDownDuration));
4086  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown); i++)
4087  g.IO.KeysDownDuration[i] = g.IO.KeysDown[i] ? (g.IO.KeysDownDuration[i] < 0.0f ? 0.0f : g.IO.KeysDownDuration[i] + g.IO.DeltaTime) : -1.0f;
4088 
4089  // Update gamepad/keyboard navigation
4090  NavUpdate();
4091 
4092  // Update mouse input state
4093  UpdateMouseInputs();
4094 
4095  // Undocking
4096  // (needs to be before UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame so the window is already offset and following the mouse on the detaching frame)
4097  DockContextNewFrameUpdateUndocking(&g);
4098 
4099  // Find hovered window
4100  // (needs to be before UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame so we fill g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow on the mouse release frame)
4101  UpdateHoveredWindowAndCaptureFlags();
4102 
4103  // Handle user moving window with mouse (at the beginning of the frame to avoid input lag or sheering)
4104  UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame();
4105 
4106  // Background darkening/whitening
4107  if (GetTopMostPopupModal() != NULL || (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL && g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha > 0.0f))
4108  g.DimBgRatio = ImMin(g.DimBgRatio + g.IO.DeltaTime * 6.0f, 1.0f);
4109  else
4110  g.DimBgRatio = ImMax(g.DimBgRatio - g.IO.DeltaTime * 10.0f, 0.0f);
4111 
4112  g.MouseCursor = ImGuiMouseCursor_Arrow;
4113  g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame = g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame = g.WantTextInputNextFrame = -1;
4114  g.PlatformImePos = ImVec2(1.0f, 1.0f); // OS Input Method Editor showing on top-left of our window by default
4115  g.PlatformImePosViewport = NULL;
4116 
4117  // Mouse wheel scrolling, scale
4118  UpdateMouseWheel();
4119 
4120  // Update legacy TAB focus
4121  UpdateTabFocus();
4122 
4123  // Mark all windows as not visible and compact unused memory.
4124  IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size == g.Windows.Size);
4125  const float memory_compact_start_time = (g.GcCompactAll || g.IO.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer < 0.0f) ? FLT_MAX : (float)g.Time - g.IO.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer;
4126  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
4127  {
4128  ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
4129  window->WasActive = window->Active;
4130  window->BeginCount = 0;
4131  window->Active = false;
4132  window->WriteAccessed = false;
4133 
4134  // Garbage collect transient buffers of recently unused windows
4135  if (!window->WasActive && !window->MemoryCompacted && window->LastTimeActive < memory_compact_start_time)
4136  GcCompactTransientWindowBuffers(window);
4137  }
4138 
4139  // Garbage collect transient buffers of recently unused tables
4140  for (int i = 0; i < g.TablesLastTimeActive.Size; i++)
4141  if (g.TablesLastTimeActive[i] >= 0.0f && g.TablesLastTimeActive[i] < memory_compact_start_time)
4142  TableGcCompactTransientBuffers(g.Tables.GetByIndex(i));
4143  if (g.GcCompactAll)
4144  GcCompactTransientMiscBuffers();
4145  g.GcCompactAll = false;
4146 
4147  // Closing the focused window restore focus to the first active root window in descending z-order
4148  if (g.NavWindow && !g.NavWindow->WasActive)
4149  FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(NULL, NULL);
4150 
4151  // No window should be open at the beginning of the frame.
4152  // But in order to allow the user to call NewFrame() multiple times without calling Render(), we are doing an explicit clear.
4153  g.CurrentWindowStack.resize(0);
4154  g.BeginPopupStack.resize(0);
4155  g.ItemFlagsStack.resize(0);
4156  g.ItemFlagsStack.push_back(ImGuiItemFlags_Default_);
4157  g.GroupStack.resize(0);
4158  ClosePopupsOverWindow(g.NavWindow, false);
4159 
4160  // Docking
4161  DockContextNewFrameUpdateDocking(&g);
4162 
4163  // [DEBUG] Item picker tool - start with DebugStartItemPicker() - useful to visually select an item and break into its call-stack.
4164  UpdateDebugToolItemPicker();
4165 
4166  // Create implicit/fallback window - which we will only render it if the user has added something to it.
4167  // We don't use "Debug" to avoid colliding with user trying to create a "Debug" window with custom flags.
4168  // This fallback is particularly important as it avoid ImGui:: calls from crashing.
4169  g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow = true;
4170  SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(400, 400), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
4171  Begin("Debug##Default");
4172  IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow->IsFallbackWindow == true);
4173 
4174  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_NewFramePost);
4175 }
4176 
4177 // [DEBUG] Item picker tool - start with DebugStartItemPicker() - useful to visually select an item and break into its call-stack.
4178 void ImGui::UpdateDebugToolItemPicker()
4179 {
4180  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4181  g.DebugItemPickerBreakId = 0;
4182  if (g.DebugItemPickerActive)
4183  {
4184  const ImGuiID hovered_id = g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame;
4185  ImGui::SetMouseCursor(ImGuiMouseCursor_Hand);
4186  if (ImGui::IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Escape))
4187  g.DebugItemPickerActive = false;
4188  if (ImGui::IsMouseClicked(0) && hovered_id)
4189  {
4190  g.DebugItemPickerBreakId = hovered_id;
4191  g.DebugItemPickerActive = false;
4192  }
4193  ImGui::SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.60f);
4194  ImGui::BeginTooltip();
4195  ImGui::Text("HoveredId: 0x%08X", hovered_id);
4196  ImGui::Text("Press ESC to abort picking.");
4197  ImGui::TextColored(GetStyleColorVec4(hovered_id ? ImGuiCol_Text : ImGuiCol_TextDisabled), "Click to break in debugger!");
4198  ImGui::EndTooltip();
4199  }
4200 }
4201 
4202 void ImGui::Initialize(ImGuiContext* context)
4203 {
4204  ImGuiContext& g = *context;
4205  IM_ASSERT(!g.Initialized && !g.SettingsLoaded);
4206 
4207  // Add .ini handle for ImGuiWindow type
4208  {
4209  ImGuiSettingsHandler ini_handler;
4210  ini_handler.TypeName = "Window";
4211  ini_handler.TypeHash = ImHashStr("Window");
4212  ini_handler.ClearAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ClearAll;
4213  ini_handler.ReadOpenFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ReadOpen;
4214  ini_handler.ReadLineFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ReadLine;
4215  ini_handler.ApplyAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ApplyAll;
4216  ini_handler.WriteAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_WriteAll;
4217  g.SettingsHandlers.push_back(ini_handler);
4218  }
4219 
4220 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_TABLE
4221  // Add .ini handle for ImGuiTable type
4222  TableSettingsInstallHandler(context);
4223 #endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_TABLE
4224 
4225  // Create default viewport
4226  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = IM_NEW(ImGuiViewportP)();
4227  viewport->ID = IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID;
4228  viewport->Idx = 0;
4229  viewport->PlatformWindowCreated = true;
4230  viewport->Flags = ImGuiViewportFlags_OwnedByApp;
4231  g.Viewports.push_back(viewport);
4232  g.PlatformIO.Viewports.push_back(g.Viewports[0]);
4233 
4234 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
4235  // Initialize Docking
4236  DockContextInitialize(&g);
4237 #endif
4238 
4239  g.Initialized = true;
4240 }
4241 
4242 // This function is merely here to free heap allocations.
4243 void ImGui::Shutdown(ImGuiContext* context)
4244 {
4245  // The fonts atlas can be used prior to calling NewFrame(), so we clear it even if g.Initialized is FALSE (which would happen if we never called NewFrame)
4246  ImGuiContext& g = *context;
4247  if (g.IO.Fonts && g.FontAtlasOwnedByContext)
4248  {
4249  g.IO.Fonts->Locked = false;
4250  IM_DELETE(g.IO.Fonts);
4251  }
4252  g.IO.Fonts = NULL;
4253 
4254  // Cleanup of other data are conditional on actually having initialized Dear ImGui.
4255  if (!g.Initialized)
4256  return;
4257 
4258  // Save settings (unless we haven't attempted to load them: CreateContext/DestroyContext without a call to NewFrame shouldn't save an empty file)
4259  if (g.SettingsLoaded && g.IO.IniFilename != NULL)
4260  {
4261  ImGuiContext* backup_context = GImGui;
4262  SetCurrentContext(&g);
4263  SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
4264  SetCurrentContext(backup_context);
4265  }
4266 
4267  // Destroy platform windows
4268  ImGuiContext* backup_context = ImGui::GetCurrentContext();
4269  SetCurrentContext(context);
4270  DestroyPlatformWindows();
4271  SetCurrentContext(backup_context);
4272 
4273  // Shutdown extensions
4274  DockContextShutdown(&g);
4275 
4276  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_Shutdown);
4277 
4278  // Clear everything else
4279  for (int i = 0; i < g.Windows.Size; i++)
4280  IM_DELETE(g.Windows[i]);
4281  g.Windows.clear();
4282  g.WindowsFocusOrder.clear();
4283  g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.clear();
4284  g.CurrentWindow = NULL;
4285  g.CurrentWindowStack.clear();
4286  g.WindowsById.Clear();
4287  g.NavWindow = NULL;
4288  g.HoveredWindow = g.HoveredRootWindow = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow = NULL;
4289  g.ActiveIdWindow = g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameWindow = NULL;
4290  g.MovingWindow = NULL;
4291  g.ColorStack.clear();
4292  g.StyleVarStack.clear();
4293  g.FontStack.clear();
4294  g.OpenPopupStack.clear();
4295  g.BeginPopupStack.clear();
4296 
4297  g.CurrentViewport = g.MouseViewport = g.MouseLastHoveredViewport = NULL;
4298  for (int i = 0; i < g.Viewports.Size; i++)
4299  IM_DELETE(g.Viewports[i]);
4300  g.Viewports.clear();
4301 
4302  g.TabBars.Clear();
4303  g.CurrentTabBarStack.clear();
4304  g.ShrinkWidthBuffer.clear();
4305 
4306  g.Tables.Clear();
4307  g.CurrentTableStack.clear();
4308  g.DrawChannelsTempMergeBuffer.clear();
4309 
4310  g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
4311  g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.clear();
4312  g.InputTextState.ClearFreeMemory();
4313 
4314  g.SettingsWindows.clear();
4315  g.SettingsHandlers.clear();
4316 
4317  if (g.LogFile)
4318  {
4319 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
4320  if (g.LogFile != stdout)
4321 #endif
4322  ImFileClose(g.LogFile);
4323  g.LogFile = NULL;
4324  }
4325  g.LogBuffer.clear();
4326 
4327  g.Initialized = false;
4328 }
4329 
4330 // FIXME: Add a more explicit sort order in the window structure.
4331 static int IMGUI_CDECL ChildWindowComparer(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
4332 {
4333  const ImGuiWindow* const a = *(const ImGuiWindow* const *)lhs;
4334  const ImGuiWindow* const b = *(const ImGuiWindow* const *)rhs;
4335  if (int d = (a->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) - (b->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
4336  return d;
4337  if (int d = (a->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) - (b->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip))
4338  return d;
4339  return (a->BeginOrderWithinParent - b->BeginOrderWithinParent);
4340 }
4341 
4342 static void AddWindowToSortBuffer(ImVector<ImGuiWindow*>* out_sorted_windows, ImGuiWindow* window)
4343 {
4344  out_sorted_windows->push_back(window);
4345  if (window->Active)
4346  {
4347  int count = window->DC.ChildWindows.Size;
4348  if (count > 1)
4349  ImQsort(window->DC.ChildWindows.Data, (size_t)count, sizeof(ImGuiWindow*), ChildWindowComparer);
4350  for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
4351  {
4352  ImGuiWindow* child = window->DC.ChildWindows[i];
4353  if (child->Active)
4354  AddWindowToSortBuffer(out_sorted_windows, child);
4355  }
4356  }
4357 }
4358 
4359 static void AddDrawListToDrawData(ImVector<ImDrawList*>* out_list, ImDrawList* draw_list)
4360 {
4361  // Remove trailing command if unused.
4362  // Technically we could return directly instead of popping, but this make things looks neat in Metrics/Debugger window as well.
4363  draw_list->_PopUnusedDrawCmd();
4364  if (draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size == 0)
4365  return;
4366 
4367  // Draw list sanity check. Detect mismatch between PrimReserve() calls and incrementing _VtxCurrentIdx, _VtxWritePtr etc.
4368  // May trigger for you if you are using PrimXXX functions incorrectly.
4369  IM_ASSERT(draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size == 0 || draw_list->_VtxWritePtr == draw_list->VtxBuffer.Data + draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size);
4370  IM_ASSERT(draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size == 0 || draw_list->_IdxWritePtr == draw_list->IdxBuffer.Data + draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size);
4371  if (!(draw_list->Flags & ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset))
4372  IM_ASSERT((int)draw_list->_VtxCurrentIdx == draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size);
4373 
4374  // Check that draw_list doesn't use more vertices than indexable (default ImDrawIdx = unsigned short = 2 bytes = 64K vertices per ImDrawList = per window)
4375  // If this assert triggers because you are drawing lots of stuff manually:
4376  // - First, make sure you are coarse clipping yourself and not trying to draw many things outside visible bounds.
4377  // Be mindful that the ImDrawList API doesn't filter vertices. Use the Metrics/Debugger window to inspect draw list contents.
4378  // - If you want large meshes with more than 64K vertices, you can either:
4379  // (A) Handle the ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset value in your renderer backend, and set 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset'.
4380  // Most example backends already support this from 1.71. Pre-1.71 backends won't.
4381  // Some graphics API such as GL ES 1/2 don't have a way to offset the starting vertex so it is not supported for them.
4382  // (B) Or handle 32-bit indices in your renderer backend, and uncomment '#define ImDrawIdx unsigned int' line in imconfig.h.
4383  // Most example backends already support this. For example, the OpenGL example code detect index size at compile-time:
4384  // glDrawElements(GL_TRIANGLES, (GLsizei)pcmd->ElemCount, sizeof(ImDrawIdx) == 2 ? GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT : GL_UNSIGNED_INT, idx_buffer_offset);
4385  // Your own engine or render API may use different parameters or function calls to specify index sizes.
4386  // 2 and 4 bytes indices are generally supported by most graphics API.
4387  // - If for some reason neither of those solutions works for you, a workaround is to call BeginChild()/EndChild() before reaching
4388  // the 64K limit to split your draw commands in multiple draw lists.
4389  if (sizeof(ImDrawIdx) == 2)
4390  IM_ASSERT(draw_list->_VtxCurrentIdx < (1 << 16) && "Too many vertices in ImDrawList using 16-bit indices. Read comment above");
4391 
4392  out_list->push_back(draw_list);
4393 }
4394 
4395 static void AddWindowToDrawData(ImGuiWindow* window, int layer)
4396 {
4397  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4398  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = window->Viewport;
4399  g.IO.MetricsRenderWindows++;
4400  AddDrawListToDrawData(&viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer], window->DrawList);
4401  for (int i = 0; i < window->DC.ChildWindows.Size; i++)
4402  {
4403  ImGuiWindow* child = window->DC.ChildWindows[i];
4404  if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(child)) // Clipped children may have been marked not active
4405  AddWindowToDrawData(child, layer);
4406  }
4407 }
4408 
4409 // Layer is locked for the root window, however child windows may use a different viewport (e.g. extruding menu)
4410 static void AddRootWindowToDrawData(ImGuiWindow* window)
4411 {
4412  int layer = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) ? 1 : 0;
4413  AddWindowToDrawData(window, layer);
4414 }
4415 
4416 void ImDrawDataBuilder::FlattenIntoSingleLayer()
4417 {
4418  int n = Layers[0].Size;
4419  int size = n;
4420  for (int i = 1; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Layers); i++)
4421  size += Layers[i].Size;
4422  Layers[0].resize(size);
4423  for (int layer_n = 1; layer_n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Layers); layer_n++)
4424  {
4425  ImVector<ImDrawList*>& layer = Layers[layer_n];
4426  if (layer.empty())
4427  continue;
4428  memcpy(&Layers[0][n], &layer[0], layer.Size * sizeof(ImDrawList*));
4429  n += layer.Size;
4430  layer.resize(0);
4431  }
4432 }
4433 
4434 static void SetupViewportDrawData(ImGuiViewportP* viewport, ImVector<ImDrawList*>* draw_lists)
4435 {
4436  // When minimized, we report draw_data->DisplaySize as zero to be consistent with non-viewport mode,
4437  // and to allow applications/backends to easily skip rendering.
4438  // FIXME: Note that we however do NOT attempt to report "zero drawlist / vertices" into the ImDrawData structure.
4439  // This is because the work has been done already, and its wasted! We should fix that and add optimizations for
4440  // it earlier in the pipeline, rather than pretend to hide the data at the end of the pipeline.
4441  const bool is_minimized = (viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized) != 0;
4442 
4443  ImGuiIO& io = ImGui::GetIO();
4444  ImDrawData* draw_data = &viewport->DrawDataP;
4445  viewport->DrawData = draw_data; // Make publicly accessible
4446  draw_data->Valid = true;
4447  draw_data->CmdLists = (draw_lists->Size > 0) ? draw_lists->Data : NULL;
4448  draw_data->CmdListsCount = draw_lists->Size;
4449  draw_data->TotalVtxCount = draw_data->TotalIdxCount = 0;
4450  draw_data->DisplayPos = viewport->Pos;
4451  draw_data->DisplaySize = is_minimized ? ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f) : viewport->Size;
4452  draw_data->FramebufferScale = io.DisplayFramebufferScale; // FIXME-VIEWPORT: This may vary on a per-monitor/viewport basis?
4453  draw_data->OwnerViewport = viewport;
4454  for (int n = 0; n < draw_lists->Size; n++)
4455  {
4456  draw_data->TotalVtxCount += draw_lists->Data[n]->VtxBuffer.Size;
4457  draw_data->TotalIdxCount += draw_lists->Data[n]->IdxBuffer.Size;
4458  }
4459 }
4460 
4461 // Push a clipping rectangle for both ImGui logic (hit-testing etc.) and low-level ImDrawList rendering.
4462 // - When using this function it is sane to ensure that float are perfectly rounded to integer values,
4463 // so that e.g. (int)(max.x-min.x) in user's render produce correct result.
4464 // - If the code here changes, may need to update code of functions like NextColumn() and PushColumnClipRect():
4465 // some frequently called functions which to modify both channels and clipping simultaneously tend to use the
4466 // more specialized SetWindowClipRectBeforeSetChannel() to avoid extraneous updates of underlying ImDrawCmds.
4467 void ImGui::PushClipRect(const ImVec2& clip_rect_min, const ImVec2& clip_rect_max, bool intersect_with_current_clip_rect)
4468 {
4469  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
4470  window->DrawList->PushClipRect(clip_rect_min, clip_rect_max, intersect_with_current_clip_rect);
4471  window->ClipRect = window->DrawList->_ClipRectStack.back();
4472 }
4473 
4474 void ImGui::PopClipRect()
4475 {
4476  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
4477  window->DrawList->PopClipRect();
4478  window->ClipRect = window->DrawList->_ClipRectStack.back();
4479 }
4480 
4481 static ImGuiWindow* FindFrontMostVisibleChildWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
4482 {
4483  for (int n = window->DC.ChildWindows.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
4484  if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(window->DC.ChildWindows[n]))
4485  return FindFrontMostVisibleChildWindow(window->DC.ChildWindows[n]);
4486  return window;
4487 }
4488 
4489 static void ImGui::EndFrameDrawDimmedBackgrounds()
4490 {
4491  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4492 
4493  // Draw modal whitening background on _other_ viewports than the one the modal is one
4494  ImGuiWindow* modal_window = GetTopMostPopupModal();
4495  const bool dim_bg_for_modal = (modal_window != NULL);
4496  const bool dim_bg_for_window_list = (g.NavWindowingTargetAnim != NULL);
4497  if (dim_bg_for_modal || dim_bg_for_window_list)
4498  for (int viewport_n = 0; viewport_n < g.Viewports.Size; viewport_n++)
4499  {
4500  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[viewport_n];
4501  if (modal_window && viewport == modal_window->Viewport)
4502  continue;
4503  if (g.NavWindowingListWindow && viewport == g.NavWindowingListWindow->Viewport)
4504  continue;
4505  if (g.NavWindowingTargetAnim && viewport == g.NavWindowingTargetAnim->Viewport)
4506  continue;
4507  if (viewport->Window && modal_window && IsWindowAbove(viewport->Window, modal_window))
4508  continue;
4509  ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(viewport);
4510  const ImU32 dim_bg_col = GetColorU32(dim_bg_for_modal ? ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg : ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg, g.DimBgRatio);
4511  draw_list->AddRectFilled(viewport->Pos, viewport->Pos + viewport->Size, dim_bg_col);
4512  }
4513 
4514  // Draw modal whitening background between CTRL-TAB list
4515  if (dim_bg_for_window_list && g.NavWindowingTargetAnim->Active)
4516  {
4517  // Choose a draw list that will be front-most across all our children
4518  // In the unlikely case that the window wasn't made active we can't rely on its drawlist and skip rendering all-together.
4519  ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim;
4520  ImDrawList* draw_list = FindFrontMostVisibleChildWindow(window->RootWindow)->DrawList;
4521  draw_list->PushClipRectFullScreen();
4522 
4523  // Docking: draw modal whitening background on other nodes of a same dock tree
4524  // For CTRL+TAB within a docking node we need to render the dimming background in 8 steps
4525  // (Because the root node renders the background in one shot, in order to avoid flickering when a child dock node is not submitted)
4526  if (window->RootWindowDockStop->DockIsActive)
4527  if (window->RootWindow != window->RootWindowDockStop)
4528  RenderRectFilledWithHole(draw_list, window->RootWindow->Rect(), window->RootWindowDockStop->Rect(), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg, g.DimBgRatio), g.Style.WindowRounding);
4529 
4530  // Draw navigation selection/windowing rectangle border
4531  float rounding = ImMax(window->WindowRounding, g.Style.WindowRounding);
4532  ImRect bb = window->Rect();
4533  bb.Expand(g.FontSize);
4534  if (bb.Contains(window->Viewport->GetMainRect())) // If a window fits the entire viewport, adjust its highlight inward
4535  {
4536  bb.Expand(-g.FontSize - 1.0f);
4537  rounding = window->WindowRounding;
4538  }
4539  draw_list->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha), rounding, ~0, 3.0f);
4540  draw_list->PopClipRect();
4541  }
4542 }
4543 
4544 // This is normally called by Render(). You may want to call it directly if you want to avoid calling Render() but the gain will be very minimal.
4545 void ImGui::EndFrame()
4546 {
4547  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4548  IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
4549 
4550  // Don't process EndFrame() multiple times.
4551  if (g.FrameCountEnded == g.FrameCount)
4552  return;
4553  IM_ASSERT(g.WithinFrameScope && "Forgot to call ImGui::NewFrame()?");
4554 
4555  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_EndFramePre);
4556 
4557  ErrorCheckEndFrameSanityChecks();
4558 
4559  // Notify OS when our Input Method Editor cursor has moved (e.g. CJK inputs using Microsoft IME)
4560  if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetImeInputPos && (g.PlatformImeLastPos.x == FLT_MAX || ImLengthSqr(g.PlatformImePos - g.PlatformImeLastPos) > 0.0001f))
4561  if (g.PlatformImePosViewport && g.PlatformImePosViewport->PlatformWindowCreated)
4562  {
4563  g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetImeInputPos(g.PlatformImePosViewport, g.PlatformImePos);
4564  g.PlatformImeLastPos = g.PlatformImePos;
4565  g.PlatformImePosViewport = NULL;
4566  }
4567 
4568  // Hide implicit/fallback "Debug" window if it hasn't been used
4569  g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow = false;
4570  if (g.CurrentWindow && !g.CurrentWindow->WriteAccessed)
4571  g.CurrentWindow->Active = false;
4572  End();
4573 
4574  // Draw modal whitening background on _other_ viewports than the one the modal is one
4575  EndFrameDrawDimmedBackgrounds();
4576 
4577  // Update navigation: CTRL+Tab, wrap-around requests
4578  NavEndFrame();
4579 
4580  SetCurrentViewport(NULL, NULL);
4581 
4582  // Drag and Drop: Elapse payload (if delivered, or if source stops being submitted)
4583  if (g.DragDropActive)
4584  {
4585  bool is_delivered = g.DragDropPayload.Delivery;
4586  bool is_elapsed = (g.DragDropPayload.DataFrameCount + 1 < g.FrameCount) && ((g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload) || !IsMouseDown(g.DragDropMouseButton));
4587  if (is_delivered || is_elapsed)
4588  ClearDragDrop();
4589  }
4590 
4591  // Drag and Drop: Fallback for source tooltip. This is not ideal but better than nothing.
4592  if (g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropSourceFrameCount < g.FrameCount && !(g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
4593  {
4594  g.DragDropWithinSource = true;
4595  SetTooltip("...");
4596  g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
4597  }
4598 
4599  // End frame
4600  g.WithinFrameScope = false;
4601  g.FrameCountEnded = g.FrameCount;
4602 
4603  // Initiate moving window + handle left-click and right-click focus
4604  UpdateMouseMovingWindowEndFrame();
4605 
4606  // Update user-facing viewport list (g.Viewports -> g.PlatformIO.Viewports after filtering out some)
4607  UpdateViewportsEndFrame();
4608 
4609  // Sort the window list so that all child windows are after their parent
4610  // We cannot do that on FocusWindow() because children may not exist yet
4611  g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.resize(0);
4612  g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.reserve(g.Windows.Size);
4613  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
4614  {
4615  ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
4616  if (window->Active && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)) // if a child is active its parent will add it
4617  continue;
4618  AddWindowToSortBuffer(&g.WindowsTempSortBuffer, window);
4619  }
4620 
4621  // This usually assert if there is a mismatch between the ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow / ParentWindow values and DC.ChildWindows[] in parents, aka we've done something wrong.
4622  IM_ASSERT(g.Windows.Size == g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.Size);
4623  g.Windows.swap(g.WindowsTempSortBuffer);
4624  g.IO.MetricsActiveWindows = g.WindowsActiveCount;
4625 
4626  // Unlock font atlas
4627  g.IO.Fonts->Locked = false;
4628 
4629  // Clear Input data for next frame
4630  g.IO.MouseWheel = g.IO.MouseWheelH = 0.0f;
4631  g.IO.InputQueueCharacters.resize(0);
4632  memset(g.IO.NavInputs, 0, sizeof(g.IO.NavInputs));
4633 
4634  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_EndFramePost);
4635 }
4636 
4637 void ImGui::Render()
4638 {
4639  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4640  IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
4641 
4642  if (g.FrameCountEnded != g.FrameCount)
4643  EndFrame();
4644  g.FrameCountRendered = g.FrameCount;
4645  g.IO.MetricsRenderWindows = 0;
4646 
4647  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_RenderPre);
4648 
4649  // Add background ImDrawList (for each active viewport)
4650  for (int n = 0; n != g.Viewports.Size; n++)
4651  {
4652  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
4653  viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Clear();
4654  if (viewport->DrawLists[0] != NULL)
4655  AddDrawListToDrawData(&viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0], GetBackgroundDrawList(viewport));
4656  }
4657 
4658  // Add ImDrawList to render
4659  ImGuiWindow* windows_to_render_top_most[2];
4660  windows_to_render_top_most[0] = (g.NavWindowingTarget && !(g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus)) ? g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindow : NULL;
4661  windows_to_render_top_most[1] = (g.NavWindowingTarget ? g.NavWindowingListWindow : NULL);
4662  for (int n = 0; n != g.Windows.Size; n++)
4663  {
4664  ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[n];
4665  if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(window) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) == 0 && window != windows_to_render_top_most[0] && window != windows_to_render_top_most[1])
4666  AddRootWindowToDrawData(window);
4667  }
4668  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(windows_to_render_top_most); n++)
4669  if (windows_to_render_top_most[n] && IsWindowActiveAndVisible(windows_to_render_top_most[n])) // NavWindowingTarget is always temporarily displayed as the top-most window
4670  AddRootWindowToDrawData(windows_to_render_top_most[n]);
4671 
4672  ImVec2 mouse_cursor_offset, mouse_cursor_size, mouse_cursor_uv[4];
4673  if (g.IO.MouseDrawCursor && g.MouseCursor != ImGuiMouseCursor_None)
4674  g.IO.Fonts->GetMouseCursorTexData(g.MouseCursor, &mouse_cursor_offset, &mouse_cursor_size, &mouse_cursor_uv[0], &mouse_cursor_uv[2]);
4675 
4676  // Setup ImDrawData structures for end-user
4677  g.IO.MetricsRenderVertices = g.IO.MetricsRenderIndices = 0;
4678  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
4679  {
4680  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
4681  viewport->DrawDataBuilder.FlattenIntoSingleLayer();
4682 
4683  // Draw software mouse cursor if requested by io.MouseDrawCursor flag
4684  // (note we scale cursor by current viewport/monitor, however Windows 10 for its own hardware cursor seems to be using a different scale factor)
4685  if (mouse_cursor_size.x > 0.0f && mouse_cursor_size.y > 0.0f)
4686  {
4687  float scale = g.Style.MouseCursorScale * viewport->DpiScale;
4688  if (viewport->GetMainRect().Overlaps(ImRect(g.IO.MousePos, g.IO.MousePos + ImVec2(mouse_cursor_size.x + 2, mouse_cursor_size.y + 2) * scale)))
4689  RenderMouseCursor(GetForegroundDrawList(viewport), g.IO.MousePos, scale, g.MouseCursor, IM_COL32_WHITE, IM_COL32_BLACK, IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 48));
4690  }
4691 
4692  // Add foreground ImDrawList (for each active viewport)
4693  if (viewport->DrawLists[1] != NULL)
4694  AddDrawListToDrawData(&viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0], GetForegroundDrawList(viewport));
4695 
4696  SetupViewportDrawData(viewport, &viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0]);
4697  ImDrawData* draw_data = viewport->DrawData;
4698  g.IO.MetricsRenderVertices += draw_data->TotalVtxCount;
4699  g.IO.MetricsRenderIndices += draw_data->TotalIdxCount;
4700  }
4701 
4702  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_RenderPost);
4703 }
4704 
4705 // Calculate text size. Text can be multi-line. Optionally ignore text after a ## marker.
4706 // CalcTextSize("") should return ImVec2(0.0f, g.FontSize)
4707 ImVec2 ImGui::CalcTextSize(const char* text, const char* text_end, bool hide_text_after_double_hash, float wrap_width)
4708 {
4709  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4710 
4711  const char* text_display_end;
4712  if (hide_text_after_double_hash)
4713  text_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end); // Hide anything after a '##' string
4714  else
4715  text_display_end = text_end;
4716 
4717  ImFont* font = g.Font;
4718  const float font_size = g.FontSize;
4719  if (text == text_display_end)
4720  return ImVec2(0.0f, font_size);
4721  ImVec2 text_size = font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, FLT_MAX, wrap_width, text, text_display_end, NULL);
4722 
4723  // Round
4724  // FIXME: This has been here since Dec 2015 (7b0bf230) but down the line we want this out.
4725  // FIXME: Investigate using ceilf or e.g.
4726  // - https://git.musl-libc.org/cgit/musl/tree/src/math/ceilf.c
4727  // - https://embarkstudios.github.io/rust-gpu/api/src/libm/math/ceilf.rs.html
4728  text_size.x = IM_FLOOR(text_size.x + 0.99999f);
4729 
4730  return text_size;
4731 }
4732 
4733 // Find window given position, search front-to-back
4734 // FIXME: Note that we have an inconsequential lag here: OuterRectClipped is updated in Begin(), so windows moved programmatically
4735 // with SetWindowPos() and not SetNextWindowPos() will have that rectangle lagging by a frame at the time FindHoveredWindow() is
4736 // called, aka before the next Begin(). Moving window isn't affected.
4737 static void FindHoveredWindow()
4738 {
4739  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4740 
4741  // Special handling for the window being moved: Ignore the mouse viewport check (because it may reset/lose its viewport during the undocking frame)
4742  ImGuiViewportP* moving_window_viewport = g.MovingWindow ? g.MovingWindow->Viewport : NULL;
4743  if (g.MovingWindow)
4744  g.MovingWindow->Viewport = g.MouseViewport;
4745 
4746  ImGuiWindow* hovered_window = NULL;
4747  ImGuiWindow* hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window = NULL;
4748  if (g.MovingWindow && !(g.MovingWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
4749  hovered_window = g.MovingWindow;
4750 
4751  ImVec2 padding_regular = g.Style.TouchExtraPadding;
4752  ImVec2 padding_for_resize_from_edges = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? ImMax(g.Style.TouchExtraPadding, ImVec2(WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS, WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS)) : padding_regular;
4753  for (int i = g.Windows.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
4754  {
4755  ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
4756  if (!window->Active || window->Hidden)
4757  continue;
4758  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs)
4759  continue;
4760  IM_ASSERT(window->Viewport);
4761  if (window->Viewport != g.MouseViewport)
4762  continue;
4763 
4764  // Using the clipped AABB, a child window will typically be clipped by its parent (not always)
4765  ImRect bb(window->OuterRectClipped);
4766  if (window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
4767  bb.Expand(padding_regular);
4768  else
4769  bb.Expand(padding_for_resize_from_edges);
4770  if (!bb.Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
4771  continue;
4772 
4773  // Support for one rectangular hole in any given window
4774  // FIXME: Consider generalizing hit-testing override (with more generic data, callback, etc.) (#1512)
4775  if (window->HitTestHoleSize.x != 0)
4776  {
4777  ImVec2 hole_pos(window->Pos.x + (float)window->HitTestHoleOffset.x, window->Pos.y + (float)window->HitTestHoleOffset.y);
4778  ImVec2 hole_size((float)window->HitTestHoleSize.x, (float)window->HitTestHoleSize.y);
4779  if (ImRect(hole_pos, hole_pos + hole_size).Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
4780  continue;
4781  }
4782 
4783  if (hovered_window == NULL)
4784  hovered_window = window;
4785  if (hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window == NULL && (!g.MovingWindow || window->RootWindow != g.MovingWindow->RootWindow))
4786  hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window = window;
4787  if (hovered_window && hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window)
4788  break;
4789  }
4790 
4791  g.HoveredWindow = hovered_window;
4792  g.HoveredRootWindow = g.HoveredWindow ? g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow : NULL;
4793  g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow = hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window;
4794 
4795  if (g.MovingWindow)
4796  g.MovingWindow->Viewport = moving_window_viewport;
4797 }
4798 
4799 // Test if mouse cursor is hovering given rectangle
4800 // NB- Rectangle is clipped by our current clip setting
4801 // NB- Expand the rectangle to be generous on imprecise inputs systems (g.Style.TouchExtraPadding)
4802 bool ImGui::IsMouseHoveringRect(const ImVec2& r_min, const ImVec2& r_max, bool clip)
4803 {
4804  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4805 
4806  // Clip
4807  ImRect rect_clipped(r_min, r_max);
4808  if (clip)
4809  rect_clipped.ClipWith(g.CurrentWindow->ClipRect);
4810 
4811  // Expand for touch input
4812  const ImRect rect_for_touch(rect_clipped.Min - g.Style.TouchExtraPadding, rect_clipped.Max + g.Style.TouchExtraPadding);
4813  if (!rect_for_touch.Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
4814  return false;
4815  if (!g.MouseViewport->GetMainRect().Overlaps(rect_clipped))
4816  return false;
4817  return true;
4818 }
4819 
4820 int ImGui::GetKeyIndex(ImGuiKey imgui_key)
4821 {
4822  IM_ASSERT(imgui_key >= 0 && imgui_key < ImGuiKey_COUNT);
4823  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4824  return g.IO.KeyMap[imgui_key];
4825 }
4826 
4827 // Note that dear imgui doesn't know the semantic of each entry of io.KeysDown[]!
4828 // Use your own indices/enums according to how your backend/engine stored them into io.KeysDown[]!
4829 bool ImGui::IsKeyDown(int user_key_index)
4830 {
4831  if (user_key_index < 0)
4832  return false;
4833  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4834  IM_ASSERT(user_key_index >= 0 && user_key_index < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown));
4835  return g.IO.KeysDown[user_key_index];
4836 }
4837 
4838 // t0 = previous time (e.g.: g.Time - g.IO.DeltaTime)
4839 // t1 = current time (e.g.: g.Time)
4840 // An event is triggered at:
4841 // t = 0.0f t = repeat_delay, t = repeat_delay + repeat_rate*N
4842 int ImGui::CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(float t0, float t1, float repeat_delay, float repeat_rate)
4843 {
4844  if (t1 == 0.0f)
4845  return 1;
4846  if (t0 >= t1)
4847  return 0;
4848  if (repeat_rate <= 0.0f)
4849  return (t0 < repeat_delay) && (t1 >= repeat_delay);
4850  const int count_t0 = (t0 < repeat_delay) ? -1 : (int)((t0 - repeat_delay) / repeat_rate);
4851  const int count_t1 = (t1 < repeat_delay) ? -1 : (int)((t1 - repeat_delay) / repeat_rate);
4852  const int count = count_t1 - count_t0;
4853  return count;
4854 }
4855 
4856 int ImGui::GetKeyPressedAmount(int key_index, float repeat_delay, float repeat_rate)
4857 {
4858  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4859  if (key_index < 0)
4860  return 0;
4861  IM_ASSERT(key_index >= 0 && key_index < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown));
4862  const float t = g.IO.KeysDownDuration[key_index];
4863  return CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, repeat_delay, repeat_rate);
4864 }
4865 
4866 bool ImGui::IsKeyPressed(int user_key_index, bool repeat)
4867 {
4868  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4869  if (user_key_index < 0)
4870  return false;
4871  IM_ASSERT(user_key_index >= 0 && user_key_index < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown));
4872  const float t = g.IO.KeysDownDuration[user_key_index];
4873  if (t == 0.0f)
4874  return true;
4875  if (repeat && t > g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay)
4876  return GetKeyPressedAmount(user_key_index, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate) > 0;
4877  return false;
4878 }
4879 
4880 bool ImGui::IsKeyReleased(int user_key_index)
4881 {
4882  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4883  if (user_key_index < 0) return false;
4884  IM_ASSERT(user_key_index >= 0 && user_key_index < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown));
4885  return g.IO.KeysDownDurationPrev[user_key_index] >= 0.0f && !g.IO.KeysDown[user_key_index];
4886 }
4887 
4888 bool ImGui::IsMouseDown(ImGuiMouseButton button)
4889 {
4890  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4891  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4892  return g.IO.MouseDown[button];
4893 }
4894 
4895 bool ImGui::IsMouseClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button, bool repeat)
4896 {
4897  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4898  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4899  const float t = g.IO.MouseDownDuration[button];
4900  if (t == 0.0f)
4901  return true;
4902 
4903  if (repeat && t > g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay)
4904  {
4905  // FIXME: 2019/05/03: Our old repeat code was wrong here and led to doubling the repeat rate, which made it an ok rate for repeat on mouse hold.
4906  int amount = CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 0.50f);
4907  if (amount > 0)
4908  return true;
4909  }
4910  return false;
4911 }
4912 
4913 bool ImGui::IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton button)
4914 {
4915  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4916  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4917  return g.IO.MouseReleased[button];
4918 }
4919 
4920 bool ImGui::IsMouseDoubleClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button)
4921 {
4922  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4923  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4924  return g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[button];
4925 }
4926 
4927 // Return if a mouse click/drag went past the given threshold. Valid to call during the MouseReleased frame.
4928 // [Internal] This doesn't test if the button is pressed
4929 bool ImGui::IsMouseDragPastThreshold(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold)
4930 {
4931  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4932  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4933  if (lock_threshold < 0.0f)
4934  lock_threshold = g.IO.MouseDragThreshold;
4935  return g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[button] >= lock_threshold * lock_threshold;
4936 }
4937 
4938 bool ImGui::IsMouseDragging(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold)
4939 {
4940  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4941  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4942  if (!g.IO.MouseDown[button])
4943  return false;
4944  return IsMouseDragPastThreshold(button, lock_threshold);
4945 }
4946 
4947 ImVec2 ImGui::GetMousePos()
4948 {
4949  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4950  return g.IO.MousePos;
4951 }
4952 
4953 // NB: prefer to call right after BeginPopup(). At the time Selectable/MenuItem is activated, the popup is already closed!
4954 ImVec2 ImGui::GetMousePosOnOpeningCurrentPopup()
4955 {
4956  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4957  if (g.BeginPopupStack.Size > 0)
4958  return g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1].OpenMousePos;
4959  return g.IO.MousePos;
4960 }
4961 
4962 // We typically use ImVec2(-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX) to denote an invalid mouse position.
4963 bool ImGui::IsMousePosValid(const ImVec2* mouse_pos)
4964 {
4965  // The assert is only to silence a false-positive in XCode Static Analysis.
4966  // Because GImGui is not dereferenced in every code path, the static analyzer assume that it may be NULL (which it doesn't for other functions).
4967  IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL);
4968  const float MOUSE_INVALID = -256000.0f;
4969  ImVec2 p = mouse_pos ? *mouse_pos : GImGui->IO.MousePos;
4970  return p.x >= MOUSE_INVALID && p.y >= MOUSE_INVALID;
4971 }
4972 
4973 bool ImGui::IsAnyMouseDown()
4974 {
4975  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4976  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown); n++)
4977  if (g.IO.MouseDown[n])
4978  return true;
4979  return false;
4980 }
4981 
4982 // Return the delta from the initial clicking position while the mouse button is clicked or was just released.
4983 // This is locked and return 0.0f until the mouse moves past a distance threshold at least once.
4984 // NB: This is only valid if IsMousePosValid(). backends in theory should always keep mouse position valid when dragging even outside the client window.
4985 ImVec2 ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold)
4986 {
4987  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4988  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4989  if (lock_threshold < 0.0f)
4990  lock_threshold = g.IO.MouseDragThreshold;
4991  if (g.IO.MouseDown[button] || g.IO.MouseReleased[button])
4992  if (g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[button] >= lock_threshold * lock_threshold)
4993  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) && IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MouseClickedPos[button]))
4994  return g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MouseClickedPos[button];
4995  return ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
4996 }
4997 
4998 void ImGui::ResetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton button)
4999 {
5000  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5001  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
5002  // NB: We don't need to reset g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr
5003  g.IO.MouseClickedPos[button] = g.IO.MousePos;
5004 }
5005 
5006 ImGuiMouseCursor ImGui::GetMouseCursor()
5007 {
5008  return GImGui->MouseCursor;
5009 }
5010 
5011 void ImGui::SetMouseCursor(ImGuiMouseCursor cursor_type)
5012 {
5013  GImGui->MouseCursor = cursor_type;
5014 }
5015 
5016 void ImGui::CaptureKeyboardFromApp(bool capture)
5017 {
5018  GImGui->WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame = capture ? 1 : 0;
5019 }
5020 
5021 void ImGui::CaptureMouseFromApp(bool capture)
5022 {
5023  GImGui->WantCaptureMouseNextFrame = capture ? 1 : 0;
5024 }
5025 
5026 bool ImGui::IsItemActive()
5027 {
5028  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5029  if (g.ActiveId)
5030  {
5031  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
5032  return g.ActiveId == window->DC.LastItemId;
5033  }
5034  return false;
5035 }
5036 
5037 bool ImGui::IsItemActivated()
5038 {
5039  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5040  if (g.ActiveId)
5041  {
5042  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
5043  if (g.ActiveId == window->DC.LastItemId && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame != window->DC.LastItemId)
5044  return true;
5045  }
5046  return false;
5047 }
5048 
5049 bool ImGui::IsItemDeactivated()
5050 {
5051  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5052  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
5053  if (window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDeactivated)
5054  return (window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Deactivated) != 0;
5055  return (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == window->DC.LastItemId && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame != 0 && g.ActiveId != window->DC.LastItemId);
5056 }
5057 
5058 bool ImGui::IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit()
5059 {
5060  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5061  return IsItemDeactivated() && (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameHasBeenEditedBefore || (g.ActiveId == 0 && g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore));
5062 }
5063 
5064 // == GetItemID() == GetFocusID()
5065 bool ImGui::IsItemFocused()
5066 {
5067  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5068  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
5069 
5070  if (g.NavId != window->DC.LastItemId || g.NavId == 0)
5071  return false;
5072 
5073  // Special handling for the dummy item after Begin() which represent the title bar or tab.
5074  // When the window is collapsed (SkipItems==true) that last item will never be overwritten so we need to detect the case.
5075  if (window->DC.LastItemId == window->ID && window->WriteAccessed)
5076  return false;
5077 
5078  return true;
5079 }
5080 
5081 bool ImGui::IsItemClicked(ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button)
5082 {
5083  return IsMouseClicked(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_None);
5084 }
5085 
5086 bool ImGui::IsItemToggledOpen()
5087 {
5088  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5089  return (g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledOpen) ? true : false;
5090 }
5091 
5092 bool ImGui::IsItemToggledSelection()
5093 {
5094  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5095  return (g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledSelection) ? true : false;
5096 }
5097 
5098 bool ImGui::IsAnyItemHovered()
5099 {
5100  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5101  return g.HoveredId != 0 || g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != 0;
5102 }
5103 
5104 bool ImGui::IsAnyItemActive()
5105 {
5106  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5107  return g.ActiveId != 0;
5108 }
5109 
5110 bool ImGui::IsAnyItemFocused()
5111 {
5112  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5113  return g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight;
5114 }
5115 
5116 bool ImGui::IsItemVisible()
5117 {
5118  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
5119  return window->ClipRect.Overlaps(window->DC.LastItemRect);
5120 }
5121 
5122 bool ImGui::IsItemEdited()
5123 {
5124  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
5125  return (window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited) != 0;
5126 }
5127 
5128 // Allow last item to be overlapped by a subsequent item. Both may be activated during the same frame before the later one takes priority.
5129 // FIXME: Although this is exposed, its interaction and ideal idiom with using ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowItemOverlap flag are extremely confusing, need rework.
5130 void ImGui::SetItemAllowOverlap()
5131 {
5132  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5133  ImGuiID id = g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemId;
5134  if (g.HoveredId == id)
5135  g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = true;
5136  if (g.ActiveId == id)
5137  g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = true;
5138 }
5139 
5140 void ImGui::SetItemUsingMouseWheel()
5141 {
5142  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5143  ImGuiID id = g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemId;
5144  if (g.HoveredId == id)
5145  g.HoveredIdUsingMouseWheel = true;
5146  if (g.ActiveId == id)
5147  g.ActiveIdUsingMouseWheel = true;
5148 }

5150 ImVec2 ImGui::GetItemRectMin()
5151 {
5152  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
5153  return window->DC.LastItemRect.Min;
5154 }
5155 
5156 ImVec2 ImGui::GetItemRectMax()
5157 {
5158  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
5159  return window->DC.LastItemRect.Max;
5160 }
5161 
5162 ImVec2 ImGui::GetItemRectSize()
5163 {
5164  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
5165  return window->DC.LastItemRect.GetSize();
5166 }
5167 
5168 bool ImGui::BeginChildEx(const char* name, ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
5169 {
5170  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5171  ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5172 
5173  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking;
5174  flags |= (parent_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove); // Inherit the NoMove flag
5175 
5176  // Size
5177  const ImVec2 content_avail = GetContentRegionAvail();
5178  ImVec2 size = ImFloor(size_arg);
5179  const int auto_fit_axises = ((size.x == 0.0f) ? (1 << ImGuiAxis_X) : 0x00) | ((size.y == 0.0f) ? (1 << ImGuiAxis_Y) : 0x00);
5180  if (size.x <= 0.0f)
5181  size.x = ImMax(content_avail.x + size.x, 4.0f); // Arbitrary minimum child size (0.0f causing too much issues)
5182  if (size.y <= 0.0f)
5183  size.y = ImMax(content_avail.y + size.y, 4.0f);
5184  SetNextWindowSize(size);
5185 
5186  // Build up name. If you need to append to a same child from multiple location in the ID stack, use BeginChild(ImGuiID id) with a stable value.
5187  if (name)
5188  ImFormatString(g.TempBuffer, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.TempBuffer), "%s/%s_%08X", parent_window->Name, name, id);
5189  else
5190  ImFormatString(g.TempBuffer, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.TempBuffer), "%s/%08X", parent_window->Name, id);
5191 
5192  const float backup_border_size = g.Style.ChildBorderSize;
5193  if (!border)
5194  g.Style.ChildBorderSize = 0.0f;
5195  bool ret = Begin(g.TempBuffer, NULL, flags);
5196  g.Style.ChildBorderSize = backup_border_size;
5197 
5198  ImGuiWindow* child_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5199  child_window->ChildId = id;
5200  child_window->AutoFitChildAxises = (ImS8)auto_fit_axises;
5201 
5202  // Set the cursor to handle case where the user called SetNextWindowPos()+BeginChild() manually.
5203  // While this is not really documented/defined, it seems that the expected thing to do.
5204  if (child_window->BeginCount == 1)
5205  parent_window->DC.CursorPos = child_window->Pos;
5206 
5207  // Process navigation-in immediately so NavInit can run on first frame
5208  if (g.NavActivateId == id && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened) && (child_window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask != 0 || child_window->DC.NavHasScroll))
5209  {
5210  FocusWindow(child_window);
5211  NavInitWindow(child_window, false);
5212  SetActiveID(id + 1, child_window); // Steal ActiveId with another arbitrary id so that key-press won't activate child item
