5213  g.ActiveIdSource = ImGuiInputSource_Nav;
5214  }
5215  return ret;
5216 }
5217 
5218 bool ImGui::BeginChild(const char* str_id, const ImVec2& size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
5219 {
5220  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
5221  return BeginChildEx(str_id, window->GetID(str_id), size_arg, border, extra_flags);
5222 }
5223 
5224 bool ImGui::BeginChild(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
5225 {
5226  IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
5227  return BeginChildEx(NULL, id, size_arg, border, extra_flags);
5228 }
5229 
5230 void ImGui::EndChild()
5231 {
5232  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5233  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
5234 
5235  IM_ASSERT(g.WithinEndChild == false);
5236  IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow); // Mismatched BeginChild()/EndChild() calls
5237 
5238  g.WithinEndChild = true;
5239  if (window->BeginCount > 1)
5240  {
5241  End();
5242  }
5243  else
5244  {
5245  ImVec2 sz = window->Size;
5246  if (window->AutoFitChildAxises & (1 << ImGuiAxis_X)) // Arbitrary minimum zero-ish child size of 4.0f causes less trouble than a 0.0f
5247  sz.x = ImMax(4.0f, sz.x);
5248  if (window->AutoFitChildAxises & (1 << ImGuiAxis_Y))
5249  sz.y = ImMax(4.0f, sz.y);
5250  End();
5251 
5252  ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5253  ImRect bb(parent_window->DC.CursorPos, parent_window->DC.CursorPos + sz);
5254  ItemSize(sz);
5255  if ((window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask != 0 || window->DC.NavHasScroll) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened))
5256  {
5257  ItemAdd(bb, window->ChildId);
5258  RenderNavHighlight(bb, window->ChildId);
5259 
5260  // When browsing a window that has no activable items (scroll only) we keep a highlight on the child
5261  if (window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask == 0 && window == g.NavWindow)
5262  RenderNavHighlight(ImRect(bb.Min - ImVec2(2, 2), bb.Max + ImVec2(2, 2)), g.NavId, ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeThin);
5263  }
5264  else
5265  {
5266  // Not navigable into
5267  ItemAdd(bb, 0);
5268  }
5269  }
5270  g.WithinEndChild = false;
5271  g.LogLinePosY = -FLT_MAX; // To enforce a carriage return
5272 }
5273 
5274 // Helper to create a child window / scrolling region that looks like a normal widget frame.
5275 bool ImGui::BeginChildFrame(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
5276 {
5277  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5278  const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5279  PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_FrameBg]);
5280  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, style.FrameRounding);
5281  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize, style.FrameBorderSize);
5282  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, style.FramePadding);
5283  bool ret = BeginChild(id, size, true, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding | extra_flags);
5284  PopStyleVar(3);
5285  PopStyleColor();
5286  return ret;
5287 }
5288 
5289 void ImGui::EndChildFrame()
5290 {
5291  EndChild();
5292 }
5293 
5294 static void SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiCond flags, bool enabled)
5295 {
5296  window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & ~flags);
5297  window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & ~flags);
5298  window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags & ~flags);
5299  window->SetWindowDockAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowDockAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowDockAllowFlags & ~flags);
5300 }
5301 
5302 ImGuiWindow* ImGui::FindWindowByID(ImGuiID id)
5303 {
5304  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5305  return (ImGuiWindow*)g.WindowsById.GetVoidPtr(id);
5306 }
5307 
5308 ImGuiWindow* ImGui::FindWindowByName(const char* name)
5309 {
5310  ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(name);
5311  return FindWindowByID(id);
5312 }
5313 
5314 static void ApplyWindowSettings(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindowSettings* settings)
5315 {
5316  const ImGuiViewport* main_viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
5317  window->ViewportPos = main_viewport->Pos;
5318  if (settings->ViewportId)
5319  {
5320  window->ViewportId = settings->ViewportId;
5321  window->ViewportPos = ImVec2(settings->ViewportPos.x, settings->ViewportPos.y);
5322  }
5323  window->Pos = ImFloor(ImVec2(settings->Pos.x + window->ViewportPos.x, settings->Pos.y + window->ViewportPos.y));
5324  if (settings->Size.x > 0 && settings->Size.y > 0)
5325  window->Size = window->SizeFull = ImFloor(ImVec2(settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y));
5326  window->Collapsed = settings->Collapsed;
5327  window->DockId = settings->DockId;
5328  window->DockOrder = settings->DockOrder;
5329 }
5330 
5331 static ImGuiWindow* CreateNewWindow(const char* name, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
5332 {
5333  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5334  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("CreateNewWindow '%s', flags = 0x%08X\n", name, flags);
5335 
5336  // Create window the first time
5337  ImGuiWindow* window = IM_NEW(ImGuiWindow)(&g, name);
5338  window->Flags = flags;
5339  g.WindowsById.SetVoidPtr(window->ID, window);
5340 
5341  // Default/arbitrary window position. Use SetNextWindowPos() with the appropriate condition flag to change the initial position of a window.
5342  const ImGuiViewport* main_viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
5343  window->Pos = main_viewport->Pos + ImVec2(60, 60);
5344  window->ViewportPos = main_viewport->Pos;
5345 
5346  // User can disable loading and saving of settings. Tooltip and child windows also don't store settings.
5347  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings))
5348  if (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = ImGui::FindWindowSettings(window->ID))
5349  {
5350  // Retrieve settings from .ini file
5351  window->SettingsOffset = g.SettingsWindows.offset_from_ptr(settings);
5352  SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver, false);
5353  ApplyWindowSettings(window, settings);
5354  }
5355  window->DC.CursorStartPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->Pos; // So first call to CalcContentSize() doesn't return crazy values
5356 
5357  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) != 0)
5358  {
5359  window->AutoFitFramesX = window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
5360  window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = false;
5361  }
5362  else
5363  {
5364  if (window->Size.x <= 0.0f)
5365  window->AutoFitFramesX = 2;
5366  if (window->Size.y <= 0.0f)
5367  window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
5368  window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0) || (window->AutoFitFramesY > 0);
5369  }
5370 
5371  g.WindowsFocusOrder.push_back(window);
5372  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus)
5373  g.Windows.push_front(window); // Quite slow but rare and only once
5374  else
5375  g.Windows.push_back(window);
5376  return window;
5377 }
5378 
5379 static ImGuiWindow* GetWindowForTitleDisplay(ImGuiWindow* window)
5380 {
5381  return window->DockNodeAsHost ? window->DockNodeAsHost->VisibleWindow : window;
5382 }
5383 
5384 static ImGuiWindow* GetWindowForTitleAndMenuHeight(ImGuiWindow* window)
5385 {
5386  return (window->DockNodeAsHost && window->DockNodeAsHost->VisibleWindow) ? window->DockNodeAsHost->VisibleWindow : window;
5387 }
5388 
5389 static ImVec2 CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size_desired)
5390 {
5391  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5392  ImVec2 new_size = size_desired;
5393  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint)
5394  {
5395  // Using -1,-1 on either X/Y axis to preserve the current size.
5396  ImRect cr = g.NextWindowData.SizeConstraintRect;
5397  new_size.x = (cr.Min.x >= 0 && cr.Max.x >= 0) ? ImClamp(new_size.x, cr.Min.x, cr.Max.x) : window->SizeFull.x;
5398  new_size.y = (cr.Min.y >= 0 && cr.Max.y >= 0) ? ImClamp(new_size.y, cr.Min.y, cr.Max.y) : window->SizeFull.y;
5399  if (g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback)
5400  {
5401  ImGuiSizeCallbackData data;
5402  data.UserData = g.NextWindowData.SizeCallbackUserData;
5403  data.Pos = window->Pos;
5404  data.CurrentSize = window->SizeFull;
5405  data.DesiredSize = new_size;
5406  g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback(&data);
5407  new_size = data.DesiredSize;
5408  }
5409  new_size.x = IM_FLOOR(new_size.x);
5410  new_size.y = IM_FLOOR(new_size.y);
5411  }
5412 
5413  // Minimum size
5414  if (!(window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize)))
5415  {
5416  ImGuiWindow* window_for_height = GetWindowForTitleAndMenuHeight(window);
5417  new_size = ImMax(new_size, g.Style.WindowMinSize);
5418  new_size.y = ImMax(new_size.y, window_for_height->TitleBarHeight() + window_for_height->MenuBarHeight() + ImMax(0.0f, g.Style.WindowRounding - 1.0f)); // Reduce artifacts with very small windows
5419  }
5420  return new_size;
5421 }
5422 
5423 static void CalcWindowContentSizes(ImGuiWindow* window, ImVec2* content_size_current, ImVec2* content_size_ideal)
5424 {
5425  bool preserve_old_content_sizes = false;
5426  if (window->Collapsed && window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0)
5427  preserve_old_content_sizes = true;
5428  else if (window->Hidden && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems == 0 && window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0)
5429  preserve_old_content_sizes = true;
5430  if (preserve_old_content_sizes)
5431  {
5432  *content_size_current = window->ContentSize;
5433  *content_size_ideal = window->ContentSizeIdeal;
5434  return;
5435  }
5436 
5437  content_size_current->x = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : IM_FLOOR(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x - window->DC.CursorStartPos.x);
5438  content_size_current->y = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : IM_FLOOR(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y - window->DC.CursorStartPos.y);
5439  content_size_ideal->x = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : IM_FLOOR(ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x, window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x) - window->DC.CursorStartPos.x);
5440  content_size_ideal->y = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : IM_FLOOR(ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y, window->DC.IdealMaxPos.y) - window->DC.CursorStartPos.y);
5441 }
5442 
5443 static ImVec2 CalcWindowAutoFitSize(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size_contents)
5444 {
5445  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5446  ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5447  ImVec2 size_decorations = ImVec2(0.0f, window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight());
5448  ImVec2 size_pad = window->WindowPadding * 2.0f;
5449  ImVec2 size_desired = size_contents + size_pad + size_decorations;
5450  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
5451  {
5452  // Tooltip always resize
5453  return size_desired;
5454  }
5455  else
5456  {
5457  // Maximum window size is determined by the viewport size or monitor size
5458  const bool is_popup = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0;
5459  const bool is_menu = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) != 0;
5460  ImVec2 size_min = style.WindowMinSize;
5461  if (is_popup || is_menu) // Popups and menus bypass style.WindowMinSize by default, but we give then a non-zero minimum size to facilitate understanding problematic cases (e.g. empty popups)
5462  size_min = ImMin(size_min, ImVec2(4.0f, 4.0f));
5463 
5464  // FIXME-VIEWPORT-WORKAREA: May want to use GetWorkSize() instead of Size depending on the type of windows?
5465  ImVec2 avail_size = window->Viewport->Size;
5466  if (window->ViewportOwned)
5467  avail_size = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
5468  const int monitor_idx = window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend;
5469  if (monitor_idx >= 0 && monitor_idx < g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size)
5470  avail_size = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[monitor_idx].WorkSize;
5471  ImVec2 size_auto_fit = ImClamp(size_desired, size_min, ImMax(size_min, avail_size - style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding * 2.0f));
5472 
5473  // When the window cannot fit all contents (either because of constraints, either because screen is too small),
5474  // we are growing the size on the other axis to compensate for expected scrollbar. FIXME: Might turn bigger than ViewportSize-WindowPadding.
5475  ImVec2 size_auto_fit_after_constraint = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
5476  bool will_have_scrollbar_x = (size_auto_fit_after_constraint.x - size_pad.x - size_decorations.x < size_contents.x && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar)) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar);
5477  bool will_have_scrollbar_y = (size_auto_fit_after_constraint.y - size_pad.y - size_decorations.y < size_contents.y && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar)) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar);
5478  if (will_have_scrollbar_x)
5479  size_auto_fit.y += style.ScrollbarSize;
5480  if (will_have_scrollbar_y)
5481  size_auto_fit.x += style.ScrollbarSize;
5482  return size_auto_fit;
5483  }
5484 }
5485 
5486 ImVec2 ImGui::CalcWindowNextAutoFitSize(ImGuiWindow* window)
5487 {
5488  ImVec2 size_contents_current;
5489  ImVec2 size_contents_ideal;
5490  CalcWindowContentSizes(window, &size_contents_current, &size_contents_ideal);
5491  ImVec2 size_auto_fit = CalcWindowAutoFitSize(window, size_contents_ideal);
5492  ImVec2 size_final = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
5493  return size_final;
5494 }
5495 
5496 static ImGuiCol GetWindowBgColorIdxFromFlags(ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
5497 {
5498  if (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
5499  return ImGuiCol_PopupBg;
5500  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
5501  return ImGuiCol_ChildBg;
5502  return ImGuiCol_WindowBg;
5503 }
5504 
5505 static void CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& corner_target, const ImVec2& corner_norm, ImVec2* out_pos, ImVec2* out_size)
5506 {
5507  ImVec2 pos_min = ImLerp(corner_target, window->Pos, corner_norm); // Expected window upper-left
5508  ImVec2 pos_max = ImLerp(window->Pos + window->Size, corner_target, corner_norm); // Expected window lower-right
5509  ImVec2 size_expected = pos_max - pos_min;
5510  ImVec2 size_constrained = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_expected);
5511  *out_pos = pos_min;
5512  if (corner_norm.x == 0.0f)
5513  out_pos->x -= (size_constrained.x - size_expected.x);
5514  if (corner_norm.y == 0.0f)
5515  out_pos->y -= (size_constrained.y - size_expected.y);
5516  *out_size = size_constrained;
5517 }
5518 
5519 struct ImGuiResizeGripDef
5520 {
5521  ImVec2 CornerPosN;
5522  ImVec2 InnerDir;
5523  int AngleMin12, AngleMax12;
5524 };
5525 
5526 static const ImGuiResizeGripDef resize_grip_def[4] =
5527 {
5528  { ImVec2(1, 1), ImVec2(-1, -1), 0, 3 }, // Lower-right
5529  { ImVec2(0, 1), ImVec2(+1, -1), 3, 6 }, // Lower-left
5530  { ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(+1, +1), 6, 9 }, // Upper-left (Unused)
5531  { ImVec2(1, 0), ImVec2(-1, +1), 9, 12 }, // Upper-right (Unused)
5532 };
5533 
5534 struct ImGuiResizeBorderDef
5535 {
5536  ImVec2 InnerDir;
5537  ImVec2 CornerPosN1, CornerPosN2;
5538  float OuterAngle;
5539 };
5540 
5541 static const ImGuiResizeBorderDef resize_border_def[4] =
5542 {
5543  { ImVec2(0, +1), ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(1, 0), IM_PI * 1.50f }, // Top
5544  { ImVec2(-1, 0), ImVec2(1, 0), ImVec2(1, 1), IM_PI * 0.00f }, // Right
5545  { ImVec2(0, -1), ImVec2(1, 1), ImVec2(0, 1), IM_PI * 0.50f }, // Bottom
5546  { ImVec2(+1, 0), ImVec2(0, 1), ImVec2(0, 0), IM_PI * 1.00f } // Left
5547 };
5548 
5549 static ImRect GetResizeBorderRect(ImGuiWindow* window, int border_n, float perp_padding, float thickness)
5550 {
5551  ImRect rect = window->Rect();
5552  if (thickness == 0.0f) rect.Max -= ImVec2(1, 1);
5553  if (border_n == 0) { return ImRect(rect.Min.x + perp_padding, rect.Min.y - thickness, rect.Max.x - perp_padding, rect.Min.y + thickness); } // Top
5554  if (border_n == 1) { return ImRect(rect.Max.x - thickness, rect.Min.y + perp_padding, rect.Max.x + thickness, rect.Max.y - perp_padding); } // Right
5555  if (border_n == 2) { return ImRect(rect.Min.x + perp_padding, rect.Max.y - thickness, rect.Max.x - perp_padding, rect.Max.y + thickness); } // Bottom
5556  if (border_n == 3) { return ImRect(rect.Min.x - thickness, rect.Min.y + perp_padding, rect.Min.x + thickness, rect.Max.y - perp_padding); } // Left
5557  IM_ASSERT(0);
5558  return ImRect();
5559 }
5560 
5561 // 0..3: corners (Lower-right, Lower-left, Unused, Unused)
5562 // 4..7: borders (Top, Right, Bottom, Left)
5563 ImGuiID ImGui::GetWindowResizeID(ImGuiWindow* window, int n)
5564 {
5565  IM_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n <= 7);
5566  ImGuiID id = window->DockIsActive ? window->DockNode->HostWindow->ID : window->ID;
5567  id = ImHashStr("#RESIZE", 0, id);
5568  id = ImHashData(&n, sizeof(int), id);
5569  return id;
5570 }
5571 
5572 // Handle resize for: Resize Grips, Borders, Gamepad
5573 // Return true when using auto-fit (double click on resize grip)
5574 static bool ImGui::UpdateWindowManualResize(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size_auto_fit, int* border_held, int resize_grip_count, ImU32 resize_grip_col[4], const ImRect& visibility_rect)
5575 {
5576  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5577  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5578 
5579  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize) || (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) || window->AutoFitFramesX > 0 || window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
5580  return false;
5581  if (window->WasActive == false) // Early out to avoid running this code for e.g. an hidden implicit/fallback Debug window.
5582  return false;
5583 
5584  bool ret_auto_fit = false;
5585  const int resize_border_count = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? 4 : 0;
5586  const float grip_draw_size = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(g.FontSize * 1.35f, window->WindowRounding + 1.0f + g.FontSize * 0.2f));
5587  const float grip_hover_inner_size = IM_FLOOR(grip_draw_size * 0.75f);
5588  const float grip_hover_outer_size = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS : 0.0f;
5589 
5590  ImVec2 pos_target(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
5591  ImVec2 size_target(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
5592 
5593  // Clip mouse interaction rectangles within the viewport rectangle (in practice the narrowing is going to happen most of the time).
5594  // - Not narrowing would mostly benefit the situation where OS windows _without_ decoration have a threshold for hovering when outside their limits.
5595  // This is however not the case with current backends under Win32, but a custom borderless window implementation would benefit from it.
5596  // - When decoration are enabled we typically benefit from that distance, but then our resize elements would be conflicting with OS resize elements, so we also narrow.
5597  // - Note that we are unable to tell if the platform setup allows hovering with a distance threshold (on Win32, decorated window have such threshold).
5598  // We only clip interaction so we overwrite window->ClipRect, cannot call PushClipRect() yet as DrawList is not yet setup.
5599  const bool clip_with_viewport_rect = !(g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport) || (g.IO.MouseHoveredViewport != window->ViewportId) || !(window->Viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration);
5600  if (clip_with_viewport_rect)
5601  window->ClipRect = window->Viewport->GetMainRect();
5602 
5603  // Resize grips and borders are on layer 1
5604  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
5605 
5606  // Manual resize grips
5607  PushID("#RESIZE");
5608  for (int resize_grip_n = 0; resize_grip_n < resize_grip_count; resize_grip_n++)
5609  {
5610  const ImGuiResizeGripDef& grip = resize_grip_def[resize_grip_n];
5611  const ImVec2 corner = ImLerp(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, grip.CornerPosN);
5612 
5613  // Using the FlattenChilds button flag we make the resize button accessible even if we are hovering over a child window
5614  ImRect resize_rect(corner - grip.InnerDir * grip_hover_outer_size, corner + grip.InnerDir * grip_hover_inner_size);
5615  if (resize_rect.Min.x > resize_rect.Max.x) ImSwap(resize_rect.Min.x, resize_rect.Max.x);
5616  if (resize_rect.Min.y > resize_rect.Max.y) ImSwap(resize_rect.Min.y, resize_rect.Max.y);
5617  bool hovered, held;
5618  ButtonBehavior(resize_rect, window->GetID(resize_grip_n), &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren | ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus);
5619  //GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(resize_rect.Min, resize_rect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
5620  if (hovered || held)
5621  g.MouseCursor = (resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNESW : ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNWSE;
5622 
5623  if (held && g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[0] && resize_grip_n == 0)
5624  {
5625  // Manual auto-fit when double-clicking
5626  size_target = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
5627  ret_auto_fit = true;
5628  ClearActiveID();
5629  }
5630  else if (held)
5631  {
5632  // Resize from any of the four corners
5633  // We don't use an incremental MouseDelta but rather compute an absolute target size based on mouse position
5634  ImVec2 corner_target = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset + ImLerp(grip.InnerDir * grip_hover_outer_size, grip.InnerDir * -grip_hover_inner_size, grip.CornerPosN); // Corner of the window corresponding to our corner grip
5635  ImVec2 clamp_min = ImVec2(grip.CornerPosN.x == 1.0f ? visibility_rect.Min.x : -FLT_MAX, grip.CornerPosN.y == 1.0f ? visibility_rect.Min.y : -FLT_MAX);
5636  ImVec2 clamp_max = ImVec2(grip.CornerPosN.x == 0.0f ? visibility_rect.Max.x : +FLT_MAX, grip.CornerPosN.y == 0.0f ? visibility_rect.Max.y : +FLT_MAX);
5637  corner_target = ImClamp(corner_target, clamp_min, clamp_max);
5638  CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(window, corner_target, grip.CornerPosN, &pos_target, &size_target);
5639  }
5640  if (resize_grip_n == 0 || held || hovered)
5641  resize_grip_col[resize_grip_n] = GetColorU32(held ? ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_ResizeGripHovered : ImGuiCol_ResizeGrip);
5642  }
5643  for (int border_n = 0; border_n < resize_border_count; border_n++)
5644  {
5645  bool hovered, held;
5646  ImRect border_rect = GetResizeBorderRect(window, border_n, grip_hover_inner_size, WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS);
5647  ButtonBehavior(border_rect, window->GetID(border_n + 4), &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren);
5648  //GetForegroundDrawLists(window)->AddRect(border_rect.Min, border_rect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
5649  if ((hovered && g.HoveredIdTimer > WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_FEEDBACK_TIMER) || held)
5650  {
5651  g.MouseCursor = (border_n & 1) ? ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeEW : ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNS;
5652  if (held)
5653  *border_held = border_n;
5654  }
5655  if (held)
5656  {
5657  ImVec2 border_target = window->Pos;
5658  ImVec2 border_posn;
5659  if (border_n == 0) { border_posn = ImVec2(0, 0); border_target.y = (g.IO.MousePos.y - g.ActiveIdClickOffset.y + WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS); } // Top
5660  if (border_n == 1) { border_posn = ImVec2(1, 0); border_target.x = (g.IO.MousePos.x - g.ActiveIdClickOffset.x + WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS); } // Right
5661  if (border_n == 2) { border_posn = ImVec2(0, 1); border_target.y = (g.IO.MousePos.y - g.ActiveIdClickOffset.y + WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS); } // Bottom
5662  if (border_n == 3) { border_posn = ImVec2(0, 0); border_target.x = (g.IO.MousePos.x - g.ActiveIdClickOffset.x + WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_HALF_THICKNESS); } // Left
5663  ImVec2 clamp_min = ImVec2(border_n == 1 ? visibility_rect.Min.x : -FLT_MAX, border_n == 2 ? visibility_rect.Min.y : -FLT_MAX);
5664  ImVec2 clamp_max = ImVec2(border_n == 3 ? visibility_rect.Max.x : +FLT_MAX, border_n == 0 ? visibility_rect.Max.y : +FLT_MAX);
5665  border_target = ImClamp(border_target, clamp_min, clamp_max);
5666  CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(window, border_target, border_posn, &pos_target, &size_target);
5667  }
5668  }
5669  PopID();
5670 
5671  // Restore nav layer
5672  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
5673 
5674  // Navigation resize (keyboard/gamepad)
5675  if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindow == window)
5676  {
5677  ImVec2 nav_resize_delta;
5678  if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_NavKeyboard && g.IO.KeyShift)
5679  nav_resize_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_Keyboard, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
5680  if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_NavGamepad)
5681  nav_resize_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadDPad, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
5682  if (nav_resize_delta.x != 0.0f || nav_resize_delta.y != 0.0f)
5683  {
5684  const float NAV_RESIZE_SPEED = 600.0f;
5685  nav_resize_delta *= ImFloor(NAV_RESIZE_SPEED * g.IO.DeltaTime * ImMin(g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.x, g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.y));
5686  nav_resize_delta = ImMax(nav_resize_delta, visibility_rect.Min - window->Pos - window->Size);
5687  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
5688  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
5689  resize_grip_col[0] = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive);
5690  // FIXME-NAV: Should store and accumulate into a separate size buffer to handle sizing constraints properly, right now a constraint will make us stuck.
5691  size_target = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, window->SizeFull + nav_resize_delta);
5692  }
5693  }
5694 
5695  // Apply back modified position/size to window
5696  if (size_target.x != FLT_MAX)
5697  {
5698  window->SizeFull = size_target;
5699  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
5700  }
5701  if (pos_target.x != FLT_MAX)
5702  {
5703  window->Pos = ImFloor(pos_target);
5704  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
5705  }
5706 
5707  window->Size = window->SizeFull;
5708  return ret_auto_fit;
5709 }
5710 
5711 static inline void ClampWindowRect(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& visibility_rect)
5712 {
5713  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5714  ImVec2 size_for_clamping = window->Size;
5715  if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5716  size_for_clamping.y = window->TitleBarHeight();
5717  window->Pos = ImClamp(window->Pos, visibility_rect.Min - size_for_clamping, visibility_rect.Max);
5718 }
5719 
5720 static void ImGui::RenderWindowOuterBorders(ImGuiWindow* window)
5721 {
5722  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5723  float rounding = window->WindowRounding;
5724  float border_size = window->WindowBorderSize;
5725  if (border_size > 0.0f && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground))
5726  window->DrawList->AddRect(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), rounding, ImDrawCornerFlags_All, border_size);
5727 
5728  int border_held = window->ResizeBorderHeld;
5729  if (border_held != -1)
5730  {
5731  const ImGuiResizeBorderDef& def = resize_border_def[border_held];
5732  ImRect border_r = GetResizeBorderRect(window, border_held, rounding, 0.0f);
5733  window->DrawList->PathArcTo(ImLerp(border_r.Min, border_r.Max, def.CornerPosN1) + ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f) + def.InnerDir * rounding, rounding, def.OuterAngle - IM_PI * 0.25f, def.OuterAngle);
5734  window->DrawList->PathArcTo(ImLerp(border_r.Min, border_r.Max, def.CornerPosN2) + ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f) + def.InnerDir * rounding, rounding, def.OuterAngle, def.OuterAngle + IM_PI * 0.25f);
5735  window->DrawList->PathStroke(GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_SeparatorActive), false, ImMax(2.0f, border_size)); // Thicker than usual
5736  }
5737  if (g.Style.FrameBorderSize > 0 && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) && !window->DockIsActive)
5738  {
5739  float y = window->Pos.y + window->TitleBarHeight() - 1;
5740  window->DrawList->AddLine(ImVec2(window->Pos.x + border_size, y), ImVec2(window->Pos.x + window->Size.x - border_size, y), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), g.Style.FrameBorderSize);
5741  }
5742 }
5743 
5744 // Draw background and borders
5745 // Draw and handle scrollbars
5746 void ImGui::RenderWindowDecorations(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& title_bar_rect, bool title_bar_is_highlight, bool handle_borders_and_resize_grips, int resize_grip_count, const ImU32 resize_grip_col[4], float resize_grip_draw_size)
5747 {
5748  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5749  ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5750  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5751 
5752  // Ensure that ScrollBar doesn't read last frame's SkipItems
5753  IM_ASSERT(window->BeginCount == 0);
5754  window->SkipItems = false;
5755 
5756  // Draw window + handle manual resize
5757  // As we highlight the title bar when want_focus is set, multiple reappearing windows will have have their title bar highlighted on their reappearing frame.
5758  const float window_rounding = window->WindowRounding;
5759  const float window_border_size = window->WindowBorderSize;
5760  if (window->Collapsed)
5761  {
5762  // Title bar only
5763  float backup_border_size = style.FrameBorderSize;
5764  g.Style.FrameBorderSize = window->WindowBorderSize;
5765  ImU32 title_bar_col = GetColorU32((title_bar_is_highlight && !g.NavDisableHighlight) ? ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive : ImGuiCol_TitleBgCollapsed);
5766  RenderFrame(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, title_bar_col, true, window_rounding);
5767  g.Style.FrameBorderSize = backup_border_size;
5768  }
5769  else
5770  {
5771  // Window background
5772  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground))
5773  {
5774  bool is_docking_transparent_payload = false;
5775  if (g.DragDropActive && (g.FrameCount - g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount) <= 1 && g.IO.ConfigDockingTransparentPayload)
5776  if (g.DragDropPayload.IsDataType(IMGUI_PAYLOAD_TYPE_WINDOW) && *(ImGuiWindow**)g.DragDropPayload.Data == window)
5777  is_docking_transparent_payload = true;
5778 
5779  ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32(GetWindowBgColorIdxFromFlags(flags));
5780  if (window->ViewportOwned)
5781  {
5782  // No alpha
5783  bg_col = (bg_col | IM_COL32_A_MASK);
5784  if (is_docking_transparent_payload)
5785  window->Viewport->Alpha *= DOCKING_TRANSPARENT_PAYLOAD_ALPHA;
5786  }
5787  else
5788  {
5789  // Adjust alpha. For docking
5790  bool override_alpha = false;
5791  float alpha = 1.0f;
5792  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasBgAlpha)
5793  {
5794  alpha = g.NextWindowData.BgAlphaVal;
5795  override_alpha = true;
5796  }
5797  if (is_docking_transparent_payload)
5798  {
5799  alpha *= DOCKING_TRANSPARENT_PAYLOAD_ALPHA; // FIXME-DOCK: Should that be an override?
5800  override_alpha = true;
5801  }
5802  if (override_alpha)
5803  bg_col = (bg_col & ~IM_COL32_A_MASK) | (IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(alpha) << IM_COL32_A_SHIFT);
5804  }
5805  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(window->Pos + ImVec2(0, window->TitleBarHeight()), window->Pos + window->Size, bg_col, window_rounding, (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) ? ImDrawCornerFlags_All : ImDrawCornerFlags_Bot);
5806  }
5807 
5808  // Title bar
5809  // (when docked, DockNode are drawing their own title bar. Individual windows however do NOT set the _NoTitleBar flag,
5810  // in order for their pos/size to be matching their undocking state.)
5811  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) && !window->DockIsActive)
5812  {
5813  ImU32 title_bar_col = GetColorU32(title_bar_is_highlight ? ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive : ImGuiCol_TitleBg);
5814  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, title_bar_col, window_rounding, ImDrawCornerFlags_Top);
5815  }
5816 
5817  // Menu bar
5818  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar)
5819  {
5820  ImRect menu_bar_rect = window->MenuBarRect();
5821  menu_bar_rect.ClipWith(window->Rect()); // Soft clipping, in particular child window don't have minimum size covering the menu bar so this is useful for them.
5822  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(menu_bar_rect.Min + ImVec2(window_border_size, 0), menu_bar_rect.Max - ImVec2(window_border_size, 0), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_MenuBarBg), (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) ? window_rounding : 0.0f, ImDrawCornerFlags_Top);
5823  if (style.FrameBorderSize > 0.0f && menu_bar_rect.Max.y < window->Pos.y + window->Size.y)
5824  window->DrawList->AddLine(menu_bar_rect.GetBL(), menu_bar_rect.GetBR(), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), style.FrameBorderSize);
5825  }
5826 
5827  // Docking: Unhide tab bar (small triangle in the corner), drag from small triangle to quickly undock
5828  ImGuiDockNode* node = window->DockNode;
5829  if (window->DockIsActive && node->IsHiddenTabBar() && !node->IsNoTabBar())
5830  {
5831  float unhide_sz_draw = ImFloor(g.FontSize * 0.70f);
5832  float unhide_sz_hit = ImFloor(g.FontSize * 0.55f);
5833  ImVec2 p = node->Pos;
5834  ImRect r(p, p + ImVec2(unhide_sz_hit, unhide_sz_hit));
5835  bool hovered, held;
5836  if (ButtonBehavior(r, window->GetID("#UNHIDE"), &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren))
5837  node->WantHiddenTabBarToggle = true;
5838  else if (held && IsMouseDragging(0))
5839  StartMouseMovingWindowOrNode(window, node, true);
5840 
5841  // FIXME-DOCK: Ideally we'd use ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive/ImGuiCol_TitleBg here, but neither is guaranteed to be visible enough at this sort of size..
5842  ImU32 col = GetColorU32(((held && hovered) || (node->IsFocused && !hovered)) ? ImGuiCol_ButtonActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_ButtonHovered : ImGuiCol_Button);
5843  window->DrawList->AddTriangleFilled(p, p + ImVec2(unhide_sz_draw, 0.0f), p + ImVec2(0.0f, unhide_sz_draw), col);
5844  }
5845 
5846  // Scrollbars
5847  if (window->ScrollbarX)
5848  Scrollbar(ImGuiAxis_X);
5849  if (window->ScrollbarY)
5850  Scrollbar(ImGuiAxis_Y);
5851 
5852  // Render resize grips (after their input handling so we don't have a frame of latency)
5853  if (handle_borders_and_resize_grips && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize))
5854  {
5855  for (int resize_grip_n = 0; resize_grip_n < resize_grip_count; resize_grip_n++)
5856  {
5857  const ImGuiResizeGripDef& grip = resize_grip_def[resize_grip_n];
5858  const ImVec2 corner = ImLerp(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, grip.CornerPosN);
5859  window->DrawList->PathLineTo(corner + grip.InnerDir * ((resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImVec2(window_border_size, resize_grip_draw_size) : ImVec2(resize_grip_draw_size, window_border_size)));
5860  window->DrawList->PathLineTo(corner + grip.InnerDir * ((resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImVec2(resize_grip_draw_size, window_border_size) : ImVec2(window_border_size, resize_grip_draw_size)));
5861  window->DrawList->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(corner.x + grip.InnerDir.x * (window_rounding + window_border_size), corner.y + grip.InnerDir.y * (window_rounding + window_border_size)), window_rounding, grip.AngleMin12, grip.AngleMax12);
5862  window->DrawList->PathFillConvex(resize_grip_col[resize_grip_n]);
5863  }
5864  }
5865 
5866  // Borders (for dock node host they will be rendered over after the tab bar)
5867  if (handle_borders_and_resize_grips && !window->DockNodeAsHost)
5868  RenderWindowOuterBorders(window);
5869  }
5870 }
5871 
5872 // Render title text, collapse button, close button
5873 // When inside a dock node, this is handled in DockNodeUpdateTabBar() instead.
5874 void ImGui::RenderWindowTitleBarContents(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& title_bar_rect, const char* name, bool* p_open)
5875 {
5876  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5877  ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5878  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5879 
5880  const bool has_close_button = (p_open != NULL);
5881  const bool has_collapse_button = !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse) && (style.WindowMenuButtonPosition != ImGuiDir_None);
5882 
5883  // Close & Collapse button are on the Menu NavLayer and don't default focus (unless there's nothing else on that layer)
5884  const ImGuiItemFlags item_flags_backup = window->DC.ItemFlags;
5885  window->DC.ItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus;
5886  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
5887 
5888  // Layout buttons
5889  // FIXME: Would be nice to generalize the subtleties expressed here into reusable code.
5890  float pad_l = style.FramePadding.x;
5891  float pad_r = style.FramePadding.x;
5892  float button_sz = g.FontSize;
5893  ImVec2 close_button_pos;
5894  ImVec2 collapse_button_pos;
5895  if (has_close_button)
5896  {
5897  pad_r += button_sz;
5898  close_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
5899  }
5900  if (has_collapse_button && style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Right)
5901  {
5902  pad_r += button_sz;
5903  collapse_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
5904  }
5905  if (has_collapse_button && style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left)
5906  {
5907  collapse_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Min.x + pad_l - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
5908  pad_l += button_sz;
5909  }
5910 
5911  // Collapse button (submitting first so it gets priority when choosing a navigation init fallback)
5912  if (has_collapse_button)
5913  if (CollapseButton(window->GetID("#COLLAPSE"), collapse_button_pos, NULL))
5914  window->WantCollapseToggle = true; // Defer actual collapsing to next frame as we are too far in the Begin() function
5915 
5916  // Close button
5917  if (has_close_button)
5918  if (CloseButton(window->GetID("#CLOSE"), close_button_pos))
5919  *p_open = false;
5920 
5921  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
5922  window->DC.ItemFlags = item_flags_backup;
5923 
5924  // Title bar text (with: horizontal alignment, avoiding collapse/close button, optional "unsaved document" marker)
5925  // FIXME: Refactor text alignment facilities along with RenderText helpers, this is WAY too much messy code..
5926  const char* UNSAVED_DOCUMENT_MARKER = "*";
5927  const float marker_size_x = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument) ? CalcTextSize(UNSAVED_DOCUMENT_MARKER, NULL, false).x : 0.0f;
5928  const ImVec2 text_size = CalcTextSize(name, NULL, true) + ImVec2(marker_size_x, 0.0f);
5929 
5930  // As a nice touch we try to ensure that centered title text doesn't get affected by visibility of Close/Collapse button,
5931  // while uncentered title text will still reach edges correctly.
5932  if (pad_l > style.FramePadding.x)
5933  pad_l += g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5934  if (pad_r > style.FramePadding.x)
5935  pad_r += g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5936  if (style.WindowTitleAlign.x > 0.0f && style.WindowTitleAlign.x < 1.0f)
5937  {
5938  float centerness = ImSaturate(1.0f - ImFabs(style.WindowTitleAlign.x - 0.5f) * 2.0f); // 0.0f on either edges, 1.0f on center
5939  float pad_extend = ImMin(ImMax(pad_l, pad_r), title_bar_rect.GetWidth() - pad_l - pad_r - text_size.x);
5940  pad_l = ImMax(pad_l, pad_extend * centerness);
5941  pad_r = ImMax(pad_r, pad_extend * centerness);
5942  }
5943 
5944  ImRect layout_r(title_bar_rect.Min.x + pad_l, title_bar_rect.Min.y, title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r, title_bar_rect.Max.y);
5945  ImRect clip_r(layout_r.Min.x, layout_r.Min.y, ImMin(layout_r.Max.x + g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, title_bar_rect.Max.x), layout_r.Max.y);
5946  //if (g.IO.KeyShift) window->DrawList->AddRect(layout_r.Min, layout_r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 128, 0, 255)); // [DEBUG]
5947  //if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) window->DrawList->AddRect(clip_r.Min, clip_r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 128, 0, 255)); // [DEBUG]
5948  RenderTextClipped(layout_r.Min, layout_r.Max, name, NULL, &text_size, style.WindowTitleAlign, &clip_r);
5949  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument)
5950  {
5951  ImVec2 marker_pos = ImVec2(ImMax(layout_r.Min.x, layout_r.Min.x + (layout_r.GetWidth() - text_size.x) * style.WindowTitleAlign.x) + text_size.x, layout_r.Min.y) + ImVec2(2 - marker_size_x, 0.0f);
5952  ImVec2 off = ImVec2(0.0f, IM_FLOOR(-g.FontSize * 0.25f));
5953  RenderTextClipped(marker_pos + off, layout_r.Max + off, UNSAVED_DOCUMENT_MARKER, NULL, NULL, ImVec2(0, style.WindowTitleAlign.y), &clip_r);
5954  }
5955 }
5956 
5957 void ImGui::UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindowFlags flags, ImGuiWindow* parent_window)
5958 {
5959  window->ParentWindow = parent_window;
5960  window->RootWindow = window->RootWindowDockStop = window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight = window->RootWindowForNav = window;
5961  if (parent_window && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip))
5962  {
5963  window->RootWindow = parent_window->RootWindow;
5964  if (!window->DockIsActive && !(parent_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost))
5965  window->RootWindowDockStop = parent_window->RootWindowDockStop;
5966  }
5967  if (parent_window && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) && (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)))
5968  window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight = parent_window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight;
5969  while (window->RootWindowForNav->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened)
5970  {
5971  IM_ASSERT(window->RootWindowForNav->ParentWindow != NULL);
5972  window->RootWindowForNav = window->RootWindowForNav->ParentWindow;
5973  }
5974 }
5975 
5976 // Push a new Dear ImGui window to add widgets to.
5977 // - A default window called "Debug" is automatically stacked at the beginning of every frame so you can use widgets without explicitly calling a Begin/End pair.
5978 // - Begin/End can be called multiple times during the frame with the same window name to append content.
5979 // - The window name is used as a unique identifier to preserve window information across frames (and save rudimentary information to the .ini file).
5980 // You can use the "##" or "###" markers to use the same label with different id, or same id with different label. See documentation at the top of this file.
5981 // - Return false when window is collapsed, so you can early out in your code. You always need to call ImGui::End() even if false is returned.
5982 // - Passing 'bool* p_open' displays a Close button on the upper-right corner of the window, the pointed value will be set to false when the button is pressed.
5983 bool ImGui::Begin(const char* name, bool* p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
5984 {
5985  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
5986  const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
5987  IM_ASSERT(name != NULL && name[0] != '\0'); // Window name required
5988  IM_ASSERT(g.WithinFrameScope); // Forgot to call ImGui::NewFrame()
5989  IM_ASSERT(g.FrameCountEnded != g.FrameCount); // Called ImGui::Render() or ImGui::EndFrame() and haven't called ImGui::NewFrame() again yet
5990 
5991  // Find or create
5992  ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name);
5993  const bool window_just_created = (window == NULL);
5994  if (window_just_created)
5995  window = CreateNewWindow(name, flags);
5996 
5997  // Automatically disable manual moving/resizing when NoInputs is set
5998  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs) == ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs)
5999  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize;
6000 
6001  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened)
6002  IM_ASSERT(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow);
6003 
6004  const int current_frame = g.FrameCount;
6005  const bool first_begin_of_the_frame = (window->LastFrameActive != current_frame);
6006  window->IsFallbackWindow = (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 0 && g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow);
6007 
6008  // Update the Appearing flag
6009  bool window_just_activated_by_user = (window->LastFrameActive < current_frame - 1); // Not using !WasActive because the implicit "Debug" window would always toggle off->on
6010  const bool window_just_appearing_after_hidden_for_resize = (window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0);
6011  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
6012  {
6013  ImGuiPopupData& popup_ref = g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size];
6014  window_just_activated_by_user |= (window->PopupId != popup_ref.PopupId); // We recycle popups so treat window as activated if popup id changed
6015  window_just_activated_by_user |= (window != popup_ref.Window);
6016  }
6017  window->Appearing = (window_just_activated_by_user || window_just_appearing_after_hidden_for_resize);
6018  if (window->Appearing)
6019  SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_Appearing, true);
6020 
6021  // Update Flags, LastFrameActive, BeginOrderXXX fields
6022  if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
6023  {
6024  window->FlagsPreviousFrame = window->Flags;
6025  window->Flags = (ImGuiWindowFlags)flags;
6026  window->LastFrameActive = current_frame;
6027  window->LastTimeActive = (float)g.Time;
6028  window->BeginOrderWithinParent = 0;
6029  window->BeginOrderWithinContext = (short)(g.WindowsActiveCount++);
6030  }
6031  else
6032  {
6033  flags = window->Flags;
6034  }
6035 
6036  // Docking
6037  // (NB: during the frame dock nodes are created, it is possible that (window->DockIsActive == false) even though (window->DockNode->Windows.Size > 1)
6038  IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode == NULL || window->DockNodeAsHost == NULL); // Cannot be both
6039  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasDock)
6040  SetWindowDock(window, g.NextWindowData.DockId, g.NextWindowData.DockCond);
6041  if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
6042  {
6043  bool has_dock_node = (window->DockId != 0 || window->DockNode != NULL);
6044  bool new_auto_dock_node = !has_dock_node && GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnTabBar(window);
6045  if (has_dock_node || new_auto_dock_node)
6046  {
6047  BeginDocked(window, p_open);
6048  flags = window->Flags;
6049  if (window->DockIsActive)
6050  IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode != NULL);
6051 
6052  // Docking currently override constraints
6053  g.NextWindowData.Flags &= ~ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint;
6054  }
6055  }
6056 
6057  // Parent window is latched only on the first call to Begin() of the frame, so further append-calls can be done from a different window stack
6058  ImGuiWindow* parent_window_in_stack = window->DockIsActive ? window->DockNode->HostWindow : g.CurrentWindowStack.empty() ? NULL : g.CurrentWindowStack.back();
6059  ImGuiWindow* parent_window = first_begin_of_the_frame ? ((flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)) ? parent_window_in_stack : NULL) : window->ParentWindow;
6060  IM_ASSERT(parent_window != NULL || !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow));
6061 
6062  // We allow window memory to be compacted so recreate the base stack when needed.
6063  if (window->IDStack.Size == 0)
6064  window->IDStack.push_back(window->ID);
6065 
6066  // Add to stack
6067  // We intentionally set g.CurrentWindow to NULL to prevent usage until when the viewport is set, then will call SetCurrentWindow()
6068  g.CurrentWindowStack.push_back(window);
6069  g.CurrentWindow = window;
6070  window->DC.StackSizesOnBegin.SetToCurrentState();
6071  g.CurrentWindow = NULL;
6072 
6073  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
6074  {
6075  ImGuiPopupData& popup_ref = g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size];
6076  popup_ref.Window = window;
6077  g.BeginPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
6078  window->PopupId = popup_ref.PopupId;
6079  }
6080 
6081  if (window_just_appearing_after_hidden_for_resize && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
6082  window->NavLastIds[0] = 0;
6083 
6084  // Update ->RootWindow and others pointers (before any possible call to FocusWindow)
6085  if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
6086  UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(window, flags, parent_window);
6087 
6088  // Process SetNextWindow***() calls
6089  // (FIXME: Consider splitting the HasXXX flags into X/Y components
6090  bool window_pos_set_by_api = false;
6091  bool window_size_x_set_by_api = false, window_size_y_set_by_api = false;
6092  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos)
6093  {
6094  window_pos_set_by_api = (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & g.NextWindowData.PosCond) != 0;
6095  if (window_pos_set_by_api && ImLengthSqr(g.NextWindowData.PosPivotVal) > 0.00001f)
6096  {
6097  // May be processed on the next frame if this is our first frame and we are measuring size
6098  // FIXME: Look into removing the branch so everything can go through this same code path for consistency.
6099  window->SetWindowPosVal = g.NextWindowData.PosVal;
6100  window->SetWindowPosPivot = g.NextWindowData.PosPivotVal;
6101  window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
6102  }
6103  else
6104  {
6105  SetWindowPos(window, g.NextWindowData.PosVal, g.NextWindowData.PosCond);
6106  }
6107  }
6108  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize)
6109  {
6110  window_size_x_set_by_api = (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & g.NextWindowData.SizeCond) != 0 && (g.NextWindowData.SizeVal.x > 0.0f);
6111  window_size_y_set_by_api = (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & g.NextWindowData.SizeCond) != 0 && (g.NextWindowData.SizeVal.y > 0.0f);
6112  SetWindowSize(window, g.NextWindowData.SizeVal, g.NextWindowData.SizeCond);
6113  }
6114  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasScroll)
6115  {
6116  if (g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.x >= 0.0f)
6117  {
6118  window->ScrollTarget.x = g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.x;
6119  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x = 0.0f;
6120  }
6121  if (g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.y >= 0.0f)
6122  {
6123  window->ScrollTarget.y = g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.y;
6124  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y = 0.0f;
6125  }
6126  }
6127  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasContentSize)
6128  window->ContentSizeExplicit = g.NextWindowData.ContentSizeVal;
6129  else if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
6130  window->ContentSizeExplicit = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
6131  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasWindowClass)
6132  window->WindowClass = g.NextWindowData.WindowClass;
6133  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasCollapsed)
6134  SetWindowCollapsed(window, g.NextWindowData.CollapsedVal, g.NextWindowData.CollapsedCond);
6135  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasFocus)
6136  FocusWindow(window);
6137  if (window->Appearing)
6138  SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_Appearing, false);
6139 
6140  // When reusing window again multiple times a frame, just append content (don't need to setup again)
6141  if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
6142  {
6143  // Initialize
6144  const bool window_is_child_tooltip = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip); // FIXME-WIP: Undocumented behavior of Child+Tooltip for pinned tooltip (#1345)
6145  window->Active = true;
6146  window->HasCloseButton = (p_open != NULL);
6147  window->ClipRect = ImVec4(-FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX);
6148  window->IDStack.resize(1);
6149  window->DrawList->_ResetForNewFrame();
6150  window->DC.CurrentTableIdx = -1;
6151 
6152  // Restore buffer capacity when woken from a compacted state, to avoid
6153  if (window->MemoryCompacted)
6154  GcAwakeTransientWindowBuffers(window);
6155 
6156  // Update stored window name when it changes (which can _only_ happen with the "###" operator, so the ID would stay unchanged).
6157  // The title bar always display the 'name' parameter, so we only update the string storage if it needs to be visible to the end-user elsewhere.
6158  bool window_title_visible_elsewhere = false;
6159  if ((window->Viewport && window->Viewport->Window == window) || (window->DockIsActive))
6160  window_title_visible_elsewhere = true;
6161  else if (g.NavWindowingListWindow != NULL && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus) == 0) // Window titles visible when using CTRL+TAB
6162  window_title_visible_elsewhere = true;
6163  if (window_title_visible_elsewhere && !window_just_created && strcmp(name, window->Name) != 0)
6164  {
6165  size_t buf_len = (size_t)window->NameBufLen;
6166  window->Name = ImStrdupcpy(window->Name, &buf_len, name);
6167  window->NameBufLen = (int)buf_len;
6168  }
6169 
6170  // UPDATE CONTENTS SIZE, UPDATE HIDDEN STATUS
6171 
6172  // Update contents size from last frame for auto-fitting (or use explicit size)
6173  CalcWindowContentSizes(window, &window->ContentSize, &window->ContentSizeIdeal);
6174  if (window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0)
6175  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems--;
6176  if (window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0)
6177  window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems--;
6178  if (window->HiddenFramesForRenderOnly > 0)
6179  window->HiddenFramesForRenderOnly--;
6180 
6181  // Hide new windows for one frame until they calculate their size
6182  if (window_just_created && (!window_size_x_set_by_api || !window_size_y_set_by_api))
6183  window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
6184 
6185  // Hide popup/tooltip window when re-opening while we measure size (because we recycle the windows)
6186  // We reset Size/ContentSize for reappearing popups/tooltips early in this function, so further code won't be tempted to use the old size.
6187  if (window_just_activated_by_user && (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) != 0)
6188  {
6189  window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
6190  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize)
6191  {
6192  if (!window_size_x_set_by_api)
6193  window->Size.x = window->SizeFull.x = 0.f;
6194  if (!window_size_y_set_by_api)
6195  window->Size.y = window->SizeFull.y = 0.f;
6196  window->ContentSize = window->ContentSizeIdeal = ImVec2(0.f, 0.f);
6197  }
6198  }
6199 
6200  // SELECT VIEWPORT
6201  // We need to do this before using any style/font sizes, as viewport with a different DPI may affect font sizes.
6202 
6203  UpdateSelectWindowViewport(window);
6204  SetCurrentViewport(window, window->Viewport);
6205  window->FontDpiScale = (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleFonts) ? window->Viewport->DpiScale : 1.0f;
6206  SetCurrentWindow(window);
6207  flags = window->Flags;
6208 
6209  // LOCK BORDER SIZE AND PADDING FOR THE FRAME (so that altering them doesn't cause inconsistencies)
6210  // We read Style data after the call to UpdateSelectWindowViewport() which might be swapping the style.
6211 
6212  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
6213  window->WindowBorderSize = style.ChildBorderSize;
6214  else
6215  window->WindowBorderSize = ((flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)) ? style.PopupBorderSize : style.WindowBorderSize;
6216  if (!window->DockIsActive && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)) && window->WindowBorderSize == 0.0f)
6217  window->WindowPadding = ImVec2(0.0f, (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) ? style.WindowPadding.y : 0.0f);
6218  else
6219  window->WindowPadding = style.WindowPadding;
6220 
6221  // Lock menu offset so size calculation can use it as menu-bar windows need a minimum size.
6222  window->DC.MenuBarOffset.x = ImMax(ImMax(window->WindowPadding.x, style.ItemSpacing.x), g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal.x);
6223  window->DC.MenuBarOffset.y = g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal.y;
6224 
6225  // Collapse window by double-clicking on title bar
6226  // At this point we don't have a clipping rectangle setup yet, so we can use the title bar area for hit detection and drawing
6227  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse) && !window->DockIsActive)
6228  {
6229  // We don't use a regular button+id to test for double-click on title bar (mostly due to legacy reason, could be fixed), so verify that we don't have items over the title bar.
6230  ImRect title_bar_rect = window->TitleBarRect();
6231  if (g.HoveredWindow == window && g.HoveredId == 0 && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame == 0 && IsMouseHoveringRect(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max) && g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[0])
6232  window->WantCollapseToggle = true;
6233  if (window->WantCollapseToggle)
6234  {
6235  window->Collapsed = !window->Collapsed;
6236  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
6237  FocusWindow(window);
6238  }
6239  }
6240  else
6241  {
6242  window->Collapsed = false;
6243  }
6244  window->WantCollapseToggle = false;
6245 
6246  // SIZE
6247 
6248  // Calculate auto-fit size, handle automatic resize
6249  const ImVec2 size_auto_fit = CalcWindowAutoFitSize(window, window->ContentSizeIdeal);
6250  bool use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = window_just_created;
6251  bool use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = window_just_created;
6252  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) && !window->Collapsed)
6253  {
6254  // Using SetNextWindowSize() overrides ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize, so it can be used on tooltips/popups, etc.
6255  if (!window_size_x_set_by_api)
6256  {
6257  window->SizeFull.x = size_auto_fit.x;
6258  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = true;
6259  }
6260  if (!window_size_y_set_by_api)
6261  {
6262  window->SizeFull.y = size_auto_fit.y;
6263  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = true;
6264  }
6265  }
6266  else if (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0 || window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
6267  {
6268  // Auto-fit may only grow window during the first few frames
6269  // We still process initial auto-fit on collapsed windows to get a window width, but otherwise don't honor ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize when collapsed.
6270  if (!window_size_x_set_by_api && window->AutoFitFramesX > 0)
6271  {
6272  window->SizeFull.x = window->AutoFitOnlyGrows ? ImMax(window->SizeFull.x, size_auto_fit.x) : size_auto_fit.x;
6273  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = true;
6274  }
6275  if (!window_size_y_set_by_api && window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
6276  {
6277  window->SizeFull.y = window->AutoFitOnlyGrows ? ImMax(window->SizeFull.y, size_auto_fit.y) : size_auto_fit.y;
6278  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = true;
6279  }
6280  if (!window->Collapsed)
6281  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
6282  }
6283 
6284  // Apply minimum/maximum window size constraints and final size
6285  window->SizeFull = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, window->SizeFull);
6286  window->Size = window->Collapsed && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? window->TitleBarRect().GetSize() : window->SizeFull;
6287 
6288  // Decoration size
6289  const float decoration_up_height = window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight();
6290 
6291  // POSITION
6292 
6293  // Popup latch its initial position, will position itself when it appears next frame
6294  if (window_just_activated_by_user)
6295  {
6296  window->AutoPosLastDirection = ImGuiDir_None;
6297  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0 && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) && !window_pos_set_by_api) // FIXME: BeginPopup() could use SetNextWindowPos()
6298  window->Pos = g.BeginPopupStack.back().OpenPopupPos;
6299  }
6300 
6301  // Position child window
6302  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
6303  {
6304  IM_ASSERT(parent_window && parent_window->Active);
6305  window->BeginOrderWithinParent = (short)parent_window->DC.ChildWindows.Size;
6306  parent_window->DC.ChildWindows.push_back(window);
6307  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !window_pos_set_by_api && !window_is_child_tooltip)
6308  window->Pos = parent_window->DC.CursorPos;
6309  }
6310 
6311  const bool window_pos_with_pivot = (window->SetWindowPosVal.x != FLT_MAX && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems == 0);
6312  if (window_pos_with_pivot)
6313  SetWindowPos(window, window->SetWindowPosVal - window->Size * window->SetWindowPosPivot, 0); // Position given a pivot (e.g. for centering)
6314  else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) != 0)
6315  window->Pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopup(window);
6316  else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0 && !window_pos_set_by_api && window_just_appearing_after_hidden_for_resize)
6317  window->Pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopup(window);
6318  else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) != 0 && !window_pos_set_by_api && !window_is_child_tooltip)
6319  window->Pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopup(window);
6320 
6321  // Late create viewport if we don't fit within our current host viewport.
6322  if (window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend >= 0 && !window->ViewportOwned && !(window->Viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized))
6323  if (!window->Viewport->GetMainRect().Contains(window->Rect()))
6324  {
6325  // This is based on the assumption that the DPI will be known ahead (same as the DPI of the selection done in UpdateSelectWindowViewport)
6326  //ImGuiViewport* old_viewport = window->Viewport;
6327  window->Viewport = AddUpdateViewport(window, window->ID, window->Pos, window->Size, ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing);
6328 
6329  // FIXME-DPI
6330  //IM_ASSERT(old_viewport->DpiScale == window->Viewport->DpiScale); // FIXME-DPI: Something went wrong
6331  SetCurrentViewport(window, window->Viewport);
6332  window->FontDpiScale = (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleFonts) ? window->Viewport->DpiScale : 1.0f;
6333  SetCurrentWindow(window);
6334  }
6335 
6336  bool viewport_rect_changed = false;
6337  if (window->ViewportOwned)
6338  {
6339  // Synchronize window --> viewport in most situations
6340  // Synchronize viewport -> window in case the platform window has been moved or resized from the OS/WM
6341  if (window->Viewport->PlatformRequestMove)
6342  {
6343  window->Pos = window->Viewport->Pos;
6344  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
6345  }
6346  else if (memcmp(&window->Viewport->Pos, &window->Pos, sizeof(window->Pos)) != 0)
6347  {
6348  viewport_rect_changed = true;
6349  window->Viewport->Pos = window->Pos;
6350  }
6351 
6352  if (window->Viewport->PlatformRequestResize)
6353  {
6354  window->Size = window->SizeFull = window->Viewport->Size;
6355  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
6356  }
6357  else if (memcmp(&window->Viewport->Size, &window->Size, sizeof(window->Size)) != 0)
6358  {
6359  viewport_rect_changed = true;
6360  window->Viewport->Size = window->Size;
6361  }
6362  window->Viewport->UpdateWorkRect();
6363 
6364  // The viewport may have changed monitor since the global update in UpdateViewportsNewFrame()
6365  // Either a SetNextWindowPos() call in the current frame or a SetWindowPos() call in the previous frame may have this effect.
6366  if (viewport_rect_changed)
6367  UpdateViewportPlatformMonitor(window->Viewport);
6368 
6369  // Update common viewport flags
6370  const ImGuiViewportFlags viewport_flags_to_clear = ImGuiViewportFlags_TopMost | ImGuiViewportFlags_NoTaskBarIcon | ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration | ImGuiViewportFlags_NoRendererClear;
6371  ImGuiViewportFlags viewport_flags = window->Viewport->Flags & ~viewport_flags_to_clear;
6372  const bool is_modal = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) != 0;
6373  const bool is_short_lived_floating_window = (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)) != 0;
6374  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
6375  viewport_flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_TopMost;
6376  if ((g.IO.ConfigViewportsNoTaskBarIcon || is_short_lived_floating_window) && !is_modal)
6377  viewport_flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoTaskBarIcon;
6378  if (g.IO.ConfigViewportsNoDecoration || is_short_lived_floating_window)
6379  viewport_flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration;
6380 
6381  // Not correct to set modal as topmost because:
6382  // - Because other popups can be stacked above a modal (e.g. combo box in a modal)
6383  // - ImGuiViewportFlags_TopMost is currently handled different in backends: in Win32 it is "appear top most" whereas in GLFW and SDL it is "stay topmost"
6384  //if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
6385  // viewport_flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_TopMost;
6386 
6387  // For popups and menus that may be protruding out of their parent viewport, we enable _NoFocusOnClick so that clicking on them
6388  // won't steal the OS focus away from their parent window (which may be reflected in OS the title bar decoration).
6389  // Setting _NoFocusOnClick would technically prevent us from bringing back to front in case they are being covered by an OS window from a different app,
6390  // but it shouldn't be much of a problem considering those are already popups that are closed when clicking elsewhere.
6391  if (is_short_lived_floating_window && !is_modal)
6392  viewport_flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing | ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnClick;
6393 
6394  // We can overwrite viewport flags using ImGuiWindowClass (advanced users)
6395  // We don't default to the main viewport because.
6396  if (window->WindowClass.ParentViewportId)
6397  window->Viewport->ParentViewportId = window->WindowClass.ParentViewportId;
6398  else if ((flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) && parent_window_in_stack)
6399  window->Viewport->ParentViewportId = parent_window_in_stack->Viewport->ID;
6400  else
6401  window->Viewport->ParentViewportId = g.IO.ConfigViewportsNoDefaultParent ? 0 : IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID;
6402  if (window->WindowClass.ViewportFlagsOverrideSet)
6403  viewport_flags |= window->WindowClass.ViewportFlagsOverrideSet;
6404  if (window->WindowClass.ViewportFlagsOverrideClear)
6405  viewport_flags &= ~window->WindowClass.ViewportFlagsOverrideClear;
6406 
6407  // We can also tell the backend that clearing the platform window won't be necessary,
6408  // as our window background is filling the viewport and we have disabled BgAlpha.
6409  // FIXME: Work on support for per-viewport transparency (#2766)
6410  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground))
6411  viewport_flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoRendererClear;
6412 
6413  window->Viewport->Flags = viewport_flags;
6414  }
6415 
6416  // Calculate the range of allowed position for that window (to be movable and visible past safe area padding)
6417  // When clamping to stay visible, we will enforce that window->Pos stays inside of visibility_rect.
6418  ImRect viewport_rect(window->Viewport->GetMainRect());
6419  ImRect viewport_work_rect(window->Viewport->GetWorkRect());
6420  ImVec2 visibility_padding = ImMax(style.DisplayWindowPadding, style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding);
6421  ImRect visibility_rect(viewport_work_rect.Min + visibility_padding, viewport_work_rect.Max - visibility_padding);
6422 
6423  // Clamp position/size so window stays visible within its viewport or monitor
6424  // Ignore zero-sized display explicitly to avoid losing positions if a window manager reports zero-sized window when initializing or minimizing.
6425  // FIXME: Similar to code in GetWindowAllowedExtentRect()
6426  if (!window_pos_set_by_api && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0)
6427  {
6428  if (!window->ViewportOwned && viewport_rect.GetWidth() > 0 && viewport_rect.GetHeight() > 0.0f)
6429  {
6430  ClampWindowRect(window, visibility_rect);
6431  }
6432  else if (window->ViewportOwned && g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size > 0)
6433  {
6434  if (window->Viewport->PlatformMonitor == -1)
6435  {
6436  // Fallback for "lost" window (e.g. a monitor disconnected): we move the window back over the main viewport
6437  const ImGuiViewport* main_viewport = GetMainViewport();
6438  SetWindowPos(window, main_viewport->Pos + style.DisplayWindowPadding, ImGuiCond_Always);
6439  }
6440  else
6441  {
6442  ImGuiPlatformMonitor& monitor = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[window->Viewport->PlatformMonitor];
6443  visibility_rect.Min = monitor.WorkPos + visibility_padding;
6444  visibility_rect.Max = monitor.WorkPos + monitor.WorkSize - visibility_padding;
6445  ClampWindowRect(window, visibility_rect);
6446  }
6447  }
6448  }
6449  window->Pos = ImFloor(window->Pos);
6450 
6451  // Lock window rounding for the frame (so that altering them doesn't cause inconsistencies)
6452  // Large values tend to lead to variety of artifacts and are not recommended.
6453  if (window->ViewportOwned || window->DockIsActive)
6454  window->WindowRounding = 0.0f;
6455  else
6456  window->WindowRounding = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? style.ChildRounding : ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)) ? style.PopupRounding : style.WindowRounding;
6457 
6458  // For windows with title bar or menu bar, we clamp to FrameHeight(FontSize + FramePadding.y * 2.0f) to completely hide artifacts.
6459  //if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) || !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
6460  // window->WindowRounding = ImMin(window->WindowRounding, g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
6461 
6462  // Apply window focus (new and reactivated windows are moved to front)
6463  bool want_focus = false;
6464  if (window_just_activated_by_user && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing))
6465  {
6466  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
6467  want_focus = true;
6468  else if ((window->DockIsActive || (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) == 0) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip))
6469  want_focus = true;
6470  }
6471 
6472  // Decide if we are going to handle borders and resize grips
6473  const bool handle_borders_and_resize_grips = (window->DockNodeAsHost || !window->DockIsActive);
6474 
6475  // Handle manual resize: Resize Grips, Borders, Gamepad
6476  int border_held = -1;
6477  ImU32 resize_grip_col[4] = {};
6478  const int resize_grip_count = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? 2 : 1; // Allow resize from lower-left if we have the mouse cursor feedback for it.
6479  const float resize_grip_draw_size = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(g.FontSize * 1.10f, window->WindowRounding + 1.0f + g.FontSize * 0.2f));
6480  if (handle_borders_and_resize_grips && !window->Collapsed)
6481  if (UpdateWindowManualResize(window, size_auto_fit, &border_held, resize_grip_count, &resize_grip_col[0], visibility_rect))
6482  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = true;
6483  window->ResizeBorderHeld = (signed char)border_held;
6484 
6485  // Synchronize window --> viewport again and one last time (clamping and manual resize may have affected either)
6486  if (window->ViewportOwned)
6487  {
6488  if (!window->Viewport->PlatformRequestMove)
6489  window->Viewport->Pos = window->Pos;
6490  if (!window->Viewport->PlatformRequestResize)
6491  window->Viewport->Size = window->Size;
6492  window->Viewport->UpdateWorkRect();
6493  viewport_rect = window->Viewport->GetMainRect();
6494  }
6495 
6496  // Save last known viewport position within the window itself (so it can be saved in .ini file and restored)
6497  window->ViewportPos = window->Viewport->Pos;
6498 
6499  // SCROLLBAR VISIBILITY
6500 
6501  // Update scrollbar visibility (based on the Size that was effective during last frame or the auto-resized Size).
6502  if (!window->Collapsed)
6503  {
6504  // When reading the current size we need to read it after size constraints have been applied.
6505  // When we use InnerRect here we are intentionally reading last frame size, same for ScrollbarSizes values before we set them again.
6506  ImVec2 avail_size_from_current_frame = ImVec2(window->SizeFull.x, window->SizeFull.y - decoration_up_height);
6507  ImVec2 avail_size_from_last_frame = window->InnerRect.GetSize() + window->ScrollbarSizes;
6508  ImVec2 needed_size_from_last_frame = window_just_created ? ImVec2(0, 0) : window->ContentSize + window->WindowPadding * 2.0f;
6509  float size_x_for_scrollbars = use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x ? avail_size_from_current_frame.x : avail_size_from_last_frame.x;
6510  float size_y_for_scrollbars = use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y ? avail_size_from_current_frame.y : avail_size_from_last_frame.y;
6511  //bool scrollbar_y_from_last_frame = window->ScrollbarY; // FIXME: May want to use that in the ScrollbarX expression? How many pros vs cons?
6512  window->ScrollbarY = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar) || ((needed_size_from_last_frame.y > size_y_for_scrollbars) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar));
6513  window->ScrollbarX = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar) || ((needed_size_from_last_frame.x > size_x_for_scrollbars - (window->ScrollbarY ? style.ScrollbarSize : 0.0f)) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar) && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar));
6514  if (window->ScrollbarX && !window->ScrollbarY)
6515  window->ScrollbarY = (needed_size_from_last_frame.y > size_y_for_scrollbars) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar);
6516  window->ScrollbarSizes = ImVec2(window->ScrollbarY ? style.ScrollbarSize : 0.0f, window->ScrollbarX ? style.ScrollbarSize : 0.0f);
6517  }
6518 
6519  // UPDATE RECTANGLES (1- THOSE NOT AFFECTED BY SCROLLING)
6520  // Update various regions. Variables they depends on should be set above in this function.
6521  // We set this up after processing the resize grip so that our rectangles doesn't lag by a frame.
6522 
6523  // Outer rectangle
6524  // Not affected by window border size. Used by:
6525  // - FindHoveredWindow() (w/ extra padding when border resize is enabled)
6526  // - Begin() initial clipping rect for drawing window background and borders.
6527  // - Begin() clipping whole child
6528  const ImRect host_rect = ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !window_is_child_tooltip) ? parent_window->ClipRect : viewport_rect;
6529  const ImRect outer_rect = window->Rect();
6530  const ImRect title_bar_rect = window->TitleBarRect();
6531  window->OuterRectClipped = outer_rect;
6532  if (window->DockIsActive)
6533  window->OuterRectClipped.Min.y += window->TitleBarHeight();
6534  window->OuterRectClipped.ClipWith(host_rect);
6535 
6536  // Inner rectangle
6537  // Not affected by window border size. Used by:
6538  // - InnerClipRect
6539  // - ScrollToBringRectIntoView()
6540  // - NavUpdatePageUpPageDown()
6541  // - Scrollbar()
6542  window->InnerRect.Min.x = window->Pos.x;
6543  window->InnerRect.Min.y = window->Pos.y + decoration_up_height;
6544  window->InnerRect.Max.x = window->Pos.x + window->Size.x - window->ScrollbarSizes.x;
6545  window->InnerRect.Max.y = window->Pos.y + window->Size.y - window->ScrollbarSizes.y;
6546 
6547  // Inner clipping rectangle.
6548  // Will extend a little bit outside the normal work region.
6549  // This is to allow e.g. Selectable or CollapsingHeader or some separators to cover that space.
6550  // Force round operator last to ensure that e.g. (int)(max.x-min.x) in user's render code produce correct result.
6551  // Note that if our window is collapsed we will end up with an inverted (~null) clipping rectangle which is the correct behavior.
6552  // Affected by window/frame border size. Used by:
6553  // - Begin() initial clip rect
6554  float top_border_size = (((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) || !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar)) ? style.FrameBorderSize : window->WindowBorderSize);
6555  window->InnerClipRect.Min.x = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Min.x + ImMax(ImFloor(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f), window->WindowBorderSize));
6556  window->InnerClipRect.Min.y = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Min.y + top_border_size);
6557  window->InnerClipRect.Max.x = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Max.x - ImMax(ImFloor(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f), window->WindowBorderSize));
6558  window->InnerClipRect.Max.y = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Max.y - window->WindowBorderSize);
6559  window->InnerClipRect.ClipWithFull(host_rect);
6560 
6561  // Default item width. Make it proportional to window size if window manually resizes
6562  if (window->Size.x > 0.0f && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
6563  window->ItemWidthDefault = ImFloor(window->Size.x * 0.65f);
6564  else
6565  window->ItemWidthDefault = ImFloor(g.FontSize * 16.0f);
6566 
6567  // SCROLLING
6568 
6569  // Lock down maximum scrolling
6570  // The value of ScrollMax are ahead from ScrollbarX/ScrollbarY which is intentionally using InnerRect from previous rect in order to accommodate
6571  // for right/bottom aligned items without creating a scrollbar.
6572  window->ScrollMax.x = ImMax(0.0f, window->ContentSize.x + window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f - window->InnerRect.GetWidth());
6573  window->ScrollMax.y = ImMax(0.0f, window->ContentSize.y + window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f - window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
6574 
6575  // Apply scrolling
6576  window->Scroll = CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(window);
6577  window->ScrollTarget = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
6578 
6579  // DRAWING
6580 
6581  // Setup draw list and outer clipping rectangle
6582  IM_ASSERT(window->DrawList->CmdBuffer.Size == 1 && window->DrawList->CmdBuffer[0].ElemCount == 0);
6583  window->DrawList->PushTextureID(g.Font->ContainerAtlas->TexID);
6584  PushClipRect(host_rect.Min, host_rect.Max, false);
6585 
6586  // Draw modal or window list full viewport dimming background (for other viewports we'll render them in EndFrame)
6587  ImGuiWindow* window_window_list = g.NavWindowingListWindow;
6588  const bool dim_bg_for_modal = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) && window == GetTopMostPopupModal() && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems <= 0;
6589  const bool dim_bg_for_window_list = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim && ((window == g.NavWindowingTargetAnim->RootWindow) || (window == window_window_list && window_window_list->Viewport != g.NavWindowingTargetAnim->Viewport));
6590  if (dim_bg_for_modal || dim_bg_for_window_list)
6591  {
6592  const ImU32 dim_bg_col = GetColorU32(dim_bg_for_modal ? ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg : ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg, g.DimBgRatio);
6593  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(viewport_rect.Min, viewport_rect.Max, dim_bg_col);
6594  }
6595 
6596  // Draw navigation selection/windowing rectangle background
6597  if (dim_bg_for_window_list && window == g.NavWindowingTargetAnim)
6598  {
6599  ImRect bb = window->Rect();
6600  bb.Expand(g.FontSize);
6601  if (!bb.Contains(viewport_rect)) // Avoid drawing if the window covers all the viewport anyway
6602  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha * 0.25f), g.Style.WindowRounding);
6603  }
6604 
6605  // Since 1.71, child window can render their decoration (bg color, border, scrollbars, etc.) within their parent to save a draw call.
6606  // When using overlapping child windows, this will break the assumption that child z-order is mapped to submission order.
6607  // We disable this when the parent window has zero vertices, which is a common pattern leading to laying out multiple overlapping child.
6608  // We also disabled this when we have dimming overlay behind this specific one child.
6609  // FIXME: More code may rely on explicit sorting of overlapping child window and would need to disable this somehow. Please get in contact if you are affected.
6610  const bool is_undocked_or_docked_visible = !window->DockIsActive || window->DockTabIsVisible;
6611  if (is_undocked_or_docked_visible)
6612  {
6613  bool render_decorations_in_parent = false;
6614  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !window_is_child_tooltip)
6615  if (window->DrawList->CmdBuffer.back().ElemCount == 0 && parent_window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.Size > 0)
6616  render_decorations_in_parent = true;
6617  if (render_decorations_in_parent)
6618  window->DrawList = parent_window->DrawList;
6619 
6620  // Handle title bar, scrollbar, resize grips and resize borders
6621  const ImGuiWindow* window_to_highlight = g.NavWindowingTarget ? g.NavWindowingTarget : g.NavWindow;
6622  const bool title_bar_is_highlight = want_focus || (window_to_highlight && (window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight == window_to_highlight->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight || (window->DockNode && window->DockNode == window_to_highlight->DockNode)));
6623  RenderWindowDecorations(window, title_bar_rect, title_bar_is_highlight, handle_borders_and_resize_grips, resize_grip_count, resize_grip_col, resize_grip_draw_size);
6624 
6625  if (render_decorations_in_parent)
6626  window->DrawList = &window->DrawListInst;
6627  }
6628 
6629  // Draw navigation selection/windowing rectangle border
6630  if (g.NavWindowingTargetAnim == window)
6631  {
6632  float rounding = ImMax(window->WindowRounding, g.Style.WindowRounding);
6633  ImRect bb = window->Rect();
6634  bb.Expand(g.FontSize);
6635  if (bb.Contains(viewport_rect)) // If a window fits the entire viewport, adjust its highlight inward
6636  {
6637  bb.Expand(-g.FontSize - 1.0f);
6638  rounding = window->WindowRounding;
6639  }
6640  window->DrawList->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha), rounding, ~0, 3.0f);
6641  }
6642
