6643  // UPDATE RECTANGLES (2- THOSE AFFECTED BY SCROLLING)
6644 
6645  // Work rectangle.
6646  // Affected by window padding and border size. Used by:
6647  // - Columns() for right-most edge
6648  // - TreeNode(), CollapsingHeader() for right-most edge
6649  // - BeginTabBar() for right-most edge
6650  const bool allow_scrollbar_x = !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar) && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
6651  const bool allow_scrollbar_y = !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar);
6652  const float work_rect_size_x = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : ImMax(allow_scrollbar_x ? window->ContentSize.x : 0.0f, window->Size.x - window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f - window->ScrollbarSizes.x));
6653  const float work_rect_size_y = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : ImMax(allow_scrollbar_y ? window->ContentSize.y : 0.0f, window->Size.y - window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f - decoration_up_height - window->ScrollbarSizes.y));
6654  window->WorkRect.Min.x = ImFloor(window->InnerRect.Min.x - window->Scroll.x + ImMax(window->WindowPadding.x, window->WindowBorderSize));
6655  window->WorkRect.Min.y = ImFloor(window->InnerRect.Min.y - window->Scroll.y + ImMax(window->WindowPadding.y, window->WindowBorderSize));
6656  window->WorkRect.Max.x = window->WorkRect.Min.x + work_rect_size_x;
6657  window->WorkRect.Max.y = window->WorkRect.Min.y + work_rect_size_y;
6658  window->ParentWorkRect = window->WorkRect;
6659 
6660  // [LEGACY] Content Region
6661  // FIXME-OBSOLETE: window->ContentRegionRect.Max is currently very misleading / partly faulty, but some BeginChild() patterns relies on it.
6662  // Used by:
6663  // - Mouse wheel scrolling + many other things
6664  window->ContentRegionRect.Min.x = window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x + window->WindowPadding.x;
6665  window->ContentRegionRect.Min.y = window->Pos.y - window->Scroll.y + window->WindowPadding.y + decoration_up_height;
6666  window->ContentRegionRect.Max.x = window->ContentRegionRect.Min.x + (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : (window->Size.x - window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f - window->ScrollbarSizes.x));
6667  window->ContentRegionRect.Max.y = window->ContentRegionRect.Min.y + (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : (window->Size.y - window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f - decoration_up_height - window->ScrollbarSizes.y));
6668 
6669  // Setup drawing context
6670  // (NB: That term "drawing context / DC" lost its meaning a long time ago. Initially was meant to hold transient data only. Nowadays difference between window-> and window->DC-> is dubious.)
6671  window->DC.Indent.x = 0.0f + window->WindowPadding.x - window->Scroll.x;
6672  window->DC.GroupOffset.x = 0.0f;
6673  window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x = 0.0f;
6674  window->DC.CursorStartPos = window->Pos + ImVec2(window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x, decoration_up_height + window->WindowPadding.y - window->Scroll.y);
6675  window->DC.CursorPos = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
6676  window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine = window->DC.CursorPos;
6677  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
6678  window->DC.IdealMaxPos = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
6679  window->DC.CurrLineSize = window->DC.PrevLineSize = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
6680  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset = 0.0f;
6681 
6682  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
6683  window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask = window->DC.NavLayerActiveMaskNext;
6684  window->DC.NavLayerActiveMaskNext = 0x00;
6685  window->DC.NavHideHighlightOneFrame = false;
6686  window->DC.NavHasScroll = (window->ScrollMax.y > 0.0f);
6687 
6688  window->DC.MenuBarAppending = false;
6689  window->DC.MenuColumns.Update(3, style.ItemSpacing.x, window_just_activated_by_user);
6690  window->DC.TreeDepth = 0;
6691  window->DC.TreeJumpToParentOnPopMask = 0x00;
6692  window->DC.ChildWindows.resize(0);
6693  window->DC.StateStorage = &window->StateStorage;
6694  window->DC.CurrentColumns = NULL;
6695  window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical;
6696  window->DC.ParentLayoutType = parent_window ? parent_window->DC.LayoutType : ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical;
6697  window->DC.FocusCounterRegular = window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop = -1;
6698 
6699  window->DC.ItemWidth = window->ItemWidthDefault;
6700  window->DC.TextWrapPos = -1.0f; // disabled
6701  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.resize(0);
6702  window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.resize(0);
6703 
6704  if (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0)
6705  window->AutoFitFramesX--;
6706  if (window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
6707  window->AutoFitFramesY--;
6708 
6709  // Apply focus (we need to call FocusWindow() AFTER setting DC.CursorStartPos so our initial navigation reference rectangle can start around there)
6710  if (want_focus)
6711  {
6712  FocusWindow(window);
6713  NavInitWindow(window, false);
6714  }
6715 
6716  // Close requested by platform window
6717  if (p_open != NULL && window->Viewport->PlatformRequestClose && window->Viewport != GetMainViewport())
6718  {
6719  if (!window->DockIsActive || window->DockTabIsVisible)
6720  {
6721  window->Viewport->PlatformRequestClose = false;
6722  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false; // Assume user mapped PlatformRequestClose on ALT-F4 so we disable ALT for menu toggle. False positive not an issue.
6723  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT("Window '%s' PlatformRequestClose\n", window->Name);
6724  *p_open = false;
6725  }
6726  }
6727 
6728  // Title bar
6729  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) && !window->DockIsActive)
6730  RenderWindowTitleBarContents(window, ImRect(title_bar_rect.Min.x + window->WindowBorderSize, title_bar_rect.Min.y, title_bar_rect.Max.x - window->WindowBorderSize, title_bar_rect.Max.y), name, p_open);
6731 
6732  // Clear hit test shape every frame
6733  window->HitTestHoleSize.x = window->HitTestHoleSize.y = 0;
6734 
6735  // Pressing CTRL+C while holding on a window copy its content to the clipboard
6736  // This works but 1. doesn't handle multiple Begin/End pairs, 2. recursing into another Begin/End pair - so we need to work that out and add better logging scope.
6737  // Maybe we can support CTRL+C on every element?
6738  /*
6739  //if (g.NavWindow == window && g.ActiveId == 0)
6740  if (g.ActiveId == window->MoveId)
6741  if (g.IO.KeyCtrl && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_C))
6742  LogToClipboard();
6743  */
6744 
6745  if (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable)
6746  {
6747  // Docking: Dragging a dockable window (or any of its child) turns it into a drag and drop source.
6748  // We need to do this _before_ we overwrite window->DC.LastItemId below because BeginDockableDragDropSource() also overwrites it.
6749  if ((g.MovingWindow == window) && (g.IO.ConfigDockingWithShift == g.IO.KeyShift))
6750  if ((window->RootWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking) == 0)
6751  BeginDockableDragDropSource(window);
6752 
6753  // Docking: Any dockable window can act as a target. For dock node hosts we call BeginDockableDragDropTarget() in DockNodeUpdate() instead.
6754  if (g.DragDropActive && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking))
6755  if (g.MovingWindow == NULL || g.MovingWindow->RootWindow != window)
6756  if ((window == window->RootWindow) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost))
6757  BeginDockableDragDropTarget(window);
6758  }
6759 
6760  // We fill last item data based on Title Bar/Tab, in order for IsItemHovered() and IsItemActive() to be usable after Begin().
6761  // This is useful to allow creating context menus on title bar only, etc.
6762  if (window->DockIsActive)
6763  SetLastItemData(window, window->ID, window->DockTabItemStatusFlags, window->DockTabItemRect);
6764  else
6765  SetLastItemData(window, window->MoveId, IsMouseHoveringRect(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, false) ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect : 0, title_bar_rect);
6766 
6767 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
6768  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
6769  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_ADD(window->DC.LastItemRect, window->DC.LastItemId);
6770 #endif
6771  }
6772  else
6773  {
6774  // Append
6775  SetCurrentViewport(window, window->Viewport);
6776  SetCurrentWindow(window);
6777  }
6778 
6779  // Pull/inherit current state
6780  window->DC.ItemFlags = g.ItemFlagsStack.back(); // Inherit from shared stack
6781  window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? parent_window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent : 0; // Inherit from parent only // -V595
6782 
6783  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost))
6784  PushClipRect(window->InnerClipRect.Min, window->InnerClipRect.Max, true);
6785 
6786  // Clear 'accessed' flag last thing (After PushClipRect which will set the flag. We want the flag to stay false when the default "Debug" window is unused)
6787  window->WriteAccessed = false;
6788  window->BeginCount++;
6789  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags();
6790 
6791  // Update visibility
6792  if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
6793  {
6794  // When we are about to select this tab (which will only be visible on the _next frame_), flag it with a non-zero HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems.
6795  // This will have the important effect of actually returning true in Begin() and not setting SkipItems, allowing an earlier submission of the window contents.
6796  // This is analogous to regular windows being hidden from one frame.
6797  // It is especially important as e.g. nested TabBars would otherwise generate flicker in the form of one empty frame, or focus requests won't be processed.
6798  if (window->DockIsActive && !window->DockTabIsVisible)
6799  {
6800  if (window->LastFrameJustFocused == g.FrameCount)
6801  window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
6802  else
6803  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
6804  }
6805 
6806  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
6807  {
6808  // Child window can be out of sight and have "negative" clip windows.
6809  // Mark them as collapsed so commands are skipped earlier (we can't manually collapse them because they have no title bar).
6810  IM_ASSERT((flags& ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) != 0 || (window->DockIsActive));
6811  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) && window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0) // FIXME: Doesn't make sense for ChildWindow??
6812  if (!g.LogEnabled)
6813  if (window->OuterRectClipped.Min.x >= window->OuterRectClipped.Max.x || window->OuterRectClipped.Min.y >= window->OuterRectClipped.Max.y)
6814  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
6815 
6816  // Hide along with parent or if parent is collapsed
6817  if (parent_window && (parent_window->Collapsed || parent_window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0))
6818  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
6819  if (parent_window && (parent_window->Collapsed || parent_window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0))
6820  window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
6821  }
6822 
6823  // Don't render if style alpha is 0.0 at the time of Begin(). This is arbitrary and inconsistent but has been there for a long while (may remove at some point)
6824  if (style.Alpha <= 0.0f)
6825  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
6826 
6827  // Update the Hidden flag
6828  window->Hidden = (window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0) || (window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0) || (window->HiddenFramesForRenderOnly > 0);
6829 
6830  // Disable inputs for requested number of frames
6831  if (window->DisableInputsFrames > 0)
6832  {
6833  window->DisableInputsFrames--;
6834  window->Flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs;
6835  }
6836 
6837  // Update the SkipItems flag, used to early out of all items functions (no layout required)
6838  bool skip_items = false;
6839  if (window->Collapsed || !window->Active || window->Hidden)
6840  if (window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0 && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems <= 0)
6841  skip_items = true;
6842  window->SkipItems = skip_items;
6843  }
6844 
6845  return !window->SkipItems;
6846 }
6847 
6848 void ImGui::End()
6849 {
6850  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6851  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
6852 
6853  // Error checking: verify that user hasn't called End() too many times!
6854  if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size <= 1 && g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow)
6855  {
6856  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 1, "Calling End() too many times!");
6857  return;
6858  }
6859  IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 0);
6860 
6861  // Error checking: verify that user doesn't directly call End() on a child window.
6862  if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost) && !window->DockIsActive)
6863  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.WithinEndChild, "Must call EndChild() and not End()!");
6864 
6865  // Close anything that is open
6866  if (window->DC.CurrentColumns)
6867  EndColumns();
6868  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost)) // Pop inner window clip rectangle
6869  PopClipRect();
6870 
6871  // Stop logging
6872  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)) // FIXME: add more options for scope of logging
6873  LogFinish();
6874 
6875  // Docking: report contents sizes to parent to allow for auto-resize
6876  if (window->DockNode && window->DockTabIsVisible)
6877  if (ImGuiWindow* host_window = window->DockNode->HostWindow) // FIXME-DOCK
6878  host_window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos + window->WindowPadding - host_window->WindowPadding;
6879 
6880  // Pop from window stack
6881  g.CurrentWindowStack.pop_back();
6882  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
6883  g.BeginPopupStack.pop_back();
6884  window->DC.StackSizesOnBegin.CompareWithCurrentState();
6885  SetCurrentWindow(g.CurrentWindowStack.empty() ? NULL : g.CurrentWindowStack.back());
6886  if (g.CurrentWindow)
6887  SetCurrentViewport(g.CurrentWindow, g.CurrentWindow->Viewport);
6888 }
6889 
6890 void ImGui::BringWindowToFocusFront(ImGuiWindow* window)
6891 {
6892  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6893  if (g.WindowsFocusOrder.back() == window)
6894  return;
6895  for (int i = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 2; i >= 0; i--) // We can ignore the top-most window
6896  if (g.WindowsFocusOrder[i] == window)
6897  {
6898  memmove(&g.WindowsFocusOrder[i], &g.WindowsFocusOrder[i + 1], (size_t)(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - i - 1) * sizeof(ImGuiWindow*));
6899  g.WindowsFocusOrder[g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1] = window;
6900  break;
6901  }
6902 }
6903 
6904 void ImGui::BringWindowToDisplayFront(ImGuiWindow* window)
6905 {
6906  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6907  ImGuiWindow* current_front_window = g.Windows.back();
6908  if (current_front_window == window || current_front_window->RootWindow == window) // Cheap early out (could be better)
6909  return;
6910  for (int i = g.Windows.Size - 2; i >= 0; i--) // We can ignore the top-most window
6911  if (g.Windows[i] == window)
6912  {
6913  memmove(&g.Windows[i], &g.Windows[i + 1], (size_t)(g.Windows.Size - i - 1) * sizeof(ImGuiWindow*));
6914  g.Windows[g.Windows.Size - 1] = window;
6915  break;
6916  }
6917 }
6918 
6919 void ImGui::BringWindowToDisplayBack(ImGuiWindow* window)
6920 {
6921  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6922  if (g.Windows[0] == window)
6923  return;
6924  for (int i = 0; i < g.Windows.Size; i++)
6925  if (g.Windows[i] == window)
6926  {
6927  memmove(&g.Windows[1], &g.Windows[0], (size_t)i * sizeof(ImGuiWindow*));
6928  g.Windows[0] = window;
6929  break;
6930  }
6931 }
6932 
6933 // Moving window to front of display and set focus (which happens to be back of our sorted list)
6934 void ImGui::FocusWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
6935 {
6936  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6937 
6938  if (g.NavWindow != window)
6939  {
6940  g.NavWindow = window;
6941  if (window && g.NavDisableMouseHover)
6942  g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
6943  g.NavInitRequest = false;
6944  g.NavId = window ? window->NavLastIds[0] : 0; // Restore NavId
6945  g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
6946  g.NavIdIsAlive = false;
6947  g.NavLayer = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
6948  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("FocusWindow(\"%s\")\n", window ? window->Name : NULL);
6949  }
6950 
6951  // Close popups if any
6952  ClosePopupsOverWindow(window, false);
6953 
6954  // Move the root window to the top of the pile
6955  IM_ASSERT(window == NULL || window->RootWindow != NULL);
6956  ImGuiWindow* focus_front_window = window ? window->RootWindowDockStop : NULL;
6957  ImGuiWindow* display_front_window = window ? window->RootWindow : NULL;
6958  ImGuiDockNode* dock_node = window ? window->DockNode : NULL;
6959  bool active_id_window_is_dock_node_host = (g.ActiveIdWindow && dock_node && dock_node->HostWindow == g.ActiveIdWindow);
6960 
6961  // Steal active widgets. Some of the cases it triggers includes:
6962  // - Focus a window while an InputText in another window is active, if focus happens before the old InputText can run.
6963  // - When using Nav to activate menu items (due to timing of activating on press->new window appears->losing ActiveId)
6964  // - Using dock host items (tab, collapse button) can trigger this before we redirect the ActiveIdWindow toward the child window.
6965  if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveIdWindow && g.ActiveIdWindow->RootWindowDockStop != focus_front_window)
6966  if (!g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss && !active_id_window_is_dock_node_host)
6967  ClearActiveID();
6968 
6969  // Passing NULL allow to disable keyboard focus
6970  if (!window)
6971  return;
6972  window->LastFrameJustFocused = g.FrameCount;
6973 
6974  // Select in dock node
6975  if (dock_node && dock_node->TabBar)
6976  dock_node->TabBar->SelectedTabId = dock_node->TabBar->NextSelectedTabId = window->ID;
6977 
6978  // Bring to front
6979  BringWindowToFocusFront(focus_front_window);
6980  if (((window->Flags | focus_front_window->Flags | display_front_window->Flags) & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus) == 0)
6981  BringWindowToDisplayFront(display_front_window);
6982 }
6983 
6984 void ImGui::FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(ImGuiWindow* under_this_window, ImGuiWindow* ignore_window)
6985 {
6986  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
6987 
6988  int start_idx = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1;
6989  if (under_this_window != NULL)
6990  {
6991  int under_this_window_idx = FindWindowFocusIndex(under_this_window);
6992  if (under_this_window_idx != -1)
6993  start_idx = under_this_window_idx - 1;
6994  }
6995  for (int i = start_idx; i >= 0; i--)
6996  {
6997  // We may later decide to test for different NoXXXInputs based on the active navigation input (mouse vs nav) but that may feel more confusing to the user.
6998  ImGuiWindow* window = g.WindowsFocusOrder[i];
6999  if (window != ignore_window && window->WasActive && window->RootWindowDockStop == window)
7000  if ((window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs)) != (ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
7001  {
7002  // FIXME-DOCK: This is failing (lagging by one frame) for docked windows.
7003  // If A and B are docked into window and B disappear, at the NewFrame() call site window->NavLastChildNavWindow will still point to B.
7004  // We might leverage the tab order implicitly stored in window->DockNodeAsHost->TabBar (essentially the 'most_recently_selected_tab' code in tab bar will do that but on next update)
7005  // to tell which is the "previous" window. Or we may leverage 'LastFrameFocused/LastFrameJustFocused' and have this function handle child window itself?
7006  ImGuiWindow* focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(window);
7007  FocusWindow(focus_window);
7008  return;
7009  }
7010  }
7011  FocusWindow(NULL);
7012 }
7013 
7014 void ImGui::SetCurrentFont(ImFont* font)
7015 {
7016  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7017  IM_ASSERT(font && font->IsLoaded()); // Font Atlas not created. Did you call io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsRGBA32 / GetTexDataAsAlpha8 ?
7018  IM_ASSERT(font->Scale > 0.0f);
7019  g.Font = font;
7020  g.FontBaseSize = ImMax(1.0f, g.IO.FontGlobalScale * g.Font->FontSize * g.Font->Scale);
7021  g.FontSize = g.CurrentWindow ? g.CurrentWindow->CalcFontSize() : 0.0f;
7022 
7023  ImFontAtlas* atlas = g.Font->ContainerAtlas;
7024  g.DrawListSharedData.TexUvWhitePixel = atlas->TexUvWhitePixel;
7025  g.DrawListSharedData.TexUvLines = atlas->TexUvLines;
7026  g.DrawListSharedData.Font = g.Font;
7027  g.DrawListSharedData.FontSize = g.FontSize;
7028 }
7029 
7030 void ImGui::PushFont(ImFont* font)
7031 {
7032  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7033  if (!font)
7034  font = GetDefaultFont();
7035  SetCurrentFont(font);
7036  g.FontStack.push_back(font);
7037  g.CurrentWindow->DrawList->PushTextureID(font->ContainerAtlas->TexID);
7038 }
7039 
7040 void ImGui::PopFont()
7041 {
7042  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7043  g.CurrentWindow->DrawList->PopTextureID();
7044  g.FontStack.pop_back();
7045  SetCurrentFont(g.FontStack.empty() ? GetDefaultFont() : g.FontStack.back());
7046 }
7047 
7048 void ImGui::PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags option, bool enabled)
7049 {
7050  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7051  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7052  ImGuiItemFlags item_flags = window->DC.ItemFlags;
7053  IM_ASSERT(item_flags == g.ItemFlagsStack.back());
7054  if (enabled)
7055  item_flags |= option;
7056  else
7057  item_flags &= ~option;
7058  window->DC.ItemFlags = item_flags;
7059  g.ItemFlagsStack.push_back(item_flags);
7060 }
7061 
7062 void ImGui::PopItemFlag()
7063 {
7064  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7065  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7066  IM_ASSERT(g.ItemFlagsStack.Size > 1); // Too many calls to PopItemFlag() - we always leave a 0 at the bottom of the stack.
7067  g.ItemFlagsStack.pop_back();
7068  window->DC.ItemFlags = g.ItemFlagsStack.back();
7069 }
7070 
7071 // FIXME: Look into renaming this once we have settled the new Focus/Activation/TabStop system.
7072 void ImGui::PushAllowKeyboardFocus(bool allow_keyboard_focus)
7073 {
7074  PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop, !allow_keyboard_focus);
7075 }
7076 
7077 void ImGui::PopAllowKeyboardFocus()
7078 {
7079  PopItemFlag();
7080 }
7081 
7082 void ImGui::PushButtonRepeat(bool repeat)
7083 {
7084  PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_ButtonRepeat, repeat);
7085 }
7086 
7087 void ImGui::PopButtonRepeat()
7088 {
7089  PopItemFlag();
7090 }
7091 
7092 void ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(float wrap_pos_x)
7093 {
7094  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7095  window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.push_back(window->DC.TextWrapPos);
7096  window->DC.TextWrapPos = wrap_pos_x;
7097 }
7098 
7099 void ImGui::PopTextWrapPos()
7100 {
7101  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
7102  window->DC.TextWrapPos = window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.back();
7103  window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.pop_back();
7104 }
7105 
7106 bool ImGui::IsWindowChildOf(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiWindow* potential_parent)
7107 {
7108  if (window->RootWindow == potential_parent)
7109  return true;
7110  while (window != NULL)
7111  {
7112  if (window == potential_parent)
7113  return true;
7114  window = window->ParentWindow;
7115  }
7116  return false;
7117 }
7118 
7119 bool ImGui::IsWindowAbove(ImGuiWindow* potential_above, ImGuiWindow* potential_below)
7120 {
7121  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7122  for (int i = g.Windows.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
7123  {
7124  ImGuiWindow* candidate_window = g.Windows[i];
7125  if (candidate_window == potential_above)
7126  return true;
7127  if (candidate_window == potential_below)
7128  return false;
7129  }
7130  return false;
7131 }
7132 
7133 bool ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
7134 {
7135  IM_ASSERT((flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped) == 0); // Flags not supported by this function
7136  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7137 
7138  if (flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow)
7139  {
7140  if (g.HoveredWindow == NULL)
7141  return false;
7142  }
7143  else
7144  {
7145  switch (flags & (ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows))
7146  {
7147  case ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows:
7148  if (g.HoveredWindow == NULL || g.HoveredWindow->RootWindowDockStop != g.CurrentWindow->RootWindowDockStop)
7149  return false;
7150  break;
7151  case ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow:
7152  if (g.HoveredWindow != g.CurrentWindow->RootWindowDockStop)
7153  return false;
7154  break;
7155  case ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows:
7156  if (g.HoveredWindow == NULL || !IsWindowChildOf(g.HoveredWindow, g.CurrentWindow))
7157  return false;
7158  break;
7159  default:
7160  if (g.HoveredWindow != g.CurrentWindow)
7161  return false;
7162  break;
7163  }
7164  }
7165 
7166  if (!IsWindowContentHoverable(g.HoveredWindow, flags))
7167  return false;
7168  if (!(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem))
7169  if (g.ActiveId != 0 && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap && g.ActiveId != g.HoveredWindow->MoveId)
7170  return false;
7171  return true;
7172 }
7173 
7174 bool ImGui::IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags flags)
7175 {
7176  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7177 
7178  if (flags & ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow)
7179  return g.NavWindow != NULL;
7180 
7181  IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow); // Not inside a Begin()/End()
7182  switch (flags & (ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows))
7183  {
7184  case ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows:
7185  return g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->RootWindowDockStop == g.CurrentWindow->RootWindowDockStop;
7186  case ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow:
7187  return g.NavWindow == g.CurrentWindow->RootWindowDockStop;
7188  case ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows:
7189  return g.NavWindow && IsWindowChildOf(g.NavWindow, g.CurrentWindow);
7190  default:
7191  return g.NavWindow == g.CurrentWindow;
7192  }
7193 }
7194 
7195 ImGuiID ImGui::GetWindowDockID()
7196 {
7197  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7198  return g.CurrentWindow->DockId;
7199 }
7200 
7201 bool ImGui::IsWindowDocked()
7202 {
7203  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7204  return g.CurrentWindow->DockIsActive;
7205 }
7206 
7207 // Can we focus this window with CTRL+TAB (or PadMenu + PadFocusPrev/PadFocusNext)
7208 // Note that NoNavFocus makes the window not reachable with CTRL+TAB but it can still be focused with mouse or programmatically.
7209 // If you want a window to never be focused, you may use the e.g. NoInputs flag.
7210 bool ImGui::IsWindowNavFocusable(ImGuiWindow* window)
7211 {
7212  return window->WasActive && window == window->RootWindowDockStop && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus);
7213 }
7214 
7215 float ImGui::GetWindowWidth()
7216 {
7217  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7218  return window->Size.x;
7219 }
7220 
7221 float ImGui::GetWindowHeight()
7222 {
7223  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7224  return window->Size.y;
7225 }
7226 
7227 ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowPos()
7228 {
7229  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7230  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7231  return window->Pos;
7232 }
7233 
7234 void ImGui::SetWindowPos(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond)
7235 {
7236  // Test condition (NB: bit 0 is always true) and clear flags for next time
7237  if (cond && (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & cond) == 0)
7238  return;
7239 
7240  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
7241  window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
7242  window->SetWindowPosVal = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
7243 
7244  // Set
7245  const ImVec2 old_pos = window->Pos;
7246  window->Pos = ImFloor(pos);
7247  ImVec2 offset = window->Pos - old_pos;
7248  window->DC.CursorPos += offset; // As we happen to move the window while it is being appended to (which is a bad idea - will smear) let's at least offset the cursor
7249  window->DC.CursorMaxPos += offset; // And more importantly we need to offset CursorMaxPos/CursorStartPos this so ContentSize calculation doesn't get affected.
7250  window->DC.IdealMaxPos += offset;
7251  window->DC.CursorStartPos += offset;
7252 }
7253 
7254 void ImGui::SetWindowPos(const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond)
7255 {
7256  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7257  SetWindowPos(window, pos, cond);
7258 }
7259 
7260 void ImGui::SetWindowPos(const char* name, const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond)
7261 {
7262  if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name))
7263  SetWindowPos(window, pos, cond);
7264 }
7265 
7266 ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowSize()
7267 {
7268  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7269  return window->Size;
7270 }
7271 
7272 void ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond)
7273 {
7274  // Test condition (NB: bit 0 is always true) and clear flags for next time
7275  if (cond && (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & cond) == 0)
7276  return;
7277 
7278  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
7279  window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
7280 
7281  // Set
7282  if (size.x > 0.0f)
7283  {
7284  window->AutoFitFramesX = 0;
7285  window->SizeFull.x = IM_FLOOR(size.x);
7286  }
7287  else
7288  {
7289  window->AutoFitFramesX = 2;
7290  window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = false;
7291  }
7292  if (size.y > 0.0f)
7293  {
7294  window->AutoFitFramesY = 0;
7295  window->SizeFull.y = IM_FLOOR(size.y);
7296  }
7297  else
7298  {
7299  window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
7300  window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = false;
7301  }
7302 }
7303 
7304 void ImGui::SetWindowSize(const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond)
7305 {
7306  SetWindowSize(GImGui->CurrentWindow, size, cond);
7307 }
7308 
7309 void ImGui::SetWindowSize(const char* name, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond)
7310 {
7311  if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name))
7312  SetWindowSize(window, size, cond);
7313 }
7314 
7315 void ImGui::SetWindowCollapsed(ImGuiWindow* window, bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond)
7316 {
7317  // Test condition (NB: bit 0 is always true) and clear flags for next time
7318  if (cond && (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags & cond) == 0)
7319  return;
7320  window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
7321 
7322  // Set
7323  window->Collapsed = collapsed;
7324 }
7325 
7326 void ImGui::SetWindowHitTestHole(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImVec2& pos, const ImVec2& size)
7327 {
7328  IM_ASSERT(window->HitTestHoleSize.x == 0); // We don't support multiple holes/hit test filters
7329  window->HitTestHoleSize = ImVec2ih(size);
7330  window->HitTestHoleOffset = ImVec2ih(pos - window->Pos);
7331 }
7332 
7333 void ImGui::SetWindowCollapsed(bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond)
7334 {
7335  SetWindowCollapsed(GImGui->CurrentWindow, collapsed, cond);
7336 }

7341  return window->Collapsed;
7342 }

7352  if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name))
7353  SetWindowCollapsed(window, collapsed, cond);
7354 }

7356 void ImGui::SetWindowFocus()
7357 {
7358  FocusWindow(GImGui->CurrentWindow);
7359 }
7360 
7361 void ImGui::SetWindowFocus(const char* name)
7362 {
7363  if (name)
7364  {
7365  if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(name))
7366  FocusWindow(window);
7367  }
7368  else
7369  {
7370  FocusWindow(NULL);
7371  }
7372 }
7373 
7374 void ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(const ImVec2& pos, ImGuiCond cond, const ImVec2& pivot)
7375 {
7376  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7377  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
7378  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos;
7379  g.NextWindowData.PosVal = pos;
7380  g.NextWindowData.PosPivotVal = pivot;
7381  g.NextWindowData.PosCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
7382  g.NextWindowData.PosUndock = true;
7383 }
7384 
7385 void ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(const ImVec2& size, ImGuiCond cond)
7386 {
7387  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7388  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
7389  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize;
7390  g.NextWindowData.SizeVal = size;
7391  g.NextWindowData.SizeCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
7392 }
7393 
7394 void ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(const ImVec2& size_min, const ImVec2& size_max, ImGuiSizeCallback custom_callback, void* custom_callback_user_data)
7395 {
7396  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7397  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint;
7398  g.NextWindowData.SizeConstraintRect = ImRect(size_min, size_max);
7399  g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback = custom_callback;
7400  g.NextWindowData.SizeCallbackUserData = custom_callback_user_data;
7401 }
7402 
7403 // Content size = inner scrollable rectangle, padded with WindowPadding.
7404 // SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(100,100) + ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize will always allow submitting a 100x100 item.
7405 void ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(const ImVec2& size)
7406 {
7407  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7408  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasContentSize;
7409  g.NextWindowData.ContentSizeVal = ImFloor(size);
7410 }

7415  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasScroll;
7416  g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal = scroll;
7417 }
7418 
7419 void ImGui::SetNextWindowCollapsed(bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond)
7420 {
7421  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7422  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
7423  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasCollapsed;
7424  g.NextWindowData.CollapsedVal = collapsed;
7425  g.NextWindowData.CollapsedCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
7426 }

7455 
7456 void ImGui::SetNextWindowClass(const ImGuiWindowClass* window_class)
7457 {
7458  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7459  IM_ASSERT((window_class->ViewportFlagsOverrideSet & window_class->ViewportFlagsOverrideClear) == 0); // Cannot set both set and clear for the same bit
7460  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasWindowClass;
7461  g.NextWindowData.WindowClass = *window_class;
7462 }

7504  g.FontSize = g.DrawListSharedData.FontSize = window->CalcFontSize();
7505 }

7513 void ImGui::PushFocusScope(ImGuiID id)
7514 {
7515  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7516  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7517  g.FocusScopeStack.push_back(window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent);
7518  window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent = id;
7519 }
7520 
7521 void ImGui::PopFocusScope()
7522 {
7523  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7524  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7525  IM_ASSERT(g.FocusScopeStack.Size > 0); // Too many PopFocusScope() ?
7526  window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent = g.FocusScopeStack.back();
7527  g.FocusScopeStack.pop_back();
7528 }
7529 
7530 void ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(int offset)
7531 {
7532  IM_ASSERT(offset >= -1); // -1 is allowed but not below
7533  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7534  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7535  g.FocusRequestNextWindow = window;
7536  g.FocusRequestNextCounterRegular = window->DC.FocusCounterRegular + 1 + offset;
7537  g.FocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = INT_MAX;
7538 }
7539 
7540 void ImGui::SetItemDefaultFocus()
7541 {
7542  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7543  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7544  if (!window->Appearing)
7545  return;
7546  if (g.NavWindow == window->RootWindowForNav && (g.NavInitRequest || g.NavInitResultId != 0) && g.NavLayer == g.NavWindow->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
7547  {
7548  g.NavInitRequest = false;
7549  g.NavInitResultId = g.NavWindow->DC.LastItemId;
7550  g.NavInitResultRectRel = ImRect(g.NavWindow->DC.LastItemRect.Min - g.NavWindow->Pos, g.NavWindow->DC.LastItemRect.Max - g.NavWindow->Pos);
7551  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
7552  if (!IsItemVisible())
7553  SetScrollHereY();
7554  }
7555 }
7556 
7557 void ImGui::SetStateStorage(ImGuiStorage* tree)
7558 {
7559  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7560  window->DC.StateStorage = tree ? tree : &window->StateStorage;
7561 }
7562 
7563 ImGuiStorage* ImGui::GetStateStorage()
7564 {
7565  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7566  return window->DC.StateStorage;
7567 }
7568 
7569 void ImGui::PushID(const char* str_id)
7570 {
7571  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7572  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7573  ImGuiID id = window->GetIDNoKeepAlive(str_id);
7574  window->IDStack.push_back(id);
7575 }
7576

7578 {
7579  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7580  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7581  ImGuiID id = window->GetIDNoKeepAlive(str_id_begin, str_id_end);
7582  window->IDStack.push_back(id);
7583 }

7588  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7589  ImGuiID id = window->GetIDNoKeepAlive(ptr_id);
7590  window->IDStack.push_back(id);
7591 }

7594 {
7595  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7596  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7597  ImGuiID id = window->GetIDNoKeepAlive(int_id);
7598  window->IDStack.push_back(id);
7599 }
7600 
7601 // Push a given id value ignoring the ID stack as a seed.
7602 void ImGui::PushOverrideID(ImGuiID id)
7603 {
7604  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7605  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7606  window->IDStack.push_back(id);
7607 }
7608 
7609 // Helper to avoid a common series of PushOverrideID -> GetID() -> PopID() call
7610 // (note that when using this pattern, TestEngine's "Stack Tool" will tend to not display the intermediate stack level.
7611 // for that to work we would need to do PushOverrideID() -> ItemAdd() -> PopID() which would alter widget code a little more)
7612 ImGuiID ImGui::GetIDWithSeed(const char* str, const char* str_end, ImGuiID seed)
7613 {
7614  ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(str, str_end ? (str_end - str) : 0, seed);
7615  ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
7616 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
7617  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7618  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ID_INFO2(id, ImGuiDataType_String, str, str_end);
7619 #endif
7620  return id;
7621 }
7622 
7623 void ImGui::PopID()
7624 {
7625  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7626  IM_ASSERT(window->IDStack.Size > 1); // Too many PopID(), or could be popping in a wrong/different window?
7627  window->IDStack.pop_back();
7628 }
7629 
7630 ImGuiID ImGui::GetID(const char* str_id)
7631 {
7632  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7633  return window->GetID(str_id);
7634 }
7635 
7636 ImGuiID ImGui::GetID(const char* str_id_begin, const char* str_id_end)
7637 {
7638  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7639  return window->GetID(str_id_begin, str_id_end);
7640 }
7641 
7642 ImGuiID ImGui::GetID(const void* ptr_id)
7643 {
7644  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7645  return window->GetID(ptr_id);
7646 }
7647 
7648 bool ImGui::IsRectVisible(const ImVec2& size)
7649 {
7650  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7651  return window->ClipRect.Overlaps(ImRect(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + size));
7652 }
7653 
7654 bool ImGui::IsRectVisible(const ImVec2& rect_min, const ImVec2& rect_max)
7655 {
7656  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7657  return window->ClipRect.Overlaps(ImRect(rect_min, rect_max));
7658 }
7659 
7660 
7661 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7662 // [SECTION] ERROR CHECKING
7663 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7664 
7665 // Helper function to verify ABI compatibility between caller code and compiled version of Dear ImGui.
7666 // Verify that the type sizes are matching between the calling file's compilation unit and imgui.cpp's compilation unit
7667 // If the user has inconsistent compilation settings, imgui configuration #define, packing pragma, etc. your user code
7668 // may see different structures than what imgui.cpp sees, which is problematic.
7669 // We usually require settings to be in imconfig.h to make sure that they are accessible to all compilation units involved with Dear ImGui.
7670 bool ImGui::DebugCheckVersionAndDataLayout(const char* version, size_t sz_io, size_t sz_style, size_t sz_vec2, size_t sz_vec4, size_t sz_vert, size_t sz_idx)
7671 {
7672  bool error = false;
7673  if (strcmp(version, IMGUI_VERSION) != 0) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(strcmp(version, IMGUI_VERSION) == 0 && "Mismatched version string!"); }
7674  if (sz_io != sizeof(ImGuiIO)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_io == sizeof(ImGuiIO) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
7675  if (sz_style != sizeof(ImGuiStyle)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_style == sizeof(ImGuiStyle) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
7676  if (sz_vec2 != sizeof(ImVec2)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_vec2 == sizeof(ImVec2) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
7677  if (sz_vec4 != sizeof(ImVec4)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_vec4 == sizeof(ImVec4) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
7678  if (sz_vert != sizeof(ImDrawVert)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_vert == sizeof(ImDrawVert) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
7679  if (sz_idx != sizeof(ImDrawIdx)) { error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_idx == sizeof(ImDrawIdx) && "Mismatched struct layout!"); }
7680  return !error;
7681 }
7682 
7683 static void ImGui::ErrorCheckNewFrameSanityChecks()
7684 {
7685  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7686 
7687  // Check user IM_ASSERT macro
7688  // (IF YOU GET A WARNING OR COMPILE ERROR HERE: it means you assert macro is incorrectly defined!
7689  // If your macro uses multiple statements, it NEEDS to be surrounded by a 'do { ... } while (0)' block.
7690  // This is a common C/C++ idiom to allow multiple statements macros to be used in control flow blocks.)
7691  // #define IM_ASSERT(EXPR) if (SomeCode(EXPR)) SomeMoreCode(); // Wrong!
7692  // #define IM_ASSERT(EXPR) do { if (SomeCode(EXPR)) SomeMoreCode(); } while (0) // Correct!
7693  if (true) IM_ASSERT(1); else IM_ASSERT(0);
7694 
7695  // Check user data
7696  // (We pass an error message in the assert expression to make it visible to programmers who are not using a debugger, as most assert handlers display their argument)
7697  IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
7698  IM_ASSERT((g.IO.DeltaTime > 0.0f || g.FrameCount == 0) && "Need a positive DeltaTime!");
7699  IM_ASSERT((g.FrameCount == 0 || g.FrameCountEnded == g.FrameCount) && "Forgot to call Render() or EndFrame() at the end of the previous frame?");
7700  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.DisplaySize.x >= 0.0f && g.IO.DisplaySize.y >= 0.0f && "Invalid DisplaySize value!");
7701  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.Fonts->Fonts.Size > 0 && "Font Atlas not built. Did you call io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsRGBA32() / GetTexDataAsAlpha8()?");
7702  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.Fonts->Fonts[0]->IsLoaded() && "Font Atlas not built. Did you call io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsRGBA32() / GetTexDataAsAlpha8()?");
7703  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.CurveTessellationTol > 0.0f && "Invalid style setting!");
7704  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.CircleTessellationMaxError > 0.0f && "Invalid style setting!");
7705  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.Alpha >= 0.0f && g.Style.Alpha <= 1.0f && "Invalid style setting!"); // Allows us to avoid a few clamps in color computations
7706  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.WindowMinSize.x >= 1.0f && g.Style.WindowMinSize.y >= 1.0f && "Invalid style setting.");
7707  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_None || g.Style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left || g.Style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Right);
7708  for (int n = 0; n < ImGuiKey_COUNT; n++)
7709  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyMap[n] >= -1 && g.IO.KeyMap[n] < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown) && "io.KeyMap[] contains an out of bound value (need to be 0..512, or -1 for unmapped key)");
7710 
7711  // Check: required key mapping (we intentionally do NOT check all keys to not pressure user into setting up everything, but Space is required and was only added in 1.60 WIP)
7712  if (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard)
7713  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_Space] != -1 && "ImGuiKey_Space is not mapped, required for keyboard navigation.");
7714 
7715  // Check: the io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges option requires backend to honor mouse cursor changes and set the ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors flag accordingly.
7716  if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges && !(g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors))
7717  g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges = false;
7718 
7719  // Perform simple check: error if Docking or Viewport are enabled _exactly_ on frame 1 (instead of frame 0 or later), which is a common error leading to loss of .ini data.
7720  if (g.FrameCount == 1 && (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable) && (g.ConfigFlagsLastFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable) == 0)
7721  IM_ASSERT(0 && "Please set DockingEnable before the first call to NewFrame()! Otherwise you will lose your .ini settings!");
7722  if (g.FrameCount == 1 && (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable) && (g.ConfigFlagsLastFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable) == 0)
7723  IM_ASSERT(0 && "Please set ViewportsEnable before the first call to NewFrame()! Otherwise you will lose your .ini settings!");
7724 
7725  // Perform simple checks: multi-viewport and platform windows support
7726  if (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable)
7727  {
7728  if ((g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_PlatformHasViewports) && (g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasViewports))
7729  {
7730  IM_ASSERT((g.FrameCount == 0 || g.FrameCount == g.FrameCountPlatformEnded) && "Forgot to call UpdatePlatformWindows() in main loop after EndFrame()? Check examples/ applications for reference.");
7731  IM_ASSERT(g.PlatformIO.Platform_CreateWindow != NULL && "Platform init didn't install handlers?");
7732  IM_ASSERT(g.PlatformIO.Platform_DestroyWindow != NULL && "Platform init didn't install handlers?");
7733  IM_ASSERT(g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowPos != NULL && "Platform init didn't install handlers?");
7734  IM_ASSERT(g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowPos != NULL && "Platform init didn't install handlers?");
7735  IM_ASSERT(g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowSize != NULL && "Platform init didn't install handlers?");
7736  IM_ASSERT(g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowSize != NULL && "Platform init didn't install handlers?");
7737  IM_ASSERT(g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size > 0 && "Platform init didn't setup Monitors list?");
7738  IM_ASSERT((g.Viewports[0]->PlatformUserData != NULL || g.Viewports[0]->PlatformHandle != NULL) && "Platform init didn't setup main viewport.");
7739  if (g.IO.ConfigDockingTransparentPayload && (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable))
7740  IM_ASSERT(g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowAlpha != NULL && "Platform_SetWindowAlpha handler is required to use io.ConfigDockingTransparent!");
7741  }
7742  else
7743  {
7744  // Disable feature, our backends do not support it
7745  g.IO.ConfigFlags &= ~ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable;
7746  }
7747 
7748  // Perform simple checks on platform monitor data + compute a total bounding box for quick early outs
7749  for (int monitor_n = 0; monitor_n < g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size; monitor_n++)
7750  {
7751  ImGuiPlatformMonitor& mon = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[monitor_n];
7752  IM_UNUSED(mon);
7753  IM_ASSERT(mon.MainSize.x > 0.0f && mon.MainSize.y > 0.0f && "Monitor main bounds not setup properly.");
7754  IM_ASSERT(ImRect(mon.MainPos, mon.MainPos + mon.MainSize).Contains(ImRect(mon.WorkPos, mon.WorkPos + mon.WorkSize)) && "Monitor work bounds not setup properly. If you don't have work area information, just copy MainPos/MainSize into them.");
7755  IM_ASSERT(mon.DpiScale != 0.0f);
7756  }
7757  }
7758 }
7759 
7760 static void ImGui::ErrorCheckEndFrameSanityChecks()
7761 {
7762  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7763 
7764  // Verify that io.KeyXXX fields haven't been tampered with. Key mods should not be modified between NewFrame() and EndFrame()
7765  // One possible reason leading to this assert is that your backends update inputs _AFTER_ NewFrame().
7766  // It is known that when some modal native windows called mid-frame takes focus away, some backends such as GLFW will
7767  // send key release events mid-frame. This would normally trigger this assertion and lead to sheared inputs.
7768  // We silently accommodate for this case by ignoring/ the case where all io.KeyXXX modifiers were released (aka key_mod_flags == 0),
7769  // while still correctly asserting on mid-frame key press events.
7770  const ImGuiKeyModFlags key_mod_flags = GetMergedKeyModFlags();
7771  IM_ASSERT((key_mod_flags == 0 || g.IO.KeyMods == key_mod_flags) && "Mismatching io.KeyCtrl/io.KeyShift/io.KeyAlt/io.KeySuper vs io.KeyMods");
7772  IM_UNUSED(key_mod_flags);
7773 
7774  // Recover from errors
7775  //ErrorCheckEndFrameRecover();
7776 
7777  // Report when there is a mismatch of Begin/BeginChild vs End/EndChild calls. Important: Remember that the Begin/BeginChild API requires you
7778  // to always call End/EndChild even if Begin/BeginChild returns false! (this is unfortunately inconsistent with most other Begin* API).
7779  if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size != 1)
7780  {
7781  if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 1)
7782  {
7783  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 1, "Mismatched Begin/BeginChild vs End/EndChild calls: did you forget to call End/EndChild?");
7784  while (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 1)
7785  End();
7786  }
7787  else
7788  {
7789  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 1, "Mismatched Begin/BeginChild vs End/EndChild calls: did you call End/EndChild too much?");
7790  }
7791  }
7792 
7793  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.GroupStack.Size == 0, "Missing EndGroup call!");
7794 }
7795 
7796 // Experimental recovery from incorrect usage of BeginXXX/EndXXX/PushXXX/PopXXX calls.
7797 // Must be called during or before EndFrame().
7798 // This is generally flawed as we are not necessarily End/Popping things in the right order.
7799 // FIXME: Can't recover from inside BeginTabItem/EndTabItem yet.
7800 // FIXME: Can't recover from interleaved BeginTabBar/Begin
7801 void ImGui::ErrorCheckEndFrameRecover(ImGuiErrorLogCallback log_callback, void* user_data)
7802 {
7803  // PVS-Studio V1044 is "Loop break conditions do not depend on the number of iterations"
7804  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7805  while (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 0)
7806  {
7807 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_TABLE
7808  while (g.CurrentTable && (g.CurrentTable->OuterWindow == g.CurrentWindow || g.CurrentTable->InnerWindow == g.CurrentWindow))
7809  {
7810  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing EndTable() in '%s'", g.CurrentTable->OuterWindow->Name);
7811  EndTable();
7812  }
7813 #endif
7814  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7815  IM_ASSERT(window != NULL);
7816  while (g.CurrentTabBar != NULL) //-V1044
7817  {
7818  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing EndTabBar() in '%s'", window->Name);
7819  EndTabBar();
7820  }
7821  while (window->DC.TreeDepth > 0)
7822  {
7823  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing TreePop() in '%s'", window->Name);
7824  TreePop();
7825  }
7826  while (g.GroupStack.Size > window->DC.StackSizesOnBegin.SizeOfGroupStack)
7827  {
7828  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing EndGroup() in '%s'", window->Name);
7829  EndGroup();
7830  }
7831  while (window->IDStack.Size > 1)
7832  {
7833  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing PopID() in '%s'", window->Name);
7834  PopID();
7835  }
7836  while (g.ColorStack.Size > window->DC.StackSizesOnBegin.SizeOfColorStack)
7837  {
7838  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing PopStyleColor() in '%s' for ImGuiCol_%s", window->Name, GetStyleColorName(g.ColorStack.back().Col));
7839  PopStyleColor();
7840  }
7841  while (g.StyleVarStack.Size > window->DC.StackSizesOnBegin.SizeOfStyleVarStack)
7842  {
7843  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing PopStyleVar() in '%s'", window->Name);
7844  PopStyleVar();
7845  }
7846  while (g.FocusScopeStack.Size > window->DC.StackSizesOnBegin.SizeOfFocusScopeStack)
7847  {
7848  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing PopFocusScope() in '%s'", window->Name);
7849  PopFocusScope();
7850  }
7851  if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 1)
7852  {
7853  IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow->IsFallbackWindow);
7854  break;
7855  }
7856  IM_ASSERT(window == g.CurrentWindow);
7857  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
7858  {
7859  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing EndChild() for '%s'", window->Name);
7860  EndChild();
7861  }
7862  else
7863  {
7864  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing End() for '%s'", window->Name);
7865  End();
7866  }
7867  }
7868 }
7869 
7870 // Save current stack sizes for later compare
7871 void ImGuiStackSizes::SetToCurrentState()
7872 {
7873  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7874  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7875  SizeOfIDStack = (short)window->IDStack.Size;
7876  SizeOfColorStack = (short)g.ColorStack.Size;
7877  SizeOfStyleVarStack = (short)g.StyleVarStack.Size;
7878  SizeOfFontStack = (short)g.FontStack.Size;
7879  SizeOfFocusScopeStack = (short)g.FocusScopeStack.Size;
7880  SizeOfGroupStack = (short)g.GroupStack.Size;
7881  SizeOfBeginPopupStack = (short)g.BeginPopupStack.Size;
7882 }
7883 
7884 // Compare to detect usage errors
7885 void ImGuiStackSizes::CompareWithCurrentState()
7886 {
7887  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7888  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7889  IM_UNUSED(window);
7890 
7891  // Window stacks
7892  // NOT checking: DC.ItemWidth, DC.TextWrapPos (per window) to allow user to conveniently push once and not pop (they are cleared on Begin)
7893  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfIDStack == window->IDStack.Size && "PushID/PopID or TreeNode/TreePop Mismatch!");
7894 
7895  // Global stacks
7896  // For color, style and font stacks there is an incentive to use Push/Begin/Pop/.../End patterns, so we relax our checks a little to allow them.
7897  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfGroupStack == g.GroupStack.Size && "BeginGroup/EndGroup Mismatch!");
7898  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfBeginPopupStack == g.BeginPopupStack.Size && "BeginPopup/EndPopup or BeginMenu/EndMenu Mismatch!");
7899  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfColorStack >= g.ColorStack.Size && "PushStyleColor/PopStyleColor Mismatch!");
7900  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfStyleVarStack >= g.StyleVarStack.Size && "PushStyleVar/PopStyleVar Mismatch!");
7901  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfFontStack >= g.FontStack.Size && "PushFont/PopFont Mismatch!");
7902  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfFocusScopeStack == g.FocusScopeStack.Size && "PushFocusScope/PopFocusScope Mismatch!");
7903 }
7904 
7905 
7906 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7907 // [SECTION] LAYOUT
7908 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7909 // - ItemSize()
7910 // - ItemAdd()
7911 // - SameLine()
7912 // - GetCursorScreenPos()
7913 // - SetCursorScreenPos()
7914 // - GetCursorPos(), GetCursorPosX(), GetCursorPosY()
7915 // - SetCursorPos(), SetCursorPosX(), SetCursorPosY()
7916 // - GetCursorStartPos()
7917 // - Indent()
7918 // - Unindent()
7919 // - SetNextItemWidth()
7920 // - PushItemWidth()
7921 // - PushMultiItemsWidths()
7922 // - PopItemWidth()
7923 // - CalcItemWidth()
7924 // - CalcItemSize()
7925 // - GetTextLineHeight()
7926 // - GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()
7927 // - GetFrameHeight()
7928 // - GetFrameHeightWithSpacing()
7929 // - GetContentRegionMax()
7930 // - GetContentRegionMaxAbs() [Internal]
7931 // - GetContentRegionAvail(),
7932 // - GetWindowContentRegionMin(), GetWindowContentRegionMax()
7933 // - GetWindowContentRegionWidth()
7934 // - BeginGroup()
7935 // - EndGroup()
7936 // Also see in imgui_widgets: tab bars, columns.
7937 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7938 
7939 // Advance cursor given item size for layout.
7940 // Register minimum needed size so it can extend the bounding box used for auto-fit calculation.
7941 // See comments in ItemAdd() about how/why the size provided to ItemSize() vs ItemAdd() may often different.
7942 void ImGui::ItemSize(const ImVec2& size, float text_baseline_y)
7943 {
7944  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7945  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7946  if (window->SkipItems)
7947  return;
7948 
7949  // We increase the height in this function to accommodate for baseline offset.
7950  // In theory we should be offsetting the starting position (window->DC.CursorPos), that will be the topic of a larger refactor,
7951  // but since ItemSize() is not yet an API that moves the cursor (to handle e.g. wrapping) enlarging the height has the same effect.
7952  const float offset_to_match_baseline_y = (text_baseline_y >= 0) ? ImMax(0.0f, window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset - text_baseline_y) : 0.0f;
7953  const float line_height = ImMax(window->DC.CurrLineSize.y, size.y + offset_to_match_baseline_y);
7954 
7955  // Always align ourselves on pixel boundaries
7956  //if (g.IO.KeyAlt) window->DrawList->AddRect(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + ImVec2(size.x, line_height), IM_COL32(255,0,0,200)); // [DEBUG]
7957  window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.x = window->DC.CursorPos.x + size.x;
7958  window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y = window->DC.CursorPos.y;
7959  window->DC.CursorPos.x = IM_FLOOR(window->Pos.x + window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x); // Next line
7960  window->DC.CursorPos.y = IM_FLOOR(window->DC.CursorPos.y + line_height + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y); // Next line
7961  window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x, window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.x);
7962  window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y, window->DC.CursorPos.y - g.Style.ItemSpacing.y);
7963  //if (g.IO.KeyAlt) window->DrawList->AddCircle(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, 3.0f, IM_COL32(255,0,0,255), 4); // [DEBUG]
7964 
7965  window->DC.PrevLineSize.y = line_height;
7966  window->DC.CurrLineSize.y = 0.0f;
7967  window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset = ImMax(window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset, text_baseline_y);
7968  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = 0.0f;
7969 
7970  // Horizontal layout mode
7971  if (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal)
7972  SameLine();
7973 }
7974 
7975 void ImGui::ItemSize(const ImRect& bb, float text_baseline_y)
7976 {
7977  ItemSize(bb.GetSize(), text_baseline_y);
7978 }
7979 
7980 // Declare item bounding box for clipping and interaction.
7981 // Note that the size can be different than the one provided to ItemSize(). Typically, widgets that spread over available surface
7982 // declare their minimum size requirement to ItemSize() and provide a larger region to ItemAdd() which is used drawing/interaction.
7983 bool ImGui::ItemAdd(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id, const ImRect* nav_bb_arg)
7984 {
7985  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
7986  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
7987 
7988  if (id != 0)
7989  {
7990  // Navigation processing runs prior to clipping early-out
7991  // (a) So that NavInitRequest can be honored, for newly opened windows to select a default widget
7992  // (b) So that we can scroll up/down past clipped items. This adds a small O(N) cost to regular navigation requests
7993  // unfortunately, but it is still limited to one window. It may not scale very well for windows with ten of
7994  // thousands of item, but at least NavMoveRequest is only set on user interaction, aka maximum once a frame.
7995  // We could early out with "if (is_clipped && !g.NavInitRequest) return false;" but when we wouldn't be able
7996  // to reach unclipped widgets. This would work if user had explicit scrolling control (e.g. mapped on a stick).
7997  // We intentionally don't check if g.NavWindow != NULL because g.NavAnyRequest should only be set when it is non null.
7998  // If we crash on a NULL g.NavWindow we need to fix the bug elsewhere.
7999  window->DC.NavLayerActiveMaskNext |= (1 << window->DC.NavLayerCurrent);
8000  if (g.NavId == id || g.NavAnyRequest)
8001  if (g.NavWindow->RootWindowForNav == window->RootWindowForNav)
8002  if (window == g.NavWindow || ((window->Flags | g.NavWindow->Flags) & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened))
8003  NavProcessItem(window, nav_bb_arg ? *nav_bb_arg : bb, id);
8004 
8005  // [DEBUG] Item Picker tool, when enabling the "extended" version we perform the check in ItemAdd()
8006 #ifdef IMGUI_DEBUG_TOOL_ITEM_PICKER_EX
8007  if (id == g.DebugItemPickerBreakId)
8008  {
8009  IM_DEBUG_BREAK();
8010  g.DebugItemPickerBreakId = 0;
8011  }
8012 #endif
8013  }
8014 
8015  // Equivalent to calling SetLastItemData()
8016  window->DC.LastItemId = id;
8017  window->DC.LastItemRect = bb;
8018  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags = ImGuiItemStatusFlags_None;
8019  g.NextItemData.Flags = ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_None;
8020 
8021 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
8022  if (id != 0)
8023  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_ADD(nav_bb_arg ? *nav_bb_arg : bb, id);
8024 #endif
8025 
8026  // Clipping test
8027  const bool is_clipped = IsClippedEx(bb, id, false);
8028  if (is_clipped)
8029  return false;
8030  //if (g.IO.KeyAlt) window->DrawList->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, IM_COL32(255,255,0,120)); // [DEBUG]
8031 
8032  // We need to calculate this now to take account of the current clipping rectangle (as items like Selectable may change them)
8033  if (IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max))
8034  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect;
8035  return true;
8036 }
8037 
8038 // Gets back to previous line and continue with horizontal layout
8039 // offset_from_start_x == 0 : follow right after previous item
8040 // offset_from_start_x != 0 : align to specified x position (relative to window/group left)
8041 // spacing_w < 0 : use default spacing if pos_x == 0, no spacing if pos_x != 0
8042 // spacing_w >= 0 : enforce spacing amount
8043 void ImGui::SameLine(float offset_from_start_x, float spacing_w)
8044 {
8045  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
8046  if (window->SkipItems)
8047  return;
8048 
8049  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8050  if (offset_from_start_x != 0.0f)
8051  {
8052  if (spacing_w < 0.0f) spacing_w = 0.0f;
8053  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x + offset_from_start_x + spacing_w + window->DC.GroupOffset.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
8054  window->DC.CursorPos.y = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y;
8055  }
8056  else
8057  {
8058  if (spacing_w < 0.0f) spacing_w = g.Style.ItemSpacing.x;
8059  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.x + spacing_w;
8060  window->DC.CursorPos.y = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y;
8061  }
8062  window->DC.CurrLineSize = window->DC.PrevLineSize;
8063  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset;
8064 }
8065 
8066 ImVec2 ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos()
8067 {
8068  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
8069  return window->DC.CursorPos;
8070 }
8071 
8072 void ImGui::SetCursorScreenPos(const ImVec2& pos)
8073 {
8074  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
8075  window->DC.CursorPos = pos;
8076  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorPos);
8077 }
8078 
8079 // User generally sees positions in window coordinates. Internally we store CursorPos in absolute screen coordinates because it is more convenient.
8080 // Conversion happens as we pass the value to user, but it makes our naming convention confusing because GetCursorPos() == (DC.CursorPos - window.Pos). May want to rename 'DC.CursorPos'.
8081 ImVec2 ImGui::GetCursorPos()
8082 {
8083  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
8084  return window->DC.CursorPos - window->Pos + window->Scroll;
8085 }
8086 
8087 float ImGui::GetCursorPosX()
8088 {
8089  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
8090  return window->DC.CursorPos.x - window->Pos.x + window->Scroll.x;
8091 }
8092 
8093 float ImGui::GetCursorPosY()
8094 {
8095  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
8096  return window->DC.CursorPos.y - window->Pos.y + window->Scroll.y;
8097 }
8098 
8099 void ImGui::SetCursorPos(const ImVec2& local_pos)
8100 {
8101  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
8102  window->DC.CursorPos = window->Pos - window->Scroll + local_pos;
8103  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorPos);
8104 }
8105 
8106 void ImGui::SetCursorPosX(float x)
8107 {
8108  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
8109  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x + x;
8110  window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x, window->DC.CursorPos.x);
8111 }
8112 
8113 void ImGui::SetCursorPosY(float y)
8114 {
8115  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
8116  window->DC.CursorPos.y = window->Pos.y - window->Scroll.y + y;
8117  window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y, window->DC.CursorPos.y);
8118 }
8119 
8120 ImVec2 ImGui::GetCursorStartPos()
8121 {
8122  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
8123  return window->DC.CursorStartPos - window->Pos;
8124 }
8125 
8126 void ImGui::Indent(float indent_w)
8127 {
8128  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8129  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
8130  window->DC.Indent.x += (indent_w != 0.0f) ? indent_w : g.Style.IndentSpacing;
8131  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x + window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
8132 }
8133 
8134 void ImGui::Unindent(float indent_w)
8135 {
8136  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8137  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
8138  window->DC.Indent.x -= (indent_w != 0.0f) ? indent_w : g.Style.IndentSpacing;
8139  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x + window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
8140 }
8141 
8142 // Affect large frame+labels widgets only.
8143 void ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(float item_width)
8144 {
8145  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8146  g.NextItemData.Flags |= ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth;
8147  g.NextItemData.Width = item_width;
8148 }
8149 
8150 // FIXME: Remove the == 0.0f behavior?
8151 void ImGui::PushItemWidth(float item_width)
8152 {
8153  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8154  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8155  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(window->DC.ItemWidth); // Backup current width
8156  window->DC.ItemWidth = (item_width == 0.0f ? window->ItemWidthDefault : item_width);
8157  g.NextItemData.Flags &= ~ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth;
8158 }
8159 
8160 void ImGui::PushMultiItemsWidths(int components, float w_full)
8161 {
8162  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8163  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8164  const ImGuiStyle& style = g.Style;
8165  const float w_item_one = ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR((w_full - (style.ItemInnerSpacing.x) * (components - 1)) / (float)components));
8166  const float w_item_last = ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR(w_full - (w_item_one + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x) * (components - 1)));
8167  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(window->DC.ItemWidth); // Backup current width
8168  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(w_item_last);
8169  for (int i = 0; i < components - 2; i++)
8170  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(w_item_one);
8171  window->DC.ItemWidth = (components == 1) ? w_item_last : w_item_one;
8172  g.NextItemData.Flags &= ~ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth;
8173 }
8174 
8175 void ImGui::PopItemWidth()
8176 {
8177  ImGuiWindow* window = GetCurrentWindow();
8178  window->DC.ItemWidth = window->DC.ItemWidthStack.back();
8179  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.pop_back();
8180 }
8181 
8182 // Calculate default item width given value passed to PushItemWidth() or SetNextItemWidth().
8183 // The SetNextItemWidth() data is generally cleared/consumed by ItemAdd() or NextItemData.ClearFlags()
8184 float ImGui::CalcItemWidth()
8185 {
8186  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8187  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8188  float w;
8189  if (g.NextItemData.Flags & ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth)
8190  w = g.NextItemData.Width;
8191  else
8192  w = window->DC.ItemWidth;
8193  if (w < 0.0f)
8194  {
8195  float region_max_x = GetContentRegionMaxAbs().x;
8196  w = ImMax(1.0f, region_max_x - window->DC.CursorPos.x + w);
8197  }
8198  w = IM_FLOOR(w);
8199  return w;
8200 }
8201 
8202 // [Internal] Calculate full item size given user provided 'size' parameter and default width/height. Default width is often == CalcItemWidth().
8203 // Those two functions CalcItemWidth vs CalcItemSize are awkwardly named because they are not fully symmetrical.
8204 // Note that only CalcItemWidth() is publicly exposed.
8205 // The 4.0f here may be changed to match CalcItemWidth() and/or BeginChild() (right now we have a mismatch which is harmless but undesirable)
8206 ImVec2 ImGui::CalcItemSize(ImVec2 size, float default_w, float default_h)
8207 {
8208  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8209 
8210  ImVec2 region_max;
8211  if (size.x < 0.0f || size.y < 0.0f)
8212  region_max = GetContentRegionMaxAbs();
8213 
8214  if (size.x == 0.0f)
8215  size.x = default_w;
8216  else if (size.x < 0.0f)
8217  size.x = ImMax(4.0f, region_max.x - window->DC.CursorPos.x + size.x);
8218 
8219  if (size.y == 0.0f)
8220  size.y = default_h;
8221  else if (size.y < 0.0f)
8222  size.y = ImMax(4.0f, region_max.y - window->DC.CursorPos.y + size.y);
8223 
8224  return size;
8225 }
8226 
8227 float ImGui::GetTextLineHeight()
8228 {
8229  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8230  return g.FontSize;
8231 }
8232 
8233 float ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()
8234 {
8235  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8236  return g.FontSize + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y;
8237 }
8238 
8239 float ImGui::GetFrameHeight()
8240 {
8241  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8242  return g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f;
8243 }
8244 
8245 float ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing()
8246 {
8247  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8248  return g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y;
8249 }
8250 
8251 // FIXME: All the Contents Region function are messy or misleading. WE WILL AIM TO OBSOLETE ALL OF THEM WITH A NEW "WORK RECT" API. Thanks for your patience!
8252 
8253 // FIXME: This is in window space (not screen space!).
8254 ImVec2 ImGui::GetContentRegionMax()
8255 {
8256  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8257  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8258  ImVec2 mx = window->ContentRegionRect.Max - window->Pos;
8259  if (window->DC.CurrentColumns || g.CurrentTable)
8260  mx.x = window->WorkRect.Max.x - window->Pos.x;
8261  return mx;
8262 }
8263 
8264 // [Internal] Absolute coordinate. Saner. This is not exposed until we finishing refactoring work rect features.
8265 ImVec2 ImGui::GetContentRegionMaxAbs()
8266 {
8267  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8268  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8269  ImVec2 mx = window->ContentRegionRect.Max;
8270  if (window->DC.CurrentColumns || g.CurrentTable)
8271  mx.x = window->WorkRect.Max.x;
8272  return mx;
8273 }
8274 
8275 ImVec2 ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail()
8276 {
8277  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8278  return GetContentRegionMaxAbs() - window->DC.CursorPos;
8279 }
8280 
8281 // In window space (not screen space!)
8282 ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionMin()
8283 {
8284  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8285  return window->ContentRegionRect.Min - window->Pos;
8286 }
8287 
8288 ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionMax()
8289 {
8290  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8291  return window->ContentRegionRect.Max - window->Pos;
8292 }
8293 
8294 float ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionWidth()
8295 {
8296  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8297  return window->ContentRegionRect.GetWidth();
8298 }
8299 
8300 // Lock horizontal starting position + capture group bounding box into one "item" (so you can use IsItemHovered() or layout primitives such as SameLine() on whole group, etc.)
8301 // Groups are currently a mishmash of functionalities which should perhaps be clarified and separated.
8302 void ImGui::BeginGroup()
8303 {
8304  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8305  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8306 
8307  g.GroupStack.resize(g.GroupStack.Size + 1);
8308  ImGuiGroupData& group_data = g.GroupStack.back();
8309  group_data.WindowID = window->ID;
8310  group_data.BackupCursorPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
8311  group_data.BackupCursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos;
8312  group_data.BackupIndent = window->DC.Indent;
8313  group_data.BackupGroupOffset = window->DC.GroupOffset;
8314  group_data.BackupCurrLineSize = window->DC.CurrLineSize;
8315  group_data.BackupCurrLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset;
8316  group_data.BackupActiveIdIsAlive = g.ActiveIdIsAlive;
8317  group_data.BackupActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive;
8318  group_data.EmitItem = true;
8319 
8320  window->DC.GroupOffset.x = window->DC.CursorPos.x - window->Pos.x - window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
8321  window->DC.Indent = window->DC.GroupOffset;
8322  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
8323  window->DC.CurrLineSize = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
8324  if (g.LogEnabled)
8325  g.LogLinePosY = -FLT_MAX; // To enforce a carriage return
8326 }
8327 
8328 void ImGui::EndGroup()
8329 {
8330  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8331  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8332  IM_ASSERT(g.GroupStack.Size > 0); // Mismatched BeginGroup()/EndGroup() calls
8333 
8334  ImGuiGroupData& group_data = g.GroupStack.back();
8335  IM_ASSERT(group_data.WindowID == window->ID); // EndGroup() in wrong window?
8336 
8337  ImRect group_bb(group_data.BackupCursorPos, ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, group_data.BackupCursorPos));
8338 
8339  window->DC.CursorPos = group_data.BackupCursorPos;
8340  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(group_data.BackupCursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorMaxPos);
8341  window->DC.Indent = group_data.BackupIndent;
8342  window->DC.GroupOffset = group_data.BackupGroupOffset;
8343  window->DC.CurrLineSize = group_data.BackupCurrLineSize;
8344  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = group_data.BackupCurrLineTextBaseOffset;
8345  if (g.LogEnabled)
8346  g.LogLinePosY = -FLT_MAX; // To enforce a carriage return
8347 
8348  if (!group_data.EmitItem)
8349  {
8350  g.GroupStack.pop_back();
8351  return;
8352  }
8353 
8354  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = ImMax(window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset, group_data.BackupCurrLineTextBaseOffset); // FIXME: Incorrect, we should grab the base offset from the *first line* of the group but it is hard to obtain now.
8355  ItemSize(group_bb.GetSize());
8356  ItemAdd(group_bb, 0);
8357 
8358  // If the current ActiveId was declared within the boundary of our group, we copy it to LastItemId so IsItemActive(), IsItemDeactivated() etc. will be functional on the entire group.
8359  // It would be be neater if we replaced window.DC.LastItemId by e.g. 'bool LastItemIsActive', but would put a little more burden on individual widgets.
8360  // Also if you grep for LastItemId you'll notice it is only used in that context.
8361  // (The two tests not the same because ActiveIdIsAlive is an ID itself, in order to be able to handle ActiveId being overwritten during the frame.)
8362  const bool group_contains_curr_active_id = (group_data.BackupActiveIdIsAlive != g.ActiveId) && (g.ActiveIdIsAlive == g.ActiveId) && g.ActiveId;
8363  const bool group_contains_prev_active_id = (group_data.BackupActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive == false) && (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive == true);
8364  if (group_contains_curr_active_id)
8365  window->DC.LastItemId = g.ActiveId;
8366  else if (group_contains_prev_active_id)
8367  window->DC.LastItemId = g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame;
8368  window->DC.LastItemRect = group_bb;
8369 
8370  // Forward Edited flag
8371  if (group_contains_curr_active_id && g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame)
8372  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited;
8373 
8374  // Forward Deactivated flag
8375  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDeactivated;
8376  if (group_contains_prev_active_id && g.ActiveId != g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame)
8377  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Deactivated;
8378 
8379  g.GroupStack.pop_back();
8380  //window->DrawList->AddRect(group_bb.Min, group_bb.Max, IM_COL32(255,0,255,255)); // [Debug]
8381 }
8382 
8383 
8384 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8385 // [SECTION] SCROLLING
8386 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8387 
8388 // Helper to snap on edges when aiming at an item very close to the edge,
8389 // So the difference between WindowPadding and ItemSpacing will be in the visible area after scrolling.
8390 // When we refactor the scrolling API this may be configurable with a flag?
8391 // Note that the effect for this won't be visible on X axis with default Style settings as WindowPadding.x == ItemSpacing.x by default.
8392 static float CalcScrollEdgeSnap(float target, float snap_min, float snap_max, float snap_threshold, float center_ratio)
8393 {
8394  if (target <= snap_min + snap_threshold)
8395  return ImLerp(snap_min, target, center_ratio);
8396  if (target >= snap_max - snap_threshold)
8397  return ImLerp(target, snap_max, center_ratio);
8398  return target;
8399 }
8400 
8401 static ImVec2 CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(ImGuiWindow* window)
8402 {
8403  ImVec2 scroll = window->Scroll;
8404  if (window->ScrollTarget.x < FLT_MAX)
8405  {
8406  float center_x_ratio = window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x;
8407  float scroll_target_x = window->ScrollTarget.x;
8408  float snap_x_min = 0.0f;
8409  float snap_x_max = window->ScrollMax.x + window->Size.x;
8410  if (window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.x > 0.0f)
8411  scroll_target_x = CalcScrollEdgeSnap(scroll_target_x, snap_x_min, snap_x_max, window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.x, center_x_ratio);
8412  scroll.x = scroll_target_x - center_x_ratio * (window->SizeFull.x - window->ScrollbarSizes.x);
8413  }
8414  if (window->ScrollTarget.y < FLT_MAX)
8415  {
8416  float decoration_up_height = window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight();
8417  float center_y_ratio = window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y;
8418  float scroll_target_y = window->ScrollTarget.y;
8419  float snap_y_min = 0.0f;
8420  float snap_y_max = window->ScrollMax.y + window->Size.y - decoration_up_height;
8421  if (window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.y > 0.0f)
8422  scroll_target_y = CalcScrollEdgeSnap(scroll_target_y, snap_y_min, snap_y_max, window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.y, center_y_ratio);
8423  scroll.y = scroll_target_y - center_y_ratio * (window->SizeFull.y - window->ScrollbarSizes.y - decoration_up_height);
8424  }
8425  scroll.x = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(scroll.x, 0.0f));
8426  scroll.y = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(scroll.y, 0.0f));
8427  if (!window->Collapsed && !window->SkipItems)
8428  {
8429  scroll.x = ImMin(scroll.x, window->ScrollMax.x);
8430  scroll.y = ImMin(scroll.y, window->ScrollMax.y);
8431  }
8432  return scroll;
8433 }
8434 
8435 // Scroll to keep newly navigated item fully into view
8436 ImVec2 ImGui::ScrollToBringRectIntoView(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& item_rect)
8437 {
8438  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8439  ImRect window_rect(window->InnerRect.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), window->InnerRect.Max + ImVec2(1, 1));
8440  //GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(window_rect.Min, window_rect.Max, IM_COL32_WHITE); // [DEBUG]
8441 
8442  ImVec2 delta_scroll;
8443  if (!window_rect.Contains(item_rect))
8444  {
8445  if (window->ScrollbarX && item_rect.Min.x < window_rect.Min.x)
8446  SetScrollFromPosX(window, item_rect.Min.x - window->Pos.x - g.Style.ItemSpacing.x, 0.0f);
8447  else if (window->ScrollbarX && item_rect.Max.x >= window_rect.Max.x)
8448  SetScrollFromPosX(window, item_rect.Max.x - window->Pos.x + g.Style.ItemSpacing.x, 1.0f);
8449  if (item_rect.Min.y < window_rect.Min.y)
8450  SetScrollFromPosY(window, item_rect.Min.y - window->Pos.y - g.Style.ItemSpacing.y, 0.0f);
8451  else if (item_rect.Max.y >= window_rect.Max.y)
8452  SetScrollFromPosY(window, item_rect.Max.y - window->Pos.y + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y, 1.0f);
8453 
8454  ImVec2 next_scroll = CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(window);
8455  delta_scroll = next_scroll - window->Scroll;
8456  }
8457 
8458  // Also scroll parent window to keep us into view if necessary
8459  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
8460  delta_scroll += ScrollToBringRectIntoView(window->ParentWindow, ImRect(item_rect.Min - delta_scroll, item_rect.Max - delta_scroll));
8461 
8462  return delta_scroll;
8463 }
8464 
8465 float ImGui::GetScrollX()
8466 {
8467  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8468  return window->Scroll.x;
8469 }
8470
