8471 float ImGui::GetScrollY()
8472 {
8473  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8474  return window->Scroll.y;
8475 }
8476 
8477 float ImGui::GetScrollMaxX()
8478 {
8479  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8480  return window->ScrollMax.x;
8481 }
8482 
8483 float ImGui::GetScrollMaxY()
8484 {
8485  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8486  return window->ScrollMax.y;
8487 }
8488 
8489 void ImGui::SetScrollX(ImGuiWindow* window, float scroll_x)
8490 {
8491  window->ScrollTarget.x = scroll_x;
8492  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x = 0.0f;
8493  window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.x = 0.0f;
8494 }
8495 
8496 void ImGui::SetScrollY(ImGuiWindow* window, float scroll_y)
8497 {
8498  window->ScrollTarget.y = scroll_y;
8499  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y = 0.0f;
8500  window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.y = 0.0f;
8501 }
8502 
8503 void ImGui::SetScrollX(float scroll_x)
8504 {
8505  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8506  SetScrollX(g.CurrentWindow, scroll_x);
8507 }
8508 
8509 void ImGui::SetScrollY(float scroll_y)
8510 {
8511  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8512  SetScrollY(g.CurrentWindow, scroll_y);
8513 }
8514 
8515 // Note that a local position will vary depending on initial scroll value,
8516 // This is a little bit confusing so bear with us:
8517 // - local_pos = (absolution_pos - window->Pos)
8518 // - So local_x/local_y are 0.0f for a position at the upper-left corner of a window,
8519 // and generally local_x/local_y are >(padding+decoration) && <(size-padding-decoration) when in the visible area.
8520 // - They mostly exists because of legacy API.
8521 // Following the rules above, when trying to work with scrolling code, consider that:
8522 // - SetScrollFromPosY(0.0f) == SetScrollY(0.0f + scroll.y) == has no effect!
8523 // - SetScrollFromPosY(-scroll.y) == SetScrollY(-scroll.y + scroll.y) == SetScrollY(0.0f) == reset scroll. Of course writing SetScrollY(0.0f) directly then makes more sense
8524 // We store a target position so centering and clamping can occur on the next frame when we are guaranteed to have a known window size
8525 void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosX(ImGuiWindow* window, float local_x, float center_x_ratio)
8526 {
8527  IM_ASSERT(center_x_ratio >= 0.0f && center_x_ratio <= 1.0f);
8528  window->ScrollTarget.x = IM_FLOOR(local_x + window->Scroll.x); // Convert local position to scroll offset
8529  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x = center_x_ratio;
8530  window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.x = 0.0f;
8531 }
8532 
8533 void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosY(ImGuiWindow* window, float local_y, float center_y_ratio)
8534 {
8535  IM_ASSERT(center_y_ratio >= 0.0f && center_y_ratio <= 1.0f);
8536  local_y -= window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight(); // FIXME: Would be nice to have a more standardized access to our scrollable/client rect
8537  window->ScrollTarget.y = IM_FLOOR(local_y + window->Scroll.y); // Convert local position to scroll offset
8538  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y = center_y_ratio;
8539  window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.y = 0.0f;
8540 }
8541 
8542 void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosX(float local_x, float center_x_ratio)
8543 {
8544  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8545  SetScrollFromPosX(g.CurrentWindow, local_x, center_x_ratio);
8546 }
8547 
8548 void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosY(float local_y, float center_y_ratio)
8549 {
8550  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8551  SetScrollFromPosY(g.CurrentWindow, local_y, center_y_ratio);
8552 }
8553 
8554 // center_x_ratio: 0.0f left of last item, 0.5f horizontal center of last item, 1.0f right of last item.
8555 void ImGui::SetScrollHereX(float center_x_ratio)
8556 {
8557  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8558  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8559  float spacing_x = g.Style.ItemSpacing.x;
8560  float target_pos_x = ImLerp(window->DC.LastItemRect.Min.x - spacing_x, window->DC.LastItemRect.Max.x + spacing_x, center_x_ratio);
8561  SetScrollFromPosX(window, target_pos_x - window->Pos.x, center_x_ratio); // Convert from absolute to local pos
8562 
8563  // Tweak: snap on edges when aiming at an item very close to the edge
8564  window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.x = ImMax(0.0f, window->WindowPadding.x - spacing_x);
8565 }
8566 
8567 // center_y_ratio: 0.0f top of last item, 0.5f vertical center of last item, 1.0f bottom of last item.
8568 void ImGui::SetScrollHereY(float center_y_ratio)
8569 {
8570  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8571  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8572  float spacing_y = g.Style.ItemSpacing.y;
8573  float target_pos_y = ImLerp(window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y - spacing_y, window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y + window->DC.PrevLineSize.y + spacing_y, center_y_ratio);
8574  SetScrollFromPosY(window, target_pos_y - window->Pos.y, center_y_ratio); // Convert from absolute to local pos
8575 
8576  // Tweak: snap on edges when aiming at an item very close to the edge
8577  window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.y = ImMax(0.0f, window->WindowPadding.y - spacing_y);
8578 }
8579 
8580 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8581 // [SECTION] TOOLTIPS
8582 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8583 
8584 void ImGui::BeginTooltip()
8585 {
8586  BeginTooltipEx(ImGuiWindowFlags_None, ImGuiTooltipFlags_None);
8587 }
8588 
8589 void ImGui::BeginTooltipEx(ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags, ImGuiTooltipFlags tooltip_flags)
8590 {
8591  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8592 
8593  if (g.DragDropWithinSource || g.DragDropWithinTarget)
8594  {
8595  // The default tooltip position is a little offset to give space to see the context menu (it's also clamped within the current viewport/monitor)
8596  // In the context of a dragging tooltip we try to reduce that offset and we enforce following the cursor.
8597  // Whatever we do we want to call SetNextWindowPos() to enforce a tooltip position and disable clipping the tooltip without our display area, like regular tooltip do.
8598  //ImVec2 tooltip_pos = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset - g.Style.WindowPadding;
8599  ImVec2 tooltip_pos = g.IO.MousePos + ImVec2(16 * g.Style.MouseCursorScale, 8 * g.Style.MouseCursorScale);
8600  SetNextWindowPos(tooltip_pos);
8601  SetNextWindowBgAlpha(g.Style.Colors[ImGuiCol_PopupBg].w * 0.60f);
8602  //PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_Alpha, g.Style.Alpha * 0.60f); // This would be nice but e.g ColorButton with checkboard has issue with transparent colors :(
8603  tooltip_flags |= ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePreviousTooltip;
8604  }
8605 
8606  char window_name[16];
8607  ImFormatString(window_name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(window_name), "##Tooltip_%02d", g.TooltipOverrideCount);
8608  if (tooltip_flags & ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePreviousTooltip)
8609  if (ImGuiWindow* window = FindWindowByName(window_name))
8610  if (window->Active)
8611  {
8612  // Hide previous tooltip from being displayed. We can't easily "reset" the content of a window so we create a new one.
8613  window->Hidden = true;
8614  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1; // FIXME: This may not be necessary?
8615  ImFormatString(window_name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(window_name), "##Tooltip_%02d", ++g.TooltipOverrideCount);
8616  }
8617  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking;
8618  Begin(window_name, NULL, flags | extra_flags);
8619 }
8620 
8621 void ImGui::EndTooltip()
8622 {
8623  IM_ASSERT(GetCurrentWindowRead()->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip); // Mismatched BeginTooltip()/EndTooltip() calls
8624  End();
8625 }
8626 
8627 void ImGui::SetTooltipV(const char* fmt, va_list args)
8628 {
8629  BeginTooltipEx(0, ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePreviousTooltip);
8630  TextV(fmt, args);
8631  EndTooltip();
8632 }
8633 
8634 void ImGui::SetTooltip(const char* fmt, ...)
8635 {
8636  va_list args;
8637  va_start(args, fmt);
8638  SetTooltipV(fmt, args);
8639  va_end(args);
8640 }
8641 
8642 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8643 // [SECTION] POPUPS
8644 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8645 
8646 // Supported flags: ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel
8647 bool ImGui::IsPopupOpen(ImGuiID id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8648 {
8649  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8650  if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId)
8651  {
8652  // Return true if any popup is open at the current BeginPopup() level of the popup stack
8653  // This may be used to e.g. test for another popups already opened to handle popups priorities at the same level.
8654  IM_ASSERT(id == 0);
8655  if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel)
8656  return g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0;
8657  else
8658  return g.OpenPopupStack.Size > g.BeginPopupStack.Size;
8659  }
8660  else
8661  {
8662  if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel)
8663  {
8664  // Return true if the popup is open anywhere in the popup stack
8665  for (int n = 0; n < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; n++)
8666  if (g.OpenPopupStack[n].PopupId == id)
8667  return true;
8668  return false;
8669  }
8670  else
8671  {
8672  // Return true if the popup is open at the current BeginPopup() level of the popup stack (this is the most-common query)
8673  return g.OpenPopupStack.Size > g.BeginPopupStack.Size && g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size].PopupId == id;
8674  }
8675  }
8676 }
8677 
8678 bool ImGui::IsPopupOpen(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8679 {
8680  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8681  ImGuiID id = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId) ? 0 : g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id);
8682  if ((popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel) && id != 0)
8683  IM_ASSERT(0 && "Cannot use IsPopupOpen() with a string id and ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel."); // But non-string version is legal and used internally
8684  return IsPopupOpen(id, popup_flags);
8685 }
8686 
8687 ImGuiWindow* ImGui::GetTopMostPopupModal()
8688 {
8689  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8690  for (int n = g.OpenPopupStack.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
8691  if (ImGuiWindow* popup = g.OpenPopupStack.Data[n].Window)
8692  if (popup->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
8693  return popup;
8694  return NULL;
8695 }
8696 
8697 void ImGui::OpenPopup(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8698 {
8699  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8700  OpenPopupEx(g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id), popup_flags);
8701 }
8702 
8703 // Mark popup as open (toggle toward open state).
8704 // Popups are closed when user click outside, or activate a pressable item, or CloseCurrentPopup() is called within a BeginPopup()/EndPopup() block.
8705 // Popup identifiers are relative to the current ID-stack (so OpenPopup and BeginPopup needs to be at the same level).
8706 // One open popup per level of the popup hierarchy (NB: when assigning we reset the Window member of ImGuiPopupRef to NULL)
8707 void ImGui::OpenPopupEx(ImGuiID id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8708 {
8709  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8710  ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
8711  const int current_stack_size = g.BeginPopupStack.Size;
8712 
8713  if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup)
8714  if (IsPopupOpen(0u, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId))
8715  return;
8716 
8717  ImGuiPopupData popup_ref; // Tagged as new ref as Window will be set back to NULL if we write this into OpenPopupStack.
8718  popup_ref.PopupId = id;
8719  popup_ref.Window = NULL;
8720  popup_ref.SourceWindow = g.NavWindow;
8721  popup_ref.OpenFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
8722  popup_ref.OpenParentId = parent_window->IDStack.back();
8723  popup_ref.OpenPopupPos = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
8724  popup_ref.OpenMousePos = IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) ? g.IO.MousePos : popup_ref.OpenPopupPos;
8725 
8726  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("OpenPopupEx(0x%08X)\n", id);
8727  if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size < current_stack_size + 1)
8728  {
8729  g.OpenPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
8730  }
8731  else
8732  {
8733  // Gently handle the user mistakenly calling OpenPopup() every frame. It is a programming mistake! However, if we were to run the regular code path, the ui
8734  // would become completely unusable because the popup will always be in hidden-while-calculating-size state _while_ claiming focus. Which would be a very confusing
8735  // situation for the programmer. Instead, we silently allow the popup to proceed, it will keep reappearing and the programming error will be more obvious to understand.
8736  if (g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].PopupId == id && g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].OpenFrameCount == g.FrameCount - 1)
8737  {
8738  g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].OpenFrameCount = popup_ref.OpenFrameCount;
8739  }
8740  else
8741  {
8742  // Close child popups if any, then flag popup for open/reopen
8743  ClosePopupToLevel(current_stack_size, false);
8744  g.OpenPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
8745  }
8746 
8747  // When reopening a popup we first refocus its parent, otherwise if its parent is itself a popup it would get closed by ClosePopupsOverWindow().
8748  // This is equivalent to what ClosePopupToLevel() does.
8749  //if (g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].PopupId == id)
8750  // FocusWindow(parent_window);
8751  }
8752 }
8753 
8754 // When popups are stacked, clicking on a lower level popups puts focus back to it and close popups above it.
8755 // This function closes any popups that are over 'ref_window'.
8756 void ImGui::ClosePopupsOverWindow(ImGuiWindow* ref_window, bool restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
8757 {
8758  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8759  if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size == 0)
8760  return;
8761 
8762  // Don't close our own child popup windows.
8763  int popup_count_to_keep = 0;
8764  if (ref_window)
8765  {
8766  // Find the highest popup which is a descendant of the reference window (generally reference window = NavWindow)
8767  for (; popup_count_to_keep < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; popup_count_to_keep++)
8768  {
8769  ImGuiPopupData& popup = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_count_to_keep];
8770  if (!popup.Window)
8771  continue;
8772  IM_ASSERT((popup.Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0);
8773  if (popup.Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
8774  continue;
8775 
8776  // Trim the stack unless the popup is a direct parent of the reference window (the reference window is often the NavWindow)
8777  // - With this stack of window, clicking/focusing Popup1 will close Popup2 and Popup3:
8778  // Window -> Popup1 -> Popup2 -> Popup3
8779  // - Each popups may contain child windows, which is why we compare ->RootWindow!
8780  // Window -> Popup1 -> Popup1_Child -> Popup2 -> Popup2_Child
8781  bool ref_window_is_descendent_of_popup = false;
8782  for (int n = popup_count_to_keep; n < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; n++)
8783  if (ImGuiWindow* popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[n].Window)
8784  if (popup_window->RootWindow == ref_window->RootWindow)
8785  {
8786  ref_window_is_descendent_of_popup = true;
8787  break;
8788  }
8789  if (!ref_window_is_descendent_of_popup)
8790  break;
8791  }
8792  }
8793  if (popup_count_to_keep < g.OpenPopupStack.Size) // This test is not required but it allows to set a convenient breakpoint on the statement below
8794  {
8795  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("ClosePopupsOverWindow(\"%s\") -> ClosePopupToLevel(%d)\n", ref_window->Name, popup_count_to_keep);
8796  ClosePopupToLevel(popup_count_to_keep, restore_focus_to_window_under_popup);
8797  }
8798 }
8799 
8800 void ImGui::ClosePopupToLevel(int remaining, bool restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
8801 {
8802  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8803  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("ClosePopupToLevel(%d), restore_focus_to_window_under_popup=%d\n", remaining, restore_focus_to_window_under_popup);
8804  IM_ASSERT(remaining >= 0 && remaining < g.OpenPopupStack.Size);
8805 
8806  // Trim open popup stack
8807  ImGuiWindow* focus_window = g.OpenPopupStack[remaining].SourceWindow;
8808  ImGuiWindow* popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[remaining].Window;
8809  g.OpenPopupStack.resize(remaining);
8810 
8811  if (restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
8812  {
8813  if (focus_window && !focus_window->WasActive && popup_window)
8814  {
8815  // Fallback
8816  FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(popup_window, NULL);
8817  }
8818  else
8819  {
8820  if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main && focus_window)
8821  focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(focus_window);
8822  FocusWindow(focus_window);
8823  }
8824  }
8825 }
8826 
8827 // Close the popup we have begin-ed into.
8828 void ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup()
8829 {
8830  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8831  int popup_idx = g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1;
8832  if (popup_idx < 0 || popup_idx >= g.OpenPopupStack.Size || g.BeginPopupStack[popup_idx].PopupId != g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx].PopupId)
8833  return;
8834 
8835  // Closing a menu closes its top-most parent popup (unless a modal)
8836  while (popup_idx > 0)
8837  {
8838  ImGuiWindow* popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx].Window;
8839  ImGuiWindow* parent_popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx - 1].Window;
8840  bool close_parent = false;
8841  if (popup_window && (popup_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
8842  if (parent_popup_window == NULL || !(parent_popup_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal))
8843  close_parent = true;
8844  if (!close_parent)
8845  break;
8846  popup_idx--;
8847  }
8848  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("CloseCurrentPopup %d -> %d\n", g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1, popup_idx);
8849  ClosePopupToLevel(popup_idx, true);
8850 
8851  // A common pattern is to close a popup when selecting a menu item/selectable that will open another window.
8852  // To improve this usage pattern, we avoid nav highlight for a single frame in the parent window.
8853  // Similarly, we could avoid mouse hover highlight in this window but it is less visually problematic.
8854  if (ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow)
8855  window->DC.NavHideHighlightOneFrame = true;
8856 }
8857 
8858 // Attention! BeginPopup() adds default flags which BeginPopupEx()!
8859 bool ImGui::BeginPopupEx(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
8860 {
8861  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8862  if (!IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
8863  {
8864  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
8865  return false;
8866  }
8867 
8868  char name[20];
8869  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
8870  ImFormatString(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "##Menu_%02d", g.BeginPopupStack.Size); // Recycle windows based on depth
8871  else
8872  ImFormatString(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "##Popup_%08x", id); // Not recycling, so we can close/open during the same frame
8873 
8874  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking;
8875  bool is_open = Begin(name, NULL, flags);
8876  if (!is_open) // NB: Begin can return false when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
8877  EndPopup();
8878 
8879  return is_open;
8880 }
8881 
8882 bool ImGui::BeginPopup(const char* str_id, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
8883 {
8884  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8885  if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size <= g.BeginPopupStack.Size) // Early out for performance
8886  {
8887  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
8888  return false;
8889  }
8890  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings;
8891  return BeginPopupEx(g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id), flags);
8892 }
8893 
8894 // If 'p_open' is specified for a modal popup window, the popup will have a regular close button which will close the popup.
8895 // Note that popup visibility status is owned by Dear ImGui (and manipulated with e.g. OpenPopup) so the actual value of *p_open is meaningless here.
8896 bool ImGui::BeginPopupModal(const char* name, bool* p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
8897 {
8898  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8899  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8900  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(name);
8901  if (!IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
8902  {
8903  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
8904  return false;
8905  }
8906 
8907  // Center modal windows by default for increased visibility
8908  // (this won't really last as settings will kick in, and is mostly for backward compatibility. user may do the same themselves)
8909  // FIXME: Should test for (PosCond & window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags) with the upcoming window.
8910  if ((g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos) == 0)
8911  {
8912  const ImGuiViewport* viewport = window->WasActive ? window->Viewport : GetMainViewport(); // FIXME-VIEWPORT: What may be our reference viewport?
8913  SetNextWindowPos(viewport->GetCenter(), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
8914  }
8915 
8916  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoDocking;
8917  const bool is_open = Begin(name, p_open, flags);
8918  if (!is_open || (p_open && !*p_open)) // NB: is_open can be 'false' when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
8919  {
8920  EndPopup();
8921  if (is_open)
8922  ClosePopupToLevel(g.BeginPopupStack.Size, true);
8923  return false;
8924  }
8925  return is_open;
8926 }
8927 
8928 void ImGui::EndPopup()
8929 {
8930  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
8931  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
8932  IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup); // Mismatched BeginPopup()/EndPopup() calls
8933  IM_ASSERT(g.BeginPopupStack.Size > 0);
8934 
8935  // Make all menus and popups wrap around for now, may need to expose that policy.
8936  if (g.NavWindow == window)
8937  NavMoveRequestTryWrapping(window, ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY);
8938 
8939  // Child-popups don't need to be laid out
8940  IM_ASSERT(g.WithinEndChild == false);
8941  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
8942  g.WithinEndChild = true;
8943  End();
8944  g.WithinEndChild = false;
8945 }
8946 
8947 // Helper to open a popup if mouse button is released over the item
8948 // - This is essentially the same as BeginPopupContextItem() but without the trailing BeginPopup()
8949 void ImGui::OpenPopupOnItemClick(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8950 {
8951  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8952  int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
8953  if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
8954  {
8955  ImGuiID id = str_id ? window->GetID(str_id) : window->DC.LastItemId; // If user hasn't passed an ID, we can use the LastItemID. Using LastItemID as a Popup ID won't conflict!
8956  IM_ASSERT(id != 0); // You cannot pass a NULL str_id if the last item has no identifier (e.g. a Text() item)
8957  OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
8958  }
8959 }
8960 
8961 // This is a helper to handle the simplest case of associating one named popup to one given widget.
8962 // - You can pass a NULL str_id to use the identifier of the last item.
8963 // - You may want to handle this on user side if you have specific needs (e.g. tweaking IsItemHovered() parameters).
8964 // - This is essentially the same as calling OpenPopupOnItemClick() + BeginPopup() but written to avoid
8965 // computing the ID twice because BeginPopupContextXXX functions may be called very frequently.
8966 bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8967 {
8968  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8969  if (window->SkipItems)
8970  return false;
8971  ImGuiID id = str_id ? window->GetID(str_id) : window->DC.LastItemId; // If user hasn't passed an ID, we can use the LastItemID. Using LastItemID as a Popup ID won't conflict!
8972  IM_ASSERT(id != 0); // You cannot pass a NULL str_id if the last item has no identifier (e.g. a Text() item)
8973  int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
8974  if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
8975  OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
8976  return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
8977 }
8978 
8979 bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextWindow(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8980 {
8981  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8982  if (!str_id)
8983  str_id = "window_context";
8984  ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
8985  int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
8986  if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
8987  if (!(popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverItems) || !IsAnyItemHovered())
8988  OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
8989  return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
8990 }
8991 
8992 bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextVoid(const char* str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8993 {
8994  ImGuiWindow* window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8995  if (!str_id)
8996  str_id = "void_context";
8997  ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
8998  int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
8999  if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && !IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow))
9000  if (GetTopMostPopupModal() == NULL)
9001  OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
9002  return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
9003 }
9004 
9005 // r_avoid = the rectangle to avoid (e.g. for tooltip it is a rectangle around the mouse cursor which we want to avoid. for popups it's a small point around the cursor.)
9006 // r_outer = the visible area rectangle, minus safe area padding. If our popup size won't fit because of safe area padding we ignore it.
9007 // (r_outer is usually equivalent to the viewport rectangle minus padding, but when multi-viewports are enabled and monitor
9008 // information are available, it may represent the entire platform monitor from the frame of reference of the current viewport.
9009 // this allows us to have tooltips/popups displayed out of the parent viewport.)
9010 ImVec2 ImGui::FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(const ImVec2& ref_pos, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiDir* last_dir, const ImRect& r_outer, const ImRect& r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy policy)
9011 {
9012  ImVec2 base_pos_clamped = ImClamp(ref_pos, r_outer.Min, r_outer.Max - size);
9013  //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r_avoid.Min, r_avoid.Max, IM_COL32(255,0,0,255));
9014  //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r_outer.Min, r_outer.Max, IM_COL32(0,255,0,255));
9015 
9016  // Combo Box policy (we want a connecting edge)
9017  if (policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_ComboBox)
9018  {
9019  const ImGuiDir dir_prefered_order[ImGuiDir_COUNT] = { ImGuiDir_Down, ImGuiDir_Right, ImGuiDir_Left, ImGuiDir_Up };
9020  for (int n = (*last_dir != ImGuiDir_None) ? -1 : 0; n < ImGuiDir_COUNT; n++)
9021  {
9022  const ImGuiDir dir = (n == -1) ? *last_dir : dir_prefered_order[n];
9023  if (n != -1 && dir == *last_dir) // Already tried this direction?
9024  continue;
9025  ImVec2 pos;
9026  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Down) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Min.x, r_avoid.Max.y); // Below, Toward Right (default)
9027  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Right) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Min.x, r_avoid.Min.y - size.y); // Above, Toward Right
9028  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Left) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Max.x - size.x, r_avoid.Max.y); // Below, Toward Left
9029  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Up) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Max.x - size.x, r_avoid.Min.y - size.y); // Above, Toward Left
9030  if (!r_outer.Contains(ImRect(pos, pos + size)))
9031  continue;
9032  *last_dir = dir;
9033  return pos;
9034  }
9035  }
9036 
9037  // Tooltip and Default popup policy
9038  // (Always first try the direction we used on the last frame, if any)
9039  if (policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Tooltip || policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Default)
9040  {
9041  const ImGuiDir dir_prefered_order[ImGuiDir_COUNT] = { ImGuiDir_Right, ImGuiDir_Down, ImGuiDir_Up, ImGuiDir_Left };
9042  for (int n = (*last_dir != ImGuiDir_None) ? -1 : 0; n < ImGuiDir_COUNT; n++)
9043  {
9044  const ImGuiDir dir = (n == -1) ? *last_dir : dir_prefered_order[n];
9045  if (n != -1 && dir == *last_dir) // Already tried this direction?
9046  continue;
9047 
9048  const float avail_w = (dir == ImGuiDir_Left ? r_avoid.Min.x : r_outer.Max.x) - (dir == ImGuiDir_Right ? r_avoid.Max.x : r_outer.Min.x);
9049  const float avail_h = (dir == ImGuiDir_Up ? r_avoid.Min.y : r_outer.Max.y) - (dir == ImGuiDir_Down ? r_avoid.Max.y : r_outer.Min.y);
9050 
9051  // If there not enough room on one axis, there's no point in positioning on a side on this axis (e.g. when not enough width, use a top/bottom position to maximize available width)
9052  if (avail_w < size.x && (dir == ImGuiDir_Left || dir == ImGuiDir_Right))
9053  continue;
9054  if (avail_h < size.y && (dir == ImGuiDir_Up || dir == ImGuiDir_Down))
9055  continue;
9056 
9057  ImVec2 pos;
9058  pos.x = (dir == ImGuiDir_Left) ? r_avoid.Min.x - size.x : (dir == ImGuiDir_Right) ? r_avoid.Max.x : base_pos_clamped.x;
9059  pos.y = (dir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? r_avoid.Min.y - size.y : (dir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? r_avoid.Max.y : base_pos_clamped.y;
9060 
9061  // Clamp top-left corner of popup
9062  pos.x = ImMax(pos.x, r_outer.Min.x);
9063  pos.y = ImMax(pos.y, r_outer.Min.y);
9064 
9065  *last_dir = dir;
9066  return pos;
9067  }
9068  }
9069 
9070  // Fallback when not enough room:
9071  *last_dir = ImGuiDir_None;
9072 
9073  // For tooltip we prefer avoiding the cursor at all cost even if it means that part of the tooltip won't be visible.
9074  if (policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Tooltip)
9075  return ref_pos + ImVec2(2, 2);
9076 
9077  // Otherwise try to keep within display
9078  ImVec2 pos = ref_pos;
9079  pos.x = ImMax(ImMin(pos.x + size.x, r_outer.Max.x) - size.x, r_outer.Min.x);
9080  pos.y = ImMax(ImMin(pos.y + size.y, r_outer.Max.y) - size.y, r_outer.Min.y);
9081  return pos;
9082 }
9083 
9084 // Note that this is used for popups, which can overlap the non work-area of individual viewports.
9085 ImRect ImGui::GetWindowAllowedExtentRect(ImGuiWindow* window)
9086 {
9087  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9088  ImRect r_screen;
9089  if (window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend >= 0)
9090  {
9091  // Extent with be in the frame of reference of the given viewport (so Min is likely to be negative here)
9092  const ImGuiPlatformMonitor& monitor = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend];
9093  r_screen.Min = monitor.WorkPos;
9094  r_screen.Max = monitor.WorkPos + monitor.WorkSize;
9095  }
9096  else
9097  {
9098  // Use the full viewport area (not work area) for popups
9099  r_screen = window->Viewport->GetMainRect();
9100  }
9101  ImVec2 padding = g.Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding;
9102  r_screen.Expand(ImVec2((r_screen.GetWidth() > padding.x * 2) ? -padding.x : 0.0f, (r_screen.GetHeight() > padding.y * 2) ? -padding.y : 0.0f));
9103  return r_screen;
9104 }
9105 
9106 ImVec2 ImGui::FindBestWindowPosForPopup(ImGuiWindow* window)
9107 {
9108  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9109 
9110  ImRect r_outer = GetWindowAllowedExtentRect(window);
9111  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
9112  {
9113  // Child menus typically request _any_ position within the parent menu item, and then we move the new menu outside the parent bounds.
9114  // This is how we end up with child menus appearing (most-commonly) on the right of the parent menu.
9115  ImGuiWindow* parent_window = window->ParentWindow;
9116  float horizontal_overlap = g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x; // We want some overlap to convey the relative depth of each menu (currently the amount of overlap is hard-coded to style.ItemSpacing.x).
9117  ImRect r_avoid;
9118  if (parent_window->DC.MenuBarAppending)
9119  r_avoid = ImRect(-FLT_MAX, parent_window->ClipRect.Min.y, FLT_MAX, parent_window->ClipRect.Max.y); // Avoid parent menu-bar. If we wanted multi-line menu-bar, we may instead want to have the calling window setup e.g. a NextWindowData.PosConstraintAvoidRect field
9120  else
9121  r_avoid = ImRect(parent_window->Pos.x + horizontal_overlap, -FLT_MAX, parent_window->Pos.x + parent_window->Size.x - horizontal_overlap - parent_window->ScrollbarSizes.x, FLT_MAX);
9122  return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(window->Pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Default);
9123  }
9124  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
9125  {
9126  ImRect r_avoid = ImRect(window->Pos.x - 1, window->Pos.y - 1, window->Pos.x + 1, window->Pos.y + 1);
9127  return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(window->Pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Default);
9128  }
9129  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
9130  {
9131  // Position tooltip (always follows mouse)
9132  float sc = g.Style.MouseCursorScale;
9133  ImVec2 ref_pos = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
9134  ImRect r_avoid;
9135  if (!g.NavDisableHighlight && g.NavDisableMouseHover && !(g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos))
9136  r_avoid = ImRect(ref_pos.x - 16, ref_pos.y - 8, ref_pos.x + 16, ref_pos.y + 8);
9137  else
9138  r_avoid = ImRect(ref_pos.x - 16, ref_pos.y - 8, ref_pos.x + 24 * sc, ref_pos.y + 24 * sc); // FIXME: Hard-coded based on mouse cursor shape expectation. Exact dimension not very important.
9139  return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(ref_pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Tooltip);
9140  }
9141  IM_ASSERT(0);
9142  return window->Pos;
9143 }
9144 
9145 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9146 // [SECTION] KEYBOARD/GAMEPAD NAVIGATION
9147 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9148 
9149 // FIXME-NAV: The existence of SetNavID vs SetNavIDWithRectRel vs SetFocusID is incredibly messy and confusing,
9150 // and needs some explanation or serious refactoring.
9151 void ImGui::SetNavID(ImGuiID id, int nav_layer, ImGuiID focus_scope_id)
9152 {
9153  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9154  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow);
9155  IM_ASSERT(nav_layer == 0 || nav_layer == 1);
9156  g.NavId = id;
9157  g.NavFocusScopeId = focus_scope_id;
9158  g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[nav_layer] = id;
9159 }
9160 
9161 void ImGui::SetNavIDWithRectRel(ImGuiID id, int nav_layer, ImGuiID focus_scope_id, const ImRect& rect_rel)
9162 {
9163  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9164  SetNavID(id, nav_layer, focus_scope_id);
9165  g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[nav_layer] = rect_rel;
9166  g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
9167  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9168  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
9169 }
9170 
9171 void ImGui::SetFocusID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindow* window)
9172 {
9173  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9174  IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
9175 
9176  // Assume that SetFocusID() is called in the context where its window->DC.NavLayerCurrent and window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent are valid.
9177  // Note that window may be != g.CurrentWindow (e.g. SetFocusID call in InputTextEx for multi-line text)
9178  const ImGuiNavLayer nav_layer = window->DC.NavLayerCurrent;
9179  if (g.NavWindow != window)
9180  g.NavInitRequest = false;
9181  g.NavWindow = window;
9182  g.NavId = id;
9183  g.NavLayer = nav_layer;
9184  g.NavFocusScopeId = window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent;
9185  window->NavLastIds[nav_layer] = id;
9186  if (window->DC.LastItemId == id)
9187  window->NavRectRel[nav_layer] = ImRect(window->DC.LastItemRect.Min - window->Pos, window->DC.LastItemRect.Max - window->Pos);
9188 
9189  if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Nav)
9190  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
9191  else
9192  g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
9193 }
9194 
9195 ImGuiDir ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(float dx, float dy)
9196 {
9197  if (ImFabs(dx) > ImFabs(dy))
9198  return (dx > 0.0f) ? ImGuiDir_Right : ImGuiDir_Left;
9199  return (dy > 0.0f) ? ImGuiDir_Down : ImGuiDir_Up;
9200 }
9201 
9202 static float inline NavScoreItemDistInterval(float a0, float a1, float b0, float b1)
9203 {
9204  if (a1 < b0)
9205  return a1 - b0;
9206  if (b1 < a0)
9207  return a0 - b1;
9208  return 0.0f;
9209 }
9210 
9211 static void inline NavClampRectToVisibleAreaForMoveDir(ImGuiDir move_dir, ImRect& r, const ImRect& clip_rect)
9212 {
9213  if (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || move_dir == ImGuiDir_Right)
9214  {
9215  r.Min.y = ImClamp(r.Min.y, clip_rect.Min.y, clip_rect.Max.y);
9216  r.Max.y = ImClamp(r.Max.y, clip_rect.Min.y, clip_rect.Max.y);
9217  }
9218  else
9219  {
9220  r.Min.x = ImClamp(r.Min.x, clip_rect.Min.x, clip_rect.Max.x);
9221  r.Max.x = ImClamp(r.Max.x, clip_rect.Min.x, clip_rect.Max.x);
9222  }
9223 }
9224 
9225 // Scoring function for gamepad/keyboard directional navigation. Based on https://gist.github.com/rygorous/6981057
9226 static bool ImGui::NavScoreItem(ImGuiNavMoveResult* result, ImRect cand)
9227 {
9228  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9229  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
9230  if (g.NavLayer != window->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
9231  return false;
9232 
9233  const ImRect& curr = g.NavScoringRect; // Current modified source rect (NB: we've applied Max.x = Min.x in NavUpdate() to inhibit the effect of having varied item width)
9234  g.NavScoringCount++;
9235 
9236  // When entering through a NavFlattened border, we consider child window items as fully clipped for scoring
9237  if (window->ParentWindow == g.NavWindow)
9238  {
9239  IM_ASSERT((window->Flags | g.NavWindow->Flags) & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened);
9240  if (!window->ClipRect.Overlaps(cand))
9241  return false;
9242  cand.ClipWithFull(window->ClipRect); // This allows the scored item to not overlap other candidates in the parent window
9243  }
9244 
9245  // We perform scoring on items bounding box clipped by the current clipping rectangle on the other axis (clipping on our movement axis would give us equal scores for all clipped items)
9246  // For example, this ensure that items in one column are not reached when moving vertically from items in another column.
9247  NavClampRectToVisibleAreaForMoveDir(g.NavMoveClipDir, cand, window->ClipRect);
9248 
9249  // Compute distance between boxes
9250  // FIXME-NAV: Introducing biases for vertical navigation, needs to be removed.
9251  float dbx = NavScoreItemDistInterval(cand.Min.x, cand.Max.x, curr.Min.x, curr.Max.x);
9252  float dby = NavScoreItemDistInterval(ImLerp(cand.Min.y, cand.Max.y, 0.2f), ImLerp(cand.Min.y, cand.Max.y, 0.8f), ImLerp(curr.Min.y, curr.Max.y, 0.2f), ImLerp(curr.Min.y, curr.Max.y, 0.8f)); // Scale down on Y to keep using box-distance for vertically touching items
9253  if (dby != 0.0f && dbx != 0.0f)
9254  dbx = (dbx / 1000.0f) + ((dbx > 0.0f) ? +1.0f : -1.0f);
9255  float dist_box = ImFabs(dbx) + ImFabs(dby);
9256 
9257  // Compute distance between centers (this is off by a factor of 2, but we only compare center distances with each other so it doesn't matter)
9258  float dcx = (cand.Min.x + cand.Max.x) - (curr.Min.x + curr.Max.x);
9259  float dcy = (cand.Min.y + cand.Max.y) - (curr.Min.y + curr.Max.y);
9260  float dist_center = ImFabs(dcx) + ImFabs(dcy); // L1 metric (need this for our connectedness guarantee)
9261 
9262  // Determine which quadrant of 'curr' our candidate item 'cand' lies in based on distance
9263  ImGuiDir quadrant;
9264  float dax = 0.0f, day = 0.0f, dist_axial = 0.0f;
9265  if (dbx != 0.0f || dby != 0.0f)
9266  {
9267  // For non-overlapping boxes, use distance between boxes
9268  dax = dbx;
9269  day = dby;
9270  dist_axial = dist_box;
9271  quadrant = ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(dbx, dby);
9272  }
9273  else if (dcx != 0.0f || dcy != 0.0f)
9274  {
9275  // For overlapping boxes with different centers, use distance between centers
9276  dax = dcx;
9277  day = dcy;
9278  dist_axial = dist_center;
9279  quadrant = ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(dcx, dcy);
9280  }
9281  else
9282  {
9283  // Degenerate case: two overlapping buttons with same center, break ties arbitrarily (note that LastItemId here is really the _previous_ item order, but it doesn't matter)
9284  quadrant = (window->DC.LastItemId < g.NavId) ? ImGuiDir_Left : ImGuiDir_Right;
9285  }
9286 
9287 #if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING
9288  char buf[128];
9289  if (IsMouseHoveringRect(cand.Min, cand.Max))
9290  {
9291  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "dbox (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\ndcen (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\nd (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\nnav %c, quadrant %c", dbx, dby, dist_box, dcx, dcy, dist_center, dax, day, dist_axial, "WENS"[g.NavMoveDir], "WENS"[quadrant]);
9292  ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
9293  draw_list->AddRect(curr.Min, curr.Max, IM_COL32(255,200,0,100));
9294  draw_list->AddRect(cand.Min, cand.Max, IM_COL32(255,255,0,200));
9295  draw_list->AddRectFilled(cand.Max - ImVec2(4, 4), cand.Max + CalcTextSize(buf) + ImVec2(4, 4), IM_COL32(40,0,0,150));
9296  draw_list->AddText(g.IO.FontDefault, 13.0f, cand.Max, ~0U, buf);
9297  }
9298  else if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) // Hold to preview score in matching quadrant. Press C to rotate.
9299  {
9300  if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_C)) { g.NavMoveDirLast = (ImGuiDir)((g.NavMoveDirLast + 1) & 3); g.IO.KeysDownDuration[g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_C]] = 0.01f; }
9301  if (quadrant == g.NavMoveDir)
9302  {
9303  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "%.0f/%.0f", dist_box, dist_center);
9304  ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
9305  draw_list->AddRectFilled(cand.Min, cand.Max, IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 200));
9306  draw_list->AddText(g.IO.FontDefault, 13.0f, cand.Min, IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255), buf);
9307  }
9308  }
9309 #endif
9310 
9311  // Is it in the quadrant we're interesting in moving to?
9312  bool new_best = false;
9313  if (quadrant == g.NavMoveDir)
9314  {
9315  // Does it beat the current best candidate?
9316  if (dist_box < result->DistBox)
9317  {
9318  result->DistBox = dist_box;
9319  result->DistCenter = dist_center;
9320  return true;
9321  }
9322  if (dist_box == result->DistBox)
9323  {
9324  // Try using distance between center points to break ties
9325  if (dist_center < result->DistCenter)
9326  {
9327  result->DistCenter = dist_center;
9328  new_best = true;
9329  }
9330  else if (dist_center == result->DistCenter)
9331  {
9332  // Still tied! we need to be extra-careful to make sure everything gets linked properly. We consistently break ties by symbolically moving "later" items
9333  // (with higher index) to the right/downwards by an infinitesimal amount since we the current "best" button already (so it must have a lower index),
9334  // this is fairly easy. This rule ensures that all buttons with dx==dy==0 will end up being linked in order of appearance along the x axis.
9335  if (((g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up || g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? dby : dbx) < 0.0f) // moving bj to the right/down decreases distance
9336  new_best = true;
9337  }
9338  }
9339  }
9340 
9341  // Axial check: if 'curr' has no link at all in some direction and 'cand' lies roughly in that direction, add a tentative link. This will only be kept if no "real" matches
9342  // are found, so it only augments the graph produced by the above method using extra links. (important, since it doesn't guarantee strong connectedness)
9343  // This is just to avoid buttons having no links in a particular direction when there's a suitable neighbor. you get good graphs without this too.
9344  // 2017/09/29: FIXME: This now currently only enabled inside menu bars, ideally we'd disable it everywhere. Menus in particular need to catch failure. For general navigation it feels awkward.
9345  // Disabling it may lead to disconnected graphs when nodes are very spaced out on different axis. Perhaps consider offering this as an option?
9346  if (result->DistBox == FLT_MAX && dist_axial < result->DistAxial) // Check axial match
9347  if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
9348  if ((g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && dax < 0.0f) || (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right && dax > 0.0f) || (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up && day < 0.0f) || (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down && day > 0.0f))
9349  {
9350  result->DistAxial = dist_axial;
9351  new_best = true;
9352  }
9353 
9354  return new_best;
9355 }
9356 
9357 static void ImGui::NavApplyItemToResult(ImGuiNavMoveResult* result, ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiID id, const ImRect& nav_bb_rel)
9358 {
9359  result->Window = window;
9360  result->ID = id;
9361  result->FocusScopeId = window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent;
9362  result->RectRel = nav_bb_rel;
9363 }
9364 
9365 // We get there when either NavId == id, or when g.NavAnyRequest is set (which is updated by NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag above)
9366 static void ImGui::NavProcessItem(ImGuiWindow* window, const ImRect& nav_bb, const ImGuiID id)
9367 {
9368  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9369  //if (!g.IO.NavActive) // [2017/10/06] Removed this possibly redundant test but I am not sure of all the side-effects yet. Some of the feature here will need to work regardless of using a _NoNavInputs flag.
9370  // return;
9371 
9372  const ImGuiItemFlags item_flags = window->DC.ItemFlags;
9373  const ImRect nav_bb_rel(nav_bb.Min - window->Pos, nav_bb.Max - window->Pos);
9374 
9375  // Process Init Request
9376  if (g.NavInitRequest && g.NavLayer == window->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
9377  {
9378  // Even if 'ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus' is on (typically collapse/close button) we record the first ResultId so they can be used as a fallback
9379  if (!(item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus) || g.NavInitResultId == 0)
9380  {
9381  g.NavInitResultId = id;
9382  g.NavInitResultRectRel = nav_bb_rel;
9383  }
9384  if (!(item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus))
9385  {
9386  g.NavInitRequest = false; // Found a match, clear request
9387  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
9388  }
9389  }
9390 
9391  // Process Move Request (scoring for navigation)
9392  // FIXME-NAV: Consider policy for double scoring (scoring from NavScoringRectScreen + scoring from a rect wrapped according to current wrapping policy)
9393  if ((g.NavId != id || (g.NavMoveRequestFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId)) && !(item_flags & (ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled | ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav)))
9394  {
9395  ImGuiNavMoveResult* result = (window == g.NavWindow) ? &g.NavMoveResultLocal : &g.NavMoveResultOther;
9396 #if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING
9397  // [DEBUG] Score all items in NavWindow at all times
9398  if (!g.NavMoveRequest)
9399  g.NavMoveDir = g.NavMoveDirLast;
9400  bool new_best = NavScoreItem(result, nav_bb) && g.NavMoveRequest;
9401 #else
9402  bool new_best = g.NavMoveRequest && NavScoreItem(result, nav_bb);
9403 #endif
9404  if (new_best)
9405  NavApplyItemToResult(result, window, id, nav_bb_rel);
9406 
9407  // Features like PageUp/PageDown need to maintain a separate score for the visible set of items.
9408  const float VISIBLE_RATIO = 0.70f;
9409  if ((g.NavMoveRequestFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet) && window->ClipRect.Overlaps(nav_bb))
9410  if (ImClamp(nav_bb.Max.y, window->ClipRect.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Max.y) - ImClamp(nav_bb.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Max.y) >= (nav_bb.Max.y - nav_bb.Min.y) * VISIBLE_RATIO)
9411  if (NavScoreItem(&g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet, nav_bb))
9412  NavApplyItemToResult(&g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet, window, id, nav_bb_rel);
9413  }
9414 
9415  // Update window-relative bounding box of navigated item
9416  if (g.NavId == id)
9417  {
9418  g.NavWindow = window; // Always refresh g.NavWindow, because some operations such as FocusItem() don't have a window.
9419  g.NavLayer = window->DC.NavLayerCurrent;
9420  g.NavFocusScopeId = window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent;
9421  g.NavIdIsAlive = true;
9422  g.NavIdTabCounter = window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop;
9423  window->NavRectRel[window->DC.NavLayerCurrent] = nav_bb_rel; // Store item bounding box (relative to window position)
9424  }
9425 }
9426 
9427 bool ImGui::NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet()
9428 {
9429  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9430  return g.NavMoveRequest && g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID == 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID == 0;
9431 }
9432 
9433 void ImGui::NavMoveRequestCancel()
9434 {
9435  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9436  g.NavMoveRequest = false;
9437  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
9438 }
9439 
9440 void ImGui::NavMoveRequestForward(ImGuiDir move_dir, ImGuiDir clip_dir, const ImRect& bb_rel, ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags)
9441 {
9442  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9443  IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_None);
9444  NavMoveRequestCancel();
9445  g.NavMoveDir = move_dir;
9446  g.NavMoveClipDir = clip_dir;
9447  g.NavMoveRequestForward = ImGuiNavForward_ForwardQueued;
9448  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = move_flags;
9449  g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer] = bb_rel;
9450 }
9451 
9452 void ImGui::NavMoveRequestTryWrapping(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags)
9453 {
9454  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9455 
9456  // Navigation wrap-around logic is delayed to the end of the frame because this operation is only valid after entire
9457  // popup is assembled and in case of appended popups it is not clear which EndPopup() call is final.
9458  g.NavWrapRequestWindow = window;
9459  g.NavWrapRequestFlags = move_flags;
9460 }
9461 
9462 // FIXME: This could be replaced by updating a frame number in each window when (window == NavWindow) and (NavLayer == 0).
9463 // This way we could find the last focused window among our children. It would be much less confusing this way?
9464 static void ImGui::NavSaveLastChildNavWindowIntoParent(ImGuiWindow* nav_window)
9465 {
9466  ImGuiWindow* parent = nav_window;
9467  while (parent && parent->RootWindowDockStop != parent && (parent->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) != 0 && (parent->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)) == 0)
9468  parent = parent->ParentWindow;
9469  if (parent && parent != nav_window)
9470  parent->NavLastChildNavWindow = nav_window;
9471 }
9472 
9473 // Restore the last focused child.
9474 // Call when we are expected to land on the Main Layer (0) after FocusWindow()
9475 static ImGuiWindow* ImGui::NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(ImGuiWindow* window)
9476 {
9477  if (window->NavLastChildNavWindow && window->NavLastChildNavWindow->WasActive)
9478  return window->NavLastChildNavWindow;
9479  if (window->DockNodeAsHost && window->DockNodeAsHost->TabBar)
9480  if (ImGuiTabItem* tab = TabBarFindMostRecentlySelectedTabForActiveWindow(window->DockNodeAsHost->TabBar))
9481  return tab->Window;
9482  return window;
9483 }
9484 
9485 static void NavRestoreLayer(ImGuiNavLayer layer)
9486 {
9487  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9488  g.NavLayer = layer;
9489  if (layer == 0)
9490  g.NavWindow = ImGui::NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(g.NavWindow);
9491  ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
9492  if (window->NavLastIds[layer] != 0)
9493  ImGui::SetNavIDWithRectRel(window->NavLastIds[layer], layer, 0, g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[layer]);
9494  else
9495  ImGui::NavInitWindow(window, true);
9496 }
9497 
9498 static inline void ImGui::NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag()
9499 {
9500  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9501  g.NavAnyRequest = g.NavMoveRequest || g.NavInitRequest || (IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING && g.NavWindow != NULL);
9502  if (g.NavAnyRequest)
9503  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow != NULL);
9504 }
9505 
9506 // This needs to be called before we submit any widget (aka in or before Begin)
9507 void ImGui::NavInitWindow(ImGuiWindow* window, bool force_reinit)
9508 {
9509  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9510  IM_ASSERT(window == g.NavWindow);
9511  bool init_for_nav = false;
9512  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
9513  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) || (window->NavLastIds[0] == 0) || force_reinit)
9514  init_for_nav = true;
9515  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavInitRequest: from NavInitWindow(), init_for_nav=%d, window=\"%s\", layer=%d\n", init_for_nav, window->Name, g.NavLayer);
9516  if (init_for_nav)
9517  {
9518  SetNavID(0, g.NavLayer, 0);
9519  g.NavInitRequest = true;
9520  g.NavInitRequestFromMove = false;
9521  g.NavInitResultId = 0;
9522  g.NavInitResultRectRel = ImRect();
9523  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
9524  }
9525  else
9526  {
9527  g.NavId = window->NavLastIds[0];
9528  g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
9529  }
9530 }
9531 
9532 static ImVec2 ImGui::NavCalcPreferredRefPos()
9533 {
9534  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9535  if (g.NavDisableHighlight || !g.NavDisableMouseHover || !g.NavWindow)
9536  {
9537  // Mouse (we need a fallback in case the mouse becomes invalid after being used)
9538  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos))
9539  return g.IO.MousePos;
9540  return g.LastValidMousePos;
9541  }
9542  else
9543  {
9544  // When navigation is active and mouse is disabled, decide on an arbitrary position around the bottom left of the currently navigated item.
9545  const ImRect& rect_rel = g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer];
9546  ImVec2 pos = g.NavWindow->Pos + ImVec2(rect_rel.Min.x + ImMin(g.Style.FramePadding.x * 4, rect_rel.GetWidth()), rect_rel.Max.y - ImMin(g.Style.FramePadding.y, rect_rel.GetHeight()));
9547  ImGuiViewport* viewport = g.NavWindow->Viewport;
9548  return ImFloor(ImClamp(pos, viewport->Pos, viewport->Pos + viewport->Size)); // ImFloor() is important because non-integer mouse position application in backend might be lossy and result in undesirable non-zero delta.
9549  }
9550 }
9551 
9552 float ImGui::GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput n, ImGuiInputReadMode mode)
9553 {
9554  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9555  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Down)
9556  return g.IO.NavInputs[n]; // Instant, read analog input (0.0f..1.0f, as provided by user)
9557 
9558  const float t = g.IO.NavInputsDownDuration[n];
9559  if (t < 0.0f && mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Released) // Return 1.0f when just released, no repeat, ignore analog input.
9560  return (g.IO.NavInputsDownDurationPrev[n] >= 0.0f ? 1.0f : 0.0f);
9561  if (t < 0.0f)
9562  return 0.0f;
9563  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed) // Return 1.0f when just pressed, no repeat, ignore analog input.
9564  return (t == 0.0f) ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
9565  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Repeat)
9566  return (float)CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 0.72f, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 0.80f);
9567  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatSlow)
9568  return (float)CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 1.25f, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 2.00f);
9569  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatFast)
9570  return (float)CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.DeltaTime, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 0.72f, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 0.30f);
9571  return 0.0f;
9572 }
9573 
9574 ImVec2 ImGui::GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags dir_sources, ImGuiInputReadMode mode, float slow_factor, float fast_factor)
9575 {
9576  ImVec2 delta(0.0f, 0.0f);
9577  if (dir_sources & ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_Keyboard)
9578  delta += ImVec2(GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_, mode), GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_, mode));
9579  if (dir_sources & ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadDPad)
9580  delta += ImVec2(GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft, mode), GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp, mode));
9581  if (dir_sources & ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadLStick)
9582  delta += ImVec2(GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickRight, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickLeft, mode), GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickDown, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickUp, mode));
9583  if (slow_factor != 0.0f && IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow))
9584  delta *= slow_factor;
9585  if (fast_factor != 0.0f && IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast))
9586  delta *= fast_factor;
9587  return delta;
9588 }
9589 
9590 static void ImGui::NavUpdate()
9591 {
9592  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9593  ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
9594 
9595  io.WantSetMousePos = false;
9596  g.NavWrapRequestWindow = NULL;
9597  g.NavWrapRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_None;
9598 #if 0
9599  if (g.NavScoringCount > 0) IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("NavScoringCount %d for '%s' layer %d (Init:%d, Move:%d)\n", g.FrameCount, g.NavScoringCount, g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow->Name : "NULL", g.NavLayer, g.NavInitRequest || g.NavInitResultId != 0, g.NavMoveRequest);
9600 #endif
9601 
9602  // Set input source as Gamepad when buttons are pressed (as some features differs when used with Gamepad vs Keyboard)
9603  // (do it before we map Keyboard input!)
9604  bool nav_keyboard_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) != 0;
9605  bool nav_gamepad_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) != 0 && (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) != 0;
9606  if (nav_gamepad_active && g.NavInputSource != ImGuiInputSource_NavGamepad)
9607  {
9608  if (io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Activate] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Input] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Cancel] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Menu] > 0.0f
9609  || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown] > 0.0f)
9610  g.NavInputSource = ImGuiInputSource_NavGamepad;
9611  }
9612 
9613  // Update Keyboard->Nav inputs mapping
9614  if (nav_keyboard_active)
9615  {
9616  #define NAV_MAP_KEY(_KEY, _NAV_INPUT) do { if (IsKeyDown(io.KeyMap[_KEY])) { io.NavInputs[_NAV_INPUT] = 1.0f; g.NavInputSource = ImGuiInputSource_NavKeyboard; } } while (0)
9617  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_Space, ImGuiNavInput_Activate );
9618  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_Enter, ImGuiNavInput_Input );
9619  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_Escape, ImGuiNavInput_Cancel );
9620  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_LeftArrow, ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_ );
9621  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_RightArrow,ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_);
9622  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_UpArrow, ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_ );
9623  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_DownArrow, ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_ );
9624  if (io.KeyCtrl)
9625  io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow] = 1.0f;
9626  if (io.KeyShift)
9627  io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast] = 1.0f;
9628  if (io.KeyAlt && !io.KeyCtrl) // AltGR is Alt+Ctrl, also even on keyboards without AltGR we don't want Alt+Ctrl to open menu.
9629  io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_KeyMenu_] = 1.0f;
9630  #undef NAV_MAP_KEY
9631  }
9632  memcpy(io.NavInputsDownDurationPrev, io.NavInputsDownDuration, sizeof(io.NavInputsDownDuration));
9633  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.NavInputs); i++)
9634  io.NavInputsDownDuration[i] = (io.NavInputs[i] > 0.0f) ? (io.NavInputsDownDuration[i] < 0.0f ? 0.0f : io.NavInputsDownDuration[i] + io.DeltaTime) : -1.0f;
9635 
9636  // Process navigation init request (select first/default focus)
9637  if (g.NavInitResultId != 0 && (!g.NavDisableHighlight || g.NavInitRequestFromMove))
9638  NavUpdateInitResult();
9639  g.NavInitRequest = false;
9640  g.NavInitRequestFromMove = false;
9641  g.NavInitResultId = 0;
9642  g.NavJustMovedToId = 0;
9643 
9644  // Process navigation move request
9645  if (g.NavMoveRequest)
9646  NavUpdateMoveResult();
9647 
9648  // When a forwarded move request failed, we restore the highlight that we disabled during the forward frame
9649  if (g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_ForwardActive)
9650  {
9651  IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveRequest);
9652  if (g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID == 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID == 0)
9653  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9654  g.NavMoveRequestForward = ImGuiNavForward_None;
9655  }
9656 
9657  // Apply application mouse position movement, after we had a chance to process move request result.
9658  if (g.NavMousePosDirty && g.NavIdIsAlive)
9659  {
9660  // Set mouse position given our knowledge of the navigated item position from last frame
9661  if ((io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos) && (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos))
9662  {
9663  if (!g.NavDisableHighlight && g.NavDisableMouseHover && g.NavWindow)
9664  {
9665  io.MousePos = io.MousePosPrev = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
9666  io.WantSetMousePos = true;
9667  }
9668  }
9669  g.NavMousePosDirty = false;
9670  }
9671  g.NavIdIsAlive = false;
9672  g.NavJustTabbedId = 0;
9673  IM_ASSERT(g.NavLayer == 0 || g.NavLayer == 1);
9674 
9675  // Store our return window (for returning from Layer 1 to Layer 0) and clear it as soon as we step back in our own Layer 0
9676  if (g.NavWindow)
9677  NavSaveLastChildNavWindowIntoParent(g.NavWindow);
9678  if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->NavLastChildNavWindow != NULL && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
9679  g.NavWindow->NavLastChildNavWindow = NULL;
9680 
9681  // Update CTRL+TAB and Windowing features (hold Square to move/resize/etc.)
9682  NavUpdateWindowing();
9683 
9684  // Set output flags for user application
9685  io.NavActive = (nav_keyboard_active || nav_gamepad_active) && g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs);
9686  io.NavVisible = (io.NavActive && g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight) || (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL);
9687 
9688  // Process NavCancel input (to close a popup, get back to parent, clear focus)
9689  if (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Cancel, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed))
9690  {
9691  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] ImGuiNavInput_Cancel\n");
9692  if (g.ActiveId != 0)
9693  {
9694  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavInput(ImGuiNavInput_Cancel))
9695  ClearActiveID();
9696  }
9697  else if (g.NavWindow && (g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && g.NavWindow->ParentWindow && g.NavWindow != g.NavWindow->RootWindowDockStop)
9698  {
9699  // Exit child window
9700  ImGuiWindow* child_window = g.NavWindow;
9701  ImGuiWindow* parent_window = g.NavWindow->ParentWindow;
9702  IM_ASSERT(child_window->ChildId != 0);
9703  FocusWindow(parent_window);
9704  SetNavID(child_window->ChildId, 0, 0);
9705  // Reassigning with same value, we're being explicit here.
9706  g.NavIdIsAlive = false; // -V1048
9707  if (g.NavDisableMouseHover)
9708  g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
9709  }
9710  else if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0)
9711  {
9712  // Close open popup/menu
9713  if (!(g.OpenPopupStack.back().Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal))
9714  ClosePopupToLevel(g.OpenPopupStack.Size - 1, true);
9715  }
9716  else if (g.NavLayer != ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
9717  {
9718  // Leave the "menu" layer
9719  NavRestoreLayer(ImGuiNavLayer_Main);
9720  }
9721  else
9722  {
9723  // Clear NavLastId for popups but keep it for regular child window so we can leave one and come back where we were
9724  if (g.NavWindow && ((g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) || !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)))
9725  g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[0] = 0;
9726  g.NavId = g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
9727  }
9728  }
9729 
9730  // Process manual activation request
9731  g.NavActivateId = g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavInputId = 0;
9732  if (g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight && !g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
9733  {
9734  bool activate_down = IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_Activate);
9735  bool activate_pressed = activate_down && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Activate, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed);
9736  if (g.ActiveId == 0 && activate_pressed)
9737  g.NavActivateId = g.NavId;
9738  if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && activate_down)
9739  g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavId;
9740  if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && activate_pressed)
9741  g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavId;
9742  if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Input, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed))
9743  g.NavInputId = g.NavId;
9744  }
9745  if (g.NavWindow && (g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
9746  g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
9747  if (g.NavActivateId != 0)
9748  IM_ASSERT(g.NavActivateDownId == g.NavActivateId);
9749  g.NavMoveRequest = false;
9750 
9751  // Process programmatic activation request
9752  if (g.NavNextActivateId != 0)
9753  g.NavActivateId = g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavInputId = g.NavNextActivateId;
9754  g.NavNextActivateId = 0;
9755 
9756  // Initiate directional inputs request
9757  if (g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_None)
9758  {
9759  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_None;
9760  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_None;
9761  if (g.NavWindow && !g.NavWindowingTarget && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
9762  {
9763  const ImGuiInputReadMode read_mode = ImGuiInputReadMode_Repeat;
9764  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Left) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_, read_mode))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Left; }
9765  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Right) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_, read_mode))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Right; }
9766  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Up) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_, read_mode))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up; }
9767  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Down) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_, read_mode))) { g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down; }
9768  }
9769  g.NavMoveClipDir = g.NavMoveDir;
9770  }
9771  else
9772  {
9773  // Forwarding previous request (which has been modified, e.g. wrap around menus rewrite the requests with a starting rectangle at the other side of the window)
9774  // (Preserve g.NavMoveRequestFlags, g.NavMoveClipDir which were set by the NavMoveRequestForward() function)
9775  IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveDir != ImGuiDir_None && g.NavMoveClipDir != ImGuiDir_None);
9776  IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_ForwardQueued);
9777  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavMoveRequestForward %d\n", g.NavMoveDir);
9778  g.NavMoveRequestForward = ImGuiNavForward_ForwardActive;
9779  }
9780 
9781  // Update PageUp/PageDown/Home/End scroll
9782  // FIXME-NAV: Consider enabling those keys even without the master ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard flag?
9783  float nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = 0.0f;
9784  if (nav_keyboard_active)
9785  nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = NavUpdatePageUpPageDown();
9786 
9787  // If we initiate a movement request and have no current NavId, we initiate a InitDefautRequest that will be used as a fallback if the direction fails to find a match
9788  if (g.NavMoveDir != ImGuiDir_None)
9789  {
9790  g.NavMoveRequest = true;
9791  g.NavMoveRequestKeyMods = io.KeyMods;
9792  g.NavMoveDirLast = g.NavMoveDir;
9793  }
9794  if (g.NavMoveRequest && g.NavId == 0)
9795  {
9796  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavInitRequest: from move, window \"%s\", layer=%d\n", g.NavWindow->Name, g.NavLayer);
9797  g.NavInitRequest = g.NavInitRequestFromMove = true;
9798  // Reassigning with same value, we're being explicit here.
9799  g.NavInitResultId = 0; // -V1048
9800  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9801  }
9802  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
9803 
9804  // Scrolling
9805  if (g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) && !g.NavWindowingTarget)
9806  {
9807  // *Fallback* manual-scroll with Nav directional keys when window has no navigable item
9808  ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
9809  const float scroll_speed = IM_ROUND(window->CalcFontSize() * 100 * io.DeltaTime); // We need round the scrolling speed because sub-pixel scroll isn't reliably supported.
9810  if (window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask == 0x00 && window->DC.NavHasScroll && g.NavMoveRequest)
9811  {
9812  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left || g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right)
9813  SetScrollX(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.x + ((g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left) ? -1.0f : +1.0f) * scroll_speed));
9814  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up || g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down)
9815  SetScrollY(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.y + ((g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? -1.0f : +1.0f) * scroll_speed));
9816  }
9817 
9818  // *Normal* Manual scroll with NavScrollXXX keys
9819  // Next movement request will clamp the NavId reference rectangle to the visible area, so navigation will resume within those bounds.
9820  ImVec2 scroll_dir = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadLStick, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down, 1.0f / 10.0f, 10.0f);
9821  if (scroll_dir.x != 0.0f && window->ScrollbarX)
9822  SetScrollX(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.x + scroll_dir.x * scroll_speed));
9823  if (scroll_dir.y != 0.0f)
9824  SetScrollY(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.y + scroll_dir.y * scroll_speed));
9825  }
9826 
9827  // Reset search results
9828  g.NavMoveResultLocal.Clear();
9829  g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet.Clear();
9830  g.NavMoveResultOther.Clear();
9831 
9832  // When using gamepad, we project the reference nav bounding box into window visible area.
9833  // This is to allow resuming navigation inside the visible area after doing a large amount of scrolling, since with gamepad every movements are relative
9834  // (can't focus a visible object like we can with the mouse).
9835  if (g.NavMoveRequest && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_NavGamepad && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
9836  {
9837  ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
9838  ImRect window_rect_rel(window->InnerRect.Min - window->Pos - ImVec2(1, 1), window->InnerRect.Max - window->Pos + ImVec2(1, 1));
9839  if (!window_rect_rel.Contains(window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer]))
9840  {
9841  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavMoveRequest: clamp NavRectRel\n");
9842  float pad = window->CalcFontSize() * 0.5f;
9843  window_rect_rel.Expand(ImVec2(-ImMin(window_rect_rel.GetWidth(), pad), -ImMin(window_rect_rel.GetHeight(), pad))); // Terrible approximation for the intent of starting navigation from first fully visible item
9844  window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer].ClipWithFull(window_rect_rel);
9845  g.NavId = g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
9846  }
9847  }
9848 
9849  // For scoring we use a single segment on the left side our current item bounding box (not touching the edge to avoid box overlap with zero-spaced items)
9850  ImRect nav_rect_rel = (g.NavWindow && !g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer].IsInverted()) ? g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer] : ImRect(0, 0, 0, 0);
9851  g.NavScoringRect = g.NavWindow ? ImRect(g.NavWindow->Pos + nav_rect_rel.Min, g.NavWindow->Pos + nav_rect_rel.Max) : ImRect(0, 0, 0, 0);
9852  g.NavScoringRect.TranslateY(nav_scoring_rect_offset_y);
9853  g.NavScoringRect.Min.x = ImMin(g.NavScoringRect.Min.x + 1.0f, g.NavScoringRect.Max.x);
9854  g.NavScoringRect.Max.x = g.NavScoringRect.Min.x;
9855  IM_ASSERT(!g.NavScoringRect.IsInverted()); // Ensure if we have a finite, non-inverted bounding box here will allows us to remove extraneous ImFabs() calls in NavScoreItem().
9856  //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(g.NavScoringRectScreen.Min, g.NavScoringRectScreen.Max, IM_COL32(255,200,0,255)); // [DEBUG]
9857  g.NavScoringCount = 0;
9858 #if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_RECTS
9859  if (g.NavWindow)
9860  {
9861  ImDrawList* draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(g.NavWindow);
9862  if (1) { for (int layer = 0; layer < 2; layer++) draw_list->AddRect(g.NavWindow->Pos + g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[layer].Min, g.NavWindow->Pos + g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[layer].Max, IM_COL32(255,200,0,255)); } // [DEBUG]
9863  if (1) { ImU32 col = (!g.NavWindow->Hidden) ? IM_COL32(255,0,255,255) : IM_COL32(255,0,0,255); ImVec2 p = NavCalcPreferredRefPos(); char buf[32]; ImFormatString(buf, 32, "%d", g.NavLayer); draw_list->AddCircleFilled(p, 3.0f, col); draw_list->AddText(NULL, 13.0f, p + ImVec2(8,-4), col, buf); }
9864  }
9865 #endif
9866 }
9867 
9868 static void ImGui::NavUpdateInitResult()
9869 {
9870  // In very rare cases g.NavWindow may be null (e.g. clearing focus after requesting an init request, which does happen when releasing Alt while clicking on void)
9871  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9872  if (!g.NavWindow)
9873  return;
9874 
9875  // Apply result from previous navigation init request (will typically select the first item, unless SetItemDefaultFocus() has been called)
9876  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavInitRequest: result NavID 0x%08X in Layer %d Window \"%s\"\n", g.NavInitResultId, g.NavLayer, g.NavWindow->Name);
9877  if (g.NavInitRequestFromMove)
9878  SetNavIDWithRectRel(g.NavInitResultId, g.NavLayer, 0, g.NavInitResultRectRel);
9879  else
9880  SetNavID(g.NavInitResultId, g.NavLayer, 0);
9881  g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer] = g.NavInitResultRectRel;
9882 }
9883 
9884 // Apply result from previous frame navigation directional move request
9885 static void ImGui::NavUpdateMoveResult()
9886 {
9887  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9888  if (g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID == 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID == 0)
9889  {
9890  // In a situation when there is no results but NavId != 0, re-enable the Navigation highlight (because g.NavId is not considered as a possible result)
9891  if (g.NavId != 0)
9892  {
9893  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9894  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
9895  }
9896  return;
9897  }
9898 
9899  // Select which result to use
9900  ImGuiNavMoveResult* result = (g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID != 0) ? &g.NavMoveResultLocal : &g.NavMoveResultOther;
9901 
9902  // PageUp/PageDown behavior first jumps to the bottom/top mostly visible item, _otherwise_ use the result from the previous/next page.
9903  if (g.NavMoveRequestFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet)
9904  if (g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet.ID != 0 && g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet.ID != g.NavId)
9905  result = &g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet;
9906 
9907  // Maybe entering a flattened child from the outside? In this case solve the tie using the regular scoring rules.
9908  if (result != &g.NavMoveResultOther && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID != 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.Window->ParentWindow == g.NavWindow)
9909  if ((g.NavMoveResultOther.DistBox < result->DistBox) || (g.NavMoveResultOther.DistBox == result->DistBox && g.NavMoveResultOther.DistCenter < result->DistCenter))
9910  result = &g.NavMoveResultOther;
9911  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow && result->Window);
9912 
9913  // Scroll to keep newly navigated item fully into view.
9914  if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
9915  {
9916  ImVec2 delta_scroll;
9917  if (g.NavMoveRequestFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdge)
9918  {
9919  float scroll_target = (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? result->Window->ScrollMax.y : 0.0f;
9920  delta_scroll.y = result->Window->Scroll.y - scroll_target;
9921  SetScrollY(result->Window, scroll_target);
9922  }
9923  else
9924  {
9925  ImRect rect_abs = ImRect(result->RectRel.Min + result->Window->Pos, result->RectRel.Max + result->Window->Pos);
9926  delta_scroll = ScrollToBringRectIntoView(result->Window, rect_abs);
9927  }
9928 
9929  // Offset our result position so mouse position can be applied immediately after in NavUpdate()
9930  result->RectRel.TranslateX(-delta_scroll.x);
9931  result->RectRel.TranslateY(-delta_scroll.y);
9932  }
9933 
9934  ClearActiveID();
9935  g.NavWindow = result->Window;
9936  if (g.NavId != result->ID)
9937  {
9938  // Don't set NavJustMovedToId if just landed on the same spot (which may happen with ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId)
9939  g.NavJustMovedToId = result->ID;
9940  g.NavJustMovedToFocusScopeId = result->FocusScopeId;
9941  g.NavJustMovedToKeyMods = g.NavMoveRequestKeyMods;
9942  }
9943  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavMoveRequest: result NavID 0x%08X in Layer %d Window \"%s\"\n", result->ID, g.NavLayer, g.NavWindow->Name);
9944  SetNavIDWithRectRel(result->ID, g.NavLayer, result->FocusScopeId, result->RectRel);
9945 }
9946 
9947 // Handle PageUp/PageDown/Home/End keys
9948 static float ImGui::NavUpdatePageUpPageDown()
9949 {
9950  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
9951  ImGuiIO& io = g.IO;
9952 
9953  if (g.NavMoveDir != ImGuiDir_None || g.NavWindow == NULL)
9954  return 0.0f;
9955  if ((g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) || g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL || g.NavLayer != ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
9956  return 0.0f;
9957 
9958  ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow;
9959  const bool page_up_held = IsKeyDown(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageUp]) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_PageUp);
9960  const bool page_down_held = IsKeyDown(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageDown]) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_PageDown);
9961  const bool home_pressed = IsKeyPressed(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_Home]) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_Home);
9962  const bool end_pressed = IsKeyPressed(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_End]) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_End);
9963  if (page_up_held != page_down_held || home_pressed != end_pressed) // If either (not both) are pressed
9964  {
9965  if (window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask == 0x00 && window->DC.NavHasScroll)
9966  {
9967  // Fallback manual-scroll when window has no navigable item
9968  if (IsKeyPressed(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageUp], true))
9969  SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y - window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
9970  else if (IsKeyPressed(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageDown], true))
9971  SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y + window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
9972  else if (home_pressed)
9973  SetScrollY(window, 0.0f);
9974  else if (end_pressed)
9975  SetScrollY(window, window->ScrollMax.y);
9976  }
9977  else
9978  {
9979  ImRect& nav_rect_rel = window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer];
9980  const float page_offset_y = ImMax(0.0f, window->InnerRect.GetHeight() - window->CalcFontSize() * 1.0f + nav_rect_rel.GetHeight());
9981  float nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = 0.0f;
9982  if (IsKeyPressed(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageUp], true))
9983  {
9984  nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = -page_offset_y;
9985  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down; // Because our scoring rect is offset up, we request the down direction (so we can always land on the last item)
9986  g.NavMoveClipDir = ImGuiDir_Up;
9987  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet;
9988  }
9989  else if (IsKeyPressed(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageDown], true))
9990  {
9991  nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = +page_offset_y;
9992  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up; // Because our scoring rect is offset down, we request the up direction (so we can always land on the last item)
9993  g.NavMoveClipDir = ImGuiDir_Down;
9994  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet;
9995  }
9996  else if (home_pressed)
9997  {
9998  // FIXME-NAV: handling of Home/End is assuming that the top/bottom most item will be visible with Scroll.y == 0/ScrollMax.y
9999  // Scrolling will be handled via the ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdge flag, we don't scroll immediately to avoid scrolling happening before nav result.
10000  // Preserve current horizontal position if we have any.
10001  nav_rect_rel.Min.y = nav_rect_rel.Max.y = -window->Scroll.y;
10002  if (nav_rect_rel.IsInverted())
10003  nav_rect_rel.Min.x = nav_rect_rel.Max.x = 0.0f;
10004  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down;
10005  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdge;
10006  }
10007  else if (end_pressed)
10008  {
10009  nav_rect_rel.Min.y = nav_rect_rel.Max.y = window->ScrollMax.y + window->SizeFull.y - window->Scroll.y;
10010  if (nav_rect_rel.IsInverted())
10011  nav_rect_rel.Min.x = nav_rect_rel.Max.x = 0.0f;
10012  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up;
10013  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdge;
10014  }
10015  return nav_scoring_rect_offset_y;
10016  }
10017  }
10018  return 0.0f;
10019 }
10020 
10021 static void ImGui::NavEndFrame()
10022 {
10023  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10024 
10025  // Show CTRL+TAB list window
10026  if (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL)
10027  NavUpdateWindowingOverlay();
10028 
10029  // Perform wrap-around in menus
10030  ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWrapRequestWindow;
10031  ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags = g.NavWrapRequestFlags;
