10032  if (window != NULL && g.NavWindow == window && NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet() && g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_None && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
10033  {
10034  IM_ASSERT(move_flags != 0); // No points calling this with no wrapping
10035  ImRect bb_rel = window->NavRectRel[0];
10036 
10037  ImGuiDir clip_dir = g.NavMoveDir;
10038  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX)))
10039  {
10040  bb_rel.Min.x = bb_rel.Max.x =
10041  ImMax(window->SizeFull.x, window->ContentSize.x + window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f) - window->Scroll.x;
10042  if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX)
10043  {
10044  bb_rel.TranslateY(-bb_rel.GetHeight());
10045  clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Up;
10046  }
10047  NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, bb_rel, move_flags);
10048  }
10049  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX)))
10050  {
10051  bb_rel.Min.x = bb_rel.Max.x = -window->Scroll.x;
10052  if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX)
10053  {
10054  bb_rel.TranslateY(+bb_rel.GetHeight());
10055  clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Down;
10056  }
10057  NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, bb_rel, move_flags);
10058  }
10059  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY)))
10060  {
10061  bb_rel.Min.y = bb_rel.Max.y =
10062  ImMax(window->SizeFull.y, window->ContentSize.y + window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f) - window->Scroll.y;
10063  if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY)
10064  {
10065  bb_rel.TranslateX(-bb_rel.GetWidth());
10066  clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Left;
10067  }
10068  NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, bb_rel, move_flags);
10069  }
10070  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY)))
10071  {
10072  bb_rel.Min.y = bb_rel.Max.y = -window->Scroll.y;
10073  if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY)
10074  {
10075  bb_rel.TranslateX(+bb_rel.GetWidth());
10076  clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Right;
10077  }
10078  NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, bb_rel, move_flags);
10079  }
10080  }
10081 }
10082 
10083 static int ImGui::FindWindowFocusIndex(ImGuiWindow* window) // FIXME-OPT O(N)
10084 {
10085  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10086  for (int i = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
10087  if (g.WindowsFocusOrder[i] == window)
10088  return i;
10089  return -1;
10090 }
10091 
10092 static ImGuiWindow* FindWindowNavFocusable(int i_start, int i_stop, int dir) // FIXME-OPT O(N)
10093 {
10094  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10095  for (int i = i_start; i >= 0 && i < g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size && i != i_stop; i += dir)
10096  if (ImGui::IsWindowNavFocusable(g.WindowsFocusOrder[i]))
10097  return g.WindowsFocusOrder[i];
10098  return NULL;
10099 }
10100 
10101 static void NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(int focus_change_dir)
10102 {
10103  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10104  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindowingTarget);
10105  if (g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
10106  return;
10107 
10108  const int i_current = ImGui::FindWindowFocusIndex(g.NavWindowingTarget);
10109  ImGuiWindow* window_target = FindWindowNavFocusable(i_current + focus_change_dir, -INT_MAX, focus_change_dir);
10110  if (!window_target)
10111  window_target = FindWindowNavFocusable((focus_change_dir < 0) ? (g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1) : 0, i_current, focus_change_dir);
10112  if (window_target) // Don't reset windowing target if there's a single window in the list
10113  g.NavWindowingTarget = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = window_target;
10114  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
10115 }
10116 
10117 // Windowing management mode
10118 // Keyboard: CTRL+Tab (change focus/move/resize), Alt (toggle menu layer)
10119 // Gamepad: Hold Menu/Square (change focus/move/resize), Tap Menu/Square (toggle menu layer)
10120 static void ImGui::NavUpdateWindowing()
10121 {
10122  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10123  ImGuiWindow* apply_focus_window = NULL;
10124  bool apply_toggle_layer = false;
10125 
10126  ImGuiWindow* modal_window = GetTopMostPopupModal();
10127  bool allow_windowing = (modal_window == NULL);
10128  if (!allow_windowing)
10129  g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
10130 
10131  // Fade out
10132  if (g.NavWindowingTargetAnim && g.NavWindowingTarget == NULL)
10133  {
10134  g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha - g.IO.DeltaTime * 10.0f, 0.0f);
10135  if (g.DimBgRatio <= 0.0f && g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha <= 0.0f)
10136  g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = NULL;
10137  }
10138 
10139  // Start CTRL-TAB or Square+L/R window selection
10140  bool start_windowing_with_gamepad = allow_windowing && !g.NavWindowingTarget && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Menu, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed);
10141  bool start_windowing_with_keyboard = allow_windowing && !g.NavWindowingTarget && g.IO.KeyCtrl && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Tab) && (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard);
10142  if (start_windowing_with_gamepad || start_windowing_with_keyboard)
10143  if (ImGuiWindow* window = g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow : FindWindowNavFocusable(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1, -INT_MAX, -1))
10144  {
10145  g.NavWindowingTarget = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = window->RootWindowDockStop;
10146  g.NavWindowingTimer = g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = 0.0f;
10147  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = start_windowing_with_keyboard ? false : true;
10148  g.NavInputSource = start_windowing_with_keyboard ? ImGuiInputSource_NavKeyboard : ImGuiInputSource_NavGamepad;
10149  }
10150 
10151  // Gamepad update
10152  g.NavWindowingTimer += g.IO.DeltaTime;
10153  if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_NavGamepad)
10154  {
10155  // Highlight only appears after a brief time holding the button, so that a fast tap on PadMenu (to toggle NavLayer) doesn't add visual noise
10156  g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha, ImSaturate((g.NavWindowingTimer - NAV_WINDOWING_HIGHLIGHT_DELAY) / 0.05f));
10157 
10158  // Select window to focus
10159  const int focus_change_dir = (int)IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_FocusPrev, ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatSlow) - (int)IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_FocusNext, ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatSlow);
10160  if (focus_change_dir != 0)
10161  {
10162  NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(focus_change_dir);
10163  g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = 1.0f;
10164  }
10165 
10166  // Single press toggles NavLayer, long press with L/R apply actual focus on release (until then the window was merely rendered top-most)
10167  if (!IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_Menu))
10168  {
10169  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer &= (g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha < 1.0f); // Once button was held long enough we don't consider it a tap-to-toggle-layer press anymore.
10170  if (g.NavWindowingToggleLayer && g.NavWindow)
10171  apply_toggle_layer = true;
10172  else if (!g.NavWindowingToggleLayer)
10173  apply_focus_window = g.NavWindowingTarget;
10174  g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
10175  }
10176  }
10177 
10178  // Keyboard: Focus
10179  if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_NavKeyboard)
10180  {
10181  // Visuals only appears after a brief time after pressing TAB the first time, so that a fast CTRL+TAB doesn't add visual noise
10182  g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha, ImSaturate((g.NavWindowingTimer - NAV_WINDOWING_HIGHLIGHT_DELAY) / 0.05f)); // 1.0f
10183  if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Tab, true))
10184  NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(g.IO.KeyShift ? +1 : -1);
10185  if (!g.IO.KeyCtrl)
10186  apply_focus_window = g.NavWindowingTarget;
10187  }
10188 
10189  // Keyboard: Press and Release ALT to toggle menu layer
10190  // FIXME: We lack an explicit IO variable for "is the imgui window focused", so compare mouse validity to detect the common case of backend clearing releases all keys on ALT-TAB
10191  if (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyMenu_, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed))
10192  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = true;
10193  if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap) && g.NavWindowingToggleLayer && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyMenu_, ImGuiInputReadMode_Released))
10194  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) == IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePosPrev))
10195  apply_toggle_layer = true;
10196 
10197  // Move window
10198  if (g.NavWindowingTarget && !(g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove))
10199  {
10200  ImVec2 move_delta;
10201  if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_NavKeyboard && !g.IO.KeyShift)
10202  move_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_Keyboard, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
10203  if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_NavGamepad)
10204  move_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadLStick, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
10205  if (move_delta.x != 0.0f || move_delta.y != 0.0f)
10206  {
10207  const float NAV_MOVE_SPEED = 800.0f;
10208  const float move_speed = ImFloor(NAV_MOVE_SPEED * g.IO.DeltaTime * ImMin(g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.x, g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.y)); // FIXME: Doesn't handle variable framerate very well
10209  ImGuiWindow* moving_window = g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindow;
10210  SetWindowPos(moving_window, moving_window->Pos + move_delta * move_speed, ImGuiCond_Always);
10211  MarkIniSettingsDirty(moving_window);
10212  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
10213  }
10214  }
10215 
10216  // Apply final focus
10217  if (apply_focus_window && (g.NavWindow == NULL || apply_focus_window != g.NavWindow->RootWindowDockStop))
10218  {
10219  ImGuiViewport* previous_viewport = g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow->Viewport : NULL;
10220  ClearActiveID();
10221  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
10222  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
10223  apply_focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(apply_focus_window);
10224  ClosePopupsOverWindow(apply_focus_window, false);
10225  FocusWindow(apply_focus_window);
10226  if (apply_focus_window->NavLastIds[0] == 0)
10227  NavInitWindow(apply_focus_window, false);
10228 
10229  // If the window only has a menu layer, select it directly
10230  if (apply_focus_window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask == (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu))
10231  g.NavLayer = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
10232 
10233  // Request OS level focus
10234  if (apply_focus_window->Viewport != previous_viewport && g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowFocus)
10235  g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowFocus(apply_focus_window->Viewport);
10236  }
10237  if (apply_focus_window)
10238  g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
10239 
10240  // Apply menu/layer toggle
10241  if (apply_toggle_layer && g.NavWindow)
10242  {
10243  // Move to parent menu if necessary
10244  ImGuiWindow* new_nav_window = g.NavWindow;
10245  while (new_nav_window->ParentWindow
10246  && (new_nav_window->DC.NavLayerActiveMask & (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu)) == 0
10247  && (new_nav_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) != 0
10248  && (new_nav_window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)) == 0)
10249  new_nav_window = new_nav_window->ParentWindow;
10250  if (new_nav_window != g.NavWindow)
10251  {
10252  ImGuiWindow* old_nav_window = g.NavWindow;
10253  FocusWindow(new_nav_window);
10254  new_nav_window->NavLastChildNavWindow = old_nav_window;
10255  }
10256  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
10257  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
10258 
10259  // When entering a regular menu bar with the Alt key, we always reinitialize the navigation ID. It however persist on docking tab tabs.
10260  const ImGuiNavLayer new_nav_layer = (g.NavWindow->DC.NavLayerActiveMask & (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu)) ? (ImGuiNavLayer)((int)g.NavLayer ^ 1) : ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
10261  const bool preserve_layer_1_nav_id = (new_nav_window->DockNodeAsHost != NULL);
10262  if (new_nav_layer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu && !preserve_layer_1_nav_id)
10263  g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[ImGuiNavLayer_Menu] = 0;
10264  NavRestoreLayer(new_nav_layer);
10265  }
10266 }
10267 
10268 // Window has already passed the IsWindowNavFocusable()
10269 static const char* GetFallbackWindowNameForWindowingList(ImGuiWindow* window)
10270 {
10271  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
10272  return "(Popup)";
10273  if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) && strcmp(window->Name, "##MainMenuBar") == 0)
10274  return "(Main menu bar)";
10275  if (window->DockNodeAsHost)
10276  return "(Dock node)";
10277  return "(Untitled)";
10278 }
10279 
10280 // Overlay displayed when using CTRL+TAB. Called by EndFrame().
10281 void ImGui::NavUpdateWindowingOverlay()
10282 {
10283  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10284  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL);
10285 
10286  if (g.NavWindowingTimer < NAV_WINDOWING_LIST_APPEAR_DELAY)
10287  return;
10288 
10289  if (g.NavWindowingListWindow == NULL)
10290  g.NavWindowingListWindow = FindWindowByName("###NavWindowingList");
10291  const ImGuiViewport* viewport = /*g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow->Viewport :*/ GetMainViewport();
10292  SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(viewport->Size.x * 0.20f, viewport->Size.y * 0.20f), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX));
10293  SetNextWindowPos(viewport->GetCenter(), ImGuiCond_Always, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
10294  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, g.Style.WindowPadding * 2.0f);
10295  Begin("###NavWindowingList", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
10296  for (int n = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
10297  {
10298  ImGuiWindow* window = g.WindowsFocusOrder[n];
10299  if (!IsWindowNavFocusable(window))
10300  continue;
10301  const char* label = window->Name;
10302  if (label == FindRenderedTextEnd(label))
10303  label = GetFallbackWindowNameForWindowingList(window);
10304  Selectable(label, g.NavWindowingTarget == window);
10305  }
10306  End();
10307  PopStyleVar();
10308 }
10309 
10310 
10311 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10312 // [SECTION] DRAG AND DROP
10313 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10314 
10315 void ImGui::ClearDragDrop()
10316 {
10317  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10318  g.DragDropActive = false;
10319  g.DragDropPayload.Clear();
10320  g.DragDropAcceptFlags = ImGuiDragDropFlags_None;
10321  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev = 0;
10322  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = FLT_MAX;
10323  g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount = -1;
10324 
10325  g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.clear();
10326  memset(&g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal, 0, sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal));
10327 }
10328 
10329 // Call when current ID is active.
10330 // When this returns true you need to: a) call SetDragDropPayload() exactly once, b) you may render the payload visual/description, c) call EndDragDropSource()
10331 bool ImGui::BeginDragDropSource(ImGuiDragDropFlags flags)
10332 {
10333  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10334  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10335 
10336  bool source_drag_active = false;
10337  ImGuiID source_id = 0;
10338  ImGuiID source_parent_id = 0;
10339  ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button = ImGuiMouseButton_Left;
10340  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern))
10341  {
10342  source_id = window->DC.LastItemId;
10343  if (source_id != 0 && g.ActiveId != source_id) // Early out for most common case
10344  return false;
10345  if (g.IO.MouseDown[mouse_button] == false)
10346  return false;
10347 
10348  if (source_id == 0)
10349  {
10350  // If you want to use BeginDragDropSource() on an item with no unique identifier for interaction, such as Text() or Image(), you need to:
10351  // A) Read the explanation below, B) Use the ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID flag, C) Swallow your programmer pride.
10352  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID))
10353  {
10354  IM_ASSERT(0);
10355  return false;
10356  }
10357 
10358  // Early out
10359  if ((window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect) == 0 && (g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveIdWindow != window))
10360  return false;
10361 
10362  // Magic fallback (=somehow reprehensible) to handle items with no assigned ID, e.g. Text(), Image()
10363  // We build a throwaway ID based on current ID stack + relative AABB of items in window.
10364  // THE IDENTIFIER WON'T SURVIVE ANY REPOSITIONING OF THE WIDGET, so if your widget moves your dragging operation will be canceled.
10365  // We don't need to maintain/call ClearActiveID() as releasing the button will early out this function and trigger !ActiveIdIsAlive.
10366  source_id = window->DC.LastItemId = window->GetIDFromRectangle(window->DC.LastItemRect);
10367  bool is_hovered = ItemHoverable(window->DC.LastItemRect, source_id);
10368  if (is_hovered && g.IO.MouseClicked[mouse_button])
10369  {
10370  SetActiveID(source_id, window);
10371  FocusWindow(window);
10372  }
10373  if (g.ActiveId == source_id) // Allow the underlying widget to display/return hovered during the mouse release frame, else we would get a flicker.
10374  g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = is_hovered;
10375  }
10376  else
10377  {
10378  g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = false;
10379  }
10380  if (g.ActiveId != source_id)
10381  return false;
10382  source_parent_id = window->IDStack.back();
10383  source_drag_active = IsMouseDragging(mouse_button);
10384 
10385  // Disable navigation and key inputs while dragging
10386  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = ~(ImU32)0;
10387  g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = ~(ImU32)0;
10388  g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask = ~(ImU64)0;
10389  }
10390  else
10391  {
10392  window = NULL;
10393  source_id = ImHashStr("#SourceExtern");
10394  source_drag_active = true;
10395  }
10396 
10397  if (source_drag_active)
10398  {
10399  if (!g.DragDropActive)
10400  {
10401  IM_ASSERT(source_id != 0);
10402  ClearDragDrop();
10403  ImGuiPayload& payload = g.DragDropPayload;
10404  payload.SourceId = source_id;
10405  payload.SourceParentId = source_parent_id;
10406  g.DragDropActive = true;
10407  g.DragDropSourceFlags = flags;
10408  g.DragDropMouseButton = mouse_button;
10409  if (payload.SourceId == g.ActiveId)
10410  g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss = true;
10411  }
10412  g.DragDropSourceFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
10413  g.DragDropWithinSource = true;
10414 
10415  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
10416  {
10417  // Target can request the Source to not display its tooltip (we use a dedicated flag to make this request explicit)
10418  // We unfortunately can't just modify the source flags and skip the call to BeginTooltip, as caller may be emitting contents.
10419  BeginTooltip();
10420  if (g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev && (g.DragDropAcceptFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewTooltip))
10421  {
10422  ImGuiWindow* tooltip_window = g.CurrentWindow;
10423  tooltip_window->SkipItems = true;
10424  tooltip_window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
10425  }
10426  }
10427 
10428  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover) && !(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern))
10429  window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags &= ~ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect;
10430 
10431  return true;
10432  }
10433  return false;
10434 }
10435 
10436 void ImGui::EndDragDropSource()
10437 {
10438  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10439  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive);
10440  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinSource && "Not after a BeginDragDropSource()?");
10441 
10442  if (!(g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
10443  EndTooltip();
10444 
10445  // Discard the drag if have not called SetDragDropPayload()
10446  if (g.DragDropPayload.DataFrameCount == -1)
10447  ClearDragDrop();
10448  g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
10449 }
10450 
10451 // Use 'cond' to choose to submit payload on drag start or every frame
10452 bool ImGui::SetDragDropPayload(const char* type, const void* data, size_t data_size, ImGuiCond cond)
10453 {
10454  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10455  ImGuiPayload& payload = g.DragDropPayload;
10456  if (cond == 0)
10457  cond = ImGuiCond_Always;
10458 
10459  IM_ASSERT(type != NULL);
10460  IM_ASSERT(strlen(type) < IM_ARRAYSIZE(payload.DataType) && "Payload type can be at most 32 characters long");
10461  IM_ASSERT((data != NULL && data_size > 0) || (data == NULL && data_size == 0));
10462  IM_ASSERT(cond == ImGuiCond_Always || cond == ImGuiCond_Once);
10463  IM_ASSERT(payload.SourceId != 0); // Not called between BeginDragDropSource() and EndDragDropSource()
10464 
10465  if (cond == ImGuiCond_Always || payload.DataFrameCount == -1)
10466  {
10467  // Copy payload
10468  ImStrncpy(payload.DataType, type, IM_ARRAYSIZE(payload.DataType));
10469  g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.resize(0);
10470  if (data_size > sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal))
10471  {
10472  // Store in heap
10473  g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.resize((int)data_size);
10474  payload.Data = g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.Data;
10475  memcpy(payload.Data, data, data_size);
10476  }
10477  else if (data_size > 0)
10478  {
10479  // Store locally
10480  memset(&g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal, 0, sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal));
10481  payload.Data = g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal;
10482  memcpy(payload.Data, data, data_size);
10483  }
10484  else
10485  {
10486  payload.Data = NULL;
10487  }
10488  payload.DataSize = (int)data_size;
10489  }
10490  payload.DataFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
10491 
10492  return (g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount == g.FrameCount) || (g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount == g.FrameCount - 1);
10493 }
10494 
10495 bool ImGui::BeginDragDropTargetCustom(const ImRect& bb, ImGuiID id)
10496 {
10497  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10498  if (!g.DragDropActive)
10499  return false;
10500 
10501  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10502  ImGuiWindow* hovered_window = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow;
10503  if (hovered_window == NULL || window->RootWindow != hovered_window->RootWindow)
10504  return false;
10505  IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
10506  if (!IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max) || (id == g.DragDropPayload.SourceId))
10507  return false;
10508  if (window->SkipItems)
10509  return false;
10510 
10511  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget == false);
10512  g.DragDropTargetRect = bb;
10513  g.DragDropTargetId = id;
10514  g.DragDropWithinTarget = true;
10515  return true;
10516 }
10517 
10518 // We don't use BeginDragDropTargetCustom() and duplicate its code because:
10519 // 1) we use LastItemRectHoveredRect which handles items that pushes a temporarily clip rectangle in their code. Calling BeginDragDropTargetCustom(LastItemRect) would not handle them.
10520 // 2) and it's faster. as this code may be very frequently called, we want to early out as fast as we can.
10521 // Also note how the HoveredWindow test is positioned differently in both functions (in both functions we optimize for the cheapest early out case)
10522 bool ImGui::BeginDragDropTarget()
10523 {
10524  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10525  if (!g.DragDropActive)
10526  return false;
10527 
10528  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10529  if (!(window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect))
10530  return false;
10531  ImGuiWindow* hovered_window = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow;
10532  if (hovered_window == NULL || window->RootWindow != hovered_window->RootWindow)
10533  return false;
10534 
10535  const ImRect& display_rect = (window->DC.LastItemStatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect) ? window->DC.LastItemDisplayRect : window->DC.LastItemRect;
10536  ImGuiID id = window->DC.LastItemId;
10537  if (id == 0)
10538  id = window->GetIDFromRectangle(display_rect);
10539  if (g.DragDropPayload.SourceId == id)
10540  return false;
10541 
10542  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget == false);
10543  g.DragDropTargetRect = display_rect;
10544  g.DragDropTargetId = id;
10545  g.DragDropWithinTarget = true;
10546  return true;
10547 }
10548 
10549 bool ImGui::IsDragDropPayloadBeingAccepted()
10550 {
10551  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10552  return g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev != 0;
10553 }
10554 
10555 const ImGuiPayload* ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload(const char* type, ImGuiDragDropFlags flags)
10556 {
10557  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10558  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10559  ImGuiPayload& payload = g.DragDropPayload;
10560  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive); // Not called between BeginDragDropTarget() and EndDragDropTarget() ?
10561  IM_ASSERT(payload.DataFrameCount != -1); // Forgot to call EndDragDropTarget() ?
10562  if (type != NULL && !payload.IsDataType(type))
10563  return NULL;
10564 
10565  // Accept smallest drag target bounding box, this allows us to nest drag targets conveniently without ordering constraints.
10566  // NB: We currently accept NULL id as target. However, overlapping targets requires a unique ID to function!
10567  const bool was_accepted_previously = (g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev == g.DragDropTargetId);
10568  ImRect r = g.DragDropTargetRect;
10569  float r_surface = r.GetWidth() * r.GetHeight();
10570  if (r_surface <= g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface)
10571  {
10572  g.DragDropAcceptFlags = flags;
10573  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = g.DragDropTargetId;
10574  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = r_surface;
10575  }
10576 
10577  // Render default drop visuals
10578  payload.Preview = was_accepted_previously;
10579  flags |= (g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect); // Source can also inhibit the preview (useful for external sources that lives for 1 frame)
10580  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect) && payload.Preview)
10581  {
10582  // FIXME-DRAG: Settle on a proper default visuals for drop target.
10583  r.Expand(3.5f);
10584  bool push_clip_rect = !window->ClipRect.Contains(r);
10585  if (push_clip_rect) window->DrawList->PushClipRect(r.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), r.Max + ImVec2(1, 1));
10586  window->DrawList->AddRect(r.Min, r.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_DragDropTarget), 0.0f, ~0, 2.0f);
10587  if (push_clip_rect) window->DrawList->PopClipRect();
10588  }
10589 
10590  g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
10591  payload.Delivery = was_accepted_previously && !IsMouseDown(g.DragDropMouseButton); // For extern drag sources affecting os window focus, it's easier to just test !IsMouseDown() instead of IsMouseReleased()
10592  if (!payload.Delivery && !(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery))
10593  return NULL;
10594 
10595  return &payload;
10596 }
10597 
10598 const ImGuiPayload* ImGui::GetDragDropPayload()
10599 {
10600  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10601  return g.DragDropActive ? &g.DragDropPayload : NULL;
10602 }
10603 
10604 // We don't really use/need this now, but added it for the sake of consistency and because we might need it later.
10605 void ImGui::EndDragDropTarget()
10606 {
10607  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10608  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive);
10609  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget);
10610  g.DragDropWithinTarget = false;
10611 }
10612 
10613 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10614 // [SECTION] LOGGING/CAPTURING
10615 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10616 // All text output from the interface can be captured into tty/file/clipboard.
10617 // By default, tree nodes are automatically opened during logging.
10618 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10619 
10620 // Pass text data straight to log (without being displayed)
10621 void ImGui::LogText(const char* fmt, ...)
10622 {
10623  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10624  if (!g.LogEnabled)
10625  return;
10626 
10627  va_list args;
10628  va_start(args, fmt);
10629  if (g.LogFile)
10630  {
10631  g.LogBuffer.Buf.resize(0);
10632  g.LogBuffer.appendfv(fmt, args);
10633  ImFileWrite(g.LogBuffer.c_str(), sizeof(char), (ImU64)g.LogBuffer.size(), g.LogFile);
10634  }
10635  else
10636  {
10637  g.LogBuffer.appendfv(fmt, args);
10638  }
10639  va_end(args);
10640 }
10641 
10642 // Internal version that takes a position to decide on newline placement and pad items according to their depth.
10643 // We split text into individual lines to add current tree level padding
10644 // FIXME: This code is a little complicated perhaps, considering simplifying the whole system.
10645 void ImGui::LogRenderedText(const ImVec2* ref_pos, const char* text, const char* text_end)
10646 {
10647  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10648  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10649 
10650  const char* prefix = g.LogNextPrefix;
10651  const char* suffix = g.LogNextSuffix;
10652  g.LogNextPrefix = g.LogNextSuffix = NULL;
10653 
10654  if (!text_end)
10655  text_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end);
10656 
10657  const bool log_new_line = ref_pos && (ref_pos->y > g.LogLinePosY + g.Style.FramePadding.y + 1);
10658  if (ref_pos)
10659  g.LogLinePosY = ref_pos->y;
10660  if (log_new_line)
10661  {
10662  LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
10663  g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
10664  }
10665 
10666  if (prefix)
10667  LogRenderedText(ref_pos, prefix, prefix + strlen(prefix)); // Calculate end ourself to ensure "##" are included here.
10668 
10669  // Re-adjust padding if we have popped out of our starting depth
10670  if (g.LogDepthRef > window->DC.TreeDepth)
10671  g.LogDepthRef = window->DC.TreeDepth;
10672  const int tree_depth = (window->DC.TreeDepth - g.LogDepthRef);
10673 
10674  const char* text_remaining = text;
10675  for (;;)
10676  {
10677  // Split the string. Each new line (after a '\n') is followed by indentation corresponding to the current depth of our log entry.
10678  // We don't add a trailing \n yet to allow a subsequent item on the same line to be captured.
10679  const char* line_start = text_remaining;
10680  const char* line_end = ImStreolRange(line_start, text_end);
10681  const bool is_last_line = (line_end == text_end);
10682  if (line_start != line_end || !is_last_line)
10683  {
10684  const int line_length = (int)(line_end - line_start);
10685  const int indentation = g.LogLineFirstItem ? tree_depth * 4 : 1;
10686  LogText("%*s%.*s", indentation, "", line_length, line_start);
10687  g.LogLineFirstItem = false;
10688  if (*line_end == '\n')
10689  {
10690  LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
10691  g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
10692  }
10693  }
10694  if (is_last_line)
10695  break;
10696  text_remaining = line_end + 1;
10697  }
10698 
10699  if (suffix)
10700  LogRenderedText(ref_pos, suffix, suffix + strlen(suffix));
10701 }
10702 
10703 // Start logging/capturing text output
10704 void ImGui::LogBegin(ImGuiLogType type, int auto_open_depth)
10705 {
10706  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10707  ImGuiWindow* window = g.CurrentWindow;
10708  IM_ASSERT(g.LogEnabled == false);
10709  IM_ASSERT(g.LogFile == NULL);
10710  IM_ASSERT(g.LogBuffer.empty());
10711  g.LogEnabled = true;
10712  g.LogType = type;
10713  g.LogNextPrefix = g.LogNextSuffix = NULL;
10714  g.LogDepthRef = window->DC.TreeDepth;
10715  g.LogDepthToExpand = ((auto_open_depth >= 0) ? auto_open_depth : g.LogDepthToExpandDefault);
10716  g.LogLinePosY = FLT_MAX;
10717  g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
10718 }
10719 
10720 // Important: doesn't copy underlying data, use carefully (prefix/suffix must be in scope at the time of the next LogRenderedText)
10721 void ImGui::LogSetNextTextDecoration(const char* prefix, const char* suffix)
10722 {
10723  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10724  g.LogNextPrefix = prefix;
10725  g.LogNextSuffix = suffix;
10726 }
10727 
10728 void ImGui::LogToTTY(int auto_open_depth)
10729 {
10730  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10731  if (g.LogEnabled)
10732  return;
10733  IM_UNUSED(auto_open_depth);
10734 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
10735  LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_TTY, auto_open_depth);
10736  g.LogFile = stdout;
10737 #endif
10738 }
10739 
10740 // Start logging/capturing text output to given file
10741 void ImGui::LogToFile(int auto_open_depth, const char* filename)
10742 {
10743  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10744  if (g.LogEnabled)
10745  return;
10746 
10747  // FIXME: We could probably open the file in text mode "at", however note that clipboard/buffer logging will still
10748  // be subject to outputting OS-incompatible carriage return if within strings the user doesn't use IM_NEWLINE.
10749  // By opening the file in binary mode "ab" we have consistent output everywhere.
10750  if (!filename)
10751  filename = g.IO.LogFilename;
10752  if (!filename || !filename[0])
10753  return;
10754  ImFileHandle f = ImFileOpen(filename, "ab");
10755  if (!f)
10756  {
10757  IM_ASSERT(0);
10758  return;
10759  }
10760 
10761  LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_File, auto_open_depth);
10762  g.LogFile = f;
10763 }
10764 
10765 // Start logging/capturing text output to clipboard
10766 void ImGui::LogToClipboard(int auto_open_depth)
10767 {
10768  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10769  if (g.LogEnabled)
10770  return;
10771  LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_Clipboard, auto_open_depth);
10772 }
10773 
10774 void ImGui::LogToBuffer(int auto_open_depth)
10775 {
10776  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10777  if (g.LogEnabled)
10778  return;
10779  LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_Buffer, auto_open_depth);
10780 }
10781 
10782 void ImGui::LogFinish()
10783 {
10784  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10785  if (!g.LogEnabled)
10786  return;
10787 
10788  LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
10789  switch (g.LogType)
10790  {
10791  case ImGuiLogType_TTY:
10792 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
10793  fflush(g.LogFile);
10794 #endif
10795  break;
10796  case ImGuiLogType_File:
10797  ImFileClose(g.LogFile);
10798  break;
10799  case ImGuiLogType_Buffer:
10800  break;
10801  case ImGuiLogType_Clipboard:
10802  if (!g.LogBuffer.empty())
10803  SetClipboardText(g.LogBuffer.begin());
10804  break;
10805  case ImGuiLogType_None:
10806  IM_ASSERT(0);
10807  break;
10808  }
10809 
10810  g.LogEnabled = false;
10811  g.LogType = ImGuiLogType_None;
10812  g.LogFile = NULL;
10813  g.LogBuffer.clear();
10814 }
10815 
10816 // Helper to display logging buttons
10817 // FIXME-OBSOLETE: We should probably obsolete this and let the user have their own helper (this is one of the oldest function alive!)
10818 void ImGui::LogButtons()
10819 {
10820  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10821 
10822  PushID("LogButtons");
10823 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
10824  const bool log_to_tty = Button("Log To TTY"); SameLine();
10825 #else
10826  const bool log_to_tty = false;
10827 #endif
10828  const bool log_to_file = Button("Log To File"); SameLine();
10829  const bool log_to_clipboard = Button("Log To Clipboard"); SameLine();
10830  PushAllowKeyboardFocus(false);
10831  SetNextItemWidth(80.0f);
10832  SliderInt("Default Depth", &g.LogDepthToExpandDefault, 0, 9, NULL);
10833  PopAllowKeyboardFocus();
10834  PopID();
10835 
10836  // Start logging at the end of the function so that the buttons don't appear in the log
10837  if (log_to_tty)
10838  LogToTTY();
10839  if (log_to_file)
10840  LogToFile();
10841  if (log_to_clipboard)
10842  LogToClipboard();
10843 }
10844 
10845 
10846 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10847 // [SECTION] SETTINGS
10848 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10849 // - UpdateSettings() [Internal]
10850 // - MarkIniSettingsDirty() [Internal]
10851 // - CreateNewWindowSettings() [Internal]
10852 // - FindWindowSettings() [Internal]
10853 // - FindOrCreateWindowSettings() [Internal]
10854 // - FindSettingsHandler() [Internal]
10855 // - ClearIniSettings() [Internal]
10856 // - LoadIniSettingsFromDisk()
10857 // - LoadIniSettingsFromMemory()
10858 // - SaveIniSettingsToDisk()
10859 // - SaveIniSettingsToMemory()
10860 // - WindowSettingsHandler_***() [Internal]
10861 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10862 
10863 // Called by NewFrame()
10864 void ImGui::UpdateSettings()
10865 {
10866  // Load settings on first frame (if not explicitly loaded manually before)
10867  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10868  if (!g.SettingsLoaded)
10869  {
10870  IM_ASSERT(g.SettingsWindows.empty());
10871  if (g.IO.IniFilename)
10872  LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
10873  g.SettingsLoaded = true;
10874  }
10875 
10876  // Save settings (with a delay after the last modification, so we don't spam disk too much)
10877  if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer > 0.0f)
10878  {
10879  g.SettingsDirtyTimer -= g.IO.DeltaTime;
10880  if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
10881  {
10882  if (g.IO.IniFilename != NULL)
10883  SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
10884  else
10885  g.IO.WantSaveIniSettings = true; // Let user know they can call SaveIniSettingsToMemory(). user will need to clear io.WantSaveIniSettings themselves.
10886  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
10887  }
10888  }
10889 }
10890 
10891 void ImGui::MarkIniSettingsDirty()
10892 {
10893  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10894  if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
10895  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = g.IO.IniSavingRate;
10896 }
10897 
10898 void ImGui::MarkIniSettingsDirty(ImGuiWindow* window)
10899 {
10900  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10901  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings))
10902  if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
10903  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = g.IO.IniSavingRate;
10904 }
10905 
10906 ImGuiWindowSettings* ImGui::CreateNewWindowSettings(const char* name)
10907 {
10908  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10909 
10910 #if !IMGUI_DEBUG_INI_SETTINGS
10911  // Skip to the "###" marker if any. We don't skip past to match the behavior of GetID()
10912  // Preserve the full string when IMGUI_DEBUG_INI_SETTINGS is set to make .ini inspection easier.
10913  if (const char* p = strstr(name, "###"))
10914  name = p;
10915 #endif
10916  const size_t name_len = strlen(name);
10917 
10918  // Allocate chunk
10919  const size_t chunk_size = sizeof(ImGuiWindowSettings) + name_len + 1;
10920  ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.alloc_chunk(chunk_size);
10921  IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(settings) ImGuiWindowSettings();
10922  settings->ID = ImHashStr(name, name_len);
10923  memcpy(settings->GetName(), name, name_len + 1); // Store with zero terminator
10924 
10925  return settings;
10926 }
10927 
10928 ImGuiWindowSettings* ImGui::FindWindowSettings(ImGuiID id)
10929 {
10930  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10931  for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
10932  if (settings->ID == id)
10933  return settings;
10934  return NULL;
10935 }
10936 
10937 ImGuiWindowSettings* ImGui::FindOrCreateWindowSettings(const char* name)
10938 {
10939  if (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = FindWindowSettings(ImHashStr(name)))
10940  return settings;
10941  return CreateNewWindowSettings(name);
10942 }
10943 
10944 ImGuiSettingsHandler* ImGui::FindSettingsHandler(const char* type_name)
10945 {
10946  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10947  const ImGuiID type_hash = ImHashStr(type_name);
10948  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
10949  if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].TypeHash == type_hash)
10950  return &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n];
10951  return NULL;
10952 }
10953 
10954 void ImGui::ClearIniSettings()
10955 {
10956  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10957  g.SettingsIniData.clear();
10958  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
10959  if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ClearAllFn)
10960  g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ClearAllFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
10961 }
10962 
10963 void ImGui::LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(const char* ini_filename)
10964 {
10965  size_t file_data_size = 0;
10966  char* file_data = (char*)ImFileLoadToMemory(ini_filename, "rb", &file_data_size);
10967  if (!file_data)
10968  return;
10969  LoadIniSettingsFromMemory(file_data, (size_t)file_data_size);
10970  IM_FREE(file_data);
10971 }
10972 
10973 // Zero-tolerance, no error reporting, cheap .ini parsing
10974 void ImGui::LoadIniSettingsFromMemory(const char* ini_data, size_t ini_size)
10975 {
10976  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
10977  IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
10978  //IM_ASSERT(!g.WithinFrameScope && "Cannot be called between NewFrame() and EndFrame()");
10979  //IM_ASSERT(g.SettingsLoaded == false && g.FrameCount == 0);
10980 
10981  // For user convenience, we allow passing a non zero-terminated string (hence the ini_size parameter).
10982  // For our convenience and to make the code simpler, we'll also write zero-terminators within the buffer. So let's create a writable copy..
10983  if (ini_size == 0)
10984  ini_size = strlen(ini_data);
10985  g.SettingsIniData.Buf.resize((int)ini_size + 1);
10986  char* const buf = g.SettingsIniData.Buf.Data;
10987  char* const buf_end = buf + ini_size;
10988  memcpy(buf, ini_data, ini_size);
10989  buf_end[0] = 0;
10990 
10991  // Call pre-read handlers
10992  // Some types will clear their data (e.g. dock information) some types will allow merge/override (window)
10993  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
10994  if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ReadInitFn)
10995  g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ReadInitFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
10996 
10997  void* entry_data = NULL;
10998  ImGuiSettingsHandler* entry_handler = NULL;
10999 
11000  char* line_end = NULL;
11001  for (char* line = buf; line < buf_end; line = line_end + 1)
11002  {
11003  // Skip new lines markers, then find end of the line
11004  while (*line == '\n' || *line == '\r')
11005  line++;
11006  line_end = line;
11007  while (line_end < buf_end && *line_end != '\n' && *line_end != '\r')
11008  line_end++;
11009  line_end[0] = 0;
11010  if (line[0] == ';')
11011  continue;
11012  if (line[0] == '[' && line_end > line && line_end[-1] == ']')
11013  {
11014  // Parse "[Type][Name]". Note that 'Name' can itself contains [] characters, which is acceptable with the current format and parsing code.
11015  line_end[-1] = 0;
11016  const char* name_end = line_end - 1;
11017  const char* type_start = line + 1;
11018  char* type_end = (char*)(void*)ImStrchrRange(type_start, name_end, ']');
11019  const char* name_start = type_end ? ImStrchrRange(type_end + 1, name_end, '[') : NULL;
11020  if (!type_end || !name_start)
11021  continue;
11022  *type_end = 0; // Overwrite first ']'
11023  name_start++; // Skip second '['
11024  entry_handler = FindSettingsHandler(type_start);
11025  entry_data = entry_handler ? entry_handler->ReadOpenFn(&g, entry_handler, name_start) : NULL;
11026  }
11027  else if (entry_handler != NULL && entry_data != NULL)
11028  {
11029  // Let type handler parse the line
11030  entry_handler->ReadLineFn(&g, entry_handler, entry_data, line);
11031  }
11032  }
11033  g.SettingsLoaded = true;
11034 
11035  // [DEBUG] Restore untouched copy so it can be browsed in Metrics (not strictly necessary)
11036  memcpy(buf, ini_data, ini_size);
11037 
11038  // Call post-read handlers
11039  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
11040  if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ApplyAllFn)
11041  g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ApplyAllFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
11042 }
11043 
11044 void ImGui::SaveIniSettingsToDisk(const char* ini_filename)
11045 {
11046  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11047  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
11048  if (!ini_filename)
11049  return;
11050 
11051  size_t ini_data_size = 0;
11052  const char* ini_data = SaveIniSettingsToMemory(&ini_data_size);
11053  ImFileHandle f = ImFileOpen(ini_filename, "wt");
11054  if (!f)
11055  return;
11056  ImFileWrite(ini_data, sizeof(char), ini_data_size, f);
11057  ImFileClose(f);
11058 }
11059 
11060 // Call registered handlers (e.g. SettingsHandlerWindow_WriteAll() + custom handlers) to write their stuff into a text buffer
11061 const char* ImGui::SaveIniSettingsToMemory(size_t* out_size)
11062 {
11063  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11064  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
11065  g.SettingsIniData.Buf.resize(0);
11066  g.SettingsIniData.Buf.push_back(0);
11067  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
11068  {
11069  ImGuiSettingsHandler* handler = &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n];
11070  handler->WriteAllFn(&g, handler, &g.SettingsIniData);
11071  }
11072  if (out_size)
11073  *out_size = (size_t)g.SettingsIniData.size();
11074  return g.SettingsIniData.c_str();
11075 }
11076 
11077 static void WindowSettingsHandler_ClearAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler*)
11078 {
11079  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
11080  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
11081  g.Windows[i]->SettingsOffset = -1;
11082  g.SettingsWindows.clear();
11083 }
11084 
11085 static void* WindowSettingsHandler_ReadOpen(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, const char* name)
11086 {
11087  ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = ImGui::FindOrCreateWindowSettings(name);
11088  ImGuiID id = settings->ID;
11089  *settings = ImGuiWindowSettings(); // Clear existing if recycling previous entry
11090  settings->ID = id;
11091  settings->WantApply = true;
11092  return (void*)settings;
11093 }
11094 
11095 static void WindowSettingsHandler_ReadLine(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, void* entry, const char* line)
11096 {
11097  ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = (ImGuiWindowSettings*)entry;
11098  int x, y;
11099  int i;
11100  ImU32 u1;
11101  if (sscanf(line, "Pos=%i,%i", &x, &y) == 2) { settings->Pos = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y); }
11102  else if (sscanf(line, "Size=%i,%i", &x, &y) == 2) { settings->Size = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y); }
11103  else if (sscanf(line, "ViewportId=0x%08X", &u1) == 1) { settings->ViewportId = u1; }
11104  else if (sscanf(line, "ViewportPos=%i,%i", &x, &y) == 2){ settings->ViewportPos = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y); }
11105  else if (sscanf(line, "Collapsed=%d", &i) == 1) { settings->Collapsed = (i != 0); }
11106  else if (sscanf(line, "DockId=0x%X,%d", &u1, &i) == 2) { settings->DockId = u1; settings->DockOrder = (short)i; }
11107  else if (sscanf(line, "DockId=0x%X", &u1) == 1) { settings->DockId = u1; settings->DockOrder = -1; }
11108  else if (sscanf(line, "ClassId=0x%X", &u1) == 1) { settings->ClassId = u1; }
11109 }
11110 
11111 // Apply to existing windows (if any)
11112 static void WindowSettingsHandler_ApplyAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler*)
11113 {
11114  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
11115  for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
11116  if (settings->WantApply)
11117  {
11118  if (ImGuiWindow* window = ImGui::FindWindowByID(settings->ID))
11119  ApplyWindowSettings(window, settings);
11120  settings->WantApply = false;
11121  }
11122 }
11123 
11124 static void WindowSettingsHandler_WriteAll(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler* handler, ImGuiTextBuffer* buf)
11125 {
11126  // Gather data from windows that were active during this session
11127  // (if a window wasn't opened in this session we preserve its settings)
11128  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
11129  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
11130  {
11131  ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[i];
11132  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings)
11133  continue;
11134 
11135  ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = (window->SettingsOffset != -1) ? g.SettingsWindows.ptr_from_offset(window->SettingsOffset) : ImGui::FindWindowSettings(window->ID);
11136  if (!settings)
11137  {
11138  settings = ImGui::CreateNewWindowSettings(window->Name);
11139  window->SettingsOffset = g.SettingsWindows.offset_from_ptr(settings);
11140  }
11141  IM_ASSERT(settings->ID == window->ID);
11142  settings->Pos = ImVec2ih(window->Pos - window->ViewportPos);
11143  settings->Size = ImVec2ih(window->SizeFull);
11144  settings->ViewportId = window->ViewportId;
11145  settings->ViewportPos = ImVec2ih(window->ViewportPos);
11146  IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode == NULL || window->DockNode->ID == window->DockId);
11147  settings->DockId = window->DockId;
11148  settings->ClassId = window->WindowClass.ClassId;
11149  settings->DockOrder = window->DockOrder;
11150  settings->Collapsed = window->Collapsed;
11151  }
11152 
11153  // Write to text buffer
11154  buf->reserve(buf->size() + g.SettingsWindows.size() * 6); // ballpark reserve
11155  for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
11156  {
11157  const char* settings_name = settings->GetName();
11158  buf->appendf("[%s][%s]\n", handler->TypeName, settings_name);
11159  if (settings->ViewportId != 0 && settings->ViewportId != ImGui::IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID)
11160  {
11161  buf->appendf("ViewportPos=%d,%d\n", settings->ViewportPos.x, settings->ViewportPos.y);
11162  buf->appendf("ViewportId=0x%08X\n", settings->ViewportId);
11163  }
11164  if (settings->Pos.x != 0 || settings->Pos.y != 0 || settings->ViewportId == ImGui::IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID)
11165  buf->appendf("Pos=%d,%d\n", settings->Pos.x, settings->Pos.y);
11166  if (settings->Size.x != 0 || settings->Size.y != 0)
11167  buf->appendf("Size=%d,%d\n", settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y);
11168  buf->appendf("Collapsed=%d\n", settings->Collapsed);
11169  if (settings->DockId != 0)
11170  {
11171  // Write DockId as 4 digits if possible. Automatic DockId are small numbers, but full explicit DockSpace() are full ImGuiID range.
11172  if (settings->DockOrder == -1)
11173  buf->appendf("DockId=0x%08X\n", settings->DockId);
11174  else
11175  buf->appendf("DockId=0x%08X,%d\n", settings->DockId, settings->DockOrder);
11176  if (settings->ClassId != 0)
11177  buf->appendf("ClassId=0x%08X\n", settings->ClassId);
11178  }
11179  buf->append("\n");
11180  }
11181 }
11182 
11183 
11184 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
11185 // [SECTION] VIEWPORTS, PLATFORM WINDOWS
11186 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
11187 // - GetMainViewport()
11188 // - FindViewportByID()
11189 // - FindViewportByPlatformHandle()
11190 // - SetCurrentViewport() [Internal]
11191 // - SetWindowViewport() [Internal]
11192 // - GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnViewport() [Internal]
11193 // - UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewport() [Internal]
11194 // - UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewports() [Internal]
11195 // - TranslateWindowsInViewport() [Internal]
11196 // - ScaleWindowsInViewport() [Internal]
11197 // - FindHoveredViewportFromPlatformWindowStack() [Internal]
11198 // - UpdateViewportsNewFrame() [Internal]
11199 // - UpdateViewportsEndFrame() [Internal]
11200 // - AddUpdateViewport() [Internal]
11201 // - UpdateSelectWindowViewport() [Internal]
11202 // - UpdatePlatformWindows()
11203 // - RenderPlatformWindowsDefault()
11204 // - FindPlatformMonitorForPos() [Internal]
11205 // - FindPlatformMonitorForRect() [Internal]
11206 // - UpdateViewportPlatformMonitor() [Internal]
11207 // - DestroyPlatformWindow() [Internal]
11208 // - DestroyPlatformWindows()
11209 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
11210 
11211 ImGuiViewport* ImGui::GetMainViewport()
11212 {
11213  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11214  return g.Viewports[0];
11215 }
11216 
11217 ImGuiViewport* ImGui::FindViewportByID(ImGuiID id)
11218 {
11219  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11220  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
11221  if (g.Viewports[n]->ID == id)
11222  return g.Viewports[n];
11223  return NULL;
11224 }
11225 
11226 ImGuiViewport* ImGui::FindViewportByPlatformHandle(void* platform_handle)
11227 {
11228  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11229  for (int i = 0; i != g.Viewports.Size; i++)
11230  if (g.Viewports[i]->PlatformHandle == platform_handle)
11231  return g.Viewports[i];
11232  return NULL;
11233 }
11234 
11235 void ImGui::SetCurrentViewport(ImGuiWindow* current_window, ImGuiViewportP* viewport)
11236 {
11237  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11238  (void)current_window;
11239 
11240  if (viewport)
11241  viewport->LastFrameActive = g.FrameCount;
11242  if (g.CurrentViewport == viewport)
11243  return;
11244  g.CurrentDpiScale = viewport ? viewport->DpiScale : 1.0f;
11245  g.CurrentViewport = viewport;
11246  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT("SetCurrentViewport changed '%s' 0x%08X\n", current_window ? current_window->Name : NULL, viewport ? viewport->ID : 0);
11247 
11248  // Notify platform layer of viewport changes
11249  // FIXME-DPI: This is only currently used for experimenting with handling of multiple DPI
11250  if (g.CurrentViewport && g.PlatformIO.Platform_OnChangedViewport)
11251  g.PlatformIO.Platform_OnChangedViewport(g.CurrentViewport);
11252 }
11253 
11254 static void SetWindowViewport(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiViewportP* viewport)
11255 {
11256  window->Viewport = viewport;
11257  window->ViewportId = viewport->ID;
11258  window->ViewportOwned = (viewport->Window == window);
11259 }
11260 
11261 static bool ImGui::GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnViewport(ImGuiWindow* window)
11262 {
11263  // Tooltips and menus are not automatically forced into their own viewport when the NoMerge flag is set, however the multiplication of viewports makes them more likely to protrude and create their own.
11264  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11265  if (g.IO.ConfigViewportsNoAutoMerge || (window->WindowClass.ViewportFlagsOverrideSet & ImGuiViewportFlags_NoAutoMerge))
11266  if (g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable)
11267  if (!window->DockIsActive)
11268  if ((window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) == 0)
11269  if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) == 0 || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) != 0)
11270  return true;
11271  return false;
11272 }
11273 
11274 static bool ImGui::UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewport(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiViewportP* viewport)
11275 {
11276  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11277  if (window->Viewport == viewport)
11278  return false;
11279  if ((viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_CanHostOtherWindows) == 0)
11280  return false;
11281  if ((viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized) != 0)
11282  return false;
11283  if (!viewport->GetMainRect().Contains(window->Rect()))
11284  return false;
11285  if (GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnViewport(window))
11286  return false;
11287 
11288  for (int n = 0; n < g.Windows.Size; n++)
11289  {
11290  ImGuiWindow* window_behind = g.Windows[n];
11291  if (window_behind == window)
11292  break;
11293  if (window_behind->WasActive && window_behind->ViewportOwned && !(window_behind->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
11294  if (window_behind->Viewport->GetMainRect().Overlaps(window->Rect()))
11295  return false;
11296  }
11297 
11298  // Move to the existing viewport, Move child/hosted windows as well (FIXME-OPT: iterate child)
11299  ImGuiViewportP* old_viewport = window->Viewport;
11300  if (window->ViewportOwned)
11301  for (int n = 0; n < g.Windows.Size; n++)
11302  if (g.Windows[n]->Viewport == old_viewport)
11303  SetWindowViewport(g.Windows[n], viewport);
11304  SetWindowViewport(window, viewport);
11305  BringWindowToDisplayFront(window);
11306 
11307  return true;
11308 }
11309 
11310 // FIXME: handle 0 to N host viewports
11311 static bool ImGui::UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewports(ImGuiWindow* window)
11312 {
11313  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11314  return UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewport(window, g.Viewports[0]);
11315 }
11316 
11317 // Translate Dear ImGui windows when a Host Viewport has been moved
11318 // (This additionally keeps windows at the same place when ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable is toggled!)
11319 void ImGui::TranslateWindowsInViewport(ImGuiViewportP* viewport, const ImVec2& old_pos, const ImVec2& new_pos)
11320 {
11321  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11322  IM_ASSERT(viewport->Window == NULL && (viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_CanHostOtherWindows));
11323 
11324  // 1) We test if ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable was just toggled, which allows us to conveniently
11325  // translate imgui windows from OS-window-local to absolute coordinates or vice-versa.
11326  // 2) If it's not going to fit into the new size, keep it at same absolute position.
11327  // One problem with this is that most Win32 applications doesn't update their render while dragging,
11328  // and so the window will appear to teleport when releasing the mouse.
11329  const bool translate_all_windows = (g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable) != (g.ConfigFlagsLastFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable);
11330  ImRect test_still_fit_rect(old_pos, old_pos + viewport->Size);
11331  ImVec2 delta_pos = new_pos - old_pos;
11332  for (int window_n = 0; window_n < g.Windows.Size; window_n++) // FIXME-OPT
11333  if (translate_all_windows || (g.Windows[window_n]->Viewport == viewport && test_still_fit_rect.Contains(g.Windows[window_n]->Rect())))
11334  TranslateWindow(g.Windows[window_n], delta_pos);
11335 }
11336 
11337 // Scale all windows (position, size). Use when e.g. changing DPI. (This is a lossy operation!)
11338 void ImGui::ScaleWindowsInViewport(ImGuiViewportP* viewport, float scale)
11339 {
11340  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11341  if (viewport->Window)
11342  {
11343  ScaleWindow(viewport->Window, scale);
11344  }
11345  else
11346  {
11347  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
11348  if (g.Windows[i]->Viewport == viewport)
11349  ScaleWindow(g.Windows[i], scale);
11350  }
11351 }
11352 
11353 // If the backend doesn't set MouseLastHoveredViewport or doesn't honor ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs, we do a search ourselves.
11354 // A) It won't take account of the possibility that non-imgui windows may be in-between our dragged window and our target window.
11355 // B) It requires Platform_GetWindowFocus to be implemented by backend.
11356 static ImGuiViewportP* FindHoveredViewportFromPlatformWindowStack(const ImVec2 mouse_platform_pos)
11357 {
11358  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11359  ImGuiViewportP* best_candidate = NULL;
11360  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
11361  {
11362  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
11363  if (!(viewport->Flags & (ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized)) && viewport->GetMainRect().Contains(mouse_platform_pos))
11364  if (best_candidate == NULL || best_candidate->LastFrontMostStampCount < viewport->LastFrontMostStampCount)
11365  best_candidate = viewport;
11366  }
11367  return best_candidate;
11368 }
11369 
11370 // Update viewports and monitor infos
11371 // Note that this is running even if 'ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable' is not set, in order to clear unused viewports (if any) and update monitor info.
11372 static void ImGui::UpdateViewportsNewFrame()
11373 {
11374  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11375  IM_ASSERT(g.PlatformIO.Viewports.Size <= g.Viewports.Size);
11376 
11377  // Update Minimized status (we need it first in order to decide if we'll apply Pos/Size of the main viewport)
11378  const bool viewports_enabled = (g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable) != 0;
11379  if (viewports_enabled)
11380  {
11381  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
11382  {
11383  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
11384  const bool platform_funcs_available = viewport->PlatformWindowCreated;
11385  if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowMinimized && platform_funcs_available)
11386  {
11387  bool minimized = g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowMinimized(viewport);
11388  if (minimized)
11389  viewport->Flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized;
11390  else
11391  viewport->Flags &= ~ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized;
11392  }
11393  }
11394  }
11395 
11396  // Create/update main viewport with current platform position.
11397  // FIXME-VIEWPORT: Size is driven by backend/user code for backward-compatibility but we should aim to make this more consistent.
11398  ImGuiViewportP* main_viewport = g.Viewports[0];
11399  IM_ASSERT(main_viewport->ID == IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID);
11400  IM_ASSERT(main_viewport->Window == NULL);
11401  ImVec2 main_viewport_pos = viewports_enabled ? g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowPos(main_viewport) : ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
11402  ImVec2 main_viewport_size = g.IO.DisplaySize;
11403  if (viewports_enabled && (main_viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized))
11404  {
11405  main_viewport_pos = main_viewport->Pos; // Preserve last pos/size when minimized (FIXME: We don't do the same for Size outside of the viewport path)
11406  main_viewport_size = main_viewport->Size;
11407  }
11408  AddUpdateViewport(NULL, IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID, main_viewport_pos, main_viewport_size, ImGuiViewportFlags_OwnedByApp | ImGuiViewportFlags_CanHostOtherWindows);
11409 
11410  g.CurrentDpiScale = 0.0f;
11411  g.CurrentViewport = NULL;
11412  g.MouseViewport = NULL;
11413  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
11414  {
11415  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
11416  viewport->Idx = n;
11417 
11418  // Erase unused viewports
11419  if (n > 0 && viewport->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount - 2)
11420  {
11421  // Clear references to this viewport in windows (window->ViewportId becomes the master data)
11422  for (int window_n = 0; window_n < g.Windows.Size; window_n++)
11423  if (g.Windows[window_n]->Viewport == viewport)
11424  {
11425  g.Windows[window_n]->Viewport = NULL;
11426  g.Windows[window_n]->ViewportOwned = false;
11427  }
11428  if (viewport == g.MouseLastHoveredViewport)
11429  g.MouseLastHoveredViewport = NULL;
11430  g.Viewports.erase(g.Viewports.Data + n);
11431 
11432  // Destroy
11433  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT("Delete Viewport %08X (%s)\n", viewport->ID, viewport->Window ? viewport->Window->Name : "n/a");
11434  DestroyPlatformWindow(viewport); // In most circumstances the platform window will already be destroyed here.
11435  IM_ASSERT(g.PlatformIO.Viewports.contains(viewport) == false);
11436  IM_DELETE(viewport);
11437  n--;
11438  continue;
11439  }
11440 
11441  const bool platform_funcs_available = viewport->PlatformWindowCreated;
11442  if (viewports_enabled)
11443  {
11444  // Update Position and Size (from Platform Window to ImGui) if requested.
11445  // We do it early in the frame instead of waiting for UpdatePlatformWindows() to avoid a frame of lag when moving/resizing using OS facilities.
11446  if (!(viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized) && platform_funcs_available)
11447  {
11448  // Viewport->WorkPos and WorkSize will be updated below
11449  if (viewport->PlatformRequestMove)
11450  viewport->Pos = viewport->LastPlatformPos = g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowPos(viewport);
11451  if (viewport->PlatformRequestResize)
11452  viewport->Size = viewport->LastPlatformSize = g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowSize(viewport);
11453  }
11454  }
11455 
11456  // Update/copy monitor info
11457  UpdateViewportPlatformMonitor(viewport);
11458 
11459  // Lock down space taken by menu bars and status bars, reset the offset for fucntions like BeginMainMenuBar() to alter them again.
11460  viewport->WorkOffsetMin = viewport->CurrWorkOffsetMin;
11461  viewport->WorkOffsetMax = viewport->CurrWorkOffsetMax;
11462  viewport->CurrWorkOffsetMin = viewport->CurrWorkOffsetMax = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
11463  viewport->UpdateWorkRect();
11464 
11465  // Reset alpha every frame. Users of transparency (docking) needs to request a lower alpha back.
11466  viewport->Alpha = 1.0f;
11467 
11468  // Translate imgui windows when a Host Viewport has been moved
11469  // (This additionally keeps windows at the same place when ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable is toggled!)
11470  const ImVec2 viewport_delta_pos = viewport->Pos - viewport->LastPos;
11471  if ((viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_CanHostOtherWindows) && (viewport_delta_pos.x != 0.0f || viewport_delta_pos.y != 0.0f))
11472  TranslateWindowsInViewport(viewport, viewport->LastPos, viewport->Pos);
11473 
11474  // Update DPI scale
11475  float new_dpi_scale;
11476  if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowDpiScale && platform_funcs_available)
11477  new_dpi_scale = g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowDpiScale(viewport);
11478  else if (viewport->PlatformMonitor != -1)
11479  new_dpi_scale = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[viewport->PlatformMonitor].DpiScale;
11480  else
11481  new_dpi_scale = (viewport->DpiScale != 0.0f) ? viewport->DpiScale : 1.0f;
11482  if (viewport->DpiScale != 0.0f && new_dpi_scale != viewport->DpiScale)
11483  {
11484  float scale_factor = new_dpi_scale / viewport->DpiScale;
11485  if (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DpiEnableScaleViewports)
11486  ScaleWindowsInViewport(viewport, scale_factor);
11487  //if (viewport == GetMainViewport())
11488  // g.PlatformInterface.SetWindowSize(viewport, viewport->Size * scale_factor);
11489 
11490  // Scale our window moving pivot so that the window will rescale roughly around the mouse position.
11491  // FIXME-VIEWPORT: This currently creates a resizing feedback loop when a window is straddling a DPI transition border.
11492  // (Minor: since our sizes do not perfectly linearly scale, deferring the click offset scale until we know the actual window scale ratio may get us slightly more precise mouse positioning.)
11493  //if (g.MovingWindow != NULL && g.MovingWindow->Viewport == viewport)
11494  // g.ActiveIdClickOffset = ImFloor(g.ActiveIdClickOffset * scale_factor);
11495  }
11496  viewport->DpiScale = new_dpi_scale;
11497  }
11498 
11499  if (!viewports_enabled)
11500  {
11501  g.MouseViewport = main_viewport;
11502  return;
11503  }
11504 
11505  // Mouse handling: decide on the actual mouse viewport for this frame between the active/focused viewport and the hovered viewport.
11506  // Note that 'viewport_hovered' should skip over any viewport that has the ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flags set.
11507  ImGuiViewportP* viewport_hovered = NULL;
11508  if (g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseHoveredViewport)
11509  {
11510  viewport_hovered = g.IO.MouseHoveredViewport ? (ImGuiViewportP*)FindViewportByID(g.IO.MouseHoveredViewport) : NULL;
11511  if (viewport_hovered && (viewport_hovered->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs))
11512  {
11513  // Backend failed at honoring its contract if it returned a viewport with the _NoInputs flag.
11514  IM_ASSERT(0);
11515  viewport_hovered = FindHoveredViewportFromPlatformWindowStack(g.IO.MousePos);
11516  }
11517  }
11518  else
11519  {
11520  // If the backend doesn't know how to honor ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs, we do a search ourselves. Note that this search:
11521  // A) won't take account of the possibility that non-imgui windows may be in-between our dragged window and our target window.
11522  // B) uses LastFrameAsRefViewport as a flawed replacement for the last time a window was focused (we could/should fix that by introducing Focus functions in PlatformIO)
11523  viewport_hovered = FindHoveredViewportFromPlatformWindowStack(g.IO.MousePos);
11524  }
11525  if (viewport_hovered != NULL)
11526  g.MouseLastHoveredViewport = viewport_hovered;
11527  else if (g.MouseLastHoveredViewport == NULL)
11528  g.MouseLastHoveredViewport = g.Viewports[0];
11529 
11530  // Update mouse reference viewport
11531  // (when moving a window we aim at its viewport, but this will be overwritten below if we go in drag and drop mode)
11532  if (g.MovingWindow)
11533  g.MouseViewport = g.MovingWindow->Viewport;
11534  else
11535  g.MouseViewport = g.MouseLastHoveredViewport;
11536 
11537  // When dragging something, always refer to the last hovered viewport.
11538  // - when releasing a moving window we will revert to aiming behind (at viewport_hovered)
11539  // - when we are between viewports, our dragged preview will tend to show in the last viewport _even_ if we don't have tooltips in their viewports (when lacking monitor info)
11540  // - consider the case of holding on a menu item to browse child menus: even thou a mouse button is held, there's no active id because menu items only react on mouse release.
11541  const bool is_mouse_dragging_with_an_expected_destination = g.DragDropActive;
11542  if (is_mouse_dragging_with_an_expected_destination && viewport_hovered == NULL)
11543  viewport_hovered = g.MouseLastHoveredViewport;
11544  if (is_mouse_dragging_with_an_expected_destination || g.ActiveId == 0 || !IsAnyMouseDown())
11545  if (viewport_hovered != NULL && viewport_hovered != g.MouseViewport && !(viewport_hovered->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs))
11546  g.MouseViewport = viewport_hovered;
11547 
11548  IM_ASSERT(g.MouseViewport != NULL);
11549 }
11550 
11551 // Update user-facing viewport list (g.Viewports -> g.PlatformIO.Viewports after filtering out some)
11552 static void ImGui::UpdateViewportsEndFrame()
11553 {
11554  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11555  g.PlatformIO.Viewports.resize(0);
11556  for (int i = 0; i < g.Viewports.Size; i++)
11557  {
11558  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[i];
11559  viewport->LastPos = viewport->Pos;
11560  if (viewport->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount || viewport->Size.x <= 0.0f || viewport->Size.y <= 0.0f)
11561  if (i > 0) // Always include main viewport in the list
11562  continue;
11563  if (viewport->Window && !IsWindowActiveAndVisible(viewport->Window))
11564  continue;
11565  if (i > 0)
11566  IM_ASSERT(viewport->Window != NULL);
11567  g.PlatformIO.Viewports.push_back(viewport);
11568  }
11569  g.Viewports[0]->ClearRequestFlags(); // Clear main viewport flags because UpdatePlatformWindows() won't do it and may not even be called
11570 }
11571 
11572 // FIXME: We should ideally refactor the system to call this every frame (we currently don't)
11573 ImGuiViewportP* ImGui::AddUpdateViewport(ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiID id, const ImVec2& pos, const ImVec2& size, ImGuiViewportFlags flags)
11574 {
11575  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11576  IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
11577 
11578  flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformWindow;
11579  if (window != NULL)
11580  {
11581  if (g.MovingWindow && g.MovingWindow->RootWindow == window)
11582  flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing;
11583  if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
11584  flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs;
11585  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing)
11586  flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing;
11587  }
11588 
11589  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)FindViewportByID(id);
11590  if (viewport)
11591  {
11592  if (!viewport->PlatformRequestMove)
11593  viewport->Pos = pos;
11594  if (!viewport->PlatformRequestResize)
11595  viewport->Size = size;
11596  viewport->Flags = flags | (viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized); // Preserve existing flags
11597  }
11598  else
11599  {
11600  // New viewport
11601  viewport = IM_NEW(ImGuiViewportP)();
11602  viewport->ID = id;
11603  viewport->Idx = g.Viewports.Size;
11604  viewport->Pos = viewport->LastPos = pos;
11605  viewport->Size = size;
11606  viewport->Flags = flags;
11607  UpdateViewportPlatformMonitor(viewport);
11608  g.Viewports.push_back(viewport);
11609  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT("Add Viewport %08X (%s)\n", id, window->Name);
11610 
11611  // We normally setup for all viewports in NewFrame() but here need to handle the mid-frame creation of a new viewport.
11612  // We need to extend the fullscreen clip rect so the OverlayDrawList clip is correct for that the first frame
11613  g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.x = ImMin(g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.x, viewport->Pos.x);
11614  g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.y = ImMin(g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.y, viewport->Pos.y);
11615  g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.z = ImMax(g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.z, viewport->Pos.x + viewport->Size.x);
11616  g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.w = ImMax(g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen.w, viewport->Pos.y + viewport->Size.y);
11617 
11618  // Store initial DpiScale before the OS platform window creation, based on expected monitor data.
11619  // This is so we can select an appropriate font size on the first frame of our window lifetime
11620  if (viewport->PlatformMonitor != -1)
11621  viewport->DpiScale = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[viewport->PlatformMonitor].DpiScale;
11622  }
11623 
11624  viewport->Window = window;
11625  viewport->LastFrameActive = g.FrameCount;
11626  viewport->UpdateWorkRect();
11627  IM_ASSERT(window == NULL || viewport->ID == window->ID);
11628 
11629  if (window != NULL)
11630  window->ViewportOwned = true;
11631 
11632  return viewport;
11633 }
11634 
11635 // FIXME-VIEWPORT: This is all super messy and ought to be clarified or rewritten.
11636 static void ImGui::UpdateSelectWindowViewport(ImGuiWindow* window)
11637 {
11638  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11639  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
11640  window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend = -1;
11641 
11642  // Restore main viewport if multi-viewport is not supported by the backend
11643  ImGuiViewportP* main_viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)(void*)GetMainViewport();
11644  if (!(g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable))
11645  {
11646  SetWindowViewport(window, main_viewport);
11647  return;
11648  }
11649  window->ViewportOwned = false;
11650 
11651  // Appearing popups reset their viewport so they can inherit again
11652  if ((flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) && window->Appearing)
11653  {
11654  window->Viewport = NULL;
11655  window->ViewportId = 0;
11656  }
11657 
11658  if ((g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasViewport) == 0)
11659  {
11660  // By default inherit from parent window
11661  if (window->Viewport == NULL && window->ParentWindow && !window->ParentWindow->IsFallbackWindow)
11662  window->Viewport = window->ParentWindow->Viewport;
11663 
11664  // Attempt to restore saved viewport id (= window that hasn't been activated yet), try to restore the viewport based on saved 'window->ViewportPos' restored from .ini file
11665  if (window->Viewport == NULL && window->ViewportId != 0)
11666  {
11667  window->Viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)FindViewportByID(window->ViewportId);
11668  if (window->Viewport == NULL && window->ViewportPos.x != FLT_MAX && window->ViewportPos.y != FLT_MAX)
11669  window->Viewport = AddUpdateViewport(window, window->ID, window->ViewportPos, window->Size, ImGuiViewportFlags_None);
11670  }
11671  }
11672 
11673  bool lock_viewport = false;
11674  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasViewport)
11675  {
11676  // Code explicitly request a viewport
11677  window->Viewport = (ImGuiViewportP*)FindViewportByID(g.NextWindowData.ViewportId);
11678  window->ViewportId = g.NextWindowData.ViewportId; // Store ID even if Viewport isn't resolved yet.
11679  lock_viewport = true;
11680  }
11681  else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) || (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
11682  {
11683  // Always inherit viewport from parent window
11684  window->Viewport = window->ParentWindow->Viewport;
11685  }
11686  else if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
11687  {
11688  window->Viewport = g.MouseViewport;
11689  }
11690  else if (GetWindowAlwaysWantOwnViewport(window))
11691  {
11692  window->Viewport = AddUpdateViewport(window, window->ID, window->Pos, window->Size, ImGuiViewportFlags_None);
11693  }
11694  else if (g.MovingWindow && g.MovingWindow->RootWindow == window && IsMousePosValid())
11695  {
11696  if (window->Viewport != NULL && window->Viewport->Window == window)
11697  window->Viewport = AddUpdateViewport(window, window->ID, window->Pos, window->Size, ImGuiViewportFlags_None);
11698  }
11699  else
11700  {
11701  // Merge into host viewport?
11702  // We cannot test window->ViewportOwned as it set lower in the function.
11703  bool try_to_merge_into_host_viewport = (window->Viewport && window == window->Viewport->Window && g.ActiveId == 0);
11704  if (try_to_merge_into_host_viewport)
11705  UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewports(window);
11706  }
11707 
11708  // Fallback: merge in default viewport if z-order matches, otherwise create a new viewport
11709  if (window->Viewport == NULL)
11710  if (!UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewport(window, main_viewport))
11711  window->Viewport = AddUpdateViewport(window, window->ID, window->Pos, window->Size, ImGuiViewportFlags_None);
11712 
11713  // Mark window as allowed to protrude outside of its viewport and into the current monitor
11714  if (!lock_viewport)
11715  {
11716  if (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
11717  {
11718  // We need to take account of the possibility that mouse may become invalid.
11719  // Popups/Tooltip always set ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend so GetWindowAllowedExtentRect() will return full monitor bounds.
11720  ImVec2 mouse_ref = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) ? g.IO.MousePos : g.BeginPopupStack.back().OpenMousePos;
11721  bool use_mouse_ref = (g.NavDisableHighlight || !g.NavDisableMouseHover || !g.NavWindow);
11722  bool mouse_valid = IsMousePosValid(&mouse_ref);
11723  if ((window->Appearing || (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))) && (!use_mouse_ref || mouse_valid))
11724  window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend = FindPlatformMonitorForPos((use_mouse_ref && mouse_valid) ? mouse_ref : NavCalcPreferredRefPos());
11725  else
11726  window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend = window->Viewport->PlatformMonitor;
11727  }
11728  else if (window->Viewport && window != window->Viewport->Window && window->Viewport->Window && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
11729  {
11730  // When called from Begin() we don't have access to a proper version of the Hidden flag yet, so we replicate this code.
11731  const bool will_be_visible = (window->DockIsActive && !window->DockTabIsVisible) ? false : true;
11732  if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost) && window->Viewport->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount && will_be_visible)
11733  {
11734  // Steal/transfer ownership
11735  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT("Window '%s' steal Viewport %08X from Window '%s'\n", window->Name, window->Viewport->ID, window->Viewport->Window->Name);
11736  window->Viewport->Window = window;
11737  window->Viewport->ID = window->ID;
11738  window->Viewport->LastNameHash = 0;
11739  }
11740  else if (!UpdateTryMergeWindowIntoHostViewports(window)) // Merge?
11741  {
11742  // New viewport
11743  window->Viewport = AddUpdateViewport(window, window->ID, window->Pos, window->Size, ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing);
11744  }
11745  }
11746  else if (window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend < 0 && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) == 0)
11747  {
11748  // Regular (non-child, non-popup) windows by default are also allowed to protrude
11749  // Child windows are kept contained within their parent.
11750  window->ViewportAllowPlatformMonitorExtend = window->Viewport->PlatformMonitor;
11751  }
11752  }
11753 
11754  // Update flags
11755  window->ViewportOwned = (window == window->Viewport->Window);
11756  window->ViewportId = window->Viewport->ID;
11757 
11758  // If the OS window has a title bar, hide our imgui title bar
11759  //if (window->ViewportOwned && !(window->Viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_NoDecoration))
11760  // window->Flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar;
11761 }
11762 
11763 // Called by user at the end of the main loop, after EndFrame()
11764 // This will handle the creation/update of all OS windows via function defined in the ImGuiPlatformIO api.
11765 void ImGui::UpdatePlatformWindows()
11766 {
11767  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11768  IM_ASSERT(g.FrameCountEnded == g.FrameCount && "Forgot to call Render() or EndFrame() before UpdatePlatformWindows()?");
11769  IM_ASSERT(g.FrameCountPlatformEnded < g.FrameCount);
11770  g.FrameCountPlatformEnded = g.FrameCount;
11771  if (!(g.ConfigFlagsCurrFrame & ImGuiConfigFlags_ViewportsEnable))
11772  return;
11773 
11774  // Create/resize/destroy platform windows to match each active viewport.
11775  // Skip the main viewport (index 0), which is always fully handled by the application!
11776  for (int i = 1; i < g.Viewports.Size; i++)
11777  {
11778  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[i];
11779 
11780  // Destroy platform window if the viewport hasn't been submitted or if it is hosting a hidden window
