11781  // (the implicit/fallback Debug##Default window will be registering its viewport then be disabled, causing a dummy DestroyPlatformWindow to be made each frame)
11782  bool destroy_platform_window = false;
11783  destroy_platform_window |= (viewport->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount - 1);
11784  destroy_platform_window |= (viewport->Window && !IsWindowActiveAndVisible(viewport->Window));
11785  if (destroy_platform_window)
11786  {
11787  DestroyPlatformWindow(viewport);
11788  continue;
11789  }
11790 
11791  // New windows that appears directly in a new viewport won't always have a size on their first frame
11792  if (viewport->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount || viewport->Size.x <= 0 || viewport->Size.y <= 0)
11793  continue;
11794 
11795  // Create window
11796  bool is_new_platform_window = (viewport->PlatformWindowCreated == false);
11797  if (is_new_platform_window)
11798  {
11799  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_VIEWPORT("Create Platform Window %08X (%s)\n", viewport->ID, viewport->Window ? viewport->Window->Name : "n/a");
11800  g.PlatformIO.Platform_CreateWindow(viewport);
11801  if (g.PlatformIO.Renderer_CreateWindow != NULL)
11802  g.PlatformIO.Renderer_CreateWindow(viewport);
11803  viewport->LastNameHash = 0;
11804  viewport->LastPlatformPos = viewport->LastPlatformSize = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX); // By clearing those we'll enforce a call to Platform_SetWindowPos/Size below, before Platform_ShowWindow (FIXME: Is that necessary?)
11805  viewport->LastRendererSize = viewport->Size; // We don't need to call Renderer_SetWindowSize() as it is expected Renderer_CreateWindow() already did it.
11806  viewport->PlatformWindowCreated = true;
11807  }
11808 
11809  // Apply Position and Size (from ImGui to Platform/Renderer backends)
11810  if ((viewport->LastPlatformPos.x != viewport->Pos.x || viewport->LastPlatformPos.y != viewport->Pos.y) && !viewport->PlatformRequestMove)
11811  g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowPos(viewport, viewport->Pos);
11812  if ((viewport->LastPlatformSize.x != viewport->Size.x || viewport->LastPlatformSize.y != viewport->Size.y) && !viewport->PlatformRequestResize)
11813  g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowSize(viewport, viewport->Size);
11814  if ((viewport->LastRendererSize.x != viewport->Size.x || viewport->LastRendererSize.y != viewport->Size.y) && g.PlatformIO.Renderer_SetWindowSize)
11815  g.PlatformIO.Renderer_SetWindowSize(viewport, viewport->Size);
11816  viewport->LastPlatformPos = viewport->Pos;
11817  viewport->LastPlatformSize = viewport->LastRendererSize = viewport->Size;
11818 
11819  // Update title bar (if it changed)
11820  if (ImGuiWindow* window_for_title = GetWindowForTitleDisplay(viewport->Window))
11821  {
11822  const char* title_begin = window_for_title->Name;
11823  char* title_end = (char*)(intptr_t)FindRenderedTextEnd(title_begin);
11824  const ImGuiID title_hash = ImHashStr(title_begin, title_end - title_begin);
11825  if (viewport->LastNameHash != title_hash)
11826  {
11827  char title_end_backup_c = *title_end;
11828  *title_end = 0; // Cut existing buffer short instead of doing an alloc/free, no small gain.
11829  g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowTitle(viewport, title_begin);
11830  *title_end = title_end_backup_c;
11831  viewport->LastNameHash = title_hash;
11832  }
11833  }
11834 
11835  // Update alpha (if it changed)
11836  if (viewport->LastAlpha != viewport->Alpha && g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowAlpha)
11837  g.PlatformIO.Platform_SetWindowAlpha(viewport, viewport->Alpha);
11838  viewport->LastAlpha = viewport->Alpha;
11839 
11840  // Optional, general purpose call to allow the backend to perform general book-keeping even if things haven't changed.
11841  if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_UpdateWindow)
11842  g.PlatformIO.Platform_UpdateWindow(viewport);
11843 
11844  if (is_new_platform_window)
11845  {
11846  // On startup ensure new platform window don't steal focus (give it a few frames, as nested contents may lead to viewport being created a few frames late)
11847  if (g.FrameCount < 3)
11848  viewport->Flags |= ImGuiViewportFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing;
11849 
11850  // Show window
11851  g.PlatformIO.Platform_ShowWindow(viewport);
11852 
11853  // Even without focus, we assume the window becomes front-most.
11854  // This is useful for our platform z-order heuristic when io.MouseHoveredViewport is not available.
11855  if (viewport->LastFrontMostStampCount != g.ViewportFrontMostStampCount)
11856  viewport->LastFrontMostStampCount = ++g.ViewportFrontMostStampCount;
11857  }
11858 
11859  // Clear request flags
11860  viewport->ClearRequestFlags();
11861  }
11862 
11863  // Update our implicit z-order knowledge of platform windows, which is used when the backend cannot provide io.MouseHoveredViewport.
11864  // When setting Platform_GetWindowFocus, it is expected that the platform backend can handle calls without crashing if it doesn't have data stored.
11865  // FIXME-VIEWPORT: We should use this information to also set dear imgui-side focus, allowing us to handle os-level alt+tab.
11866  if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowFocus != NULL)
11867  {
11868  ImGuiViewportP* focused_viewport = NULL;
11869  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size && focused_viewport == NULL; n++)
11870  {
11871  ImGuiViewportP* viewport = g.Viewports[n];
11872  if (viewport->PlatformWindowCreated)
11873  if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_GetWindowFocus(viewport))
11874  focused_viewport = viewport;
11875  }
11876 
11877  // Store a tag so we can infer z-order easily from all our windows
11878  // We compare PlatformLastFocusedViewportId so newly created viewports with _NoFocusOnAppearing flag
11879  // will keep the front most stamp instead of losing it back to their parent viewport.
11880  if (focused_viewport && g.PlatformLastFocusedViewportId != focused_viewport->ID)
11881  {
11882  if (focused_viewport->LastFrontMostStampCount != g.ViewportFrontMostStampCount)
11883  focused_viewport->LastFrontMostStampCount = ++g.ViewportFrontMostStampCount;
11884  g.PlatformLastFocusedViewportId = focused_viewport->ID;
11885  }
11886  }
11887 }
11888 
11889 // This is a default/basic function for performing the rendering/swap of multiple Platform Windows.
11890 // Custom renderers may prefer to not call this function at all, and instead iterate the publicly exposed platform data and handle rendering/sync themselves.
11891 // The Render/Swap functions stored in ImGuiPlatformIO are merely here to allow for this helper to exist, but you can do it yourself:
11892 //
11893 // ImGuiPlatformIO& platform_io = ImGui::GetPlatformIO();
11894 // for (int i = 1; i < platform_io.Viewports.Size; i++)
11895 // if ((platform_io.Viewports[i]->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized) == 0)
11896 // MyRenderFunction(platform_io.Viewports[i], my_args);
11897 // for (int i = 1; i < platform_io.Viewports.Size; i++)
11898 // if ((platform_io.Viewports[i]->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized) == 0)
11899 // MySwapBufferFunction(platform_io.Viewports[i], my_args);
11900 //
11901 void ImGui::RenderPlatformWindowsDefault(void* platform_render_arg, void* renderer_render_arg)
11902 {
11903  // Skip the main viewport (index 0), which is always fully handled by the application!
11904  ImGuiPlatformIO& platform_io = ImGui::GetPlatformIO();
11905  for (int i = 1; i < platform_io.Viewports.Size; i++)
11906  {
11907  ImGuiViewport* viewport = platform_io.Viewports[i];
11908  if (viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized)
11909  continue;
11910  if (platform_io.Platform_RenderWindow) platform_io.Platform_RenderWindow(viewport, platform_render_arg);
11911  if (platform_io.Renderer_RenderWindow) platform_io.Renderer_RenderWindow(viewport, renderer_render_arg);
11912  }
11913  for (int i = 1; i < platform_io.Viewports.Size; i++)
11914  {
11915  ImGuiViewport* viewport = platform_io.Viewports[i];
11916  if (viewport->Flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_Minimized)
11917  continue;
11918  if (platform_io.Platform_SwapBuffers) platform_io.Platform_SwapBuffers(viewport, platform_render_arg);
11919  if (platform_io.Renderer_SwapBuffers) platform_io.Renderer_SwapBuffers(viewport, renderer_render_arg);
11920  }
11921 }
11922 
11923 static int ImGui::FindPlatformMonitorForPos(const ImVec2& pos)
11924 {
11925  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11926  for (int monitor_n = 0; monitor_n < g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size; monitor_n++)
11927  {
11928  const ImGuiPlatformMonitor& monitor = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[monitor_n];
11929  if (ImRect(monitor.MainPos, monitor.MainPos + monitor.MainSize).Contains(pos))
11930  return monitor_n;
11931  }
11932  return -1;
11933 }
11934 
11935 // Search for the monitor with the largest intersection area with the given rectangle
11936 // We generally try to avoid searching loops but the monitor count should be very small here
11937 // FIXME-OPT: We could test the last monitor used for that viewport first, and early
11938 static int ImGui::FindPlatformMonitorForRect(const ImRect& rect)
11939 {
11940  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11941 
11942  const int monitor_count = g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size;
11943  if (monitor_count <= 1)
11944  return monitor_count - 1;
11945 
11946  // Use a minimum threshold of 1.0f so a zero-sized rect won't false positive, and will still find the correct monitor given its position.
11947  // This is necessary for tooltips which always resize down to zero at first.
11948  const float surface_threshold = ImMax(rect.GetWidth() * rect.GetHeight() * 0.5f, 1.0f);
11949  int best_monitor_n = -1;
11950  float best_monitor_surface = 0.001f;
11951 
11952  for (int monitor_n = 0; monitor_n < g.PlatformIO.Monitors.Size && best_monitor_surface < surface_threshold; monitor_n++)
11953  {
11954  const ImGuiPlatformMonitor& monitor = g.PlatformIO.Monitors[monitor_n];
11955  const ImRect monitor_rect = ImRect(monitor.MainPos, monitor.MainPos + monitor.MainSize);
11956  if (monitor_rect.Contains(rect))
11957  return monitor_n;
11958  ImRect overlapping_rect = rect;
11959  overlapping_rect.ClipWithFull(monitor_rect);
11960  float overlapping_surface = overlapping_rect.GetWidth() * overlapping_rect.GetHeight();
11961  if (overlapping_surface < best_monitor_surface)
11962  continue;
11963  best_monitor_surface = overlapping_surface;
11964  best_monitor_n = monitor_n;
11965  }
11966  return best_monitor_n;
11967 }
11968 
11969 // Update monitor from viewport rectangle (we'll use this info to clamp windows and save windows lost in a removed monitor)
11970 static void ImGui::UpdateViewportPlatformMonitor(ImGuiViewportP* viewport)
11971 {
11972  viewport->PlatformMonitor = (short)FindPlatformMonitorForRect(viewport->GetMainRect());
11973 }
11974 
11975 void ImGui::DestroyPlatformWindow(ImGuiViewportP* viewport)
11976 {
11977  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
11978  if (viewport->PlatformWindowCreated)
11979  {
11980  if (g.PlatformIO.Renderer_DestroyWindow)
11981  g.PlatformIO.Renderer_DestroyWindow(viewport);
11982  if (g.PlatformIO.Platform_DestroyWindow)
11983  g.PlatformIO.Platform_DestroyWindow(viewport);
11984  IM_ASSERT(viewport->RendererUserData == NULL && viewport->PlatformUserData == NULL);
11985 
11986  // Don't clear PlatformWindowCreated for the main viewport, as we initially set that up to true in Initialize()
11987  // The righter way may be to leave it to the backend to set this flag all-together, and made the flag public.
11988  if (viewport->ID != IMGUI_VIEWPORT_DEFAULT_ID)
11989  viewport->PlatformWindowCreated = false;
11990  }
11991  else
11992  {
11993  IM_ASSERT(viewport->RendererUserData == NULL && viewport->PlatformUserData == NULL && viewport->PlatformHandle == NULL);
11994  }
11995  viewport->RendererUserData = viewport->PlatformUserData = viewport->PlatformHandle = NULL;
11996  viewport->ClearRequestFlags();
11997 }
11998 
11999 void ImGui::DestroyPlatformWindows()
12000 {
12001  // We call the destroy window on every viewport (including the main viewport, index 0) to give a chance to the backend
12002  // to clear any data they may have stored in e.g. PlatformUserData, RendererUserData.
12003  // It is convenient for the platform backend code to store something in the main viewport, in order for e.g. the mouse handling
12004  // code to operator a consistent manner.
12005  // It is expected that the backend can handle calls to Renderer_DestroyWindow/Platform_DestroyWindow without
12006  // crashing if it doesn't have data stored.
12007  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12008  for (int i = 0; i < g.Viewports.Size; i++)
12009  DestroyPlatformWindow(g.Viewports[i]);
12010 }
12011 
12012 
12013 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12014 // [SECTION] DOCKING
12015 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12016 // Docking: Internal Types
12017 // Docking: Forward Declarations
12018 // Docking: ImGuiDockContext
12019 // Docking: ImGuiDockContext Docking/Undocking functions
12020 // Docking: ImGuiDockNode
12021 // Docking: ImGuiDockNode Tree manipulation functions
12022 // Docking: Public Functions (SetWindowDock, DockSpace, DockSpaceOverViewport)
12023 // Docking: Builder Functions
12024 // Docking: Begin/End Support Functions (called from Begin/End)
12025 // Docking: Settings
12026 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12027 
12028 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12029 // Typical Docking call flow: (root level is generally public API):
12030 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12031 // - NewFrame() new dear imgui frame
12032 // | DockContextNewFrameUpdateUndocking() - process queued undocking requests
12033 // | - DockContextProcessUndockWindow() - process one window undocking request
12034 // | - DockContextProcessUndockNode() - process one whole node undocking request
12035 // | DockContextNewFrameUpdateUndocking() - process queue docking requests, create floating dock nodes
12036 // | - update g.HoveredDockNode - [debug] update node hovered by mouse
12037 // | - DockContextProcessDock() - process one docking request
12038 // | - DockNodeUpdate()
12039 // | - DockNodeUpdateForRootNode()
12040 // | - DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlagAndInactiveChilds()
12041 // | - DockNodeFindInfo()
12042 // | - destroy unused node or tab bar
12043 // | - create dock node host window
12044 // | - Begin() etc.
12045 // | - DockNodeStartMouseMovingWindow()
12046 // | - DockNodeTreeUpdatePosSize()
12047 // | - DockNodeTreeUpdateSplitter()
12048 // | - draw node background
12049 // | - DockNodeUpdateTabBar() - create/update tab bar for a docking node
12050 // | - DockNodeAddTabBar()
12051 // | - DockNodeUpdateWindowMenu()
12052 // | - DockNodeCalcTabBarLayout()
12053 // | - BeginTabBarEx()
12054 // | - TabItemEx() calls
12055 // | - EndTabBar()
12056 // | - BeginDockableDragDropTarget()
12057 // | - DockNodeUpdate() - recurse into child nodes...
12058 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12059 // - DockSpace() user submit a dockspace into a window
12060 // | Begin(Child) - create a child window
12061 // | DockNodeUpdate() - call main dock node update function
12062 // | End(Child)
12063 // | ItemSize()
12064 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12065 // - Begin()
12066 // | BeginDocked()
12067 // | BeginDockableDragDropSource()
12068 // | BeginDockableDragDropTarget()
12069 // | - DockNodePreviewDockRender()
12070 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12071 
12072 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12073 // Docking: Internal Types
12074 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12075 // - ImGuiDockRequestType
12076 // - ImGuiDockRequest
12077 // - ImGuiDockPreviewData
12078 // - ImGuiDockNodeSettings
12079 // - ImGuiDockContext
12080 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12081 
12082 enum ImGuiDockRequestType
12083 {
12084  ImGuiDockRequestType_None = 0,
12085  ImGuiDockRequestType_Dock,
12086  ImGuiDockRequestType_Undock,
12087  ImGuiDockRequestType_Split // Split is the same as Dock but without a DockPayload
12088 };
12089 
12090 struct ImGuiDockRequest
12091 {
12092  ImGuiDockRequestType Type;
12093  ImGuiWindow* DockTargetWindow; // Destination/Target Window to dock into (may be a loose window or a DockNode, might be NULL in which case DockTargetNode cannot be NULL)
12094  ImGuiDockNode* DockTargetNode; // Destination/Target Node to dock into
12095  ImGuiWindow* DockPayload; // Source/Payload window to dock (may be a loose window or a DockNode), [Optional]
12096  ImGuiDir DockSplitDir;
12097  float DockSplitRatio;
12098  bool DockSplitOuter;
12099  ImGuiWindow* UndockTargetWindow;
12100  ImGuiDockNode* UndockTargetNode;
12101 
12102  ImGuiDockRequest()
12103  {
12104  Type = ImGuiDockRequestType_None;
12105  DockTargetWindow = DockPayload = UndockTargetWindow = NULL;
12106  DockTargetNode = UndockTargetNode = NULL;
12107  DockSplitDir = ImGuiDir_None;
12108  DockSplitRatio = 0.5f;
12109  DockSplitOuter = false;
12110  }
12111 };
12112 
12113 struct ImGuiDockPreviewData
12114 {
12115  ImGuiDockNode FutureNode;
12116  bool IsDropAllowed;
12117  bool IsCenterAvailable;
12118  bool IsSidesAvailable; // Hold your breath, grammar freaks..
12119  bool IsSplitDirExplicit; // Set when hovered the drop rect (vs. implicit SplitDir==None when hovered the window)
12120  ImGuiDockNode* SplitNode;
12121  ImGuiDir SplitDir;
12122  float SplitRatio;
12123  ImRect DropRectsDraw[ImGuiDir_COUNT + 1]; // May be slightly different from hit-testing drop rects used in DockNodeCalcDropRects()
12124 
12125  ImGuiDockPreviewData() : FutureNode(0) { IsDropAllowed = IsCenterAvailable = IsSidesAvailable = IsSplitDirExplicit = false; SplitNode = NULL; SplitDir = ImGuiDir_None; SplitRatio = 0.f; for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(DropRectsDraw); n++) DropRectsDraw[n] = ImRect(+FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX); }
12126 };
12127 
12128 // Persistent Settings data, stored contiguously in SettingsNodes (sizeof() ~32 bytes)
12129 struct ImGuiDockNodeSettings
12130 {
12131  ImGuiID ID;
12132  ImGuiID ParentNodeId;
12133  ImGuiID ParentWindowId;
12134  ImGuiID SelectedWindowId;
12135  signed char SplitAxis;
12136  char Depth;
12137  ImGuiDockNodeFlags Flags; // NB: We save individual flags one by one in ascii format (ImGuiDockNodeFlags_SavedFlagsMask_)
12138  ImVec2ih Pos;
12139  ImVec2ih Size;
12140  ImVec2ih SizeRef;
12141  ImGuiDockNodeSettings() { ID = ParentNodeId = ParentWindowId = SelectedWindowId = 0; SplitAxis = ImGuiAxis_None; Depth = 0; Flags = ImGuiDockNodeFlags_None; }
12142 };
12143 
12144 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12145 // Docking: Forward Declarations
12146 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12147 
12148 namespace ImGui
12149 {
12150  // ImGuiDockContext
12151  static ImGuiDockNode* DockContextAddNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID id);
12152  static void DockContextRemoveNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node, bool merge_sibling_into_parent_node);
12153  static void DockContextQueueNotifyRemovedNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node);
12154  static void DockContextProcessDock(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockRequest* req);
12155  static void DockContextProcessUndockWindow(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiWindow* window, bool clear_persistent_docking_ref = true);
12156  static void DockContextProcessUndockNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node);
12157  static void DockContextPruneUnusedSettingsNodes(ImGuiContext* ctx);
12158  static ImGuiDockNode* DockContextFindNodeByID(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID id);
12159  static ImGuiDockNode* DockContextBindNodeToWindow(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiWindow* window);
12160  static void DockContextBuildNodesFromSettings(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNodeSettings* node_settings_array, int node_settings_count);
12161  static void DockContextBuildAddWindowsToNodes(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID root_id); // Use root_id==0 to add all
12162 
12163  // ImGuiDockNode
12164  static void DockNodeAddWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiWindow* window, bool add_to_tab_bar);
12165  static void DockNodeMoveWindows(ImGuiDockNode* dst_node, ImGuiDockNode* src_node);
12166  static void DockNodeMoveChildNodes(ImGuiDockNode* dst_node, ImGuiDockNode* src_node);
12167  static ImGuiWindow* DockNodeFindWindowByID(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiID id);
12168  static void DockNodeApplyPosSizeToWindows(ImGuiDockNode* node);
12169  static void DockNodeRemoveWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiID save_dock_id);
12170  static void DockNodeHideHostWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node);
12171  static void DockNodeUpdate(ImGuiDockNode* node);
12172  static void DockNodeUpdateForRootNode(ImGuiDockNode* node);
12173  static void DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlagAndInactiveChilds(ImGuiDockNode* node);
12174  static void DockNodeUpdateTabBar(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiWindow* host_window);
12175  static void DockNodeAddTabBar(ImGuiDockNode* node);
12176  static void DockNodeRemoveTabBar(ImGuiDockNode* node);
12177  static ImGuiID DockNodeUpdateWindowMenu(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar);
12178  static void DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlag(ImGuiDockNode* node);
12179  static void DockNodeStartMouseMovingWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiWindow* window);
12180  static bool DockNodeIsDropAllowed(ImGuiWindow* host_window, ImGuiWindow* payload_window);
12181  static void DockNodePreviewDockSetup(ImGuiWindow* host_window, ImGuiDockNode* host_node, ImGuiWindow* payload_window, ImGuiDockPreviewData* preview_data, bool is_explicit_target, bool is_outer_docking);
12182  static void DockNodePreviewDockRender(ImGuiWindow* host_window, ImGuiDockNode* host_node, ImGuiWindow* payload_window, const ImGuiDockPreviewData* preview_data);
12183  static void DockNodeCalcTabBarLayout(const ImGuiDockNode* node, ImRect* out_title_rect, ImRect* out_tab_bar_rect, ImVec2* out_window_menu_button_pos);
12184  static void DockNodeCalcSplitRects(ImVec2& pos_old, ImVec2& size_old, ImVec2& pos_new, ImVec2& size_new, ImGuiDir dir, ImVec2 size_new_desired);
12185  static bool DockNodeCalcDropRectsAndTestMousePos(const ImRect& parent, ImGuiDir dir, ImRect& out_draw, bool outer_docking, ImVec2* test_mouse_pos);
12186  static const char* DockNodeGetHostWindowTitle(ImGuiDockNode* node, char* buf, int buf_size) { ImFormatString(buf, buf_size, "##DockNode_%02X", node->ID); return buf; }
12187  static int DockNodeGetTabOrder(ImGuiWindow* window);
12188 
12189  // ImGuiDockNode tree manipulations
12190  static void DockNodeTreeSplit(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* parent_node, ImGuiAxis split_axis, int split_first_child, float split_ratio, ImGuiDockNode* new_node);
12191  static void DockNodeTreeMerge(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* parent_node, ImGuiDockNode* merge_lead_child);
12192  static void DockNodeTreeUpdatePosSize(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImVec2 pos, ImVec2 size, bool only_write_to_marked_nodes = false);
12193  static void DockNodeTreeUpdateSplitter(ImGuiDockNode* node);
12194  static ImGuiDockNode* DockNodeTreeFindVisibleNodeByPos(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImVec2 pos);
12195  static ImGuiDockNode* DockNodeTreeFindFallbackLeafNode(ImGuiDockNode* node);
12196 
12197  // Settings
12198  static void DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences(ImGuiID old_node_id, ImGuiID new_node_id);
12199  static void DockSettingsRemoveNodeReferences(ImGuiID* node_ids, int node_ids_count);
12200  static ImGuiDockNodeSettings* DockSettingsFindNodeSettings(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID node_id);
12201  static void DockSettingsHandler_ClearAll(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*);
12202  static void DockSettingsHandler_ApplyAll(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*);
12203  static void* DockSettingsHandler_ReadOpen(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, const char* name);
12204  static void DockSettingsHandler_ReadLine(ImGuiContext*, ImGuiSettingsHandler*, void* entry, const char* line);
12205  static void DockSettingsHandler_WriteAll(ImGuiContext* imgui_ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler* handler, ImGuiTextBuffer* buf);
12206 }
12207 
12208 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12209 // Docking: ImGuiDockContext
12210 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12211 // The lifetime model is different from the one of regular windows: we always create a ImGuiDockNode for each ImGuiDockNodeSettings,
12212 // or we always hold the entire docking node tree. Nodes are frequently hidden, e.g. if the window(s) or child nodes they host are not active.
12213 // At boot time only, we run a simple GC to remove nodes that have no references.
12214 // Because dock node settings (which are small, contiguous structures) are always mirrored by their corresponding dock nodes (more complete structures),
12215 // we can also very easily recreate the nodes from scratch given the settings data (this is what DockContextRebuild() does).
12216 // This is convenient as docking reconfiguration can be implemented by mostly poking at the simpler settings data.
12217 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12218 // - DockContextInitialize()
12219 // - DockContextShutdown()
12220 // - DockContextClearNodes()
12221 // - DockContextRebuildNodes()
12222 // - DockContextNewFrameUpdateUndocking()
12223 // - DockContextNewFrameUpdateDocking()
12224 // - DockContextFindNodeByID()
12225 // - DockContextBindNodeToWindow()
12226 // - DockContextGenNodeID()
12227 // - DockContextAddNode()
12228 // - DockContextRemoveNode()
12229 // - ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData
12230 // - DockContextPruneUnusedSettingsNodes()
12231 // - DockContextBuildNodesFromSettings()
12232 // - DockContextBuildAddWindowsToNodes()
12233 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12234 
12235 void ImGui::DockContextInitialize(ImGuiContext* ctx)
12236 {
12237  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
12238 
12239  // Add .ini handle for persistent docking data
12240  ImGuiSettingsHandler ini_handler;
12241  ini_handler.TypeName = "Docking";
12242  ini_handler.TypeHash = ImHashStr("Docking");
12243  ini_handler.ClearAllFn = DockSettingsHandler_ClearAll;
12244  ini_handler.ReadInitFn = DockSettingsHandler_ClearAll; // Also clear on read
12245  ini_handler.ReadOpenFn = DockSettingsHandler_ReadOpen;
12246  ini_handler.ReadLineFn = DockSettingsHandler_ReadLine;
12247  ini_handler.ApplyAllFn = DockSettingsHandler_ApplyAll;
12248  ini_handler.WriteAllFn = DockSettingsHandler_WriteAll;
12249  g.SettingsHandlers.push_back(ini_handler);
12250 }
12251 
12252 void ImGui::DockContextShutdown(ImGuiContext* ctx)
12253 {
12254  ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
12255  for (int n = 0; n < dc->Nodes.Data.Size; n++)
12256  if (ImGuiDockNode* node = (ImGuiDockNode*)dc->Nodes.Data[n].val_p)
12257  IM_DELETE(node);
12258 }
12259 
12260 void ImGui::DockContextClearNodes(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID root_id, bool clear_settings_refs)
12261 {
12262  IM_UNUSED(ctx);
12263  IM_ASSERT(ctx == GImGui);
12264  DockBuilderRemoveNodeDockedWindows(root_id, clear_settings_refs);
12265  DockBuilderRemoveNodeChildNodes(root_id);
12266 }
12267 
12268 // [DEBUG] This function also acts as a defacto test to make sure we can rebuild from scratch without a glitch
12269 // (Different from DockSettingsHandler_ClearAll() + DockSettingsHandler_ApplyAll() because this reuses current settings!)
12270 void ImGui::DockContextRebuildNodes(ImGuiContext* ctx)
12271 {
12272  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextRebuild()\n");
12273  ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
12274  SaveIniSettingsToMemory();
12275  ImGuiID root_id = 0; // Rebuild all
12276  DockContextClearNodes(ctx, root_id, false);
12277  DockContextBuildNodesFromSettings(ctx, dc->NodesSettings.Data, dc->NodesSettings.Size);
12278  DockContextBuildAddWindowsToNodes(ctx, root_id);
12279 }
12280 
12281 // Docking context update function, called by NewFrame()
12282 void ImGui::DockContextNewFrameUpdateUndocking(ImGuiContext* ctx)
12283 {
12284  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
12285  ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
12286  if (!(g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable))
12287  {
12288  if (dc->Nodes.Data.Size > 0 || dc->Requests.Size > 0)
12289  DockContextClearNodes(ctx, 0, true);
12290  return;
12291  }
12292 
12293  // Setting NoSplit at runtime merges all nodes
12294  if (g.IO.ConfigDockingNoSplit)
12295  for (int n = 0; n < dc->Nodes.Data.Size; n++)
12296  if (ImGuiDockNode* node = (ImGuiDockNode*)dc->Nodes.Data[n].val_p)
12297  if (node->IsRootNode() && node->IsSplitNode())
12298  {
12299  DockBuilderRemoveNodeChildNodes(node->ID);
12300  //dc->WantFullRebuild = true;
12301  }
12302 
12303  // Process full rebuild
12304 #if 0
12305  if (ImGui::IsKeyPressed(ImGui::GetKeyIndex(ImGuiKey_C)))
12306  dc->WantFullRebuild = true;
12307 #endif
12308  if (dc->WantFullRebuild)
12309  {
12310  DockContextRebuildNodes(ctx);
12311  dc->WantFullRebuild = false;
12312  }
12313 
12314  // Process Undocking requests (we need to process them _before_ the UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame call in NewFrame)
12315  for (int n = 0; n < dc->Requests.Size; n++)
12316  {
12317  ImGuiDockRequest* req = &dc->Requests[n];
12318  if (req->Type == ImGuiDockRequestType_Undock && req->UndockTargetWindow)
12319  DockContextProcessUndockWindow(ctx, req->UndockTargetWindow);
12320  else if (req->Type == ImGuiDockRequestType_Undock && req->UndockTargetNode)
12321  DockContextProcessUndockNode(ctx, req->UndockTargetNode);
12322  }
12323 }
12324 
12325 // Docking context update function, called by NewFrame()
12326 void ImGui::DockContextNewFrameUpdateDocking(ImGuiContext* ctx)
12327 {
12328  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
12329  ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
12330  if (!(g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_DockingEnable))
12331  return;
12332 
12333  // [DEBUG] Store hovered dock node.
12334  // We could in theory use DockNodeTreeFindVisibleNodeByPos() on the root host dock node, but using ->DockNode is a good shortcut.
12335  // Note this is mostly a debug thing and isn't actually used for docking target, because docking involve more detailed filtering.
12336  g.HoveredDockNode = NULL;
12337  if (ImGuiWindow* hovered_window = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow)
12338  {
12339  if (hovered_window->DockNodeAsHost)
12340  g.HoveredDockNode = DockNodeTreeFindVisibleNodeByPos(hovered_window->DockNodeAsHost, g.IO.MousePos);
12341  else if (hovered_window->RootWindowDockStop->DockNode)
12342  g.HoveredDockNode = hovered_window->RootWindowDockStop->DockNode;
12343  }
12344 
12345  // Process Docking requests
12346  for (int n = 0; n < dc->Requests.Size; n++)
12347  if (dc->Requests[n].Type == ImGuiDockRequestType_Dock)
12348  DockContextProcessDock(ctx, &dc->Requests[n]);
12349  dc->Requests.resize(0);
12350 
12351  // Create windows for each automatic docking nodes
12352  // We can have NULL pointers when we delete nodes, but because ID are recycled this should amortize nicely (and our node count will never be very high)
12353  for (int n = 0; n < dc->Nodes.Data.Size; n++)
12354  if (ImGuiDockNode* node = (ImGuiDockNode*)dc->Nodes.Data[n].val_p)
12355  if (node->IsFloatingNode())
12356  DockNodeUpdate(node);
12357 }
12358 
12359 static ImGuiDockNode* ImGui::DockContextFindNodeByID(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID id)
12360 {
12361  return (ImGuiDockNode*)ctx->DockContext.Nodes.GetVoidPtr(id);
12362 }
12363 
12364 ImGuiID ImGui::DockContextGenNodeID(ImGuiContext* ctx)
12365 {
12366  // Generate an ID for new node (the exact ID value doesn't matter as long as it is not already used)
12367  // FIXME-OPT FIXME-DOCK: This is suboptimal, even if the node count is small enough not to be a worry. We should poke in ctx->Nodes to find a suitable ID faster.
12368  ImGuiID id = 0x0001;
12369  while (DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, id) != NULL)
12370  id++;
12371  return id;
12372 }
12373 
12374 static ImGuiDockNode* ImGui::DockContextAddNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID id)
12375 {
12376  // Generate an ID for the new node (the exact ID value doesn't matter as long as it is not already used) and add the first window.
12377  if (id == 0)
12378  id = DockContextGenNodeID(ctx);
12379  else
12380  IM_ASSERT(DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, id) == NULL);
12381 
12382  // We don't set node->LastFrameAlive on construction. Nodes are always created at all time to reflect .ini settings!
12383  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextAddNode 0x%08X\n", id);
12384  ImGuiDockNode* node = IM_NEW(ImGuiDockNode)(id);
12385  ctx->DockContext.Nodes.SetVoidPtr(node->ID, node);
12386  return node;
12387 }
12388 
12389 static void ImGui::DockContextRemoveNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node, bool merge_sibling_into_parent_node)
12390 {
12391  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
12392  ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
12393 
12394  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextRemoveNode 0x%08X\n", node->ID);
12395  IM_ASSERT(DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, node->ID) == node);
12396  IM_ASSERT(node->ChildNodes[0] == NULL && node->ChildNodes[1] == NULL);
12397  IM_ASSERT(node->Windows.Size == 0);
12398 
12399  if (node->HostWindow)
12400  node->HostWindow->DockNodeAsHost = NULL;
12401 
12402  ImGuiDockNode* parent_node = node->ParentNode;
12403  const bool merge = (merge_sibling_into_parent_node && parent_node != NULL);
12404  if (merge)
12405  {
12406  IM_ASSERT(parent_node->ChildNodes[0] == node || parent_node->ChildNodes[1] == node);
12407  ImGuiDockNode* sibling_node = (parent_node->ChildNodes[0] == node ? parent_node->ChildNodes[1] : parent_node->ChildNodes[0]);
12408  DockNodeTreeMerge(&g, parent_node, sibling_node);
12409  }
12410  else
12411  {
12412  for (int n = 0; parent_node && n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(parent_node->ChildNodes); n++)
12413  if (parent_node->ChildNodes[n] == node)
12414  node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[n] = NULL;
12415  dc->Nodes.SetVoidPtr(node->ID, NULL);
12416  IM_DELETE(node);
12417  }
12418 }
12419 
12420 static int IMGUI_CDECL DockNodeComparerDepthMostFirst(const void* lhs, const void* rhs)
12421 {
12422  const ImGuiDockNode* a = *(const ImGuiDockNode* const*)lhs;
12423  const ImGuiDockNode* b = *(const ImGuiDockNode* const*)rhs;
12424  return ImGui::DockNodeGetDepth(b) - ImGui::DockNodeGetDepth(a);
12425 }
12426 
12427 // Pre C++0x doesn't allow us to use a function-local type (without linkage) as template parameter, so we moved this here.
12428 struct ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData
12429 {
12430  int CountWindows, CountChildWindows, CountChildNodes;
12431  ImGuiID RootId;
12432  ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData() { CountWindows = CountChildWindows = CountChildNodes = 0; RootId = 0; }
12433 };
12434 
12435 // Garbage collect unused nodes (run once at init time)
12436 static void ImGui::DockContextPruneUnusedSettingsNodes(ImGuiContext* ctx)
12437 {
12438  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
12439  ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
12440  IM_ASSERT(g.Windows.Size == 0);
12441 
12442  ImPool<ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData> pool;
12443  pool.Reserve(dc->NodesSettings.Size);
12444 
12445  // Count child nodes and compute RootID
12446  for (int settings_n = 0; settings_n < dc->NodesSettings.Size; settings_n++)
12447  {
12448  ImGuiDockNodeSettings* settings = &dc->NodesSettings[settings_n];
12449  ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData* parent_data = settings->ParentNodeId ? pool.GetByKey(settings->ParentNodeId) : 0;
12450  pool.GetOrAddByKey(settings->ID)->RootId = parent_data ? parent_data->RootId : settings->ID;
12451  if (settings->ParentNodeId)
12452  pool.GetOrAddByKey(settings->ParentNodeId)->CountChildNodes++;
12453  }
12454 
12455  // Count reference to dock ids from dockspaces
12456  // We track the 'auto-DockNode <- manual-Window <- manual-DockSpace' in order to avoid 'auto-DockNode' being ditched by DockContextPruneUnusedSettingsNodes()
12457  for (int settings_n = 0; settings_n < dc->NodesSettings.Size; settings_n++)
12458  {
12459  ImGuiDockNodeSettings* settings = &dc->NodesSettings[settings_n];
12460  if (settings->ParentWindowId != 0)
12461  if (ImGuiWindowSettings* window_settings = FindWindowSettings(settings->ParentWindowId))
12462  if (window_settings->DockId)
12463  if (ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData* data = pool.GetByKey(window_settings->DockId))
12464  data->CountChildNodes++;
12465  }
12466 
12467  // Count reference to dock ids from window settings
12468  // We guard against the possibility of an invalid .ini file (RootID may point to a missing node)
12469  for (ImGuiWindowSettings* settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
12470  if (ImGuiID dock_id = settings->DockId)
12471  if (ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData* data = pool.GetByKey(dock_id))
12472  {
12473  data->CountWindows++;
12474  if (ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData* data_root = (data->RootId == dock_id) ? data : pool.GetByKey(data->RootId))
12475  data_root->CountChildWindows++;
12476  }
12477 
12478  // Prune
12479  for (int settings_n = 0; settings_n < dc->NodesSettings.Size; settings_n++)
12480  {
12481  ImGuiDockNodeSettings* settings = &dc->NodesSettings[settings_n];
12482  ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData* data = pool.GetByKey(settings->ID);
12483  if (data->CountWindows > 1)
12484  continue;
12485  ImGuiDockContextPruneNodeData* data_root = (data->RootId == settings->ID) ? data : pool.GetByKey(data->RootId);
12486 
12487  bool remove = false;
12488  remove |= (data->CountWindows == 1 && settings->ParentNodeId == 0 && data->CountChildNodes == 0 && !(settings->Flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode)); // Floating root node with only 1 window
12489  remove |= (data->CountWindows == 0 && settings->ParentNodeId == 0 && data->CountChildNodes == 0); // Leaf nodes with 0 window
12490  remove |= (data_root->CountChildWindows == 0);
12491  if (remove)
12492  {
12493  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextPruneUnusedSettingsNodes: Prune 0x%08X\n", settings->ID);
12494  DockSettingsRemoveNodeReferences(&settings->ID, 1);
12495  settings->ID = 0;
12496  }
12497  }
12498 }
12499 
12500 static void ImGui::DockContextBuildNodesFromSettings(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNodeSettings* node_settings_array, int node_settings_count)
12501 {
12502  // Build nodes
12503  for (int node_n = 0; node_n < node_settings_count; node_n++)
12504  {
12505  ImGuiDockNodeSettings* settings = &node_settings_array[node_n];
12506  if (settings->ID == 0)
12507  continue;
12508  ImGuiDockNode* node = DockContextAddNode(ctx, settings->ID);
12509  node->ParentNode = settings->ParentNodeId ? DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, settings->ParentNodeId) : NULL;
12510  node->Pos = ImVec2(settings->Pos.x, settings->Pos.y);
12511  node->Size = ImVec2(settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y);
12512  node->SizeRef = ImVec2(settings->SizeRef.x, settings->SizeRef.y);
12513  node->AuthorityForPos = node->AuthorityForSize = node->AuthorityForViewport = ImGuiDataAuthority_DockNode;
12514  if (node->ParentNode && node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[0] == NULL)
12515  node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[0] = node;
12516  else if (node->ParentNode && node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[1] == NULL)
12517  node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[1] = node;
12518  node->SelectedTabId = settings->SelectedWindowId;
12519  node->SplitAxis = (ImGuiAxis)settings->SplitAxis;
12520  node->LocalFlags |= (settings->Flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_SavedFlagsMask_);
12521 
12522  // Bind host window immediately if it already exist (in case of a rebuild)
12523  // This is useful as the RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight links necessary to highlight the currently focused node requires node->HostWindow to be set.
12524  char host_window_title[20];
12525  ImGuiDockNode* root_node = DockNodeGetRootNode(node);
12526  node->HostWindow = FindWindowByName(DockNodeGetHostWindowTitle(root_node, host_window_title, IM_ARRAYSIZE(host_window_title)));
12527  }
12528 }
12529 
12530 void ImGui::DockContextBuildAddWindowsToNodes(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiID root_id)
12531 {
12532  // Rebind all windows to nodes (they can also lazily rebind but we'll have a visible glitch during the first frame)
12533  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
12534  for (int n = 0; n < g.Windows.Size; n++)
12535  {
12536  ImGuiWindow* window = g.Windows[n];
12537  if (window->DockId == 0 || window->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount - 1)
12538  continue;
12539  if (window->DockNode != NULL)
12540  continue;
12541 
12542  ImGuiDockNode* node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, window->DockId);
12543  IM_ASSERT(node != NULL); // This should have been called after DockContextBuildNodesFromSettings()
12544  if (root_id == 0 || DockNodeGetRootNode(node)->ID == root_id)
12545  DockNodeAddWindow(node, window, true);
12546  }
12547 }
12548 
12549 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12550 // Docking: ImGuiDockContext Docking/Undocking functions
12551 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12552 // - DockContextQueueDock()
12553 // - DockContextQueueUndockWindow()
12554 // - DockContextQueueUndockNode()
12555 // - DockContextQueueNotifyRemovedNode()
12556 // - DockContextProcessDock()
12557 // - DockContextProcessUndockWindow()
12558 // - DockContextProcessUndockNode()
12559 // - DockContextCalcDropPosForDocking()
12560 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12561 
12562 void ImGui::DockContextQueueDock(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiWindow* target, ImGuiDockNode* target_node, ImGuiWindow* payload, ImGuiDir split_dir, float split_ratio, bool split_outer)
12563 {
12564  IM_ASSERT(target != payload);
12565  ImGuiDockRequest req;
12566  req.Type = ImGuiDockRequestType_Dock;
12567  req.DockTargetWindow = target;
12568  req.DockTargetNode = target_node;
12569  req.DockPayload = payload;
12570  req.DockSplitDir = split_dir;
12571  req.DockSplitRatio = split_ratio;
12572  req.DockSplitOuter = split_outer;
12573  ctx->DockContext.Requests.push_back(req);
12574 }
12575 
12576 void ImGui::DockContextQueueUndockWindow(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiWindow* window)
12577 {
12578  ImGuiDockRequest req;
12579  req.Type = ImGuiDockRequestType_Undock;
12580  req.UndockTargetWindow = window;
12581  ctx->DockContext.Requests.push_back(req);
12582 }
12583 
12584 void ImGui::DockContextQueueUndockNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node)
12585 {
12586  ImGuiDockRequest req;
12587  req.Type = ImGuiDockRequestType_Undock;
12588  req.UndockTargetNode = node;
12589  ctx->DockContext.Requests.push_back(req);
12590 }
12591 
12592 void ImGui::DockContextQueueNotifyRemovedNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node)
12593 {
12594  ImGuiDockContext* dc = &ctx->DockContext;
12595  for (int n = 0; n < dc->Requests.Size; n++)
12596  if (dc->Requests[n].DockTargetNode == node)
12597  dc->Requests[n].Type = ImGuiDockRequestType_None;
12598 }
12599 
12600 void ImGui::DockContextProcessDock(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockRequest* req)
12601 {
12602  IM_ASSERT((req->Type == ImGuiDockRequestType_Dock && req->DockPayload != NULL) || (req->Type == ImGuiDockRequestType_Split && req->DockPayload == NULL));
12603  IM_ASSERT(req->DockTargetWindow != NULL || req->DockTargetNode != NULL);
12604 
12605  ImGuiContext& g = *ctx;
12606  IM_UNUSED(g);
12607 
12608  ImGuiWindow* payload_window = req->DockPayload; // Optional
12609  ImGuiWindow* target_window = req->DockTargetWindow;
12610  ImGuiDockNode* node = req->DockTargetNode;
12611  if (payload_window)
12612  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextProcessDock node 0x%08X target '%s' dock window '%s', split_dir %d\n", node ? node->ID : 0, target_window ? target_window->Name : "NULL", payload_window ? payload_window->Name : "NULL", req->DockSplitDir);
12613  else
12614  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextProcessDock node 0x%08X, split_dir %d\n", node ? node->ID : 0, req->DockSplitDir);
12615 
12616  // Decide which Tab will be selected at the end of the operation
12617  ImGuiID next_selected_id = 0;
12618  ImGuiDockNode* payload_node = NULL;
12619  if (payload_window)
12620  {
12621  payload_node = payload_window->DockNodeAsHost;
12622  payload_window->DockNodeAsHost = NULL; // Important to clear this as the node will have its life as a child which might be merged/deleted later.
12623  if (payload_node && payload_node->IsLeafNode())
12624  next_selected_id = payload_node->TabBar->NextSelectedTabId ? payload_node->TabBar->NextSelectedTabId : payload_node->TabBar->SelectedTabId;
12625  if (payload_node == NULL)
12626  next_selected_id = payload_window->ID;
12627  }
12628 
12629  // FIXME-DOCK: When we are trying to dock an existing single-window node into a loose window, transfer Node ID as well
12630  // When processing an interactive split, usually LastFrameAlive will be < g.FrameCount. But DockBuilder operations can make it ==.
12631  if (node)
12632  IM_ASSERT(node->LastFrameAlive <= g.FrameCount);
12633  if (node && target_window && node == target_window->DockNodeAsHost)
12634  IM_ASSERT(node->Windows.Size > 0 || node->IsSplitNode() || node->IsCentralNode());
12635 
12636  // Create new node and add existing window to it
12637  if (node == NULL)
12638  {
12639  node = DockContextAddNode(ctx, 0);
12640  node->Pos = target_window->Pos;
12641  node->Size = target_window->Size;
12642  if (target_window->DockNodeAsHost == NULL)
12643  {
12644  DockNodeAddWindow(node, target_window, true);
12645  node->TabBar->Tabs[0].Flags &= ~ImGuiTabItemFlags_Unsorted;
12646  target_window->DockIsActive = true;
12647  }
12648  }
12649 
12650  ImGuiDir split_dir = req->DockSplitDir;
12651  if (split_dir != ImGuiDir_None)
12652  {
12653  // Split into one, one side will be our payload node unless we are dropping a loose window
12654  const ImGuiAxis split_axis = (split_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || split_dir == ImGuiDir_Right) ? ImGuiAxis_X : ImGuiAxis_Y;
12655  const int split_inheritor_child_idx = (split_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || split_dir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? 1 : 0; // Current contents will be moved to the opposite side
12656  const float split_ratio = req->DockSplitRatio;
12657  DockNodeTreeSplit(ctx, node, split_axis, split_inheritor_child_idx, split_ratio, payload_node); // payload_node may be NULL here!
12658  ImGuiDockNode* new_node = node->ChildNodes[split_inheritor_child_idx ^ 1];
12659  new_node->HostWindow = node->HostWindow;
12660  node = new_node;
12661  }
12662  node->LocalFlags &= ~ImGuiDockNodeFlags_HiddenTabBar;
12663 
12664  if (node != payload_node)
12665  {
12666  // Create tab bar before we call DockNodeMoveWindows (which would attempt to move the old tab-bar, which would lead us to payload tabs wrongly appearing before target tabs!)
12667  if (node->Windows.Size > 0 && node->TabBar == NULL)
12668  {
12669  DockNodeAddTabBar(node);
12670  for (int n = 0; n < node->Windows.Size; n++)
12671  TabBarAddTab(node->TabBar, ImGuiTabItemFlags_None, node->Windows[n]);
12672  }
12673 
12674  if (payload_node != NULL)
12675  {
12676  // Transfer full payload node (with 1+ child windows or child nodes)
12677  if (payload_node->IsSplitNode())
12678  {
12679  if (node->Windows.Size > 0)
12680  {
12681  // We can dock a split payload into a node that already has windows _only_ if our payload is a node tree with a single visible node.
12682  // In this situation, we move the windows of the target node into the currently visible node of the payload.
12683  // This allows us to preserve some of the underlying dock tree settings nicely.
12684  IM_ASSERT(payload_node->OnlyNodeWithWindows != NULL); // The docking should have been blocked by DockNodePreviewDockSetup() early on and never submitted.
12685  ImGuiDockNode* visible_node = payload_node->OnlyNodeWithWindows;
12686  if (visible_node->TabBar)
12687  IM_ASSERT(visible_node->TabBar->Tabs.Size > 0);
12688  DockNodeMoveWindows(node, visible_node);
12689  DockNodeMoveWindows(visible_node, node);
12690  DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences(node->ID, visible_node->ID);
12691  }
12692  if (node->IsCentralNode())
12693  {
12694  // Central node property needs to be moved to a leaf node, pick the last focused one.
12695  // FIXME-DOCK: If we had to transfer other flags here, what would the policy be?
12696  ImGuiDockNode* last_focused_node = DockContextFindNodeByID(ctx, payload_node->LastFocusedNodeId);
12697  IM_ASSERT(last_focused_node != NULL);
12698  ImGuiDockNode* last_focused_root_node = DockNodeGetRootNode(last_focused_node);
12699  IM_ASSERT(last_focused_root_node == DockNodeGetRootNode(payload_node));
12700  last_focused_node->LocalFlags |= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode;
12701  node->LocalFlags &= ~ImGuiDockNodeFlags_CentralNode;
12702  last_focused_root_node->CentralNode = last_focused_node;
12703  }
12704 
12705  IM_ASSERT(node->Windows.Size == 0);
12706  DockNodeMoveChildNodes(node, payload_node);
12707  }
12708  else
12709  {
12710  const ImGuiID payload_dock_id = payload_node->ID;
12711  DockNodeMoveWindows(node, payload_node);
12712  DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences(payload_dock_id, node->ID);
12713  }
12714  DockContextRemoveNode(ctx, payload_node, true);
12715  }
12716  else if (payload_window)
12717  {
12718  // Transfer single window
12719  const ImGuiID payload_dock_id = payload_window->DockId;
12720  node->VisibleWindow = payload_window;
12721  DockNodeAddWindow(node, payload_window, true);
12722  if (payload_dock_id != 0)
12723  DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences(payload_dock_id, node->ID);
12724  }
12725  }
12726  else
12727  {
12728  // When docking a floating single window node we want to reevaluate auto-hiding of the tab bar
12729  node->WantHiddenTabBarUpdate = true;
12730  }
12731 
12732  // Update selection immediately
12733  if (ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = node->TabBar)
12734  tab_bar->NextSelectedTabId = next_selected_id;
12735  MarkIniSettingsDirty();
12736 }
12737 
12738 void ImGui::DockContextProcessUndockWindow(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiWindow* window, bool clear_persistent_docking_ref)
12739 {
12740  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextProcessUndockWindow window '%s', clear_persistent_docking_ref = %d\n", window->Name, clear_persistent_docking_ref);
12741  IM_UNUSED(ctx);
12742  if (window->DockNode)
12743  DockNodeRemoveWindow(window->DockNode, window, clear_persistent_docking_ref ? 0 : window->DockId);
12744  else
12745  window->DockId = 0;
12746  window->Collapsed = false;
12747  window->DockIsActive = false;
12748  window->DockTabIsVisible = false;
12749  MarkIniSettingsDirty();
12750 }
12751 
12752 void ImGui::DockContextProcessUndockNode(ImGuiContext* ctx, ImGuiDockNode* node)
12753 {
12754  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockContextProcessUndockNode node %08X\n", node->ID);
12755  IM_ASSERT(node->IsLeafNode());
12756  IM_ASSERT(node->Windows.Size >= 1);
12757 
12758  if (node->IsRootNode() || node->IsCentralNode())
12759  {
12760  // In the case of a root node or central node, the node will have to stay in place. Create a new node to receive the payload.
12761  ImGuiDockNode* new_node = DockContextAddNode(ctx, 0);
12762  DockNodeMoveWindows(new_node, node);
12763  DockSettingsRenameNodeReferences(node->ID, new_node->ID);
12764  for (int n = 0; n < new_node->Windows.Size; n++)
12765  UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(new_node->Windows[n], new_node->Windows[n]->Flags, NULL);
12766  node = new_node;
12767  }
12768  else
12769  {
12770  // Otherwise extract our node and merging our sibling back into the parent node.
12771  IM_ASSERT(node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[0] == node || node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[1] == node);
12772  int index_in_parent = (node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[0] == node) ? 0 : 1;
12773  node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[index_in_parent] = NULL;
12774  DockNodeTreeMerge(ctx, node->ParentNode, node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[index_in_parent ^ 1]);
12775  node->ParentNode->AuthorityForViewport = ImGuiDataAuthority_Window; // The node that stays in place keeps the viewport, so our newly dragged out node will create a new viewport
12776  node->ParentNode = NULL;
12777  }
12778  node->AuthorityForPos = node->AuthorityForSize = ImGuiDataAuthority_Window;
12779  node->WantMouseMove = true;
12780  MarkIniSettingsDirty();
12781 }
12782 
12783 // This is mostly used for automation.
12784 bool ImGui::DockContextCalcDropPosForDocking(ImGuiWindow* target, ImGuiDockNode* target_node, ImGuiWindow* payload, ImGuiDir split_dir, bool split_outer, ImVec2* out_pos)
12785 {
12786  if (split_outer)
12787  {
12788  IM_ASSERT(0);
12789  }
12790  else
12791  {
12792  ImGuiDockPreviewData split_data;
12793  DockNodePreviewDockSetup(target, target_node, payload, &split_data, false, split_outer);
12794  if (split_data.DropRectsDraw[split_dir+1].IsInverted())
12795  return false;
12796  *out_pos = split_data.DropRectsDraw[split_dir+1].GetCenter();
12797  return true;
12798  }
12799  return false;
12800 }
12801 
12802 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12803 // Docking: ImGuiDockNode
12804 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12805 // - DockNodeGetTabOrder()
12806 // - DockNodeAddWindow()
12807 // - DockNodeRemoveWindow()
12808 // - DockNodeMoveChildNodes()
12809 // - DockNodeMoveWindows()
12810 // - DockNodeApplyPosSizeToWindows()
12811 // - DockNodeHideHostWindow()
12812 // - ImGuiDockNodeFindInfoResults
12813 // - DockNodeFindInfo()
12814 // - DockNodeFindWindowByID()
12815 // - DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlagAndInactiveChilds()
12816 // - DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlag()
12817 // - DockNodeStartMouseMovingWindow()
12818 // - DockNodeUpdate()
12819 // - DockNodeUpdateWindowMenu()
12820 // - DockNodeBeginAmendTabBar()
12821 // - DockNodeEndAmendTabBar()
12822 // - DockNodeUpdateTabBar()
12823 // - DockNodeAddTabBar()
12824 // - DockNodeRemoveTabBar()
12825 // - DockNodeIsDropAllowedOne()
12826 // - DockNodeIsDropAllowed()
12827 // - DockNodeCalcTabBarLayout()
12828 // - DockNodeCalcSplitRects()
12829 // - DockNodeCalcDropRectsAndTestMousePos()
12830 // - DockNodePreviewDockSetup()
12831 // - DockNodePreviewDockRender()
12832 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12833 
12834 ImGuiDockNode::ImGuiDockNode(ImGuiID id)
12835 {
12836  ID = id;
12837  SharedFlags = LocalFlags = ImGuiDockNodeFlags_None;
12838  ParentNode = ChildNodes[0] = ChildNodes[1] = NULL;
12839  TabBar = NULL;
12840  SplitAxis = ImGuiAxis_None;
12841 
12842  State = ImGuiDockNodeState_Unknown;
12843  HostWindow = VisibleWindow = NULL;
12844  CentralNode = OnlyNodeWithWindows = NULL;
12845  LastFrameAlive = LastFrameActive = LastFrameFocused = -1;
12846  LastFocusedNodeId = 0;
12847  SelectedTabId = 0;
12848  WantCloseTabId = 0;
12849  AuthorityForPos = AuthorityForSize = ImGuiDataAuthority_DockNode;
12850  AuthorityForViewport = ImGuiDataAuthority_Auto;
12851  IsVisible = true;
12852  IsFocused = HasCloseButton = HasWindowMenuButton = false;
12853  WantCloseAll = WantLockSizeOnce = WantMouseMove = WantHiddenTabBarUpdate = WantHiddenTabBarToggle = false;
12854  MarkedForPosSizeWrite = false;
12855 }
12856 
12857 ImGuiDockNode::~ImGuiDockNode()
12858 {
12859  IM_DELETE(TabBar);
12860  TabBar = NULL;
12861  ChildNodes[0] = ChildNodes[1] = NULL;
12862 }
12863 
12864 int ImGui::DockNodeGetTabOrder(ImGuiWindow* window)
12865 {
12866  ImGuiTabBar* tab_bar = window->DockNode->TabBar;
12867  if (tab_bar == NULL)
12868  return -1;
12869  ImGuiTabItem* tab = TabBarFindTabByID(tab_bar, window->ID);
12870  return tab ? tab_bar->GetTabOrder(tab) : -1;
12871 }
12872 
12873 static void ImGui::DockNodeAddWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiWindow* window, bool add_to_tab_bar)
12874 {
12875  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui; (void)g;
12876  if (window->DockNode)
12877  {
12878  // Can overwrite an existing window->DockNode (e.g. pointing to a disabled DockSpace node)
12879  IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode->ID != node->ID);
12880  DockNodeRemoveWindow(window->DockNode, window, 0);
12881  }
12882  IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode == NULL || window->DockNodeAsHost == NULL);
12883  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockNodeAddWindow node 0x%08X window '%s'\n", node->ID, window->Name);
12884 
12885  node->Windows.push_back(window);
12886  node->WantHiddenTabBarUpdate = true;
12887  window->DockNode = node;
12888  window->DockId = node->ID;
12889  window->DockIsActive = (node->Windows.Size > 1);
12890  window->DockTabWantClose = false;
12891 
12892  // If more than 2 windows appeared on the same frame, we'll create a new hosting DockNode from the point of the second window submission.
12893  // Then we need to hide the first window (after its been output) otherwise it would be visible as a standalone window for one frame.
12894  if (node->HostWindow == NULL && node->Windows.Size == 2 && node->Windows[0]->WasActive == false)
12895  {
12896  node->Windows[0]->Hidden = true;
12897  node->Windows[0]->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
12898  }
12899 
12900  // When reactivating a node with one or two loose window, the window pos/size/viewport are authoritative over the node storage.
12901  // In particular it is important we init the viewport from the first window so we don't create two viewports and drop one.
12902  if (node->HostWindow == NULL && node->IsFloatingNode())
12903  {
12904  if (node->AuthorityForPos == ImGuiDataAuthority_Auto)
12905  node->AuthorityForPos = ImGuiDataAuthority_Window;
12906  if (node->AuthorityForSize == ImGuiDataAuthority_Auto)
12907  node->AuthorityForSize = ImGuiDataAuthority_Window;
12908  if (node->AuthorityForViewport == ImGuiDataAuthority_Auto)
12909  node->AuthorityForViewport = ImGuiDataAuthority_Window;
12910  }
12911 
12912  // Add to tab bar if requested
12913  if (add_to_tab_bar)
12914  {
12915  if (node->TabBar == NULL)
12916  {
12917  DockNodeAddTabBar(node);
12918  node->TabBar->SelectedTabId = node->TabBar->NextSelectedTabId = node->SelectedTabId;
12919 
12920  // Add existing windows
12921  for (int n = 0; n < node->Windows.Size - 1; n++)
12922  TabBarAddTab(node->TabBar, ImGuiTabItemFlags_None, node->Windows[n]);
12923  }
12924  TabBarAddTab(node->TabBar, ImGuiTabItemFlags_Unsorted, window);
12925  }
12926 
12927  DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlag(node);
12928 
12929  // Update this without waiting for the next time we Begin() in the window, so our host window will have the proper title bar color on its first frame.
12930  if (node->HostWindow)
12931  UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(window, window->Flags | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow, node->HostWindow);
12932 }
12933 
12934 static void ImGui::DockNodeRemoveWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiWindow* window, ImGuiID save_dock_id)
12935 {
12936  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
12937  IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode == node);
12938  //IM_ASSERT(window->RootWindow == node->HostWindow);
12939  //IM_ASSERT(window->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount); // We may call this from Begin()
12940  IM_ASSERT(save_dock_id == 0 || save_dock_id == node->ID);
12941  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_DOCKING("DockNodeRemoveWindow node 0x%08X window '%s'\n", node->ID, window->Name);
12942 
12943  window->DockNode = NULL;
12944  window->DockIsActive = window->DockTabWantClose = false;
12945  window->DockId = save_dock_id;
12946  UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(window, window->Flags & ~ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow, NULL); // Update immediately
12947 
12948  // Remove window
12949  bool erased = false;
12950  for (int n = 0; n < node->Windows.Size; n++)
12951  if (node->Windows[n] == window)
12952  {
12953  node->Windows.erase(node->Windows.Data + n);
12954  erased = true;
12955  break;
12956  }
12957  IM_ASSERT(erased);
12958  if (node->VisibleWindow == window)
12959  node->VisibleWindow = NULL;
12960 
12961  // Remove tab and possibly tab bar
12962  node->WantHiddenTabBarUpdate = true;
12963  if (node->TabBar)
12964  {
12965  TabBarRemoveTab(node->TabBar, window->ID);
12966  const int tab_count_threshold_for_tab_bar = node->IsCentralNode() ? 1 : 2;
12967  if (node->Windows.Size < tab_count_threshold_for_tab_bar)
12968  DockNodeRemoveTabBar(node);
12969  }
12970 
12971  if (node->Windows.Size == 0 && !node->IsCentralNode() && !node->IsDockSpace() && window->DockId != node->ID)
12972  {
12973  // Automatic dock node delete themselves if they are not holding at least one tab
12974  DockContextRemoveNode(&g, node, true);
12975  return;
12976  }
12977 
12978  if (node->Windows.Size == 1 && !node->IsCentralNode() && node->HostWindow)
12979  {
12980  ImGuiWindow* remaining_window = node->Windows[0];
12981  if (node->HostWindow->ViewportOwned && node->IsRootNode())
12982  {
12983  // Transfer viewport back to the remaining loose window
12984  IM_ASSERT(node->HostWindow->Viewport->Window == node->HostWindow);
12985  node->HostWindow->Viewport->Window = remaining_window;
12986  node->HostWindow->Viewport->ID = remaining_window->ID;
12987  }
12988  remaining_window->Collapsed = node->HostWindow->Collapsed;
12989  }
12990 
12991  // Update visibility immediately is required so the DockNodeUpdateRemoveInactiveChilds() processing can reflect changes up the tree
12992  DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlag(node);
12993 }
12994 
12995 static void ImGui::DockNodeMoveChildNodes(ImGuiDockNode* dst_node, ImGuiDockNode* src_node)
12996 {
12997  IM_ASSERT(dst_node->Windows.Size == 0);
12998  dst_node->ChildNodes[0] = src_node->ChildNodes[0];
12999  dst_node->ChildNodes[1] = src_node->ChildNodes[1];
13000  if (dst_node->ChildNodes[0])
13001  dst_node->ChildNodes[0]->ParentNode = dst_node;
13002  if (dst_node->ChildNodes[1])
13003  dst_node->ChildNodes[1]->ParentNode = dst_node;
13004  dst_node->SplitAxis = src_node->SplitAxis;
13005  dst_node->SizeRef = src_node->SizeRef;
13006  src_node->ChildNodes[0] = src_node->ChildNodes[1] = NULL;
13007 }
13008 
13009 static void ImGui::DockNodeMoveWindows(ImGuiDockNode* dst_node, ImGuiDockNode* src_node)
13010 {
13011  // Insert tabs in the same orders as currently ordered (node->Windows isn't ordered)
13012  IM_ASSERT(src_node && dst_node && dst_node != src_node);
13013  ImGuiTabBar* src_tab_bar = src_node->TabBar;
13014  if (src_tab_bar != NULL)
13015  IM_ASSERT(src_node->Windows.Size <= src_node->TabBar->Tabs.Size);
13016 
13017  // If the dst_node is empty we can just move the entire tab bar (to preserve selection, scrolling, etc.)
13018  bool move_tab_bar = (src_tab_bar != NULL) && (dst_node->TabBar == NULL);
13019  if (move_tab_bar)
13020  {
13021  dst_node->TabBar = src_node->TabBar;
13022  src_node->TabBar = NULL;
13023  }
13024 
13025  for (int n = 0; n < src_node->Windows.Size; n++)
13026  {
13027  // DockNode's TabBar may have non-window Tabs manually appended by user
13028  if (ImGuiWindow* window = src_tab_bar ? src_tab_bar->Tabs[n].Window : src_node->Windows[n])
13029  {
13030  window->DockNode = NULL;
13031  window->DockIsActive = false;
13032  DockNodeAddWindow(dst_node, window, move_tab_bar ? false : true);
13033  }
13034  }
13035  src_node->Windows.clear();
13036 
13037  if (!move_tab_bar && src_node->TabBar)
13038  {
13039  if (dst_node->TabBar)
13040  dst_node->TabBar->SelectedTabId = src_node->TabBar->SelectedTabId;
13041  DockNodeRemoveTabBar(src_node);
13042  }
13043 }
13044 
13045 static void ImGui::DockNodeApplyPosSizeToWindows(ImGuiDockNode* node)
13046 {
13047  for (int n = 0; n < node->Windows.Size; n++)
13048  {
13049  SetWindowPos(node->Windows[n], node->Pos, ImGuiCond_Always); // We don't assign directly to Pos because it can break the calculation of SizeContents on next frame
13050  SetWindowSize(node->Windows[n], node->Size, ImGuiCond_Always);
13051  }
13052 }
13053 
13054 static void ImGui::DockNodeHideHostWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node)
13055 {
13056  if (node->HostWindow)
13057  {
13058  if (node->HostWindow->DockNodeAsHost == node)
13059  node->HostWindow->DockNodeAsHost = NULL;
13060  node->HostWindow = NULL;
13061  }
13062 
13063  if (node->Windows.Size == 1)
13064  {
13065  node->VisibleWindow = node->Windows[0];
13066  node->Windows[0]->DockIsActive = false;
13067  }
13068 
13069  if (node->TabBar)
13070  DockNodeRemoveTabBar(node);
13071 }
13072 
13073 // Search function called once by root node in DockNodeUpdate()
13074 struct ImGuiDockNodeFindInfoResults
13075 {
13076  ImGuiDockNode* CentralNode;
13077  ImGuiDockNode* FirstNodeWithWindows;
13078  int CountNodesWithWindows;
13079  //ImGuiWindowClass WindowClassForMerges;
13080 
13081  ImGuiDockNodeFindInfoResults() { CentralNode = FirstNodeWithWindows = NULL; CountNodesWithWindows = 0; }
13082 };
13083 
13084 static void DockNodeFindInfo(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiDockNodeFindInfoResults* results)
13085 {
13086  if (node->Windows.Size > 0)
13087  {
13088  if (results->FirstNodeWithWindows == NULL)
13089  results->FirstNodeWithWindows = node;
13090  results->CountNodesWithWindows++;
13091  }
13092  if (node->IsCentralNode())
13093  {
13094  IM_ASSERT(results->CentralNode == NULL); // Should be only one
13095  IM_ASSERT(node->IsLeafNode() && "If you get this assert: please submit .ini file + repro of actions leading to this.");
13096  results->CentralNode = node;
13097  }
13098  if (results->CountNodesWithWindows > 1 && results->CentralNode != NULL)
13099  return;
13100  if (node->ChildNodes[0])
13101  DockNodeFindInfo(node->ChildNodes[0], results);
13102  if (node->ChildNodes[1])
13103  DockNodeFindInfo(node->ChildNodes[1], results);
13104 }
13105 
13106 static ImGuiWindow* ImGui::DockNodeFindWindowByID(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiID id)
13107 {
13108  IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
13109  for (int n = 0; n < node->Windows.Size; n++)
13110  if (node->Windows[n]->ID == id)
13111  return node->Windows[n];
13112  return NULL;
13113 }
13114 
13115 // - Remove inactive windows/nodes.
13116 // - Update visibility flag.
13117 static void ImGui::DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlagAndInactiveChilds(ImGuiDockNode* node)
13118 {
13119  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13120  IM_ASSERT(node->ParentNode == NULL || node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[0] == node || node->ParentNode->ChildNodes[1] == node);
13121 
13122  // Inherit most flags
13123  if (node->ParentNode)
13124  node->SharedFlags = node->ParentNode->SharedFlags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_SharedFlagsInheritMask_;
13125 
13126  // Recurse into children
13127  // There is the possibility that one of our child becoming empty will delete itself and moving its sibling contents into 'node'.
13128  // If 'node->ChildNode[0]' delete itself, then 'node->ChildNode[1]->Windows' will be moved into 'node'
13129  // If 'node->ChildNode[1]' delete itself, then 'node->ChildNode[0]->Windows' will be moved into 'node' and the "remove inactive windows" loop will have run twice on those windows (harmless)
13130  if (node->ChildNodes[0])
13131  DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlagAndInactiveChilds(node->ChildNodes[0]);
13132  if (node->ChildNodes[1])
13133  DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlagAndInactiveChilds(node->ChildNodes[1]);
13134 
13135  // Remove inactive windows
13136  // Merge node flags overrides stored in windows
13137  for (int window_n = 0; window_n < node->Windows.Size; window_n++)
13138  {
13139  ImGuiWindow* window = node->Windows[window_n];
13140  IM_ASSERT(window->DockNode == node);
13141 
13142  bool node_was_active = (node->LastFrameActive + 1 == g.FrameCount);
13143  bool remove = false;
13144  remove |= node_was_active && (window->LastFrameActive + 1 < g.FrameCount);
13145  remove |= node_was_active && (node->WantCloseAll || node->WantCloseTabId == window->ID) && window->HasCloseButton && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument); // Submit all _expected_ closure from last frame
13146  remove |= (window->DockTabWantClose);
13147  if (remove)
13148  {
13149  window->DockTabWantClose = false;
13150  if (node->Windows.Size == 1 && !node->IsCentralNode())
13151  {
13152  DockNodeHideHostWindow(node);
13153  node->State = ImGuiDockNodeState_HostWindowHiddenBecauseSingleWindow;
13154  DockNodeRemoveWindow(node, window, node->ID); // Will delete the node so it'll be invalid on return
13155  return;
13156  }
13157  DockNodeRemoveWindow(node, window, node->ID);
13158  window_n--;
13159  }
13160  else
13161  {
13162  // FIXME-DOCKING: Missing policies for conflict resolution, hence the "Experimental" tag on this.
13163  node->LocalFlags &= ~window->WindowClass.DockNodeFlagsOverrideClear;
13164  node->LocalFlags |= window->WindowClass.DockNodeFlagsOverrideSet;
13165  }
13166  }
13167 
13168  // Auto-hide tab bar option
13169  ImGuiDockNodeFlags node_flags = node->GetMergedFlags();
13170  if (node->WantHiddenTabBarUpdate && node->Windows.Size == 1 && (node_flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_AutoHideTabBar) && !node->IsHiddenTabBar())
13171  node->WantHiddenTabBarToggle = true;
13172  node->WantHiddenTabBarUpdate = false;
13173 
13174  // Cancel toggling if we know our tab bar is enforced to be hidden at all times
13175  if (node->WantHiddenTabBarToggle && node->VisibleWindow && (node->VisibleWindow->WindowClass.DockNodeFlagsOverrideSet & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_HiddenTabBar))
13176  node->WantHiddenTabBarToggle = false;
13177 
13178  // Apply toggles at a single point of the frame (here!)
13179  if (node->Windows.Size > 1)
13180  node->LocalFlags &= ~ImGuiDockNodeFlags_HiddenTabBar;
13181  else if (node->WantHiddenTabBarToggle)
13182  node->LocalFlags ^= ImGuiDockNodeFlags_HiddenTabBar;
13183  node->WantHiddenTabBarToggle = false;
13184 
13185  DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlag(node);
13186 }
13187 
13188 static void ImGui::DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlag(ImGuiDockNode* node)
13189 {
13190  // Update visibility flag
13191  bool is_visible = (node->ParentNode == NULL) ? node->IsDockSpace() : node->IsCentralNode();
13192  is_visible |= (node->Windows.Size > 0);
13193  is_visible |= (node->ChildNodes[0] && node->ChildNodes[0]->IsVisible);
13194  is_visible |= (node->ChildNodes[1] && node->ChildNodes[1]->IsVisible);
13195  node->IsVisible = is_visible;
13196 }
13197 
13198 static void ImGui::DockNodeStartMouseMovingWindow(ImGuiDockNode* node, ImGuiWindow* window)
13199 {
13200  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13201  IM_ASSERT(node->WantMouseMove == true);
13202  StartMouseMovingWindow(window);
13203  g.ActiveIdClickOffset = g.IO.MouseClickedPos[0] - node->Pos;
13204  g.MovingWindow = window; // If we are docked into a non moveable root window, StartMouseMovingWindow() won't set g.MovingWindow. Override that decision.
13205  node->WantMouseMove = false;
13206 }
13207 
13208 // Update CentralNode, OnlyNodeWithWindows, LastFocusedNodeID. Copy window class.
13209 static void ImGui::DockNodeUpdateForRootNode(ImGuiDockNode* node)
13210 {
13211  DockNodeUpdateVisibleFlagAndInactiveChilds(node);
13212 
13213  // FIXME-DOCK: Merge this scan into the one above.
13214  // - Setup central node pointers
13215  // - Find if there's only a single visible window in the hierarchy (in which case we need to display a regular title bar -> FIXME-DOCK: that last part is not done yet!)
13216  ImGuiDockNodeFindInfoResults results;
13217  DockNodeFindInfo(node, &results);
13218  node->CentralNode = results.CentralNode;
13219  node->OnlyNodeWithWindows = (results.CountNodesWithWindows == 1) ? results.FirstNodeWithWindows : NULL;
13220  if (node->LastFocusedNodeId == 0 && results.FirstNodeWithWindows != NULL)
13221  node->LastFocusedNodeId = results.FirstNodeWithWindows->ID;
13222 
13223  // Copy the window class from of our first window so it can be used for proper dock filtering.
13224  // When node has mixed windows, prioritize the class with the most constraint (DockingAllowUnclassed = false) as the reference to copy.
13225  // FIXME-DOCK: We don't recurse properly, this code could be reworked to work from DockNodeUpdateScanRec.
13226  if (ImGuiDockNode* first_node_with_windows = results.FirstNodeWithWindows)
13227  {
13228  node->WindowClass = first_node_with_windows->Windows[0]->WindowClass;
13229  for (int n = 1; n < first_node_with_windows->Windows.Size; n++)
13230  if (first_node_with_windows->Windows[n]->WindowClass.DockingAllowUnclassed == false)
13231  {
13232  node->WindowClass = first_node_with_windows->Windows[n]->WindowClass;
13233  break;
13234  }
13235  }
13236 }
13237 
13238 static void ImGui::DockNodeUpdate(ImGuiDockNode* node)
13239 {
13240  ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
13241  IM_ASSERT(node->LastFrameActive != g.FrameCount);
13242  node->LastFrameAlive = g.FrameCount;
13243  node->MarkedForPosSizeWrite = false;
13244 
13245  node->CentralNode = node->OnlyNodeWithWindows = NULL;
13246  if (node->IsRootNode())
13247  DockNodeUpdateForRootNode(node);
13248 
13249  // Remove tab bar if not needed
13250  if (node->TabBar && node->IsNoTabBar())
13251  DockNodeRemoveTabBar(node);
13252 
13253  // Early out for hidden root dock nodes (when all DockId references are in inactive windows, or there is only 1 floating window holding on the DockId)
13254  bool want_to_hide_host_window = false;
13255  if (node->Windows.Size <= 1 && node->IsFloatingNode() && node->IsLeafNode())
13256  if (!g.IO.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar && (node->Windows.Size == 0 || !node->Windows[0]->WindowClass.DockingAlwaysTabBar))
13257  want_to_hide_host_window = true;
13258  if (want_to_hide_host_window)
13259  {
13260  if (node->Windows.Size == 1)
13261  {
13262  // Floating window pos/size is authoritative
13263  ImGuiWindow* single_window = node->Windows[0];
13264  node->Pos = single_window->Pos;
13265  node->Size = single_window->SizeFull;
13266  node->AuthorityForPos = node->AuthorityForSize = node->AuthorityForViewport = ImGuiDataAuthority_Window;
13267 
13268  // Transfer focus immediately so when we revert to a regular window it is immediately selected
13269  if (node->HostWindow && g.NavWindow == node->HostWindow)
13270  FocusWindow(single_window);
13271  if (node->HostWindow)
13272  {
13273  single_window->Viewport = node->HostWindow->Viewport;
13274  single_window->ViewportId = node->HostWindow->ViewportId;
13275  if (node->HostWindow->ViewportOwned)
13276  {
13277  single_window->Viewport->Window = single_window;
13278  single_window->ViewportOwned = true;
13279  }
13280  }
13281  }
13282 
13283  DockNodeHideHostWindow(node);
13284  node->State = ImGuiDockNodeState_HostWindowHiddenBecauseSingleWindow;
13285  node->WantCloseAll = false;
13286  node->WantCloseTabId = 0;
13287  node->HasCloseButton = node->HasWindowMenuButton = false;
13288  node->LastFrameActive = g.FrameCount;
13289 
13290  if (node->WantMouseMove && node->Windows.Size == 1)
13291  DockNodeStartMouseMovingWindow(node, node->Windows[0]);
13292  return;
13293  }
13294 
13295  // In some circumstance we will defer creating the host window (so everything will be kept hidden),
13296  // while the expected visible window is resizing itself.
13297  // This is important for first-time (no ini settings restored) single window when io.ConfigDockingAlwaysTabBar is enabled,
13298  // otherwise the node ends up using the minimum window size. Effectively those windows will take an extra frame to show up:
13299  // N+0: Begin(): window created (with no known size), node is created
13300  // N+1: DockNodeUpdate(): node skip creating host window / Begin(): window size applied, not visible
13301  // N+2: DockNodeUpdate(): node can create host window / Begin(): window becomes visible
13302  // We could remove this frame if we could reliably calculate the expected window size during node update, before the Begin() code.
13303  // It would require a generalization of CalcWindowExpectedSize(), probably extracting code away from Begin().
13304  // In reality it isn't very important as user quickly ends up with size data in .ini file.
13305  if (node->IsVisible && node->HostWindow == NULL && node->IsFloatingNode() && node->IsLeafNode())
13306  {
13307  IM_ASSERT(node->Windows.Size > 0);
13308  ImGuiWindow* ref_window = NULL;
13309  if (node->SelectedTabId != 0) // Note that we prune single-window-node settings on .ini loading, so this is generally 0 for them!
13310  ref_window = DockNodeFindWindowByID(node, node->SelectedTabId);
13311  if (ref_window == NULL)
13312  ref_window = node->Windows[0];
13313  if (ref_window->AutoFitFramesX > 0 || ref_window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
13314  {
13315  node->State = ImGuiDockNodeState_HostWindowHiddenBecauseWindowsAreResizing;
13316  return;
13317  }
13318  }
13319 
13320  const ImGuiDockNodeFlags node_flags = node->GetMergedFlags();
13321 
13322  // Decide if the node will have a close button and a window menu button
13323  node->HasWindowMenuButton = (node->Windows.Size > 0) && (node_flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoWindowMenuButton) == 0;
13324  node->HasCloseButton = false;
13325  for (int window_n = 0; window_n < node->Windows.Size; window_n++)
13326  {
13327  // FIXME-DOCK: Setting DockIsActive here means that for single active window in a leaf node, DockIsActive will be cleared until the next Begin() call.
13328  ImGuiWindow* window = node->Windows[window_n];
13329  node->HasCloseButton |= window->HasCloseButton;
13330  window->DockIsActive = (node->Windows.Size > 1);
13331  }
13332  if (node_flags & ImGuiDockNodeFlags_NoCloseButton)
13333  node->HasCloseButton = false;
13334 
13335  // Bind or create host window
13336  ImGuiWindow* host_window = NULL;
13337  bool beginned_into_host_window = false;
13338  if (node->IsDockSpace())
13339  {
13340  // [Explicit root dockspace node]
13341  IM_ASSERT(node->HostWindow);
13342  host_window = node->HostWindow;
13343  }
13344  else
13345  {
13346  // [Automatic root or child nodes]
13347  if (node->IsRootNode() && node->IsVisible)
13348  {
13349  ImGuiWindow* ref_window = (node->Windows.Size > 0) ? node->Windows[0] : NULL;
13350 
13351  // Sync Pos
13352  if (node->AuthorityForPos == ImGuiDataAuthority_Window && ref_window)
13353  SetNextWindowPos(ref_window->Pos);
13354  else if (node->AuthorityForPos == ImGuiDataAuthority_DockNode)
13355  SetNextWindowPos(node->Pos);
13356 
13357  // Sync Size
13358  if (node->AuthorityForSize == ImGuiDataAuthority_Window && ref_window)
13359  SetNextWindowSize(ref_window->SizeFull);
13360  else if (node->AuthorityForSize == ImGuiDataAuthority_DockNode)
13361  SetNextWindowSize(node->Size);
13362 
13363  // Sync Collapsed
13364  if (node->AuthorityForSize == ImGuiDataAuthority_Window && ref_window)
13365  SetNextWindowCollapsed(ref_window->Collapsed);
13366 
13367  // Sync Viewport
13368  if (node->AuthorityForViewport == ImGuiDataAuthority_Window && ref_window)
13369  SetNextWindowViewport(ref_window->ViewportId);
13370 
13371  SetNextWindowClass(&node->WindowClass);
13372 
13373  // Begin into the host window
13374  char window_label[20];
13375  DockNodeGetHostWindowTitle(node, window_label, IM_ARRAYSIZE(window_label));
13376  ImGuiWindowFlags window_flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse | ImGuiWindowFlags_DockNodeHost;
13377  window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing;
13378  window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse;
13379  window_flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar;
13380 
13381  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, ImVec2(0, 0));
13382  Begin(window_label, NULL, window_flags);
13383  PopStyleVar();
13384  beginned_into_host_window = true;
13385 
13386  node->HostWindow = host_window = g.CurrentWindow;
13387  host_window->DockNodeAsHost = node;
13388  host_window->DC.CursorPos = host_window->Pos;
13389  node->Pos = host_window->Pos;
13390  node->Size = host_window->Size;
13391 
13392  // We set ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing because we don't want the host window to take full focus (e.g. steal NavWindow)
13393  // But we still it bring it to the front of display. There's no way to choose this precise behavior via window flags.
13394  // One simple case to ponder if: window A has a toggle to create windows B/C/D. Dock B/C/D together, clear the toggle and enable it again.
13395  // When reappearing B/C/D will request focus and be moved to the top of the display pile, but they are not linked to the dock host window
13396  // during the frame they appear. The dock host window would keep its old display order, and the sorting in EndFrame would move B/C/D back
13397  // after the dock host window, losing their top-most status.
